explanation: With their hearts split, their bodies drenched in blood, disfigured and lifeless, the demons fell down on earth like trees cut  at the roots.

content: तान् दृष्ट्वा पतितान्भूमौ राक्षसी क्रोधमूर्छिता।।3.20.21।।परित्रस्ता पुनस्तत्र व्यसृजद्भैरवस्वनान्।
explanation: Seeing the demons fallen on the ground, the demoness wild with anger and fear roared.

content: उपगम्य खरं सा तु किञ्चित्संशुष्कशोणिता।।3.20.22।।पपात पुनरेवार्ता सनिर्यासेव सल्लकी।
explanation: Her blood slightly dried up, she came back afflicted to Khara and fell down like a sallaki tree, its sap oozing.

content: पपात पुनरेवार्ता सनिर्यासेव सल्लकी ।।3.20.23 ।।
explanation: Missing

content: भ्रातुस्समीपे शोकार्ता ससर्ज निनदं मुहुः।।3.20.24।।सस्वरं मुमुचे बाष्पं विषण्णवदना तदा।
explanation: Then desperately screaming and shedding tears with a sad face beside her brother, she roared again and again.

content: निपातितान् दृश्य रणे तु राक्षसान् प्रधाविता शूर्पणखा पुनस्ततः।वधं च तेषां निखिलेन रक्षसां शशंस सर्वं भगिनी खरस्य सा।।3.20.25।।
explanation: When Surpanakha saw the demons fall dead on the battleground, she ran to Khara,her brother and told in detail about the death of the demons.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे विंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentieth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Khara pacifies Surpanakha -- Surpanakha provokes Khara against Rama.]स पुनः पतितां दृष्ट्वा क्रोधाच्छूर्पणखां खरः।उवाच व्यक्तया वाचा तामनर्थार्थमागताम्।।3.21.1।।
explanation: Seeing Surpanakha collapse, Khara said in clear terms about the unfortunate situation she had created:

content: मया त्विदानीं शूरास्ते राक्षसा रुधिराशनाः।त्वत्प्रियार्थं विनिर्दिष्टाः किमर्थं रुद्यते पुनः।।3.21.2।।
explanation: The valiant demons who feed on blood have been commissioned for your pleasure. Why are you crying again?

content: भक्ताश्चैवानुरक्ताश्च हिताश्च मम नित्यशः।हन्यमाना न हन्यन्ते न न कुर्युर्वचो मम।।3.21.3।।
explanation: They are loyal and faithful to me. They are always my wellwishers. Even when attacked, they cannot be killed. They never fail to carry out my orders.

content: किमेतच्छ्रोतुमिच्छामि कारणं यत्कृते पुनः।हा नाथेति विनर्दन्ती सर्पवल्लुठसि क्षितौ।।3.21.4।।
explanation: I wish to know what makes you lament and roll on the ground like a serpent and hissing?

content: अनाथवद्विलपसि नाथे तु मयि संस्थिते।उत्तिष्ठोत्तिष्ठ माभैषीर्वैक्लव्यं त्यज्यतामिह।।3.21.5।।
explanation: When I am here like a lord to protect you, why do you weep like an orphan? Get up. Give up your anxiety. Be not afraid.

content: इत्येवमुक्ता दुर्धर्षा खरेण परिसान्त्विता।विमृज्य नयने सास्रे खरं भ्रातरमब्रवीत्।।3.21.6।।
explanation: Thus consoled by Khara, invincible Surpanakha wiped her tearful eyes and said to her brother:

content: अस्मीदानीमहं प्राप्ता हृतश्रवणनासिका।शोणितौघपरिक्लिन्ना त्वया च परिसान्त्विता।।3.21.7।।
explanation: My ears and nose sliced off, drenched with blood, I came to you and you pacified me.

content: प्रेषिताश्च त्वया वीर राक्षसास्ते चतुर्दश।निहन्तुं राघवं क्रोधान्मत्प्रियार्थं सलक्षणम्।।3.21.8।।
explanation: O warrior  you had sent, out of anger, fourteen demons to put an end to Rama along with Lakshmana in order to please me.

content: ते तु रामेण सामर्षाः शूलपट्टसपाणयः।समरे निहतास्सर्वे सायकैर्मर्मभेदिभिः।।3.21.9।।
explanation: The demons who went with spears in their hands were killed, their hearts pierced by  Rama's arrows.

content: तान्दृष्ट्वा पतितान्भूमौ क्षणेनैव महाबलान्।रामस्य च महत्कर्म महांस्त्रासोऽभवन्मम।।3.21.10।।
explanation: Seeing the powerful demons collapse on the ground in a moment's time through Rama's action, I was frightened.

content: अहमस्मि समुद्विग्ना विषण्णा च निशाचर।शरणं त्वां पुनः प्राप्ता सर्वतोभयदर्शिनी।।3.21.11।।
explanation: O demon  I am scared and sad. To me everything looks frightening. I, therefore, seek refuge in you.

content: विषादनक्राध्युषिते परित्रासोर्मिमालिनि।किं मां न त्रायसे मग्नां विपुले शोकसागरे।।3.21.12।।
explanation: I am drowned in a vast sea of sorrow where crocodiles in the form of distress reside. It is full of rows of waves of fright. Why do you not save me?

content: एते च निहता भूमौ रामेण निशितैः शरैः।येऽपि मे पदवीं प्राप्ता राक्षसाः पिशिताशनाः।।3.21.13।।
explanation: The demons who live on flesh, who came following me fell down on earth and lay dead,  shot by the sharp arrows of Rama.

content: मयि ते यद्यनुक्रोशो यदि रक्षस्सु तेषु च।रामेण यदि ते शक्तिस्तेजो वास्ति निशाचर।3.21.14।।दण्डकारण्यनिलयं जहि राक्षसकण्टकम्।
explanation: O demon  if you have compassion for me or for the demons, if you have the power and energy to face Rama, kill the enemy of the demons living in Dandaka forest.

content: यदि रामं ममामित्रं न त्वमद्यवधिष्यसि।।3.21.15।।तवैव चाग्रतः प्राणांस्त्यक्षामि निरपत्रप।
explanation: If now you do not kill that Rama, my enemy, O shameless one, I will give up my life in your very presence.

content: बुद्ध्याहमनुपश्यामि न त्वं रामस्य संयुगे।।3.21.16।।स्थातुं प्रतिमुखे शक्तस्सबलश्च महात्मनः।
explanation: Instinctively I can foresee that you and your army do not have the capability to encounter that great Rama in a fight.

content: शूरमानी न शूरस्त्वं मिथ्यारोपितविक्रमः।।3.21.17।।मानुषौ यो न शक्नोषि हन्तुं तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।
explanation: You call yourself a hero, yet are not able to kill two humans like Rama and Lakshmana. Your claim to heroism is false. You are not a hero at all.

content: रामेण यदि ते शक्तिस्तेजो वास्ति निशाचर।।3.21.18।।दण्डकारण्यनिलयं जहि तं कुलपांसन।
explanation: O demon  you are a disgrace to the family. If you have power or energy, kill that Rama dwelling in Dandaka forest.

content: निस्सत्वस्याल्प वीर्यस्य वासस्ते कीदृशस्त्विह।।3.21.19।।अपयाहि जनस्थानातत्वरितस्सहबान्धवः।
explanation: You have little strength and less heroism. You with your relations should immediately leave Janasthana. What kind of position do you have here?

content: रामतेजोभिभूतो हि त्वं क्षिप्रं विनशिष्यसि।3.21.20।।स हि तेजस्समायुक्तो रामो दशरथात्मजः।भ्राता चास्य महावीर्यो येन चास्मि विरूपिता।।3.21.21।।
explanation: Let down by the brilliance of Rama, son of Dasaratha, you will be soon destroyed. He is mighty and his brother who has disfigured me is very valiant.

content: एवं विलप्य बहुशो राक्षसी विततोदरी।कराभ्यामुदरं हत्वा रुरोद भृशदुःखिता।।3.21.22।।
explanation: Overcome by sorrow, the bigbellied demoness cried  in several ways and being very sad started beating her chest with both hands.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकविंशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the twentyfirst sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Khara gets his brother Dusana and the army ready to fight Rama -- proceeds with  fourteen thousand demons.]एवमाधर्षितश्शूरश्शूर्पणख्या खरस्ततः।उवाच रक्षसां मध्ये खरः खरतरं वचः।।3.22.1।।
explanation: Ashamed and accused thus in the presence of the demons, the valiant Khara spoke to Surpanakha in harsh words:

content: तवावमानप्रभवः क्रोधोऽयमतुलो मम।न शक्यते धारयितुं लवणाम्भ इवोल्बणम्।।3.22.2।।
explanation: Like the overslowing salt sea water, I am unable to contain this my excessive anger arising out of your insult.

content: न रामं गणये वीर्यान्मानुषं क्षीणजीवितम्।आत्मदुश्चरितैः प्राणान्हतोयोऽद्य विमोक्ष्यते।।3.22.3।।
explanation: Rama is a shortlived human. I do not care for his valour. His life span will be shortened (he will be killed) now for his own misdeeds.

content: बाष्पस्संह्रियतामेष सम्भ्रमश्च विमुच्यताम्।अहं रामं सह भ्रात्रा नयामि यमसादनम्।।3.22.4।।
explanation: Restrain your tears and your anxieties I will send Rama along with his brother to the abode of Yama.

content: परश्वथहतस्याद्य मन्दप्राणस्य संयुगे।रामस्य रुधिरं रक्तमुष्णं पास्यसि राक्षसि।।3.22.5।।
explanation: With his life ebbing out, killed by my axe in the fight, you will drink today, O demoness, Rama's red, hot blood.

content: सा प्रहृष्टा वचश्श्रुत्वा खरस्य वदनाच्च्युतम्।प्रशशंस पुनर्मौर्ख्याद्भ्रातरं रक्षसां वरम्।।3.22.6।।
explanation: On hearing the words that came out of Khara's mouth, she was pleased. And in stupidity began praising her brother once again as the best of demons.

content: तया परुषितः पूर्वं पुनरेव प्रशंसितः।अब्रवीद्दूषणं नाम खरस्सेनापतिं तदा।।3.22.7।।
explanation: Khara, accused by her earlier and admired again, said to Dusana, chief of army:

content: चतुर्दश सहस्राणि मम चित्तानुवर्तिनाम्।रक्षसां भीमवेगानां समरेष्वनिवर्तिनाम्।।3.22.8।।
explanation: There are fourteen thousand demons at my command ready to act according to my will. They are warriors of terrific speed and will not retreat from the fight.

content: नीलजीमूतवर्णानां घोराणां क्रूरकर्मणाम्।लोकहिंसाविहाराणां बलिनामुग्रतेजसाम्।।3.22.9।।
explanation: They are of the colour of the dark blue cloud, dreadful and merciless, strong and powerful fighters who roam about forturing people.

content: तेषां शार्दूलदर्पाणां महास्यानां महौजसाम्।सर्वोद्योग मुदीर्णानां रक्षसां सौम्य कारय।।3.22.10।।
explanation: O handsome one, get them all, powerful like tigers, demons with large countenances, mighty and arragant, ready (for the fight).

content: उपस्थापय मे क्षिप्रं रथं सौम्य धनूंषि च।शरांश्चित्रांश्च खङ्गांश्च शक्तीश्च विविधाश्शिताः।।3.22.11।।
explanation: O goodnatured one, get my chariot, bows and arrows, wonderful swords of different kinds and sharp missiles ready quickly.

content: अग्रे निर्यातुमिच्छामि पौलस्त्यानां महात्मनाम्।वधार्थं दुर्विनीतस्य रामस्य रणकोविदः।।3.22.12।।
explanation: O expert in warfare, I wish to lead those great warriors of Paulasthya family, to kill that immodest Rama.

content: इति तस्य ब्रुवाणस्य सूर्यवर्णं महारथम्।सदश्वैश्शबलैर्युक्तमाचचक्षेऽथ दूषणः।।3.22.13।।
explanation: While Khara was speaking thus, Dusana reported that a huge chariot of the colour of the Sun yoked with good horses of variegated hues stood ready.

content: तं मेरुशिखराकारं तप्तकाञ्चनभूषणम्।हेमचक्रमसम्बाधं वैदूर्यमयकूबरम्।।3.22.14।।मत्स्यैः पुष्पैर्द्रुमैश्शैलैश्चन्द्रसूर्यैश्च काञ्चनैः।मङ्गलैः पक्षिसङ्घैश्च ताराभिरभिसंवृतम्।।3.22.15।।ध्वजनिस्त्रिंशसम्पन्नं किङ्किणीकविराजितम्।सदश्वयुक्तं सोऽमर्षादारुरोह खरो रथम्।।3.22.16।।
explanation: Then the impatient Khara mounted the chariot that looked like the peak of mount Meru. It was decorated with pure gold, had golden wheels, poles studded with vaidurya. The carriage of the chariot was engraved with golden figures of fishes, flowers, trees, the Sun, stars, flocks of auspicious birds, flags and swords. Shining with small bells, it was yoked to fine horses.

content: निशाम्य तु रथस्थं तं राक्षसा भीमविक्रमाः।तस्थुस्संपरिवार्यैनं दूषणं च महाबलम्।।3.22.17।।
explanation: The demons of terrific prowess surounded Khara and Dusana and stood by, when they saw both of them mounting the chariot.

content: खरस्तु तान्महेष्वासान्घोरवर्मायुधध्वजान्।निर्यातेत्यब्रवीद्दृष्ट्वा रथस्थस्सर्वराक्षसान्।।3.22.18।।
explanation: Khara mounted the chariot, saw the demons holding great weapons, wearing dreadful shields and holding flags, and ordered them to march.

content: ततस्तद् राक्षसं सैन्यं घोरचर्मायुधध्वजम्।निर्जगाम जनस्थानान्महानादं महाजवम्।।3.22.19।।
explanation: Then the army of the demons wearing dreadful shields, holding weapons and flags, and making a loud noise started in great speed from Janasthanam.

content: मुद्गरैः पट्टिसैश्शूलैस्सुतीक्ष्णैश्च परश्वधैः।खङ्गैश्चक्रैश्च हस्तस्थैर्भ्राजमानैश्च तोमरैः।।3.22.20।।शक्तिभिः परिघैर्घोरैरतिमात्रैश्च कार्मुकैः।गदासिमुसलैर्वज्रैर्गृहीतैर्भीमदर्शनैः।।3.22.21।।राक्षसानां सुघोराणां सहस्राणि चतुर्दश।निर्यातानि जनस्थानात्खरचित्तानुवर्तिनाम्।।3.22.22।।
explanation: The fourteen thousand demons loyal to the wishes of Khara, took in their hands, maces, piercing weapons, spears, sharp axes used in battle, swords, wheels, splinters, iron clubs, powerful missiles, dreadful iron bars of giant size, bows made of bamboo, clubs and frightening weapons like thunderbolt (of Indra) and  departed from Janasthana.

content: तांस्त्वभिद्रवतो दृष्ट्वा राक्षसान् भीमविक्रमान्।खरस्यापि रथः किञ्चिज्जगाम तदनन्तरम्।।3.22.23।।
explanation: Khara's chariot moved a bit behind the army of demons of frightening prowess who rushed forward to attack (Rama).

content: ततस्ताञ्छबलानश्वास्तप्तकाञ्चनभूषितान्।खरस्य मतिमाज्ञाय सारथिस्समचोदयत्।।3.22.24।।
explanation: Knowing the mind of Khara, the charioteer hastened the horses of the colourful  chariot decorated with pure gold.

content: स चोदितो रथश्शीघ्रं खरस्य रिपुघातिनः।शब्देनापूरयामास दिशश्च प्रदिशस्तदा।।3.22.25।।
explanation: Spurred by the charioteer, the chariot of Khara, the slayer of enemies, produced a rattle that filled all four quarters and the intermediate directions.

content: प्रवृद्धमन्युस्तु खरः खरस्वनो रिपोर्वधार्थं त्वरितो यथान्तकः।अचूचुदत्सारथिमुन्नदन्घनं महाबलो मेघ इवाश्मवर्षवान्।।3.22.26।।
explanation: Khara in extreme anger hastened, like Yama, to slay his enemy. He roared loudly like a cloud raining hail stones and impelled his charioteer to speed up. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वालल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे द्वाविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentysecond sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Khara  sees dreadful omens.]तस्मिन्याते बले घोरमशिवं शोणितोदकम्।अभ्यवर्षन्महामेघस्तुमुलो गर्दभारुणः।।3.23.1।।
explanation: As the army marched from there (Janasthana) a huge dark cloud of the colour of an ass rained dreadful inauspicious water, red as blood.

content: निपेतुस्तुरगास्तस्य रथयुक्ता महाजवाः।समे पुष्पचिते देशे राजमार्गे यदृच्छया।।3.23.2।।
explanation: The swift horses yoked to the chariot stumbled casually while galloping on the plane highway sprinkled with flowers.

content: श्यामं रुधिरपर्यन्तं बभूव परिवेषणम्।अलातचक्रप्रतिमं परिगृह्य दिवाकरम्।।3.23.3।।
explanation: A dark ring, bloodred in colour appeared on the border of the Sun's orb, dark in the middle. This phenomenon of the Sun appeared like a ring of moving charcoal covering the Sun.

content: ततो ध्वजमुपागम्य हेमदण्डं समुच्छ्रितम्।समाक्रम्य महाकायस्तस्थौ गृध्रस्सुदारुणः।।3.23.4।।
explanation: A huge vulture, frightening to look at flew up and sat on top of the flag on the staff of gold.

content: जनस्थानसमीपे तु समागम्य खरस्वनाः।विस्वरान्विविधांश्चक्रुर्मांसादा मृगपक्षिणः।।3.23.5।।
explanation: Flesheating beasts and birds flocked at Janasthana producing a cacophony.

content: व्याजह्रुश्च प्रदीप्तायां दिशि वै भैरवस्वनम्।अशिवं यातुधानानां शिवा घोरा महास्वनाः।।3.23.6।।
explanation: The dreadful jackals making ghastly howls turning towards the illuminated direction and produced frightening sounds indicating inauspicious time for the demons.

content: प्रभिन्नगिरिसङ्काशास्तोयशोणितधारिणः।आकाशं तदनाकाशं चक्रुर्भीमा वलाहकाः।।3.23.7।।
explanation: The clouds looked like shattered mountains pouring down bloodlike rain which filled the sky and made it appear frighteningly different.

content: बभूव तिमिरं घोरमुद्धतं रोमहर्षणम्।दिशो वा विदिशो वापि न च व्यक्तं चकाशिरे।।3.23.8।।
explanation: A terrific darkness, spread all over, produced frightening horripilation. Even the four quarters and the intermediary zones were not discernible.

content: क्षतजार्द्रसवर्णाभा सन्ध्याकालं विना बभौ।खरस्याभिमुखा नेदुस्तदा घोरमृगाः खगाः।।3.23.9।।कङ्कगोमायुगृध्राश्च चुक्रुशुर्भयशंसिनः।
explanation: Even before Sunset the twilight looked like a fresh wound. Then wild animals, birds, kankas, jackals and vultures facing towards Khara screeched, indicating danger.

content: नित्याशुभकरा युद्धे शिवा घोरनिदर्शनाः।।3.23.10।।नेदुर्बलस्याभिमुखं ज्वालोद्गारिभिराननैः।
explanation: Bad omens that always bring inauspiciousness were a dreadful evidence of what is going to happen. Jackals howled, facing Khara's army with their mouths emitting fire.

content: कबन्धः परिघाभासो दृश्यते भास्करान्तिके।।3.23.11।।जग्राह सूर्यं स्वर्भानुरपर्वणि महाग्रहः।प्रवाति मारुतश्शीघ्रं निष्प्रभोऽभूद्दिवाकरः।।3.23.12।।
explanation: The planet Ketu appeared  like an iron beam near the Sun. Although it was not the fullmoon or newmoon day, Rahu eclipsed the Sun. Wind blew hard and the Sun was lustreless.

content: उत्पेतुश्च विना रात्रिं ताराः खद्योतसप्रभाः।संलीनमीनविहगा नलिन्यश्शुष्कपङ्कजाः।।3.23.13।।तस्मिन् क्षणे बभूवुश्च विना पुष्पफलैर्द्रुमाः।
explanation: The stars rose in the sky and glittered like fireflies even before night arrived. The fishes and the aquatic birds in the lotusponds hid themselves under water.  Lotuses dried up in tanks and the trees stood bereft of flowers and fruits.

content: उद्धूतश्च विना वातं रेणुर्जलधरारुणः।।3.23.14।।वीचीकूचीति वाश्यन्त्यो बभूवुस्तत्र शारिकाः।
explanation: Although there was no wind, dust rose like a brown cloud and the sarika birds sang (vichi kuchi) thoughtlessly.

content: उल्काश्चापि सनिर्घाता निपेतुर्घोरदर्शनाः।।3.23.15।।प्रचचाल मही सर्वा सशैलवनकानना।
explanation: Dreadful to watch were the thunderstorms and the meteors that dropped down from the sky. The earth trembled all over with mountains, groves and forests.

content: खरस्य च रथस्थस्य नर्दमानस्य धीमतः।।3.23.16।।प्राकम्पत भुजस्सव्यस्स्वरश्चास्यावसज्जत।
explanation: While the intelligent and courageous Khara was seated on the chariot and shouting, his left shoulder shook violently and throat throttled.

content: सास्रा सम्पद्यते दृष्टिः पश्यमानस्य सर्वतः।।3.23.17।।ललाटे च रुजा जाता न च मोहान्यवर्तत।
explanation: While watching all this, his eyes brimmed with tears. His forehead ached. Yet he was too deluded to beat a retreat.

content: तान्समीक्षय महोत्पातानुत्थितान्रोमहर्षणान्।।3.23.18।।अब्रवीद्राक्षसान्सर्वान्प्रहसन्सखरस्तदा।
explanation: Looking at these dreadful, horripilating occurrences Khara laughed and said to the demons:

content: महोत्पातानिमान्सर्वानुत्थितान्घोरदर्शनान्।।3.23.19।।न चिन्तयाम्यहं वीर्याद्बलवान्दुर्बलानिव।
explanation: Valiant and strong, I do not take seriously these terrifying omens boding calamity  just as a strong man does not care for the weak.

content: तारा अपि शरैस्तीक्ष्णैः पातयामि नभस्स्थलात्।।3.23.20।।मृत्युं मरणधर्मेण सङ्क्रुद्धो योजयाम्यहम्।
explanation: With my sharp arrows I can even bring down the stars from the sky. If angered, I can cause mortality to the god of death.

content: राघवं तं बलोत्सिक्तं भ्रातरं चास्य लक्ष्मणम्।।3.23.21।।अहत्वा सायकैस्तीक्ष्णैर्नोपावर्तितुमुत्सहे।
explanation: I do not wish to return, without killing with my sharp arrows that Rama who is proud of his strength and his brother Lakshmana.

content: सकामा भगिनी मेऽस्तु पीत्वा तु रुधिरं तयोः।।3.23.22।।यन्निमित्तस्तु रामस्य लक्ष्मणस्य विपर्ययः।
explanation: Let my sister be satisfied by drinking the blood of both Rama and Lakshmana on whose account this adversity has come.

content: न क्वचित्प्राप्तपूर्वो मे संयुगेषु पराजयः।।3.23.23।।युष्माकमेतत्प्रत्यक्षं नानृतं कथयाम्यहम्।
explanation: I have never faced defeat in wars, and all of you have seen it with your eyes. I am not telling you a lie.

content: देवराजमपि क्रुद्धो मत्तैरावतयायिनम्।।3.23.24।।वज्रहस्तं रणे हन्यां किं पुनस्तौ कुमानुषौ।
explanation: When angry, I can kill even (Indra) the wielder of the thunderbolt, rider of the intoxicated Airavata and lord of the gods. What to speak of these two petty humans?

content: सा तस्य गर्जितं श्रुत्वा राक्षसस्य महाचमूः।।3.23.25।।प्रहर्षमतुलं लेभे मृत्युपाशावपाशिता।
explanation: Fallen into the deathtrap, the great army of the demon, felt very happy on hearing Khara roaring.

content: समीयुश्च महात्मानो युद्धदर्शनकाङ्क्षिणः।।3.23.26।।ऋषयो देवगन्दर्वास्सिद्धाश्च सहचारणैः।
explanation: Great souls like sages, gods, gandharvas, and siddhas including celestial bards assembled to see the battle.

content: समेत्य चोचुस्सहितास्तेऽन्योन्यं पुण्यकर्मणः।स्वस्ति गोब्राह्मणेभ्योऽस्तु लोकानां येऽभिसङ्गताः।।3.23.27।।
explanation: Holy men assembled and uttered benedictions, saying, 'let there be wellbeing for the cows and brahmins associated with men of pious deeds in all the (three) worlds.

content: जयतां राघवस्संख्ये पौलस्त्यान् रजनीचरान्।।3.23.28।।चक्रहस्तो यथा युद्धे सर्वानसुरपुङ्गवान्।
explanation: 'Let Rama conquer the descendants of Paulasthya in the war like Visnu, the wielder of the wheel had defeated great demons'.

content: एतच्चान्यच्च बहुशो ब्रुवाणाः परमर्षयः।।3.23.29।।जातकौतूहलास्तत्र विमानस्थाश्च देवताः।ददृशुर्वाहिनीं तेषां राक्षसानां गतायुषाम्।।3.23.30।।
explanation: The great ascetics were talking thus and more. The gods waiting eagerly on heavenly chariots saw the army of the demons whose life span was shortened (who were doomed to death).

content: रथेन तु खरो वेगादुग्रसैन्यो विनिस्सृतः।तं दृष्ट्वा राक्षसं भूयो राक्षसाश्च विनिस्सृताः।।3.23.31।।
explanation: Seeing Khara, their chief on the chariot driving fast, the army of demons too marched forward.

content: श्येनगामी पृथुग्रीवो यज्ञशत्रुर्विहङ्गमः।दुर्जयः करवीराक्षः परुषः कालकार्मुकः।।3.23.32।।मेघमाली महामाली सर्वास्यो रुधिराशनः।द्वादशैते महावीर्याः प्रतस्थुरभितः खरम्।।3.23.33।।
explanation: Surrounded by twelve valiant warriors like Syenagami, Pruthugreeva, Yagnasatru, Vihangama, Durjaya, Karaviraksha, Parusha, Kalakarmuka, Meghmali, Mahamali, Sarpasya and Rudhirasana, Khara proceeded.

content: महाकपालिस्स्थूलाक्षः प्रमाथी त्रिशिरास्तथा।चत्वार एते सेनान्यो दूषणं पृष्ठतो ययुः।।3.23.34।।
explanation: Similarly Dusana proceeded with four  Mahakapali, Sthulaksha, Pramathi and Trisira  around him.

content: सा भीमवेगा समराभिकामा महाबला राक्षसवीरसेना।तौ राजपुत्रौ सहसाभ्युपेता माला ग्रहाणामिव चन्द्रसूर्यौ।।3.23.35।।
explanation: The mighty, swiftfooted army of valiant demons surrounded the princes (Rama and Lakshmana) all on a sudden like the planets around the Sun and the Moon.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे त्रयोविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentythird sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama sees signs of war -- asks Sita and Lakshmana to stay in the cave and proceeds to meet Khara.]आश्रमं प्रति याते तु खरे खरपराक्रमे।तानेवौत्पातिकान्रामस्सह भ्रात्रा ददर्श ह।।3.24.1।।
explanation: When Khara endowed with malicious might was marching towards the hermitage, Rama and his brother saw the same omens of impending calamity the demon had seen.

content: तानुत्पातान्महोघोरानुत्थितान्रोमहर्षणान्।प्रजानामहितान्दृष्ट्वा रामो लक्ष्मणमब्रवीत्।।3.24.2।।
explanation: When Rama saw the most dreadful, horripilating phenomena foreboding calamity, he said to Lakshmana:

content: इमान्पश्य महाबाहो सर्वभूतापहारिणः।समुत्थितान्महोत्पातान्संहर्तुं सर्वराक्षसान्।।3.24.3।।
explanation: O longarmed Lakshmana see these calamitous phenomena that forebode mass destruction of men and demons.

content: अमी रुधिरधारास्तु विसृजन्तः खरस्वनाः।व्योम्नि मेघा विवर्तन्ते परुषा गर्दभारुणाः।।3.24.4।।
explanation: These rumbling clouds, brownishred like the colour of a donkey,  are moving about in the sky showering streams of blood.

content: सधूमाश्च शरास्सर्वे मम युद्धाभिनन्दिनः।रुक्मपृष्ठानि चापानि विचेष्टन्ते च लक्ष्मण।।3.24.5।।
explanation: O Lakshmana all my arrows are smoking and this goldplated bow welcomes me to war.

content: यादृशा इह कूजन्ति पक्षिणः वनचारिणः।अग्रतो नो भयं प्राप्तं संशयो जीवितस्य च।।3.24.6।।
explanation: The way the forestbirds are screeching makes me foresee danger and makes survival doubtful.

content: सम्प्रहारस्तु सुमहान्भविष्यति न संशयः।अयमाख्याति मे बाहुस्स्फुरमाणो मुहुर्मुहुः।।3.24.7।।सन्निकर्षे तु न श्शूर जयं शत्रोः पराजयम्।सप्रभं च प्रसन्नं च तव वक्त्रं हि लक्ष्यते।।3.24.8।।
explanation: A mass destruction of life is going to take place. There is no doubt about it. O brave Lakshmana my right shoulder trembles again and again, indicating the defeat of the enemy. Your beaming visage presages victory.

content: उद्यतानां हि युद्धार्थं येषां भवति लक्ष्मण।निष्प्रभं वदनं तेषां भवत्यायुः परिक्षयः।।3.24.9।।
explanation: O Lakshmana, while preparing for war, those whose faces look pale are, for sure, going to die.

content: रक्षसां नर्दतां घोरश्श्रूयते च महाध्वनिः।आहतानां च भेरीणां राक्षसैः क्रूरकर्मभिः।।3.24.10।।
explanation: A dreadful roar of demons and the loud sound of wardrums beaten by the wicked demons are heard.

content: अनागतविधानं तु कर्तव्यं शुभमिच्छता।आपदं शङ्कमानेन पुरुषेण विपश्चिता।।3.24.11।।
explanation: A wise man who apprehends danger or one who desires his own good should plan his defence even before the onset of danger.

content: तस्माद्गृहीत्वा वैदेहीं शरपाणिर्धनुर्धरः।गुहामाश्रय शैलस्य दुर्गां पादपसङ्कुलाम्।।3.24.12।।
explanation: Therefore, take shelter along with Sita in the inaccessible mountain cave, overgrown with trees, ready with your bow and arrows.

content: प्रतिकूलितुमिच्छामि न हि वाक्यमिदं त्वया।शापितो मम पादाभ्यां गम्यतां वत्स मा चिरम्।।3.24.13।।
explanation: O dear, I do not like you to oppose this word of honour. You must touch my feet and go without delay.

content: त्वं हि शूरश्च बलवान्हन्याह्येतान्न संशयः।स्वयं तु हन्तुमिच्छामि सर्वानेव निशाचरान्।।3.24.14।।
explanation: You are valiant and strong. There is no doubt that you can kill all these demons. But I desire to kill them.

content: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण लक्ष्मणस्सह सीताया।शरानादाय चापं च गुहां दुर्गां समाश्रयत्।।3.24.15।।
explanation: Thus ordered by Rama, Lakshmana took the arrows and the bow and accompanied by Sita took shelter in the inaccessible cave.

content: तस्मिन्प्रविष्टे तु गुहां लक्ष्मणे सह सीतया।हन्त निर्युक्तमित्युक्त्वा रामः कवचमाविशत्।।3.24.16।।
explanation: With Lakshmana and Sita inside the cave, Rama heaved his shield, saying, Oh the work is accomplished.

content: स तेनाग्नि निकाशेन कवचेन विभूषितः।बभूव राम स्तिमिरे विधूमोऽग्निरिवोत्थितः।।3.24.17।।
explanation: Adorned with the shield, Rama shone like smokeless fire rising in darkness.

content: स चापमुद्यम्य महच्छरानादाय वीर्यवान्।बभूवावस्थितस्तत्र ज्यास्वनैः पूरयन्दिशः।।3.24.18।।
explanation: Valiant Rama lifted the huge bow and arrows and stood there, filling the directions with the twangs of his bow.

content: ततो देवास्सगन्धर्वास्सिद्धाश्च सह चारणैः।समेयुश्च महात्मानो युद्धदर्शनकाङ्क्षिणः।।3.24.19।।
explanation: Then the gods along with gandharvas, siddhas, and celestial bards assembled there, wishing to witness the war.

content: ऋषयश्च महात्मानो लोके ब्रह्मर्षिसत्तमाः।समेत्य चोचुस्सहिता अन्योन्यं पुण्यकर्मणः।।3.24.20।।
explanation: Great ascetics of the world, distinguished brahmarsis, accomplishers of pious deeds assembled and said to one another:

content: स्वस्ति गोब्राह्मणेभ्योऽस्तु लोकानां येऽभिसङ्गताः। जयतां राघवो युद्धे पौलस्त्यान् रजनीचरान्।।3.24.21।।चक्रहस्तो यथा युद्धे सर्वानसुर पुङ्गवान्।
explanation: 'Let there be wellbeing for the cows, brahmins, and all the worlds. Let Rama, the scion of the Raghu race, conquer the Paulastyas (demons) in war like lord Visnu, wielder of the disc, who defeated the most powerful demons'.

content: एवमुक्त्वा पुनः प्रोचुरालोक्य च परस्परम्।।3.24.22।।चतुर्दश सहस्राणि रक्षसां भीमकर्मणाम्।एकश्च रामो धर्मात्मा कथं युद्धं भविष्यति।।3.24.23।।
explanation: Thus looking at one another they discussed among themselves how there can be war between the righteous Rama fighting singlehanded on the one hand and the fourteen thousand demons, performers of terrific deeds, on the other.

content: इति राजर्षयस्सिद्धास्सगणाश्च द्विजर्षभाः।जातकौतूहलास्तस्थुर्विमानस्थाश्च देवताः।।3.24.24।।
explanation: Rajarsis, siddhas, great brahmins with their clan and gods on the celestial chariots waited to see the war whetted with curiosity.

content: आविष्टं तेजसा रामं सङ्ग्रामशिरसि स्थितम्।दृष्ट्वा सर्वाणि भूतानि भयाद्विव्यथिरे तदा।।3.24.25।।
explanation: Seeing Rama standing on the war front, engrossed and radiating heroic lustre, all beings were alarmed.

content: रूपमप्रतिमं तस्य रामस्याक्लिष्टकर्मणः।बभूव रूपं क्रुद्धस्य रुद्रस्येव पिनाकिनः।।3.24.26।।
explanation: Rama, who is unwearied in action and who is of an incomparable (lovely) form, looked ferocious like the wielder of Pinaka (Lord Siva).

content: ततो गम्भीरनिर्ह्रादं घोरवर्मायुधध्वजम्।अनीकं यातुधानानां समन्तात्प्रत्यदृश्यत।।3.24.27।।
explanation: Then appeared on all sides the wellequipped army of demons raising deep sounds with dreadful shields, weapons and banners.

content: सिंहनादं विसृजतामन्योन्यमभिगर्जताम्।चापानि विस्फ़ारयतां जृम्भतामप्यभीक्ष्णशः।।3.24.28।।विप्रघुष्टस्वनानां च दुन्धुभींश्चापि निघ्नताम्।तेषां सुतुमुलश्शब्दः पूरयामास तद्वनम्।।3.24.29।।
explanation: The forest was filled with tumultuous sounds of the warriors roaring like lions,  shouting at one another, stretching the bowstrings constantly, yawning, proclaiming loudly and beating the drums.

content: तेन शब्देन वित्रस्ताश्वापदा वनचारिणः।दुद्रुवुर्यत्र निश्शब्दं पृष्ठतो न व्यलोकयन्।।3.24.30।।
explanation: The ferocious animals of the forest got frightened and ran away to silent spots without looking back.

content: तत्त्वनीकं महाघोरं रामं समुपसर्पत।धृतनानाप्रहरणं गम्भीरं सागरोपमम्।।3.24.31।।
explanation: The fierce army, deep like the sea, equipped with various missiles approached Rama.

content: रामोऽपि चारयंश्चक्षुस्सर्वतो रणपण्डितः।ददर्श खरसैन्यं तद्युद्धाभिमुखमुत्थितम्।।3.24.32।।
explanation: Rama, wellversed in warfare, cast his eyes on all sides to see the army of Khara that had come prepared for war.

content: वितत्य च धनुर्भीमं तूण्याश्चोद्धृत्य सायकान्।क्रोधमाहारयत्तीव्रं वधार्थं सर्वरक्षसाम्।।3.24.33।।
explanation: Rama stretched the formidable bow and lifted the arrows from his quiver to kill the demons and assumed intense anger.

content: दुष्प्रेक्ष्यस्सोऽभवत्कृद्धो युगान्ताग्निरिव ज्वलन्।तं दृष्ट्वा तेजसाविष्टं प्राद्रवन्वनदेवताः।।3.24.34।।
explanation: Rama stood burning in anger like the fire of the doom's day. It was difficult even to look at him. Seeing him full of glow even the sylvan deities ran away.

content: तस्य क्रुद्धस्य रूपं तु रामस्य ददृशे तदा।दक्षस्येव क्रतुं हन्तुमुद्यतस्य पिनाकिनः।।3.24.35।।
explanation: Rama in anger looked like Lord Siva ready to destroy the sacrifice of Daksha.

content: आविष्टं तेजसा रामं सङ्ग्रामशिरसि स्थितम्।दृष्ट्वा सर्वाणि भूतानि भयार्तानि प्रदुद्रुवुः।।3.24.36।।
explanation: Seeing Rama flashing (in anger) and standing on the warfront all creatures ran away frightened.

content: तत्कार्मुकैराभरणैर्ध्वजैश्च तैर्वर्मभिश्चाग्निसमानवर्णैः।बभूव सैन्यं पिशिताशनानां सूर्योदये नीलमिवाभ्रबृन्दम्।।3.24.37।।
explanation: The army of demons equipped with blazing armour, bows and banners appeared like a mass of blue clouds at Sunrise. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे चतुर्विंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyfourth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Khara  and his army attack Rama -- Rama retaliates -- kills all the demons]अवष्टब्धधनुं रामं क्रुद्धं च रिपुघातिनम्।ददर्शाऽश्रममागम्य खरस्सह पुरस्सरैः।।3.25.1।।
explanation: Khara accompanied by his pilot party arrived at the hermitage of Rama, the destroyer of enemies and saw him in fury, standing ready with his bow.

content: तं दृष्ट्वा सशरं चापमुद्यम्य खरनिस्स्वनम्।रामस्याभिमुखं सूतं चोद्यतामित्यचोदयत्।।3.25.2।।
explanation: On seeing Rama, Khara held his terribly twanging bow and arrow, stood facing him, and ordered the charioteer to drive towards him.

content: स खरस्याज्ञया सूतस्तुरगान् समचोदयत्।यत्र रामो महाबाहुरेको चुन्वन्स्थितो धनुः।।3.25.3।।
explanation: Commanded by Khara, the charioteer also urged the horses towards the mightyarmed Rama standing alone and wielding the bow.

content: तं तु निष्पतितं दृष्ट्वा सर्वे ते रजनीचराः।नर्दमाना महानादं सचिवाः पर्यवारयन्।।3.25.4।।
explanation: Seeing Khara attacking (Rama) all the demon ministers surrounded him  roaring.

content: स तेषां यातुधानानां मध्ये रथगतः खरः।बभूव मध्ये ताराणां लोहिताङ्ग इवोदितः।।3.25.5।।
explanation: Seated on a chariot in the midst of the demons, Khara looked like the rising Mars in the middle of the stars.

content: ततश्शरसहस्रेण राममप्रतिमौजसम्।अर्दयित्वा महानादं ननाद समरे खरः।।3.25.6।।
explanation: Khara struck Rama of immeasurable prowess with a thousand arrows and roared loudly.

content: ततस्तं भीमधन्वानं क्रुद्धाः सर्वे निशाचराः।रामं नानाविधैः शस्स्रैरभ्यवर्षन्त दुर्जयम्।।3.25.7।।
explanation: Thereafter all the infuriated demons showered on invincible Rama, wielder of a fierce bow, many kinds of weapons.

content: मुद्गरैः पट्टसैश्शूलैः प्रासैः खङ्गै परश्वथैः।राक्षसास्समरे रामं निजघ्नू रोषतत्पराः।।3.25.8।।
explanation: Overtaken by anger, the demons continuously hurled at Rama hammers, spears, spikes, barbed missiles, swords and battleaxes.

content: ते वलाहसङ्काशा महानादा महौजसः।अभ्यधावन्त काकुत्स्थं रथैर्वाजिभिरेव च।।3.25.9।।गजैः पर्वतकूटाभै रामं युद्धे जिघांसवः।
explanation: Very powerful demons like huge clouds roared, eager to kill Rama in war. They ran forward on chariots, horses and tall elephants, looking like  mountain tops.

content: ते रामे शरवर्षाणि व्यसृजन् रक्षसां गणाः।।3.25.10।।शैलेन्द्रमिव धाराभिर्वर्षमाणा वलाहकाः।
explanation: The battalions of demons sent down streams of arrows on Rama just like clouds  downpour on mountains.

content: स तैः परिवृतो घोरैः राघवो रक्षसां गणैः।।3.25.11।।तिथिष्वि महादेवो वृत परिषदाङ्गणै
explanation: Surrounded by the terrible demons Rama appeared like Lord Siva at dusk with hosts of his retinues arounds.

content: तानि मुक्तानि शस्त्राणि यातुधानैस्सराघवः।प्रतिजग्राह विशिखैर्नद्योघानिव सागरः।।3.25.12।।
explanation: Rama resisted the weapons released by the demons like the sea, the inflow of river waters.

content: स तैः प्रहरणैर्घोरैर्भिन्नगात्रो न विव्यथे।रामः प्रदीप्तैर्बहुभिर्वज्रैरिव महाचलः।।3.25.13।।
explanation: Rama remained unhurt like a great mountain struck by many glowing thunderbolts. He felt no pain even though his limbs were hit by the dreadful weapons.

content: स विद्धः क्षतजादिग्धः सर्वगात्रेषु राघवः।बभूव रामः सन्ध्याभ्रैर्दिवाकर इवावृतः।।3.25.14।।
explanation: Wounded all over the body, bleeding through the wounds caused by weapons, Rama looked like the evening Sun covered with clouds.

content: विषेदुर्देवगन्धर्वास्सिद्धाश्च परमर्षयः।एकं सहस्रैर्भहुभिस्तदा दृष्ट्वा समावृतम्।।3.25.15।।
explanation: Seeing Rama left alone surrounded by many thousands of demons, the gods, ghandarvas and siddhas became very sad.

content: ततो रामस्सुसङ्कृद्धो मण्डलीकृतकार्मुकः।ससर्ज विशिखान्बाणाञ्छतशोऽथ सहस्रश।।3.25.16।।
explanation: Thereafter Rama, mighty angry, bent his bow and released hundreds and thousands of unfeathered arrows.

content: दुरावारान्दुर्विषहान्कालदण्डोपमान् रणे।मुमोच लीलया रामः कङ्कपत्रानजिह्मगान्।।3.25.17।।
explanation: As if sporting, Rama discharged the arrows attached with herons' feathers. The arrows were inescapable, unbearable like that of Yama's staff, that went straight without missing the target.

content: ते शराश्शत्रुसैन्येषु मुक्ता रामेण लीलया।अददू रक्षसां प्राणान्पाशाः कालकृता इव।।3.25.18।।
explanation: The arrows like the noose of the god of death released by Rama on the enemy army easily destroyed the lives of the demons.

content: भित्त्वा राक्षसदेहां स्तांस्ते शरा रुधिराप्लुताः।अन्तरिक्षगता रेजुर्दीप्ताग्निसमतेजसः।।3.25.19।।
explanation: Rama's arrows pierced the bodies of the demons and drenched in blood, they, looking like burning fire, shone in the sky.

content: असङ्ख्येयास्तु रामस्य सायकाश्चापमण्डलात्।विनिष्पेतुरतीवोग्रा रक्षःप्राणापहारिणः।।3.25.20।।
explanation: From Rama's bow bent into a cirle, countless fierce arrows able to take the lives of demons were released.

content: तैर्धनूंषि ध्वजाग्राणि वर्माणि च शिरांसि च।बाहून्सहस्ताभरणानूरून्करिकरोपमान्।।3.25.21।।चिच्छेद रामस्समरे शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः।
explanation: In war Rama cut asunder the bows, flag tops, armour and heads of demons, their shoulders and thighs that were like the trunks of elephants, in their hundreds and thousands.

content: हयान्काञ्चनसन्नाहान्रथयुक्तान्ससारथीन्।।3.25.22।।गजांश्च सगजारोहान्सहयान्सादिनस्तथा।पदातीन्समरे हत्वा ह्यनयद्यमसादनम्।।3.25.23।।
explanation: He killed horses with golden armours yoked to the chariots along with charioteers, elephants along with riders, the cavalry along with their horses and infantry and sent them all to the abode of death.

content: ततो नालीकनाराचैस्तीक्ष्णाग्रैश्च विकर्णिभिः।भीममार्तस्वरं चक्रुर्भिद्यमाना निशाचराः।।3.25.24।।
explanation: The bodies of the demons torn into pieces by the very sharp iron arrows and by the arrows called vikarni, they cried and shouted aloud in pitiable voices.

content: तत्सैन्यं निशितैर्बाणैरर्दितं मर्मभेदिभिः।रामेण न सुखं लेभे शुष्कं वनमिवाग्निना।।3.25.25।।
explanation: Just like the dried up forest burnt by the fire, the army was totally destroyed by Rama's arrows that pierced into the vital parts of the soldiers.

content: केचिद्भीमबलाश्शूराश्शूलान्खङ्गान्परश्वधान्।रामस्याभिमुखं गत्वा चिक्षिपुः परमायुधान्।।3.25.26।।
explanation: A few warriors of fierce strength approached Rama and hurled at him very powerful weapons, spears, swords and axes.

content: तानि बाणैर्महाबाहुश्शस्त्राण्यावार्य राघवः।जहार समरे प्राणांश्चिच्छेद च शिरोधरान्।।3.25.27।।
explanation: Strongarmed Rama attacked them with his arrows and cut off their heads and took their lives.

content: ते छिन्नशिरसः पेतुश्चिन्नवर्मशरासनाः।सुपर्णवातविक्षिप्ता जगत्यां पादपा यथा।।3.25.28।।
explanation: The heads, armour and bows fell down broken on the ground like trees in the wind gererated by Garuda's wings.

content: अवशिष्टाश्च ये तत्र विषण्णाश्च निशाचराः।खरमेवाभ्यधावन्त शरणार्थं शरार्दिताः।।3.25.29।।
explanation: The rest of the demons hit by the arrows ran desperate towards Khara for refuge.

content: तान्सर्वान्पुनरादाय समाश्वास्य च दूषणः।अभ्यधावत काकुत्स्थं क्रुद्धो रुद्रमिवान्तकः।।3.25.30।।
explanation: Pacifying them all, Dusana regathered them again and ran towards Rama like an angry Yama rushing towards Rudra.

content: निवृत्तास्तु पुनस्सर्वे दूषणाश्रयनिर्भयाः।राममेवाभ्यधावन्त सालतालशिलायुधाः।।3.25.31।।
explanation: Under Dusana's protection, all of them felt relieved from fear and, carrying sal and palm trees and stones as weapons, advanced towards Rama again.

content: शूलमुद्गरहस्ताश्च चापहस्ता महाबलाः।सृजन्तश्शरवर्षाणि शस्त्रवर्षाणि संयुगे।।3.25.32।।द्रुमवर्षाणि मुञ्चन्तश्शिलावर्षाणि राक्षसाः।।
explanation: Holding spears, hammers and bows in their hands, the mighty demons rained on Rama weapons like arrows, trees and stones.

content: तद्बभूवाद्भुतं युद्धं तुमुलं रोमहर्षणम्।रामस्य च महाघोरं पुनस्तेषां च रक्षसाम्।।3.25.33।।
explanation: The thrilling, fierce, horrifying and horripilating battle again ensued betwen Rama and the demons.

content: ते समन्तादतिक्रुद्धा राघवं पुनरभ्ययुः।।3.25.34।।तैश्च सर्वा दिशो दृष्ट्वा प्रदिशश्च समावृताः।राक्षसैरुद्यतप्रासैश्शरवर्षाभिवर्षिभिः।।3.25.35।।स कृत्वा भैरवं नादमस्त्रं परमभास्वरम्।संयोजयत गान्धर्वं राक्षसेषु महाबलः।।3.25.36।।
explanation: As the infuriated demons again hurtled towards Rama, filling the quarters and the intermediate directions and raining missiles, Rama aimed at them dazzling gandharvastras, producing a frightening warcry.

content: ततश्शरसहस्राणि निर्ययुश्चापमण्डलात्।सर्वा दश दिशो बाणैरावार्यन्त समागतैः।।3.25.37।।
explanation: Rama then let out from his bow, stretched round, thousands of arrows that covered all the ten quarters.

content: नाददानं शरान्घोरान्नमुञ्चन्तं शिलीमुखान्।विकर्षमाणं पश्यन्ति राक्षसास्ते शरार्दिताः।।3.25.38।।
explanation: The demons, though wounded, could not see whereform the terrible arrows came. They only saw Rama shooting the arrows.

content: शरान्धकारमाकाशमावृणोत्सदिवाकरम्।बभूवावस्थितो रामः प्रवमन्निव ताञ्छरान्।।3.25.39।।
explanation: Through the darkness created by the arrows that covered the sky and the Sun, Rama looked as though he was vomitting them.

content: युगपत्पतमानैश्च युगपच्च हतैर्भृशम्।युगपत्पतितैश्चैव विकीर्णा वसुधा भवत्।।3.25.40।।
explanation: It seemed as if it all happened at the same time, the entire earth filling with demons seriously injured, slain and fallen down on the ground.

content: निहताः पतिताः क्षीणाश्छिन्ना भिन्ना विदारिताः।तत्र तत्र स्म दृश्यन्ते राक्षसास्ते सहस्रशः।।3.25.41।।
explanation: There were bodies of demons pierced and torn, thinned and fallen down, destroyed, broken and cut into pieces scattered in their thousands.

content: सोष्णीषैरुत्तमाङ्गैश्च साङ्गदैर्बाहुभिस्तथा।ऊरुभिर्जानुभिश्छिन्नैर्नानारूपैविभूषणैः।।3.25.42।।हयैश्च द्विपमुख्यैश्च रथैर्भिन्नैरनेकशः।चामरैर्व्यजनैश्छत्रैर्ध्वजैर्नानाविधैरपि।।3.25.43।।रामस्य बाणाभिहतैर्विचित्रैश्शूलपट्टिसैः।खङ्गै खण्डीकृतैः प्रासैर्विकीर्णैश्च परश्वधैः।।3.25.44।।चूर्णिताभिश्शिलाभिश्च शरैश्चित्रैरनेकशः।विच्छिन्नैस्समरे भूमिर्विकीर्णाऽभूद्भयङ्करा।।3.25.45।।
explanation: Slain thus by Rama's arrows, the ground was littered with (bodies of) demons with limbs dismembered, headdresses and shoulders cut off, arms, thighs and knees decked with various ornaments amputated, chariots, horses, best of elephants, fans made of the tail of chamari deer (used as an insignia of royalty), umbrellas, several  flags, and weapons like spears, swords, darts, battleaxes and stones crushed into pieces and arrows splintered and scattered all over. The ground looked frightening.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे पञ्चविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyfifth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Dusana and his army chiefs get killed in severe combat with Ramathe  demon army also gets destroyed]दूषणस्तु स्वकं सैन्यं हन्यमानं निरीक्ष्य सः।सन्दिदेश महाबाहुर्भीमवेगान्दुरासदान्।।3.26.1।।राक्षसान्पञ्चसहस्रान्समरेष्वनिवर्तिनः।
explanation: Mightyarmed Dusana saw  the army  getting killed in war. He led the forces of five thousand demons, dreadfuly quick at fighting, dangeous to face and who will not beat a retreat.

content: ते शूलैः पट्टिशैः खङ्गै शिलावर्षैर्द्रुमैरपि।।3.26.2।।शरवर्षैरविच्छिन्नं ववर्षुस्तं समन्ततः।
explanation: The demons continuously hurled at him (Rama)  spears and swords and rained stones, trees and arrows from all sides

content: स दृमाणां शिलानां च वर्षं प्राणहरं महत्।।3.26.3।।प्रतिजग्राह धर्मात्मा राघवस्तीक्ष्णसायकैः।
explanation: Righteous Rama, retaliated with his sharp arrows such as the rain of trees and stones, the mighty destroyers of life.

content: प्रतिगृह्य च तद्वर्षं निमीलित इवर्षभः।।3.26.4।।रामः क्रोधं परं भेजे वधार्थं सर्वरक्षसाम्।
explanation: Rama retaliated in great anger to kill without caring for the shower of weapons like a bull with its eyes closed.

content: ततः क्रोधसमाविष्टः प्रदीप्त इव तेजसा।।3.26.5।।शरैरवाकिरत्सैन्यं सर्वतस्सहदूषणम्।
explanation: Overpowered by anger, Rama, with a blazing glow, covered Dusana and his army with his arrows.

content: ततस्सेनापतिः क्रुद्धो दूषणश्शत्रुदूषणः।।3.26.6।।शरैरशनिकल्पैस्तं राघवं समवाकिरत्।
explanation: Thereafter Dusana, chief of the army, angrily released at Rama equally powerful arrows comparable to thunderbolt.

content: ततो रामस्सुसङ्कृद्धः क्षुरेणास्य महद्धनुः।।3.26.7।।चिच्छेद समरे वीरश्चतुर्भिश्चतुरो हयान्।
explanation: Heroic Rama, mighty angry, then, broke the big bow of  Dusana, with his swordlike arrow. And with a series of four arrows cut his four horses to pieces.

content: हत्वा चाश्वान्शरैस्तीक्ष्णैरर्धचन्द्रेण सारथेः।।3.26.8।।शिरो जहार तद्रक्षस्त्रिभिर्विव्याध वक्षसि।
explanation: After killing the horses with sharp arrows Rama severed the charioteer's head with an arrow of the shape of the crescent moon and pierced Dusana's chest with a set of three arrows.

content: स च्छिन्नधन्वा विरथो हताश्वो हतसारथिः।।3.26.9।।जग्राह गिरिशृङ्गाभं परिघं रोमहर्षणम्।वेष्टितं काञ्चनैः पट्टैर्देवसैन्यप्रमर्दनम्।।3.26.10।।आयसैश्शङ्कुभिस्तीक्ष्णैः कीर्णं परवसोक्षितम्।वज्राशनिसमस्पर्शं परगोपुरदारणम्।।3.26.11।।
explanation: With his bow and chariot broken, charioteer and horses killed,  Dusana took up a spear in his hand that appeared like a huge mountain top. Bound by golden bands, covered the iron nails, wetted with the enemy's marrow it created a horripilation. It appeared as though it  could crush the army of gods and render the enemy powerless. It carried the killing touch of the thunderbolt and could break open the enemy's fort.

content: तं महोरगसङ्काशं प्रगृह्य परिघं रणे।दूषणोऽभ्यद्रवद्रामं क्रूरकर्मा निशाचरः।।3.26.12।।
explanation: With the spear that looked like a mighty serpent, Dusana, the cruel demon, advanced towards Rama.

content: तस्याभिपतमानस्य दूषणस्य स राघवः।द्वाभ्यां शराभ्यां चिच्छेद सहस्ताभरणौ भुजौ।।3.26.13।।
explanation: Seeing Dusana going to pounce upon him, Rama cut off with two arrows both his arms adorned with armlets.

content: भ्रष्टस्तस्य महाकायः पपात रणमूर्धनि।परिघश्छिन्नहस्तस्य शक्रध्वज इवाग्रतः।।3.26.14।।
explanation: With the hands amputated, his huge spear, like the banner of Indra, slipped off his hands and fell down on the ground on the battle front.

content: स कराभ्यां विकीर्णाभ्यां पपात भुवि दूषणः।विषाणाभ्यां विशीर्णाभ्यां मनस्वीव महागजः।।3.26.15।।
explanation: Dusana fell down on the ground with broken hands like a proud elephant with both his tusks shattered.

content: तं दृष्ट्वा पतितं भूमौ दूषणं निहतं रणे।साधुसाध्विति काकुत्स्थं सर्वभूतान्यपूजयन्।।3.26.16।।
explanation: Seeing Dusaana collapse dead on the ground, all beings hailed Rama, saying, 'Well done, well done'.

content: एतस्मिन्नन्तरे क्रुद्धास्त्रयः सेनाग्रयायिनः।संहृत्याभ्यद्रवन् रामं मृत्युपाशावपाशिताः।।3.26.17।।महाकपालः स्थूलाक्षः प्रमाथी च महाबलः।
explanation: Meanwhile all the three army chiefs, Mahakapala, Sthulaksha, and the mighty Pramathi ran towards Rama in anger, bound (as though) by the noose of death.

content: महाकपालो विपुलं शूलमुद्यम्य राक्षसः।।3.26.18।।स्थूलाक्षः पट्टिसं गृह्य प्रमाथी च परश्वधम्।
explanation: Mahakapala had a huge spear, Sthulaksha, a sharpedged spear and Pramathi, a battleaxe.

content: दृष्ट्वैवापततस्तूर्णं राघवस्सायकैश्शितैः।।3.26.19।।तीक्ष्णाग्रैः प्रतिजग्राह सम्प्राप्तानतिथीनिव।
explanation: On seeing them rushing to attack him with sharp weapons, Rama received them quickly with pointed arrows as though they were guests.

content: महाकपालस्य शिरश्चिच्छेद परमेषुभिः।।3.26.20।।असङ्ख्येयैस्तु बाणौघैः प्रममाथ प्रमाथिनम्।स पपात हतो भूमौ विटपीव महाद्रुमः।।3.26.21।।
explanation: Mahakapala's head was cut to pieces with sharp arrows and Pramathi was killed with a countless series  of arrows. Pramathi's body, like a huge tree with many branches collapsed on the ground.

content: स्थूलाक्षस्याक्षिणी तीक्ष्णैः पूरयामास सायकैः।दूषणस्यानुगान्पञ्चसहस्रान्कुपितः क्षणात्।।3.26.22।।बाणौघैः पञ्चसाहस्रैरनयद्यमसादनम्।
explanation: Rama filled the eyes of Sthulaksha with sharp arrows, and in anger shot five thousand arrows at the five thousand followers of Dusana in a moment and sent them to the abode of Yama.

content: दूषणं निहतं दृष्ट्वा तस्य चैव पदानुगान्।।3.26.23।।व्यादिदेश खरः क्रुद्धः सेनाध्यक्षान्महाबलान्।
explanation: Seeing Dusana and his followers killed, enraged Khara commanded his extremely strong army chiefs this way:

content: अयं विनिहतस्संख्ये दूषणस्सपदानुगः।।3.26.24।।महत्या सेनया सार्धं युद्ध्वा रामं कुमानुषम्।शस्त्रैर्नानाविधाकारैर्हनध्वं सर्वराक्षसाः।।3.26.25।।
explanation: Dusana and his followers are killed in the battle. You, all the demons, along with your great army and different kinds of weapons should kill that wicked human being, Rama.

content: एवमुक्त्वा खरः क्रुद्धो राममेवाभिदुद्रुवे।श्येनगामी पृथुग्रीवो यज्ञशत्रुर्विहङ्गमः।।3.26.26।।दुर्जयः करवीराक्षः परुषः कालकार्मुकः।मेघमाली महामाली सर्पास्यो रुधिराशनः।।3.26.27।।द्वादशैते महावीर्या बलाध्यक्षास्ससैनिकाः।राममेवाभ्यधावन्त विसृजन्तश्शरोत्तमान्।।3.26.28।।
explanation: Having spoken thus, angry Khara ran towards Rama. Syenagami, Pruthugriva, Yajnasatru, Vihanga, Durjaya, Karaveeraksha, Parusha, Kalakarmuka, Meghamali, Mahamali, Sarpasya, Rudhirasanaall these twelve valiant army chiefs along with their forces rushed towards Rama, releasing the sharpest arrows at him.

content: ततः पावकसङ्काशैर्हेमवज्रविभूषितैः।जघान शेषं तेजस्वी तस्य सैन्यस्य सायकैः।।3.26.29।।
explanation: Powerful Rama thereafter slayed the remaining army with his weapons studded with gold and diamonds and glowing like fire.

content: ते रुक्मपुङ्खा विशिखास्सधूमा इव पावकाः।निजघ्नुस्तानि रक्षांसि वज्रा इव महाद्रुमान्।।3.26.30।।
explanation: The goldtipped arrows which resembled fire covered with smoke shattered the army of demons like huge trees knocked down by thunder.

content: रक्षसां तु शतं रामश्शतेनैकेन कर्णिना।सहस्रं च सहस्रेण जघान रणमूर्धनि।।3.26.31।।
explanation: Rama killed a hundred demons  with one hundred arrows by a single stroke. The same way he killed a thousand of them with a thousand arrows on the battle front.

content: तैर्भिन्नवर्माभरणाश्छिन्नभिन्नशरासनाः।निपेतुश्शोणितादिग्धा धरण्यां रजनीचराः।।3.26.32।।
explanation: The demons fell down on the ground with their shields  and ornaments broken, their  bows stained with blood splintered.

content: तैर्मुक्तकेशैस्समरे पतितैश्शोणितोक्षितैः।आस्तीर्णा वसुधा कृत्स्ना महावेदिः कुशैरिव।।3.26.33।।
explanation: The entire ground was littered with bodies of demons fallen in the battle with loose hair and with drops of blood on them looking like a great sacrificial altar strewn all over with kusa grass.

content: क्षणेन तु महाघोरं वनं निहतराक्षसम्।बभूव निरयप्रख्यं मांसशोणितकर्दमम्।।3.26.34।।
explanation: With the slaughtered bodies of demons lying on the ground, the forest in a moment looked very dreadful like hell with the mud of soil soaked with flesh and blood.

content: चतुर्दश सहस्राणि रक्षसां भीमकर्मणाम्।हतान्येकेन रामेण मानुषेण पदातिना।।3.26.35।।
explanation: Fourteen thousand formidable demons were killed by Rama, a pedestrian human,  singlehanded.

content: तस्य सैन्यस्य सर्वस्य खरश्शेषो महारथः।राक्षसस्त्रिशिराश्चैव रामश्च रिपुसूदनः।।3.26.36।।
explanation: Of that entire army great warrior Khara,Trisira and Rama, destroyer of foes alone remained.

content: शेषा हता महासत्वा राक्षसा रणमूर्धनि।घोरा दुर्विषहाः सर्वे लक्ष्मणस्याग्रजेन ते।।3.26.37।।
explanation: The rest of the mighty, dreadful, intolerable demons were killed on the war front by Rama, elder brother to Lakshmana.

content: ततस्तु तद्भीमबलं महाहवे समीक्ष्य रामेण हतं बलीयसा।रथेन रामं महता खरस्तदा समाससादेन्द्र इवोद्यताशनिः।।3.26.38।।
explanation: Thereafter seeing the formidable army killed by mighty Rama, Khara lifted a thunderbolt like Indra, and advanced towards Rama in a great chariot.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वालमिकिय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे षङ्विंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentysixth sarga in Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama's fight with Trisira -- death of Trisira.]खरं तु रामाभिमुखं प्रयान्तं वाहिनीपतिः। राक्षसस्त्रिशिरा नाम सन्निपत्येदमब्रवीत्।।3.27.1।।
explanation: As Khara advanced towards Rama, Trisira the chief of the army approached him and said these words:

content: मां नियोजय विक्रान्त सन्निवर्तस्व साहसात्। पश्य रामं महाबाहुं संयुगे विनिपातितम्।।3.27.2।।
explanation: O valiant one assign this work to me. Refrain from this audacity. See how I am going to put down the mightyarmed Rama in the battle.

content: प्रतिजानामि ते सत्यमायुधं चाहमालभे। यथा रामं वधिष्यामि वधार्हं सर्वरक्षसाम्।।3.27.3।।
explanation: I promise you on my weapon that I will kill Rama.He who killed all demons deserves to be slain.

content: अहं वास्य रणे मृत्युरेष वा समरे मम। विनिवृत्य रणोत्साहान्मुहूर्तं प्राश्निको भव।।3.27.4।।
explanation: Restrain yourself for a moment from the enthusiasm to fight the war. Please act as an arbitrator and see who is killing whom.

content: प्रहृष्टो वा हते रामे जनस्थानं प्रयास्यसि। मयि वा निहते रामं संयुगायोपयास्यसि।।3.27.5।।
explanation: If Rama is killed be happy and go to Janasthana or else if I am killed you can fight.

content: खरस्त्रिशिरसा तेन मृत्युलोभात्प्रसादितः। गच्छ युध्येत्यनुज्ञातो राघवाभिमुखो ययौ।।3.27.6।।
explanation: When Khara was prevailed upon by Trisara in that manner with a wish to face death, Khara  permitted him  by saying 'You may go and fight'.Accordingly he advanced towards Rama.

content: त्रिशिराश्च रथेनैव वाजियुक्तेन भास्वता। अभ्यद्रवद्रणे रामं त्रिशृङ्ग इव पर्वतः।।3.27.7।।
explanation: Trisira who looked a mountain with three peaks also got horses harnessed to a shining chariot and to attack Rama proceeded.

content: शरधारासमूहान्स महामेघ इवोत्सृजन्। व्यसृजत्सदृशं नादं जलार्द्रस्य तु दुन्दुभेः।।3.27.8।।
explanation: Trisira unleashed a stream of arrows like a huge cloud (releasing rain). They produced sound, a drum drenched with water, creates.

content: आगच्छन्तं त्रिशिरसं राक्षसं प्रेक्ष्य राघवः। धनुषा प्रतिजग्राह विधुन्वन्सायकान् शितान्।।3.27.9।।
explanation: On seeing demon Trisira advancing towards him, Rama shook sharp arrows off his bow.

content: स सम्प्रहारस्तुमुलो रामत्रिशिरसोर्महान्। बभूवातीव बलिनोस्सिंहकुञ्जरयोरिव।।3.27.10।।
explanation: The tumultuous combat between Rama and Trisira looked like the strong fight between a lion and an elephant.

content: ततस्त्रिशिरसा बाणैर्ललाटे ताडितस्त्रिभिः। अमर्षी कुपितोरामस्संरब्धमिदमब्रवीत्।।3.27.11।।
explanation: Then Rama hit  with three arrows on the forehead by Trisira flew into a fury and said in a state of great excitement:

content: अहो विक्रमशूरस्य राक्षसस्येदृशं बलम्। पुष्पैरिव शरैर्यस्य ललाटेऽस्मिन्परिक्षतः।।3.27.12।।
explanation: Oh see the strength of this undaunted demon whose arrows fell like flowers on my forehead and only left a scratch.

content: ममापि प्रतिगृह्णीष्व शरांश्चापगुणाच्च्युतान्। एवमुक्त्वा तु संरब्धश्शरानाशीविषोपमान्।3.27.13।।त्रिशिरोवक्षसि क्रुद्धो निजघान चतुर्दश।
explanation: Receive the arrows released from my bowstring. Saying so, the angry and agitated Rama discharged fourteen arrows, venomous like a snake, on the chest of Trisira .

content: चतुर्भिस्तुरगानस्य शरैः सन्नतपर्वभिः।।3.27.14।।न्यपातयत तेजस्वी चतुरस्तस्य वाजिनः।
explanation: With four arrows having strong joints, the mighty hero (Rama) threw down his enemy's four swiftfooted horses.

content: अष्टभिस्सायकैस्सूतं रथोपस्थान्न्यपातयत्।।3.27.15।।रामश्चिच्छेद बाणेन ध्वजं चास्य समुच्छ्रितम्।
explanation: Rama brought down the charioteer with eight arrows and with one tore down the lofty banner of the chariot to shreds.

content: ततो हतरथात्तस्मादुत्पतन्तं निशाचरम्।।3.27.16।।बिभेद रामस्तं बाणैर्हृदये सोऽभवज्जडः।
explanation: Rama then hit the demon with arrows on his chest while he was running away from the broken chariot. The demon became numb.

content: सायकैश्चाप्रमेयात्मा सामर्षस्तस्य रक्षसः।।3.27.17।।शिरांस्यपातयद्रामो वेगवद्भिस्त्रिभिश्शितैः।
explanation: The mighty Rama in fury dismembered the heads of that demon with three sharp and swift arrows.

content: स भूमौ रुधिरोद्गारी रामबाणाभिपीडितः।।3.27.18।।न्यपतत्पतितैः पूर्वं स्वशिरोभिर्निशाचरः।
explanation: The demon with his heads decapitated, hit by Rama's arrows a little while ago, fell down, vomitting blood.

content: हतशेषास्ततो भग्ना राक्षसाः खरसंश्रया।।3.27.19।।द्रवन्ति स्म न तिष्ठन्ति व्याघ्रत्रस्ता मृगा इव।
explanation: Those surviving demons who were under the protection of Khara got scared and retreated fast and fled like deer frightened by a tiger.

content: तान्खरो द्रवतो दृष्ट्वा निवर्त्य रुषितस्स्वयम्।।3.27.20।।राममेवाभिदुद्राव राहुश्चन्द्रमसं यथा।
explanation: Personally persuading the fleeing army to come back, the angry Khara leaped forward towards Rama just as Rahu approaches the moon.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे सप्तविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyseventh sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Combat between Rama and Khara---- wounded Khara gets down the chariot to fight-- deities assemble-- worship great Rama.]निहतं दूषणं दृष्ट्वा रणे त्रिशिरसा सह।खरस्याप्यभवत्त्रासो दृष्ट्वा रामस्य विक्रमम्।।3.28.1।।
explanation: Khara was overtaken by fear at the prowess of Rama, when he saw Dusana and Trisira killed.

content: स दृष्ट्वा राक्षसं सैन्यमविसह्यं महाबलः।हतमेकेन रामेण त्रिशिरोदूषणावपि।।3.28.2।।तद्बलं हतभूयिष्ठं विमनाः प्रेक्ष्य राक्षसः।आससाद खरो रामं नमुचिर्वासवं यथा।।3.28.3।।
explanation: Khara, the mighty demon, saw his large, irrepressible army killed. He saw Trisira and Dusana slain singlehanded by Rama. Nervous, he advanced towards Rama wage war just as Namuchi approached Indra.

content: विकृष्य बलवच्चापं नाराचान्रक्तभोजनान्।खरश्चिक्षेप रामाय क्रुद्धानाशीविषानिव।।3.28.4।।
explanation: Khara drew his strong bowstring in anger and released the bloodhungry arrows, which appeared like venomous snakes.

content: ज्यां विधून्वंसुबहुशश्शिक्षयास्त्राणि दर्शयन्।चचार समरे मार्गाञ्छरै रथगतः खरः।।3.28.5।।
explanation: Khara, sat on the chariot, and with a twang of his bowstring released arrows in all directions, exhibiting his skill in the use of weapons.

content: स सर्वाश्च दिशो बाणैः प्रदिशश्च महारथः।पूरयामास तं दृष्ट्वा रामोऽपि सुमहद्धनुः।।3.28.6।।
explanation: When Rama, the great warrior, saw Khara approaching him, he fixed powerful arrows  on his bow and covered all directions and intermediate quarters with his arrows.

content: स सायकैर्दुर्विसहैस्सस्फुलिङ्गैरिवाग्निभिः।नभश्चकाराविवरं पर्जन्य इव वृष्टिभिः।।3.28.7।।
explanation: He rained sparkling arrows which were irresistible. He filled the sky with arrows just as the raingod fills it with rain without leaving any space.

content: तद्बभूव शितैर्बाणैः खररामविसर्जितैः।पर्याकाशमनाकाशं सर्वतश्शरसङ्कुलम्।।3.28.8।।
explanation: The arrows released by Khara and Rama on one another filled the entire sky. Everywhere only arrows and no sky could be seen.

content: शरजालावृतस्सूर्यो न तदा स्म प्रकाशते।अन्योन्यवधसंरम्भादुभयोस्संप्रयुध्यतोः।।3.28.9।।
explanation: While they were engaged in the battle, eager to kill each other the sky was covered with arrow and the Sun could not be seen.

content: ततो नालीकनाराचैस्तीक्ष्णाग्रैश्च विकर्णिभिः।आजघान खरो रामं तोत्रैरिव महाद्विपम्।।3.28.10।।
explanation: Then Khara shot Rama with Nalika darts and darts called Vikarni like goads hit a mighty elephant.

content: तं रथस्थं धनुष्पाणिं राक्षसं पर्यवस्थितम्।ददृशुस्सर्वभूतानि पाशहस्तमिवान्तकम्।।3.28.11।।
explanation: Demon Khara positioned on the chariot, bow in hand, appeared to all beings like Yama, god of death holding the noose.

content: हन्तारं सर्वसैन्यस्य पौरुषे पर्यवस्थितम्।परिश्रान्तं महासत्वं मेने रामं खरस्तदा।।3.28.12।।
explanation: Khara thought valiant Rama who had destroyed his whole army might be exhausted by now.

content: तं सिंहमिव विक्रान्तं सिंहविक्रान्तगामिनम्।दृष्ट्वा नोद्विजते रामः सिंहः क्षुद्रमृगं यथा।।3.28.13।।
explanation: When Rama saw Khara aggressively advancing like a lion to attack him, he was not perturbed, for he knew he was a fawn before a lion (which Rama was).

content: ततः सूर्यनिकाशेन रथेन महता खरः।आससाद रणे रामं पतङ्ग इव पावकम्।।3.28.14।।
explanation: Then Khara mounting a great chariot which was glowing like the Sun, advanced towards Rama just as an insect hurtles towards fire.

content: ततोऽस्य सशरं चापं मुष्टिदेशे महात्मनः।खरश्चिच्छेद रामस्य दर्शयन्पाणिलाघवम्।।3.28.15।।
explanation: Exhibiting his agility of the hand, Khara shattered the bow and the arrow in the grip of Rama ,the  great soul.

content: स पुनस्त्वपरान्सप्त शरानादाय वर्मणि।निजघान खरः क्रुद्धश्शक्राशनिसमप्रभान्।।3.28.16।।
explanation: The influriated Khara this time took up seven arrows blazing like Indra's thunderbolt  and hit his armour.

content: ततस्तत्प्रहतं बाणैः खरमुक्तैस्सुपर्वभिः।पपात कवचं भूमौ रामस्यादित्यवर्चसः।।3.28.17।।
explanation: The armour of Rama who looked radiant like the Sun fell on the ground, struck by the welljointed darts released by Khara.

content: ततश्शरसहस्रेण राममप्रतिमौजसम्।अर्दयित्वा महानादं ननाद समरे खरः।।3.28.18।।
explanation: Khara then attacked Rama of unequal strength in fight, with a thousand darts  and roared loudly.

content: स शरैरर्दितः क्रुद्धस्सर्वगात्रेषु राघवः।रराज समरे रामो विधूमोऽग्निरिव ज्वलन्।।3.28.19।।
explanation: Rama, scion of the Raghu race, afflicted by the darts in all parts of the body, glowed in his anger like smokeless fire burning.

content: ततो गम्भीरनिर्ह्रादं रामश्शत्रुनिबर्हणः।चकारान्ताय स रिपोस्सज्यमन्यन्महद्धनुः।।3.28.20।।
explanation: Then Rama, destroyer of foes, strung another great bow of fearful sound in order to put an end to the enemy.

content: सुमहद्वैष्णवं यत्तदतिसृष्टं महर्षिणा।वरं तद्धनुरुद्यम्य खरं समभिधावत।।3.28.21।।
explanation: Thereafter Rama advanced, aiming at Khara the superior Vaishnava bow given by sage Agastya.

content: ततः कनकपुङ्खैस्तु शरैस्सन्नतपर्वभिः।बिभेद रामस्सङ्क्रुद्धः खरस्य समरे ध्वजम्।।3.28.22।।
explanation: Rama took up in a rage the welljointed, smooth darts with golden feathers and broke the flag post of the chariot of Khara to pieces.

content: स दर्शनीयो बहुधा विकीर्णः काञ्चनध्वजः।जगाम धरणीं सूर्यो देवतानामिवाज्ञया।।3.28.23।।
explanation: The beautiful, golden flag post, broken into several pieces, fell down on earth.It appeared as if the Sun had come down to earth at the behest of the gods.

content: तं चतुर्भिः खरः क्रुद्धो रामं गात्रेषु मार्गणैः।विव्याध युधि मर्मज्ञो मातङ्गमिव तोमरैः।।3.28.24।।
explanation: Quite enraged, Khara who knew how to hit the tender parts (of the body) in an encounter sent out four arrows on Rama. It was like poking an elephant's limbs with a javelin.

content: स रामो बहुभिर्बाणैः खरकार्मुकनिस्सृतैः।विद्धो रुधिरसिक्ताङ्गो बभूव रुषितो भृशम्।।3.28.25।।
explanation: Rama, hit by the arrows released from the bow of Khara, all his limbs drenched in blood, became very furious.

content: स धनुर्धन्विनां श्रेष्ठः प्रगृह्य परमाहवे।मुमोच परमेष्वासष्षट्छरानभिलक्षितान्।।3.28.26।।
explanation: The best among archers and a supreme shooter, he lifted the bow, fixed his target and released six arrows in the great fight.

content: शिरस्येकेन बाणेन द्वाभ्यां बह्वोरथार्दयत्।त्रिभिश्चन्द्रार्धवक्त्रैश्च वक्षस्यभिजघान ह।।3.28.27।।
explanation: Rama hit one arrow on the head, two on the shoulders and three of the shape of the crescent moon on the chest (of the enemy).

content: ततः पश्चान्महातेजा नाराचान्भास्करोपमान्।जिघांसू राक्षसङ्कृद्धस्त्रयोदश समाददे।।3.28.28।।
explanation: Enraged and effulgent Rama took up thirteen darts, radiant like the Sun, with a wish to kill the demon.

content: ततोऽस्य युगमेकेन चतुर्भिश्चतुरो हयान्।षष्ठेन तु शिरस्सङ्ख्ये खरस्य रथसारथेः।।3.28.29।।त्रिभिस्त्रिवेणुं बलवान्द्वाभ्यामक्षं महाबलः।द्वादशेन तु बाणेन खरस्य सशरं धनुः।।3.28.30।।छित्वा वज्रनिकाशेन राघवः प्रहसन्निव।त्रयोदशेनेन्द्रसमो बिभेद समरे खरम्।।3.28.31।।
explanation: Rama, like Indra, strong and mighty, broke the yoke of Khara's chariot with one arrow, the four horses with four arrows, and with the sixth the charioteer's head, with three others the main pole of the chariot, with two the axle of the chariot, and with the twelfth Khara's bow and arrows were splintered. As if laughing at him, he pierced Khara's body with the thirteenth arrow.

content: प्रभग्नधन्वा विरथो हताश्वो हतसारथिः।गदापाणिरवप्लुत्य तस्थौ भूमौ खरस्तदा।।3.28.32।।
explanation: Then, with bow broken, chariot destroyed, horses and charioteer dead, Khara jumped  down the chariot and stood on the ground holding a mace.

content: तत्कर्म रामस्य महारथस्य समेत्य देवाश्च महर्षयश्च।अपूजयन्प्राञ्जलयः प्रहृष्टाः तदा विमानाग्रगतास्समेताः।।3.28.33।।
explanation: Then the gods, along with great sages came down in aerial chariots and assembled there. Delighted, they adored Rama, the great warrior, with folded hands for the work done.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकिय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे अष्टाविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyeigth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Encounter between  Rama and Khara.]खरं तु विरथं रामो गदापाणिमवस्थितम्।मृदुपूर्वं महातेजाः परुषं वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।3.29.1।।
explanation: Effulgent Rama looked at Khara who stood with a mace in hand minus his chariot  and said to him first in a gentle voice and then harshly :

content: गजाश्वरथसम्बाधे बले महति तिष्ठता।कृतं सुदारुणं कर्म सर्वलोकजुगुप्सितम्।।3.29.2।।
explanation: Although you command a huge army with many elephants, horses, chariots, etc.  you have done such cruel deeds that the entire world despises you.

content: उद्वेजनीयो भूतानां नृशंसः पापकर्मकृत्।त्रयाणामपि लोकानामीश्वरोऽपि न तिष्ठति।।3.29.3।।
explanation: One who  is wicked, does sinful deeds and causes distress to all beings, will not survive even if he is the lord of the three worlds.

content: कर्म लोकविरुद्धं तु कुर्वाणं क्षणदाचर।तीक्ष्णं सर्वजनो हन्ति सर्पं दुष्टमिवागतम्।।3.29.4।।
explanation: O nightranger, one who does a horrific deed which is against the world will be killed like an evil serpent come near.

content: लोभात्पापानि कुर्वाणः कामाद्वा यो न बुध्यते।भ्रष्टः पश्यति तस्यान्तं ब्राह्मणी करकादिव।।3.29.5।।
explanation: Whoever commits sinful deeds out of greed or passion and without realisation will be ruined at the end like a lizard that eats hailstone (and dies).

content: वसतो दण्डकारण्ये तापसान्धर्मचारिणः।किन्नु हत्वा महाभागान्फलं प्राप्स्यसि राक्षस।।3.29.6।।
explanation: O demon  what benefit will you  get by killing the venerable ascetics, followers of righteous path residing in Dandaka forest?

content: न चिरं पापकर्माणः क्रूरा लोकजुगुप्सिताः।ऐश्वर्यं प्राप्य तिष्ठन्ति शीर्णमूला इव द्रुमाः।।3.29.7।।
explanation: Cruel people, who are despised by the world for their sinful deeds, will not  be prosperous for long just like trees with decayed roots.

content: अवश्यं लभते जन्तुः फलं पापस्य कर्मणः।घोरं पर्यागते काले द्रुमाः पुष्पमिवार्तवम्।।3.29.8।।
explanation: Just as the trees bear flowers at the proper season, so also people will certainly reap the fruits of their terrible, sinful deeds at appropriate time.

content: नचिरात्प्राप्यते लोके पापानां कर्मणां फलम्।सविषाणामिवान्नानां भुक्तानां क्षणदाचर।।3.29.9।।
explanation: O nightranger  people will reap the result of their sinful actions in this world soon like one eating poisonous food.

content: पापमाचरतां घोरं लोकस्याप्रियमिच्छताम्।अहमासादितो राजा प्राणान्हन्तुं निशाचर।।3.29.10।।
explanation: O nightranger  I have come with the orders of the king to put an end to the lives of the perpetrators of dreadful, sinful and offensive deeds in this world.

content: अद्य हि त्वां मया मुक्ताश्शराः काञ्चनभूषणाः।विदार्यातिपतिष्यन्ति वल्मीकमिव पन्नगाः।।3.29.11।।
explanation: Now when I unleash the golden  arrows, they will pierce through your body and come out like serpents emerging from the anthill.

content: ये त्वया दण्डकारण्ये भक्षिता धर्मचारिणः।तानद्य निहतस्सङ्ख्ये ससैन्योऽनुगमिष्यसि।।3.29.12।।
explanation: Slain by me in the battle today, you and your army will follow the righteous men eaten by you in Dandaka forest.

content: अद्य त्वां निहतं बाणैः पश्यन्तु परमर्षयः।निरयस्थं विमानस्था ये त्वया हिंसिताः पुरा।।3.29.13।।
explanation: The great seers whom you have earlier tortured and killed will, from their aerial vehicles, see you fallen into hell.

content: प्रहर त्वं यथाकामं कुरु यत्नं कुलाधम।अद्य ते पातयिष्यामि शिरस्तालफलं यथा।।3.29.14।।
explanation: O vile fellow, now you may strike at me as you please. I will make your head fall  down like a palm fruit.

content: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण कृद्धस्संरक्तलोचनः।प्रत्युवाच खरो रामं प्रहसन्क्रोधमूर्छितः।।3.29.15।।
explanation: Challenged by Rama  in that manner, Khara, his senses switched off, eyes turned red due to anger, replied laughing :

content: प्राकृतान्राक्षसान्हत्वा युद्धे दशरथात्मज।आत्मना कथमात्मानमप्रशस्यं प्रशंससि।।3.29.16।।
explanation: O son of Dasaratha, it is not praiseworthy to kill ordinary demons in war. Why do you praise yourself for it?

content: विक्रान्ता बलवन्तो वा ये भवन्ति नरर्षभाः।कथयन्ति न ते किञ्चित्तेजसा स्वेन गर्विताः।।3.29.17।।
explanation: The valiant, strong and the best of men do not at all speak proudly of themselves  and their valour.

content: प्राकृतास्त्वकृतात्मानो लोके क्षत्रियपांसनाः।निरर्थकं विकत्थन्ते यथा राम विकत्थसे।।3.29.18।।
explanation: O Rama common people, having no control over themselves and the lowest of kshatriyas boast of themselves in the world in a meaningless way as you are doing (now).

content: कुलं व्यपदिशन्वीरस्समरे कोऽभिधास्यति।मृत्युकाले हि सम्प्राप्ते स्वयमप्रस्तवे स्तवम्।।3.29.19।।
explanation: When death comes in a battle no hero will name his race and boast of himself unnessarily.

content: सर्वथैव लघुत्वं ते कत्थनेन विदर्शितम्।सुवर्णप्रतिरूपेण तप्तेनेव कुशाग्निना।।3.29.20।।
explanation: All your meanness is exhibited by your boasting just as the kusa grass caught by fire appears like gold.

content: न तु मामिह तिष्ठन्तं पश्यसि त्वं गदाधरम्।धराधरमिवाकम्प्यं पर्वतं धातुभिश्चितम्।।3.29.21।।
explanation: Indeed, (it is strange that) you do not see me holding a mace and standing here like an unshakeable mountain which contains minerals and supports the earth.

content: पर्याप्तोऽहं गदापाणिर्हन्तुं प्राणान्रणे तव।त्रयाणामपि लोकानां पाशहस्त इवान्तकः।।3.29.22।।
explanation: Just like lord Yama, holding a noose of death is alone enough to destroy the three worlds, I am alone sufficient to take away your life in war, a mace in hand.

content: कामं बह्वपि वक्तव्यं त्वयि वक्ष्यामि न त्वहम्।अस्तं गच्छेद्धि सविता युद्धविघ्नस्ततो भवेत्।।3.29.23।।
explanation: Indeed, I shall not speak any more even though a lot can be said on you. But the Sun is about to set and it will be improper to wage war thereafter.

content: चतुर्दश सहस्राणि राक्षसानां हतानि ते।त्वद्विनाशात्करोम्येषां तेषामश्रुप्रमार्जनम्।।3.29.24।।
explanation: You have killed these fourteen thousand demons. Therefore, I will wipe their tears by destroying you.

content: इत्युक्त्वा परमक्रुद्धस्तां गदां परमाङ्गदः।खरश्चिक्षेप रामाय प्रदीप्तामशनिं यथा।।3.29.25।।
explanation: Having said this, highly enraged Khara adorned with large shoulder bands, hurled  at Rama, his mace glowing like a thunderbolt.

content: खरबाहुप्रयुक्ता सा प्रदीप्ता महती गदा।भस्मवृक्षांश्च गुल्मांश्च कृत्वागात्तत्समीपतः।।3.29.26।।
explanation: The huge, blazing mace hurled by Khara's arms reduced the trees and shrubs into ashes and came close to Rama.

content: तामापतन्तीं ज्वलतां मृत्युपाशोपमां गदाम्।अन्तरिक्षगतां रामचशिच्छेद बहुधा शरैः।।3.29.27।।
explanation: The mace, which moved in the sky burning like the noose of death was shattered to pieces by Rama.

content: सा विकीर्णा शरैर्भग्ना पपात धरणीतले।गदा मन्त्रौषधबलैर्व्यालीव विनिपातिता।।3.29.28।।
explanation: The mace shattered by the arrows of Rama , fell down scattered to pieces on the ground like a female serpent subdued by the force of mantras and medicine.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकोनत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyninth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Khara's death in the hands of Rama-- gods and charanas praise him offer prayers-- Lakshmana and Sita come out of the cave.]भित्त्वा तु तां गदां बाणै राघवो धर्मवत्सलः।स्मयमानः खरं वाक्यं संरब्धमिदमब्रवीत्।।3.30.1।।
explanation: Rama, fond of dharma, broke into pieces Khara's mace with his arrows, and smiling at bewildered Khara, said:

content: एतत्ते बलसर्वस्वं दर्शितं राक्षसाधम।शक्तिहीनतरो मत्तो वृथा त्वमवगर्जसि।।3.30.2।।
explanation: O lowly demon, you have already exhibited all your strength. Inferior to me in energy, you are needlessly roaring.

content: एषा बाणविनिर्भिन्ना गदा भूमितलं गता।अभिधानप्रगल्भस्य तव प्रत्ययघातिनी।।3.30.3।।
explanation: The mace about which you boasted so much has betrayed your confidence. Shattered by my arrows it now lies on the ground.

content: यत्त्वयोक्तं विनष्टानामहमश्रुप्रमार्जनम्।राक्षसानां करोमीति मिथ्या तदपि ते वचः।।3.30.4।।
explanation: You said you will wipe the tears of the dead demons. (Now) those words have proved false.

content: नीचस्य क्षुद्रशीलस्य मिथ्यावृत्तस्य रक्षसः।प्राणानहं हरिष्यामि गरुत्मानमृतं यथा।।3.30.5।।
explanation: You are mean. You have false pride. You are of low behaviour. I shall take away your life, O demon,, Just as Garuda carried off the nectar.

content: अद्य ते छिन्नकण्ठस्य फेनबुद्बुदभूषितम्।विदारितस्य मद्बाणैर्मही पास्यति शोणितम्।।3.30.6।।
explanation: Now with your throat split open by my arrows , the earth will drink your foamy blood full of bubbles.

content: पांसुरूषितसर्वाङ्गस्स्रस्तन्यस्त भुजद्वयः।स्वप्स्यसे गां समालिङ्ग्य दुर्लभां प्रमदामिव।।3.30.7।।
explanation: With all your limbs covered with dust, both the arms dropped down and stretched  out  on the ground, you will sleep as though hugging the earth, like embracing a rare woman.

content: प्रबद्धनिद्रे शयिते त्वयि राक्षसपांसने।भविष्यन्तिशरण्यानां शरण्या दण्डका इमे।।3.30.8।।
explanation: When you, O vile demon, will go into eternal sleep the Dandaka grounds will provide shelter to those who deserve it here.

content: जनस्थाने हतस्थाने तव राक्षस मच्छरैः।निर्भया विचरिष्यन्ति सर्वतो मुनयो वने।।3.30.9।।
explanation: O demon, when my arrows destroy your hold over Janasthana the sages will move freely without fear all over this forest.

content: अद्य विप्रसरिष्यन्ति राक्षस्यो हतबान्धवाः।बाष्पार्द्रवदना दीना भयादन्यभयावहाः।।3.30.10।।
explanation: Having lost all their relations, the demonesses, who were causing fear to others,will move away with faces full of tears.

content: अद्य शोकरसज्ञास्ता भविष्यन्ति निरर्थकाः।अनुरूपकुलाः पत्न्यो यासां त्वं पतिरीदृशः।।3.30.11।।
explanation: Your wives, who have got a husband like you, must have been born to a befitting race. They will taste the pangs of sorrow today, for no reasons whatsoever.

content: नृशंस नीच क्षुद्रात्मन्नित्यं ब्राह्मणकण्टक।यत्कृते शङ्कितैरग्नौ मुनिभिः पात्यते हविः।।3.30.12।।
explanation: O cruel, mean, vile fellow, you had been always opposing the brahmins who pour oblations in fire under fear.

content: तमेवमभिसंरब्धं ब्रुवाणं राघवं रणे।खरो निर्भर्त्सयामास रोषात्खरतरस्वरः।।3.30.13।।
explanation: When Rama was thus speaking in a state of excitement in the middle of war, the choleric Khara  started abusing him in a harsher tone.

content: दृढं खल्ववलिप्तोऽसि भयेष्वपि च निर्भयः।वाच्यावाच्यं ततो हि त्वं मृत्युवश्यो न बुध्यसे।।3.30.14।।
explanation: You are very haughty. When there is every cause of fear you pretend fearlessness. Being in the grip of death you do not know what to speak and what not to speak.

content: कालपाशपरिक्षिप्ता भवन्ति पुरुषा हि ये।कार्याकार्यं न जानन्ति ते निरस्तषडिन्द्रियाः।।3.30.15।।
explanation: Those bound by the noose of death, do not know what to and what not to do, as their six senses cease to function.

content: एवमुक्त्वा ततो रामं संरुध्य भ्रुकुटीं ततः।स ददर्श महासालमविदूरे निशाचरः।।3.30.16।।रणे प्रहरणस्यार्थे सर्वतो ह्यवलोकयन्।
explanation: Having said thus to Rama with a frown on his face, Khara, looking around for something to strike him with, saw a huge sal tree not very far.

content: स तमुत्पाटयामास संदश्य दशनच्छदम्।।3.30.17।।तं समुत्क्षिप्य बाहुभ्यां विनद्य च महाबलः।राममुद्दिश्य चिक्षेप हतस्त्वमिति चाब्रवीत्।।3.30.18।।
explanation: Khara, biting his lower lip, uprooted the tree , lifted it with his mighty arms, and shouting at Rama loudly hurled it at him, saying, 'You are dead'.

content: तमापतन्तं बाणौघैच्छित्वा रामः प्रतापवान्।रोषमाहारयत्तीव्रं निहन्तुं समरे खरम्।।3.30.19।।
explanation: Brave Rama shattered with a flood of arrows the tree falling over him and summoned sharp anger to end Khara in war.

content: जातस्वेदस्ततो रामो रोषाद्रक्तान्तलोचनः।निर्भिभेद सहस्रेण बाणानां समरे खरम्।।3.30.20।।
explanation: Full of sweat and with the corners of his eyes turned red, Rama hit Khara with a thousand arrows in the encounter.

content: तस्य बाणान्तराद्रक्तं बहु सुस्राव फेनिलम्।गिरेः प्रस्रवणस्येव तोयधारापरिस्रवः।।3.30.21।।
explanation: With his body pierced with arrows his blood started flowing like the waterfalls flow from mount Prasravana.

content: विह्वलस्सकृतो बाणैः खरो रामेण संयुगे।मत्तो रुधिरगन्धेन तमेवाभ्यद्रवद्द्रुतम्।।3.30.22।।
explanation: Completely struck by Rama's arrows, Khara, intoxicated with the smell of  blood, ran speedily charging towards Rama.

content: तमापतन्तं संरब्धं कृतास्त्रो रुधिराप्लुतम्।अपासर्पत्प्रतिपदं किञ्चित्वरितविक्रमः।।3.30.23।।
explanation: Rama who was an adept in the science of arms picked up his valour quickly and moved a step back (not  to give him an opportunity to strike), looking at the highly agitated Khara falling upon him, with his body fully drenched in blood.

content: ततः पावकसङ्काशं वधाय समरे शरम्।खरस्य रामो जग्राह ब्रह्मदण्डमिवापरम्।।3.30.24।।
explanation: Rama took a dart glowing like fire which resembled another Brahmadanda to kill Khara in the war.

content: स तं दत्तं मघवता सुरराजेन धीमता।संदधे चापि धर्मात्मा मुमोच च खरं प्रति।।3.30.25।।
explanation: Righteous Rama placed on his bow the dart given him by wise Indra, king of the gods, and shot it at Khara.

content: स विमुक्तो महाबाणो निर्घातसमनिस्वनः।रामेण धनुरायम्य खरस्योरसिचापतत्।।3.30.26।।
explanation: Bending the bow fully, Rama released the arrow roaring like a violent gust of wind, which fell on Khara's chest.

content: स पपात खरो भूमौ दह्यमानश्शरानग्निना।रुद्रेणेव विनिर्दग्धश्वेतारण्ये यथान्तकः।।3.30.27।।
explanation: Just as Yama was burnt by Rudra's fire(from his eyes) in Swetaranya, Khara collapsed on the ground consumed by the fire of Rama's arrow.

content: स वृत्र इव वज्रेण फेनेन नमुचिर्यथा।बलो वेन्द्राशनिहतो निपपात हतः खरः।।3.30.28।।
explanation: Khara fell down just like Vrutra or Bala killed by Indra's thunderbolt or like Numuchi by the froth of the sea.

content: ततो राजर्षयस्सर्वे सङ्गताः परमर्षयः।सभाज्य मुदिता राममिदं वचनमब्रुवन्।।3.30.29।।
explanation: Then the rajarsis, great seers gathered together, offered their worship to Rama  and said these words joyfully :

content: एतदर्थं महातेजा महेन्द्रः पाकशासनः।शरभङ्गाश्रमं पुण्यमाजगाम पुरन्दरः।।3.30.30।।
explanation: For this purpose, killer of Paka, the gIorious Indra (who can break a fortress), came to the hermitage of Sarabhanga.

content: आनीतस्त्वमिमं देशमुपायेन महर्षिभिः।एषां वधार्थं क्रूराणां रक्षसां पापकर्मणाम्।।3.30.31।।
explanation: You are brought to this place by the great sages who had cleverly devised a plan to kill the cruel sinners, these demons৷৷

content: तदिदं नः कृतं कार्यं त्वया दशरथात्मज।सुखं धर्मं चरिष्यन्ति दण्डकेषु महर्षयः।।3.30.32।।
explanation: O son of Dasaratha, you have accomplished such a task that hereafter the sages in Dandaka will discharge their rightful duties happily.

content: एतस्मिन्तरे देवाश्चारणैस्सह सङ्गताः।दुन्दुभींश्चाभिनिघ्नन्तः पुष्पवर्षं समन्ततः।।3.30.33।।रामस्योपरि संह्रुष्टा ववृषुर्विस्मितास्तदा।
explanation: Meanwhile the wonderstruck gods along with the charanas (celestial bards) got together and began beating the drums and raining showers of flowers on Rama from all sides.

content: अर्धाधिकमुहूर्तेन रामेण निशितैश्शरैः।।3.30.34।।चतुर्दशसहस्राणि रक्षसां भीमकर्मणाम्।खरदूषणमुख्यानां निहतानि महाहवे।।3.30.35।।
explanation: 'In a little more than half a moment of this great war Rama had accomplished the terrific task of killing with sharp darts fourteen thousand demons, led by Khara and Dusana.

content: अहो बत महत्कर्म रामस्य विदितात्मनः।अहो वीर्यमहो दाक्ष्यं विष्णोरिव हि दृश्यते।।3.30.36।।इत्येवमुक्त्वा ते सर्वे ययुर्देवा यथागतम्।
explanation: 'Rama who knows the self has performed a great work. Oh what prowess what efficiency  only lord Visnu could do this'. So saying all the gods went back to their respective destinations.

content: तस्मिन्नन्तरे वीरो लक्ष्मणस्सह सीतया।गिरिदुर्गाद्विनिष्क्रम्य संविवेशाश्रमं सुखी।।3.30.37।।
explanation: In the mean time, heroic Lakshmana accompanied by Sita came out of the mountain cave happily and entered the hermitage.

content: ततो रामस्तु विजयी पूज्यमानो महर्षिभिः।प्रविवेशाश्रमं वीरो लक्ष्मणेनाभिपूजितः।।3.30.38।।
explanation: Then victorious Rama having been worshipped by the seers and also by Lakshmana entered the hermitage.

content: तं दृष्ट्वा शत्रुहन्तारं महर्षीणां सुखावहम्।बभूव हृष्टा वैदेही भर्तारं परिषस्वजे।।3.30.39।।
explanation: On seeing Rama killing the enemies of the great sages for their happiness Sita felt glad and embraced her husband.

content: मुदा परमया युक्ता दृष्ट्वा रक्षोगणान्हतान्।रामं चैवाव्यथं दृष्ट्वा तुतोष जनकात्मजा।।3.30.40।।
explanation: Sita, daughter of Janaka, was happy to see the demons killed by Rama who himself was unhurt.

content: ततस्तु तं राक्षससङ्घमर्दनं सभाज्यमानं मुदितैर्महर्षिभिः।पुनः परिष्वज्य शशिप्रभानना बभूव हृष्टा जनकात्मजा तदा।।3.30.41।।
explanation: Then the daughter of Janaka, cheerful Sita, who had a face bright like the moon, embraced Rama, destroyer of demons who was worshipped by the delighted sages. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीये आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtieth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [ Akampana reaches Lanka -- reveals to Ravana about the happenings at Janasthana-- describes Rama's valour-- suggests to Ravana the strategy to win Rama through the abduction of Sita-- Ravana's visit to Maricha-- Maricha's advice to Ravana.]त्वरमाणस्ततो गत्वा जनस्थानादकम्पनः।प्रविश्य लङ्कां वेगेन रावणं वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।3.31.1।।
explanation: Quickly did Akampana leave Janasthana, and quickly he entered Lanka. He said to Ravana:
