content: जनस्थानस्थिता राजन्राक्षसा बहवो हताः।खरश्च निहतस्सङ्ख्ये कथञ्चिदहमागतः।।3.31.2।।
explanation: O king many demons dwelling at Janasthana including Khara have been killed. I manged to escape with much difficulty.

content: एवमुक्तो दशग्रीवः क्रुद्ध स्संरक्तलोचनः।अकम्पनमुवाचेदं निर्दहन्निव चक्षुषा।।3.31.3।।
explanation: When Akampana thus reported to the tenheaded Ravana, his eyes reddened with anger. He spoke to Akampana as if he was burning him with his eyes :

content: केन रम्यं जनस्थानं हतं मम परासुना।को हि सर्वेषु लोकेषु गतिं चाधिगमिष्यति।।3.31.4।।
explanation: He who has destroyed my beautiful Janasthana is sure to die. His life is under the control of others (his enemies). Where can he be(alive) in all the worlds?

content: न हि मे विप्रियं कृत्वा शक्यं मघवता सुखम्।प्राप्तुं वैश्रवणेनापि न यमेन न विष्णुना।।3.31.5।।
explanation: One who has caused displeasure to me cannot be happy, be it Indra or Kubera, or Yama or even Visnu.

content: कालस्य चाप्यहं कालो दहेयमपि पावकम्।मृत्युं मरणधर्मेण संयोजयितुमुत्सहे।।3.31.6।।
explanation: I am the destroyer of the destroyer (Yama). I can burn even that which burns (fire). I can infuse Death with the characteristics of death itself.

content: दहेयमपि सङ्कृद्धस्तेजसाऽदित्यपावकौ।वातस्य तरसा वेगं निहन्तुमहमुत्सहे।।3.31.7।।
explanation: If angry, I can burn the Sun and even fire with my radiance. I can arrest  the speed of the wind instantly with my effort.

content: तथा क्रुद्धं दशग्रीवं कृताञ्जलिरकम्पनः।भयात्सन्दिग्धया वाचा रावणं याचतेऽभयम्।।3.31.8।।
explanation: Akampana, out of fear, implored the inflamed Ravana with folded hands and faltering voice to spare him.

content: दशग्रीवोऽभयं तस्मै प्रददौ रक्षसां वरः।स विस्रब्धोऽब्रवीद्वाक्यमसन्दिग्धमकम्पनः।।3.31.9।।
explanation: The tenheaded Ravana, lord of the demons, assured safety to Akampana, who  gratefully said these words without hesitation:

content: पुत्रो दशरथस्यास्ति सिंहसंहननो युवा।रामो नाम वृषस्कन्धो वृत्तायतमहाभुजः।।3.31.10।।
explanation: Dasaratha has  a young son,  by name, Rama. He has a body like a lion's. He has strong, round arms and his shoulders resemble those of a bull.

content: वीरः पृथुयशाश्श्रीमानतुल्यबलविक्रमः।हतं तेन जनस्थानं खरश्च सह दूषणः।।3.31.11।।
explanation: He is a hero of great fame and unequal prowess. He has destroyed your Janasthana and also Khara along with Dusana.

content: अकम्पनवच श्रुत्वा रावणो राक्षसाधिपः।नागेन्द्र इव निश्वस्य वचनं चेदमब्रवीत्।।3.31.12।।
explanation: Having heard Akampana's words, Ravana, the lord of demons, sighed heavily like the king of serpents and said these words:

content: स सुरेन्द्रेण संयुक्तो रामस्सर्वामरैस्सह।उपयातो जनस्थानं ब्रूहि कच्चिदकम्पन।।3.31.13।।
explanation: Did Rama come to Janasthana with Indra and the gods ? O Akampana   speak.

content: रावणस्य पुनर्वाक्यं निशम्य तदकम्पनः।आचचक्षे बलं तस्य विक्रमं च महात्मनः।।3.31.14।।
explanation: Hearing Ravana's words, Akampana continued telling about great Rama's strength and his exploits in war.

content: रामो नाम महातेजा श्रेष्ठस्सर्वधनुष्मताम्।दिव्यास्त्रगुणसम्पन्नः पुरन्दरसमो युधि।।3.31.15।।
explanation: Rama is his name. He looks very radiant. He is the best among the archers. Owner of divine weapons, he is comparable to Indra in war.

content: तस्यानुरूपो बलवान्रक्ताक्षो दन्दुभिस्वनः।कनीयान्लक्ष्मणो नाम भ्राता शशिनिभाननः।।3.31.16।।
explanation: He is strong with bright red eyes. He has a deep voice with the resonance of a drum. His face is like the moon. Lakshmana, his younger brother, is similar to him in appearance.

content: स तेन सह संयुक्तः पावकेनानिलो यथा।श्रीमान्राजवरस्तेन जनस्थानं निपातितम्।।3.31.17।।
explanation: Rama is prosperous. He is the best among kings. Lakshmana with him is like wind with fire. Rama has pulled down Janasthana.

content: नैव देवा महात्मानो नात्र कार्या विचारणा।शरा रामेण तूत्सृष्टा रुक्मपुङ्खाः पतत्रिणः।।3.31.18।।सर्पाः पञ्चानना भूत्वा भक्षयन्ति स्म राक्षसान्।
explanation: Indeed, they are great men. No god came there (to lend him a hand). There is no need to investigate further about it.  The goldenfeathered arrows released by Rama turned into fivehooded serpents and consumed the demons.

content: येन येन च गच्छन्ति राक्षसा भयकर्शिताः।3.31.19।।तेन तेन स्म पश्यन्ति राममेवाग्रतः स्थितम्।इत्थं विनाशितं तेन जनस्थानं तवानघ।।3.31.20।।
explanation: Wherever the demons went they, gripped by fear, only saw Rama in front. O sinless sire In this manner your Janasthana was destroyed by him.

content: अकम्पनवचश्रुत्वा रावणो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।जनस्थानं गमिष्यामि हन्तुं रामं सलक्ष्मणम्।।3.31.21।।
explanation: Hearing Akampana's words, Ravana said, I will go to Janasthana and kill Rama along with Lakshmana.

content: अथैवमुक्ते वचने प्रोवाचेदमकम्पनः।शृणु राजन्यथावृत्तं रामस्य बलपौरुषम्।।3.31.22।।
explanation: Thus said by Ravana, Akampana responded, I will tell you what happened there. O king   listen to the strength and valour of Rama.

content: असाध्यः कुपितो रामो विक्रमेण महायशाः।आपगायास्सुपूर्णाया वेगं परिहरेच्छरैः।।3.31.23।।
explanation: Rama is of great fame. When outraged, he is irrepressible. He can arrest with his arrows even the speed of a river (in spate).

content: सतारग्रहनक्षत्रं नभश्चाप्यवसादयेत्।असौ रामस्तु सीदन्तीं श्रीमानभ्युद्धरेन्महीम्।।3.31.24।।
explanation: Powerful Rama can pull down the sky along with the planets and stars. He can lift the drowning earth from the depth of the sea.

content: भित्त्वा वेलां समुद्रस्य लोकानाप्लावयेद्विभुः।वेगं वापि समुद्रस्य वायुं वा विधमेच्छरैः।।3.31.25।।
explanation: He is so very powerful that he can drown the earth by breaking the boundary of the sea. He can arrest the speed of the sea or of the wind with his arrows.

content: संहृत्य वा पुनर्लोकान्विक्रमेण महायशाः।शक्तस्सपुरुषव्याघ्रः स्रष्टुं पुनरपि प्रजाः।।3.31.26।।
explanation: He is a tiger among men. He is so powerful that he can destroy the world and recreate the creatures once again by his valour.

content: न हि रामो दशग्रीव शक्यो जेतुं त्वया युधि।रक्षसां वापि लोकेन स्वर्गः पापजनैरिव।।3.31.27।।
explanation: O tenheaded one, just as it is not possible for sinners to attain heaven it is not possible for you or for the entire world of demons to win him in war

content: न तं वध्यमहं मन्ये सर्वैर्देवासुरैरपि।अयं तस्य वधोपायस्तन्ममैकमनाश्शृणु।।3.31.28।।
explanation: I do not think it is possible for gods and demons together to kill him, yet there is a way for his destruction. You may listen to me with single mindedattention:

content: भार्या तस्योत्तमा लोके सीता नाम सुमध्यमा।श्यामा समविभक्ताङ्गी स्त्रीरत्नं रत्नभूषिता।।3.31.29।।
explanation: Rama has a wife in this world, by name, Sita, who is beautiful, has a slender waist and a wellformed body. Adorned with gems, she is a jewel among women,

content: नैव देवी न गन्धर्वी नाप्सरा नापि दानवी।तुल्या सीमन्तिनी तस्या मानुषीषु कुतो भवेत्।।3.31.30।।
explanation: She has no equal among goddesses nor among gandharvis nor apasaras nor among demonesses. How can there be a peer of her among human beings ?

content: तस्यापहर भार्यांत्वं प्रमथ्य तु महावने।सीतया रहितः कामी रामो हास्यति जीवितम्।।3.31.31।।
explanation: Abduct Rama's wife by force in that great forest and bereft of Sita, he will give up his life.

content: अरोचयत तद्वाक्यं रावणो राक्षसाधिपः।चिन्तयित्वा महाबाहुरकम्पनमुवाच ह।।3.31.32।।
explanation: Ravana, the strongarmed king of demons, relished the words of Akampana and pondering over the matter, said to him :

content: बाढं काल्यं गमिष्यामि ह्येकस्सारथिना सह।आनयिष्यामि वैदेहीमिमां हृष्टो महापुरीम्।।3.31.33।।
explanation: Yes, early in the morning I will go alone gladly with the charioteer and bring Vaidehi here to this great city.

content: अथैवमुक्त्वा प्रययौ खरयुक्तेन रावणः।रथेनादित्यवर्णेन दिशस्सर्वाः प्रकाशयन्।।3.31.34।।
explanation: Having said so, Ravana got on a chariot yoked with donkeys. It had the colour of the Sun. It illuminated all directions. Ravana left.

content: स रथो राक्षसेन्द्रस्य नक्षत्रपथगो महान्।सञ्चार्यमाणश्शुशुभे जलदे चन्द्रमा इव।।3.31.35।।
explanation: The great chariot of the demon king (Ravana) flying in the sky shone like the Moon in the cloud.

content: स मारीचाश्रमं प्राप्य ताटकेयमुपागमत्।मारीचेनार्चितो राजा भक्ष्यभोज्यैरमानुषैः।।3.31.36।।
explanation: Ravana reached the hermitage of Maricha and met him who was the son of Tataka. The demon king was treated with food that can be chewed and food that can be eaten.

content: तं स्वयं पूजयित्वा तु आसनेनोदकेन च।अर्थोपहितया वाचा मारीचो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।3.31.37।।
explanation: Maricha personally offered Ravana a seat. He offered him water and paid him obeisance. Making meaningful enquiries he said in appropriate words :

content: कच्चित्सुकुशलं राजन्लोकानां राक्षसेश्वर।आशङ्के नाथ जाने त्वं यतस्तूर्णमिहागतः।।3.31.38।।
explanation: O lord of demons  O king hope every one is fine in the world of demons. O lord, (though) your sudden arrival puts me in doubt (about everything going right).

content: एवमुक्तो महातेजा मारीचेन स रावणः।ततः पश्चादिदं वाक्यमब्रवीद्वाक्यकोविदः।।3.31.39।।
explanation: Having thus been asked by Maricha, glorious Ravana, who was eloquent in speech, spoke to him :

content: आरक्षो मे हतस्तात रामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा।जनस्थानमवध्य तत्सर्वं युधि निपातितम्।।3.31.40।।तस्य मे कुरु साचिव्यं तस्य भार्यापहारणे।
explanation: O dear, Rama who is capable of doing difficult deeds has killed my sentinels. The indestructible Janasthana has been routed in war. Could you help me in abudcting his wife ? (That is the only way to bring him to his knees).

content: राक्षसेन्द्रवचश्श्रुत्वा मारीचो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।3.31.41।।आख्याता केन सीता सा मित्ररूपेण शत्रुणा।त्वया राक्षसशार्दूल को न नन्दति नन्दितः।।3.31.42।।
explanation: Having heard Ravana ,the king of demons, Maricha said these words:  O king, who is that enemy of yours who, in the guise of a friend,  has told you about Sita? Though obliged by you, who is he that is not happy with you, O tiger among demons?

content: सीतामिहानयस्वेति को ब्रवीति ब्रवीहि मे।रक्षोलोकस्य सर्वस्य कश्शृङ्गं छेत्तुमिच्छति।।3.31.43।।
explanation: Tell me who asked you to bring Sita ? Who wishes to demolish the peak of the entire clan of demons ?

content: प्रोत्साहयति कश्च त्वां स च शत्रुरसंशयः।अशीविषमुखाद्दंष्ट्रामुद्धर्तुं चेच्छति त्वया।।3.31.44।।
explanation: He who has encouraged you in this is your enemy, indeed. He wants you to pluck out the fangs from the serpent's mouth.

content: कर्मणा केन केनासि कापथं प्रतिपादितः।सुखसुप्तस्य ते राजन् प्रहृतं केन मूर्धनि।।3.31.45।।
explanation: By  whose action have you been led into this wrong direction? Who has hit you on your forehead while you were sleeping comfortably?

content: विशुद्धवंशाभिजनाग्रहस्त स्तेजोमदस्संस्थितदोर्विषाणः।उदीक्षितुं रावण नेह युक्तः स संयुगे राघवगन्धहस्ती।।3.31.46।।
explanation: Rama is like a mighty tusker. His pure and high birth is his trunk. His wellbuilt and strong arms are his tusks. His brilliance in his ichor. Nobody can face this intoxicated elephant in battle.

content: असौ रणान्तः स्थितिसंधिवालो विदग्धरक्षोमृगहा नृसिंहः।सुप्तस्त्वया बोधयितुं न युक्तः शराङ्गपूर्णो निशितासिदंष्ट्रः।।3.31.47।।
explanation: Rama is a lion in the form of man, a lion on warfront with its tail touching the waist when angry. This lion is deft in killing deer in the form of clever demons. His body is full of arrows. The sharp swords are his pointed teeth. It does not behove you to rouse such a lion who is asleep.

content: चापापहारे भुजवेगपङ्के शरोर्मिमाले सुमहाहवौघे।न रामपातालमुखेऽतिघोरे प्रस्कन्दितुं राक्षसराज युक्तम्।।3.31.48।।
explanation: O king of demons  it is not proper (for you) to jump into the extremely fierce mouth of the nether world known as Rama. Who can steal the bow from his mighty arms which are whirlpools of mud. His arrows are rows of waves in the flow of the great war.

content: प्रसीद लङ्केश्वर राक्षसेन्द्र लङ्कां प्रसन्नो भव साधु गच्छ।त्वं स्वेषु दारेषु रमस्व नित्यं रामस्सभार्यो रमतां वनेषु।।3.31.49।।
explanation: O lord of Lanka, chief of the demons, be pleased to return to Lanka and enjoy yourself in  the company of your wives. Let Rama enjoy with his wife in the forest.

content: एवमुक्तो दशग्रीवो मारीचेन स रावणः।न्यवर्तत पुरीं लङ्कां विवेश च गृहोत्तमम्।।3.31.50।।
explanation: Thus advised by Maricha ,the ten headed Ravana returned and entered his best of homes in the city of Lanka .इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyfirst sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Surpanakha meets Ravana at Lanka -- describes Rama, Sita and Lakshmana to Ravana.]ततश्शूर्पणखा दृष्ट्वा सहस्राणि चतुर्दश।हतान्येकेन रामेण रक्षसां भीमकर्मणाम्।।3.32.1।।दूषणं च खरं चैव हतं त्रिशिरसा सह।दृष्ट्वा पुनर्महानादं ननाद जलदो यथा।।3.32.2।।
explanation: Seeing Dusana, Khara and also Trisira along with the fourteen thousand demon warriors of terrific performance killed by Rama, singlehanded, Surpanakha roared     like a cloud.

content: सा दृष्ट्वा कर्म रामस्य कृतमन्यैस्सुदुष्करम्।जगाम परमोद्विग्ना लङ्कां रावणपालिताम्।।3.32.3।।
explanation: Seeing the performance of Rama which is very difficult for others, Surpanakha got scared and went to Lanka, ruled by Ravana.

content: सा ददर्श विमानाग्रे रावणं दीप्ततेजसम्।उपोपविष्टं सचिवैर्मरुद्भिरिव वासवम्।।3.32.4।।
explanation: Surpanakha saw Ravana shining brilliantly, seated like Indra along with ministers and Maruts on top of the aerial chariot.

content: आसीनं सूर्यसङ्काशे काञ्चने परमासने।रुक्मवेदिगतं प्राज्यं ज्वलन्तमिव पावकम्।।3.32.5।।
explanation: Ravana, sitting on the magnificent golden seat on a golden altar looked radiant like the Sun or the blazing fire.

content: देवगन्धर्वभूतानामृषीणां च महात्मनाम्।अजेयं समरे शूरं व्यात्ताननमिवान्तकम्।।3.32.6।।
explanation: Invincible to gods, gandharvas, all living beings, great sages and seers, he was like Yama, lord of death with wide open jaws.

content: देवासुरविमर्देषु वज्राशनिकृतव्रणम्।ऐरावतविषाणग्रैरुद्घृष्टकिणवक्षसम्।।3.32.7।।
explanation: He had scars of wounds caused by the thunderbolt received in war between gods and demons, and marks of scars on his chest made by tips of the the tusks of elephant Airavata.

content: विंशद्भुजं दशग्रीवं दर्शनीयपरिच्छदम्।विशालवक्षसं वीरं राजलक्षण शोभितम्।।3.32.8।।
explanation: Valiant Ravana had an attractive appearance with beautiful dresses twenty arms,ten heads, a broad chest  and brilliant royal marks.

content: स्निग्धवैडूर्यसङ्काशं तप्तकाञ्चनकुण्डलम्।सुभुजं शुक्लदशनं महास्यं पर्वतोपमम्।।3.32.9।।
explanation: Wearing burnished golden earrings, he looked bright like the glittering vaidurya. And with his wellformed arms, white teeth and  wide mouth, he looked like a mountain.

content: विष्णुचक्रनिपातैश्च शतशो देवसंयुगे।अन्यैश्शस्त्रप्रहारैश्च महायुद्धेषु ताडितम्।।3.32.10।।
explanation: He was hit by the wheel of Visnu for hundreds of times during great wars and beaten by other weapons.

content: अहताङ्गं समस्तैश्च देवप्रहरणैस्तथा।अक्षोभ्याणां समुद्राणां क्षोभणं क्षिप्रकारिणम्।।3.32.11।।
explanation: Ravana whose body was not hurt by the weapons in war with gods, who could perturb even the imperturbable seas, was quick  in action.

content: क्षेप्तारं पर्वतेन्द्राणां सुराणां च प्रमर्दनम्।उच्छेत्तारं च धर्माणां परदाराभिमर्शनम्।।3.32.12।।
explanation: (He was) one who could lift and throw great mountains, torment even gods, violate  dharma at the root, and cast an evil eye on the wives of others.

content: सर्वदिव्यास्त्रयोक्तारं यज्ञविघ्नकरं सदा।पुरीं भोगवतीं प्राप्य पराजित्य च वासुकिम्।।3.32.13।।तक्षकस्य प्रियां भार्यां पराजित्य जहार यः।
explanation: He who could employ all divine weapons, disrupt sacrifices, had gone to the city of Bhogavati, defeated Vasuki and abducted the dear wife of Takshaka.

content: कैलासपर्वतं गत्वा विजित्य नरवाहनम्।विमानं पुष्पकं तस्य कामगं वै जहार यः।।3.32.14।।
explanation: Ravana went to mount Kailasa, conquered Kubera and took away forcibly his aerial chariot Pushpaka which can fly as per the rider's desire

content: वनं चैत्ररथं दिव्यं नलिनीं नन्दनं वनम्।विनाशयति यः क्रोधाद्देवोद्यानानि वीर्यवान्।।3.32.15।।
explanation: Out of anger he destroyed all the gardens of gods like Chitraratha of Kubera full of lotusponds and Nandana, the pleasuregarden of Indra.

content: चन्द्रसूर्यौ महाभागावुत्तिष्ठन्तौ परन्तपौ।निवारयति बाहुभ्यां यश्शैलशिखरोपमः।।3.32.16।।
explanation: He was like the peak of a mountain. He could stop with his arms the great Moon and Sun from rising. He was a scorcher of enemies.

content: दशवर्षसहस्राणि तपस्तप्वा महावने।पुरा स्वयंभुवे धीरश्शिरांस्युपजहार यः।।3.32.17।।
explanation: This steadfast Ravana who had in the past performed penance for ten thousand years in a dense forest offered his heads to the selfborn Brahma.

content: देवदानवगन्धर्वपिशाचपतगोरगैः।अभयं यस्य सङ्ग्रामे मृत्युतो मानुषादृते।।3.32.18।।
explanation: He was unafraid of death in the hands of gods or demons or gandharvas or pisachas or birds or snakes in war except humans.

content: मन्त्रैरभिष्टुतं पुण्यमध्वरेषु द्विजातिभिः।हविर्धानेषु यस्सोममुपहन्ति महाबलः।।3.32.19।।
explanation: The mighty Ravana  defiled the sacred Soma juice, worthy of oblations, extracted by Brahmins by chanting mantras in scrifices.

content: आप्तयज्ञहरं क्रूरं ब्रह्मघ्नं दुष्टचारिणम्।कर्कशं निरनुक्रोशं प्रजानामहिते रतम्।।3.32.20।।
explanation: He disrupted sacrifices at the final stage. He killed brahmins. He was ruthless, harsh, and  merciless. He was involved in activities against human welfare.

content: रावणं सर्वभूतानां सर्वलोकभयावहम्।राक्षसी भ्रातरं शूरं सा ददर्श महाबलम्।।3.32.21।।
explanation: That demoness , Surpanakha saw  her very strong,valiant brother Ravana who made all beings cry and created fear in all worlds

content: तं दिव्यवस्त्राभरणं दिव्यमाल्योपशोभितम्।आसने सूपविष्टं च कालकालमिवोद्यतम्।।3.32.22।।
explanation: Resplendently attired, adorned with jewels, wearing beautiful gardlands, seated on a raised throne, he(Ravana) was like death to even the lord of death

content: राक्षसेन्द्रं महाभागं पौलस्त्यकुलनन्दनम्। 3.32.23।।रावणं शत्रुहन्तारं मन्त्रिभिः परिवारितम्।अभिगम्याब्रवीद्वाक्यं राक्षसी भयविह्वला।।3.32.24।।
explanation: On reaching Ravana, the lord of demons, the delight of the Paulastya dynasty, and the destroyer of enemies surrounded by ministers, the terrified, Surpanakha said these words:

content: तमब्रवीद्दीप्तविशाललोचनं प्रदर्शयित्वा भयमोहमूर्छिता।सुदारुणं वाक्यमभीतचारिणी महात्मना शूर्पणखा विरूपिता।।3.32.25।।
explanation: Showing her body disfigured by great Lakshmana, Surpanakha, the fearless wanderer, overwhelmed with fear said these cruel words  to Ravana sitting with large, glittering eyes:इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे द्वात्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtysecond sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Surpanakha points out the flaws in Ravana's rule-- praises Rama's abilities-- describes the qualities of a good king.]ततः शूर्पणखा दीना रावणं लोकरावणम्।अमात्यमध्ये सङ्क्रुद्धा परुषं वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।3.33.1।।
explanation: When the distressed, anguished Surpanakha met Ravana who makes the world weep, he was seated in the midst of his ministers. She addressed him these harsh words:

content: प्रमत्तः कामभोगेषु स्वैरवृत्तो निरङ्कुशः।समुत्पन्नं भयं घोरं बोद्धव्यं नावबुध्यसे।।3.33.2।।
explanation: Intoxicated with the pleasures of passion, acting on your own, ungoaded and unguided, you do not understand the problems arising out of great fear, problems you ought to know.

content: सक्तं ग्राम्येषु भोगेषु कामवृत्तं महीपतिम्।लुब्धं न बहुमन्यन्ते श्मशानाग्निमिव प्रजाः।।3.33.3।।
explanation: Lustful and greedy, you are addicted to vulgar pleasures. People will not respect you like the fire on the crematorium.

content: स्वयं कार्याणि यः काले नानुतिष्ठति पार्थिवः।स तु वै सह राज्येन तैश्च कार्यैर्विनश्यति।।3.33.4।।
explanation: A king who does not act at the right time will be ruined along with the kingdom and its works.

content: अयुक्तचारं दुर्दर्शमस्वाधीनं नराधिपम्।वर्जयन्ति नरा दूरान्नदीपङ्कामिव द्विपाः।।3.33.5।।
explanation: Just as elephants keep away from a muddy river, people will keep distance from the king who does not employ spies, does not give audience to his people and is not independent.

content: ये न रक्षन्ति विषयमस्वाधीना नराधिपाः।ते न वृद्ध्या प्रकाशन्ते गिरयस्सागरे यथा।।3.33.6।।
explanation: Kings who are not under their own control and cannot protect the country, do not attract the minds of the people like mountains inside sea water.

content: आत्मवद्भिर्विगृह्य त्वं देवगन्धर्वदानवैः।अयुक्तचारश्चपलः कथं राजा भविष्यसि।।3.33.7।।
explanation: Having created enmity with selfrespecting persons like gods, gandharvas and demons, with a fickle mind and without spies how long can you continue as king ?

content: त्वन्तु बालस्वभावश्च बुद्धिहीनश्च राक्षस।ज्ञातव्यन्तु न जानीषे कथं राजा भविष्यसि।।3.33.8।।
explanation: O demon  you are childish and foolish. You do not even know what ought to be known. How can you rule as a king?

content: येषां चारश्च कोशश्च नयश्च जयतां वर।अस्वाधीना नरेन्द्राणां प्राकृतैस्ते जनैस्समाः।।3.33.9।।
explanation: The best among the victorious kings, who are not masters of their espionage, judicial system and their exchequer are equal to the laity.

content: यस्मात्पश्यन्ति दूरस्थान् सर्वानर्थान्नराधिपाः।चारेण तस्मादुच्यन्ते राजानो दीर्घचक्षुषः।।3.33.10।।
explanation: Since kings can see things from a faroff place with the help of the spies they are called farsighted.

content: अयुक्तचारं मन्ये त्वां प्राकृतैस्सचिवैर्वृतम्।स्वजनं तु जनस्थाने हतं यो नावबुद्ध्यसे।।3.33.11।।
explanation: Since you have not engaged any spy you do not know when your own relatives were killed in Janasthana. I take you to be a fool surrounded by ordinary ministers.

content: चतुर्दश सहस्राणि रक्षसां क्रूरकर्मणाम्।हतान्येकेन रामेण खरश्च सहदूषणः।।3.33.12।।
explanation: One Rama alone killed all the fourteen thousand demons including Dusana and Khara, demons  capable of fierce exploits.

content: ऋषीणामभयं दत्तं कृतक्षेमाश्च दण्डकाः।धर्षितं च जनस्थानं रामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा।।3.33.13।।
explanation: Rama, the effortless performer of formindable tasks, has assured safety to the sages. Peace and happiness was restored to Dandaka forest but Janasthana has been ravaged.

content: त्वन्तु लुब्दः प्रमत्तश्च पराधीनश्च रावण।विषये स्वे समुत्पन्नं भयं यो नावबुध्यसे।।3.33.14।।
explanation: O Ravana, you are not aware of what  has happened to your own kingdom. You are avaricious, intoxicated, and under others' control. A great fear has been generated in your own kingdom.

content: तीक्ष्णमल्पप्रदातारं प्रमत्तं गर्वितं शठम्।व्यसने सर्वभूतानि नाभिधावन्ति पार्थिवम्।।3.33.15।।
explanation: All living beings stop seeking refuge under a king who is, not a generous giver, but intoxicated, harsh, arrogant and fraudulent. They do not run to him for protection in times of calamity.

content: अतिमानिनमग्राह्यमात्मसम्भावितं नरम्।क्रोधिनं व्यसने हन्ति स्वजनोऽपि महीपतिम्।।3.33.16।।
explanation: A king who is extremely arrogant, who is not acceptable to good people, who is selfconceited and cholerictempered will be murdered even by his own people at the time of adversity.

content: नानुतिष्ठति कार्याणि भयेषु न बिभेति च।क्षिप्रं राज्याच्युतो दीनस्तृणैस्तुल्यो भविष्यति।।3.33.17।।
explanation: A king who does not do what ought to be done, does not fear what ought to be feared, will surely be dislodged from the kingdom and live a wretched life like a blade of grass.

content: शुष्कैः काष्ठैर्भवेत्कार्यं लोष्टैरपि च पांसुभिः।न तु स्थानात्परिभ्रष्टैः कार्यं स्याद्वसुधाधिपैः।।3.33.18।।
explanation: Even dried up logs, or clods of earth, or a handful of dust may have some value but not a king who is dethroned.

content: अपभुक्तं यथा वासस्स्रजो वा मृदिता यथा।एवं राज्यात्परिभ्रष्टस्समर्थोऽपि निरर्थकः।।3.33.19।।
explanation: Like a piece of cloth that is worn and discarded, like garlands put on  and crushed, a king dislodged from the kingdom is worthless even if he is capable.

content: अप्रमत्तश्च यो राजा सर्वज्ञो विजितेन्द्रियः।कृतज्ञो धर्मशीलश्च स राजा तिष्ठते चिरम्।।3.33.20।।
explanation: A king who is alert, omniscient, has control over his senses, has a sense of gratitude and one of righteous conduct continues to rule for a long time.

content: नयनाभ्यां प्रसुप्तोऽपि जागर्ति नयचक्षुषा।त्यक्तक्रोधप्रमादश्च स राजा पूज्यते जनैः।।3.33.21।।
explanation: The king who keeps both his eyes shut but keeps the eye of justice open, one who is free from anger and remains ever alert, is worshipped by the people.

content: त्वं तु रावण दुर्बुद्धिर्गुणैरेतैर्विवर्जितः।यस्य तेऽविदितश्चारै रक्षसां सुमहान्वधः।।3.33.22।।
explanation: O Ravana you are evilminded. You  are devoid of all these good qualities. Your spies could not know that there had been a great massacre of your fellowdemons.

content: परावमन्ता विषयेषु सङ्गतो न देशकालप्रविभागतत्ववित्।अयुक्तबुद्धिर्गुणदोषनिश्चये विपन्नराज्यो नचिराद्विपत्स्यसे।।3.33.23।।
explanation: A king who accuses others, who is addicted to sensual pleasures, who lacks a sense of judgement of  place and time, a sense of discrimination between virtue and vice and the right wisdom will destroy himself and the kingdom in no time.

content: इति स्वदोषान् परिकीर्तितांस्तया समीक्ष्य बुद्ध्या क्षणदाचरेश्वरः।धनेन दर्पेण बलेन चान्वितो विचिन्तयामास चिरं स रावणः।।3.33.24।।
explanation: Ravana, king of demons, wealthy, arrogant and mighty, listened to Surpanakha and pondered over the mistakes she mentioned.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे त्रयस्त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtythird sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Surpanakha describes Rama and Sita to Ravana--incites him to abduct Sita and make her his wife.]ततश्शूर्पणखां दृष्ट्वा ब्रुवन्तीं परुषं वचः।अमात्यमध्ये सङ्क्रुद्धः परिपप्रच्छ रावणः।।3.34.1।।
explanation: Incensed at the harsh words Surpanakha used in the midst of ministers, Ravana said:

content: कश्च रामः कथंवीर्यः किंरूपः किंपराक्रमः।किमर्थं दण्डकारण्यं प्रविष्टस्सुदुरासदम्।।3.34.2।।
explanation: Who is Rama? What is his strength? How does he look? How valiant is he? For what purpose has he entered the impenetrable Dandaka forest?

content: आयुधं किञ्च रामस्य निहता येन राक्षसाः।खरश्च निहतस्संख्ये दूषणस्त्रिशिरास्तथा।।3.34.3।।
explanation: With what weapons he has killed demons like Khara, Dusana and Trisira ?

content: इत्युक्ता राक्षसेन्द्रेण राक्षसी क्रोधमूर्छिता।ततो रामं यथातत्वमाख्यातुमुपचक्रमे।।3.34.4।।
explanation: Thus questioned by Ravana, the demoness, overcome by anger, began telling him about Rama faithfully:

content: दीर्घबाहुर्विशालाक्ष श्चीरकृष्णाजिनाम्बरः।कन्दर्पसमरूपश्च रामो दशरथात्मजः।।3.34.5।।
explanation: Rama, Dasaratha's son, has long arms, large eyes. He is clad in deerskin and bark. He resembles Cupid.

content: शक्रचापनिभं चापं विकृष्य कनकाङ्गदम्।दीप्तान् क्षिपति नाराचान्सर्पानिव महाविषान्।।3.34.6।।
explanation: His bow resembles Indra's, He is adorned with gold bands. Drawing the bow, he releases glittering arrows like highly poisonous snakes.

content: नाददानं शरान्घोरान्नमुञ्चन्तं शिलीमुखान्।न कार्मुकं विकर्षन्तं रामं पश्यामि संयुगे।।3.34.7।।
explanation: I could not see Rama in the dreadful war while he was pulling an arrow from the quiver, aiming the dart, and drawing the bowstring.

content: हन्यमानं तु तत्सैन्यं पश्यामि शरवृष्टिभिः।इन्द्रेणेवोत्तमं सस्यमाहतन्त्वश्मवृष्टिभिः।।3.34.8।।
explanation: Just as Indra destroys the crop ready for harvest by raining hailstones, I have seen Rama killing the army with a shower of arrows.

content: रक्षसां भीमरूपाणां सहस्राणि चतुर्दश।निहतानि शरै स्तीक्ष्णैस्तेनैकेन पदातिना।।3.34.9।।अर्धाधिकमुहूर्तेन खरश्च सहदूषणः।
explanation: Fighting alone on foot with his sharp arrows Rama killed within a span of one and a half muhurta, the fourteen thousand dreadful demons including Dusana and Khara.

content: ऋषीणामभयं दत्तं कृतक्षेमाश्च दण्डकाः।।3.34.10।।एका कथञ्चिन्मुक्ताहं परिभूय महात्मना। स्त्रीवधं शङ्कमानेन रामेण विदितात्मना।।3.34.11।।
explanation: Sages have been assured safety. Peace has been restored to Dandaka forest. As Rama, the great soul, who knows the self, hesitated to kill a woman, I was alone saved after this humiliation.

content: भ्राता चास्य महातेजा गुणतस्तुल्यविक्रमः।अनुरक्तश्च भक्तश्च लक्ष्मणो नाम वीर्यवान्।।3.34.12।।
explanation: His brother called Lakshmana looks radiant. He is virtuous and courageous like him, valiant, devoted and loyal.

content: अमर्षी दुर्जयो जेता विक्रान्तो बुद्धिमान्बली।रामस्य दक्षिणो बाहुर्नित्यं प्राणो बहिश्चरः।।3.34.13।।
explanation: He is impatient, invincible, victorious, bold, intelligent and strong. He is even the right hand of Rama, his outer life.

content: रामस्य तु विशालाक्षी पूर्णेन्दुसदृशानना।धर्मपत्नी प्रिया भर्तुर्नित्यं प्रियहिते रता।।3.34.14।।
explanation: Rama's beloved consort is a largeeyed lady. Her face is like the full moon. She is engaged in the wellbeing of her husband.

content: सा सुकेशी सुनासोरुस्सुरूपा च यशस्विनी।देवतेव वनस्यास्य राजते श्रीरिवापरा।।3.34.15।।
explanation: She is an illustrious lady. She is goodlooking with her long hair, wellshaped nose and things. She appears to be the presiding deity of the forest, another goddess of wealth (Laxmi).

content: तप्तकाञ्चनवर्णाभा रक्ततुङ्गनखी शुभा।सीता नाम वरारोहा वैदेही तनुमध्यमा।।3.34.16।।
explanation: She is Sita, princess of Videha, a virtuous lady of golden complexion, a beautiful lady of slender waist and heavy hips.

content: नैव देवी न गन्धर्वी न यक्षी न च किन्नरी।नैवंरूपा मया नारी दृष्टपूर्वा महीतले।।3.34.17।।
explanation: I had not seen such a beautiful woman earlier, among the gandharvas, or yakshas, or kinneras. I have not seen such a beauty among the humans on earth.

content: यस्य सीता भवेद्भार्या यं च हृष्टा परिष्वजेत्।अतिजीवेत्स सर्वेषु लोकेष्वपि पुरन्दरात्।।3.34.18।।
explanation: Whosoever gets Sita as his wife, whoever she embraces happily will wish to live longer than Indra, the breaker of fortresses in this world.

content: सा सुशीला वपुश्श्लाघ्या रूपेणाप्रतिमा भुवि।तवानुरूपा भार्या स्यात्त्वं च तस्यास्तथा पतिः।।3.34.19।।
explanation: She is a woman of good conduct, of praiseworthy beauty. She is matchless in her beauty on earth. She will be a suitable wife for you and you, a suitable husband for her.

content: तां तु विस्तीर्णजघनां पीनश्रोणिपयोधराम्।भार्यार्थे च तवानेतुमुद्यताहं वराननाम्।।3.34.20।।विरूपितास्मि क्रूरेण लक्ष्मणेन महाभुज।
explanation: O mightyarmed one  I have been disfigured by cruel Lakshmana as I was attempting to bring that lady of broad thighs, pointed breasts, heavy hips and a beautiful face to make her your wife.

content: तां तु दृष्ट्वाद्य वैदेहीं पूर्णचन्द्रनिभाननाम्।मन्मथस्य शराणां वै त्वं विधेयो भविष्यसि।।3.34.21।।
explanation: If you see her today, this lady with a face like the fullmoon, you will (instantaneously) fall a victim to the arrows of the god of love.

content: यदि तस्यामभिप्रायो भार्यार्थे तव जायते।शीघ्रमुद्ध्रियतां पादो जयार्थमिह दक्षिणः।।3.34.22।।
explanation: If you intend her to be your wife, raise your right foot now and proceed to win her over.

content: कुरु प्रियं तथा तेषां रक्षसां राक्षसेश्वर।वधात्तस्य नृशंसस्य रामस्याश्रमवासिनः।।3.34.23।।
explanation: O lord of the demons, do a favour to your clan by  killing that cruel Rama dwelling in the hermitage.

content: तं शरैर्निशितैर्हत्वा लक्ष्मणं च महारथम्।हतनाथां सुखं सीतां यथावदुपभोक्ष्यसि।।3.34.24।।
explanation: Kill Rama, that great warrior along with Lakshmana with sharp arrows and enjoy the  company of Sita happily as you like, with her husband dead.

content: रोचते यति ते वाक्यं ममैतद्राक्षसेश्वर।क्रियतां निर्विशङ्केन वचनं मम रावण।।3.34.25।।
explanation: If you like what I have said, do accordingly without any hesitation, O Ravana, lord of the demons.

content: विज्ञायेहात्मशक्तिं च ह्रियतामबला बलात्।सीता सर्वानवद्याङ्गी भार्यार्थे राक्षसेश्वर।।3.34.26।।
explanation: Assess your own strength, O Lord of the demons, before you forcefully abduct that delicate Sita who is charming in all respects and make her your wife.

content: निशम्य रामेण शरैरजिह्मगै र्हतान् जनस्थानगतान्निशाचरान्।खरं च बुद्ध्वा निहतं च दूषणं त्वमत्र कृत्यं प्रतिपत्तुमर्हसि।।3.34.27।।
explanation: On hearing about the death of the demons including Khara and Dusana who fell to the straight and swift arrows of Rama, you should decide your course of action.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे चतुस्त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtytfourth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Ravana departs stealthily secretly to meet Maricha--description of the beautiful nature on the way to Maricha's hermitage.]ततश्शूर्पणखावाक्यं तच्छ्रुत्वा रोमहर्षणम्।सचिवानभ्यनुज्ञाय कार्यं बुद्ध्वा जगाम ह।।3.35.1।।
explanation: Then hearing the horripilating words of Surpanakha, Ravana took leave of the ministers and went thinking about the task ahead of him.

content: तत्कार्यमनुगम्याथ यथावदुपलभ्य च।दोषाणां च गुणानां च सम्प्रधार्य बलाबलम्।3.35.2।।इति कर्तव्यमित्येव कृत्वा निश्चयमात्मनः।स्थिरबुद्धिस्ततो रम्यां यानशालां जगाम ह।।3.35.3।।
explanation: Deliberating on the task ahead, duly considering the pros and cons, demerits and merits, strength and weakness, of the issue and having firmly decided within himself, he left for the beautiful coachshed.

content: यानशालां ततो गत्वा प्रच्छन्नो राक्षसाधिपः।सूतं सञ्चोदयामास रथस्संयोज्यतामिति।।3.35.4।।
explanation: Ravana went covertly to the coachshed and to the charioteer to get a chariot harnessed.

content: एवमुक्तः क्षेणेनैव सारथिर्लघुविक्रमः।रथं संयोजयामास तस्याभिमतमुत्तमम्।।3.35.5।।
explanation: Thus ordered, the smart charioteer got the chariot of his choice harnessed in an instant.

content: काञ्चनं रथमास्थाय कामगं रत्नभूषितम्।पिशाचवदनैर्युक्तं खरैः काञ्चनभूषणैः।।3.35.6।।मेघप्रतिमनादेन स तेन धनदानुजः।राक्षसाधिपतिश्श्रीमान्ययौ नदनदीपतिम्।।3.35.7।।
explanation: The younger brother of Kubera (Ravana), the prosperous lord of the demons ascended the chariot which could go where he desired. Embellished with gold, studded with gems, harnessed with demonfaced donkeys, the chariot rolled towards the ocean, rumbling like a cloud.

content: स श्वेतवालव्यजनः श्वेतच्छत्रो दशाननः।स्निग्धवैदूर्यसंकाश स्तप्तकाञ्चनकुण्डलः।।3.35.8।।विंशद्भुजो दशग्रीवो दर्शनीयपरिच्छदः।त्रिदशारिर्मुनीन्द्रघ्नो दशशीर्ष इवाद्रिराट्।।3.35.9।।कामगं रथमास्थाय शुशुभे राक्षसेश्वरः।विद्युन्मण्डलवान्मेघस्सबलाक इवाम्बरे।।3.35.10।।
explanation: Ravana, enemy of the gods, slayer of towering sages, with white yaktail fans, and white parasols, shining like smooth vaidurya, wearing pure gold earrings, clad in attractive attire, ten necks with twenty strong hands, ten heads looking like ten mountain peaks, a cloud in the sky encircled by lightnings and accompanied by cranes, ascended the chariot that could go wherever he desired.

content: स शैलं सागरानूपं वीर्यवानवलोकयन्।नानापुष्पफलैर्वृक्षैरनुकीर्णं सहस्रशः।।3.35.11।।
explanation: Valiant Ravana wentwatching the mountains full of thousands of trees bearing flowers and fruits on the shore of the sea.

content: शीतमङ्गलतोयाभिः पद्मिनीभिस्समन्ततः।विशालैराश्रमपदैर्वेदिमद्भिस्समावृतम्।।3.35.12।।
explanation: (The area) surrounded on all sides with lotusladen ponds filled with cool, sacred water, sprawling hermitages with elevated altars.

content: कदल्याढकिसम्बाधं नारिकेलोपशोभितम्।सालैस्तालैस्तमालैश्च पुष्पितैस्तरुभिर्वृतम्।।3.35.13।।
explanation: The place covered with banana plants and coconut trees  as well as blossoming sal and tamala trees was looking extremely beautiful.

content: नागैस्सुपर्णैर्गन्धैर्वैः किन्नरैश्च सहस्रशः।अजैर्वैखानसैर्माषैर्वालखिल्यैर्मरीचिपैः।।3.35.14।।अत्यन्तनियताहारैश्शोभितं परमर्षिभिः।जितकामैश्च सिद्धैश्च चारणैरुपशोभितम्।।3.35.15।।
explanation: The place looked charming with nagas, garudas, gandharvas, kinneras in their thousands and with the descendants of ajas, vaikhanasas, valakhilyas and with those who drink the rays of Sun and Moon for survival, with  sages who were highly disciplined in the intake of food,  spiritually accomplished  and selfcontrolled hermits and charanas.

content: दिव्याभरणमाल्याभिर्दिव्यरूपाभिरावृतम्।क्रीडारतिविधिज्ञाभिरप्सरोभिस्सहस्रशः।।3.35.16।।
explanation: (The place was) full of apsaras  in their thousands and paragons of beauty adorned with divine ornaments and garlands, and experts in lovesports.

content: सेवितं देवपन्तीभिश्श्रीमतीभिश्श्रियाऽऽवृतम्।देवदानवसङ्घैश्च चरितं त्वमृताशिभिः।।3.35.17।।
explanation: It was chosen by prosperous wives of gods as a reosrt. Hosts of gods and demons were wandering, there in the hope of tasting nectar.

content: हंसक्रौञ्चप्लवाकीर्णं सारसैस्सम्प्रणादितम्।वैढूर्यप्रस्तरं रम्यं स्निग्धं सागरतेजसा।।3.35.18।।
explanation: (It was ) full of small floats, flocks of swans, kraunchas, sarasas cackling in the ponds, with great joy. It had stretches of vaidurya stones on the shore and shone with the radiance of the sea

content: पाण्डुराणि विशालानि दिव्यमाल्ययुतानि च।तूर्यगीताभिजुष्टानि विमानानि समन्ततः।।3.35.19।।तपसा जितलोकानां कामगान्यभिसम्पतन्।गन्धर्वाप्सरसश्चैव ददर्श धनदानुजः।।3.35.20।।
explanation: Speeding along, the brother of Kubera (Ravana) saw palewhite, spacious aerial chariots on all sides controlled by those who had conquered the higher worlds by their penances. These chariots, decked with heavenly garlands, and ringing with divine music could fly where one desired. He saw gandharvas and apsaras as well.

content: निर्यासरसमूलानां चन्दनानां सहस्रशः।वनानि पश्यन्सौम्यानि घ्राणतृप्तिकराणि च।।3.35.21।।
explanation: He saw thousands of tree trunks with finesmelling resins and sandalwood trees.

content: अगरूणां च मुख्यानां वनान्युपवनानि च।तक्कोलानां च जात्यानां फलानां च सुगन्धिनाम्।।3.35.22।।
explanation: (He saw) very fine aguru trees in the forest as well as pleasuregroves of takkola fruits, fragrant  trees of a fine variety and fragrant nutmegs.

content: पुष्पाणि च तमालस्य गुल्मानि मरिचस्य च।मुक्तानां च समूहानि शुष्यमाणानि तीरतः।।3.35.23।।
explanation: (He saw) tamala flowers in bloom, pepper shrubs in clusters and hoards of pearls kept for drying on the shores.

content: शङ्खानां प्रसरं चैव प्रवालनिचयं तथा।काञ्चनानि च शैलानि राजतानि च सर्वशः।।3.35.24।।
explanation: He saw stretches of conches, heaps of corals and mounds of gold and silver too.

content: प्रस्रवाणि मनोज्ञानि प्रसन्नानि ह्रदानि च।धनधान्योपपन्नानि स्त्रीरत्नैश्शोभितानि च।।3.35.25।।हस्त्यश्वरथगाढानि नगराण्यवलोकयन्।
explanation: He went watching fascinating waterfalls, pleasing ponds, cities filled with wealth and grain, looking splendid with beautiful women and full of elephants, horses and chariots.

content: तं समं सर्वतस्निग्धं मृदुसंस्पर्शमारुतम्।अनूपं सिन्धुराजस्य ददर्श त्रिदिवोपमम्।।3.35.26।।
explanation: It was a veritable heaven with the plain land flooded with the backwaters of the sea and gentle breeze blowing.

content: तत्रापश्यत्स मेघाभं न्यग्रोधमृषिभिर्वृतम्।।3.35.27।।समन्ताद्यस्य ताश्शाखाश्शतयोजनमायताः।
explanation: He saw a banyan tree with its branches spread on all sides measuring a hundred yojanas, looking like a cloud and providing shelter to the sages.

content: यस्य हस्तिनमादाय महाकायं च कच्छपम्।।3.35.28।।भक्षार्थं गरुडश्शाखामाजगाम महाबलः।
explanation: In the past, the mighty Garuda brought an elephant and a huge tortoise and sat on a branch of this tree to feed on them.

content: तस्य तां सहसा शाखां भारेण पतगोत्तमः।।3.35.29।।सुपर्णः पर्णबहुलां बभञ्ज च महाबलः।
explanation: Due to the weight of this best of birds, the mighty Garuda, the leafy branch at once broke down.

content: तत्र वैखानसा माषा वालखिल्या मरीचिपाः।।3.35.30।।अजा बभूवुर्धूम्राश्च सङ्गताः परमर्षयः।
explanation: Gathered together under the great tree were great sages like vaikhanasas, mashas, marichipas, valakhilyas, ajas and dhumras.

content: तेषां दयार्थं गरुडस्तां शाखां शतयोजनाम्।।3.35.31।।जगामादाय वेगेन तौ चोभौ गजकच्छपौ।
explanation: Out of compassion for the (endangered) seers Garuda carried away that hundredyojanalong branch along with the elephant and the tortoise with great speed.

content: एकपादेन धर्मात्मा भक्षयित्वा तदामिषम्।।3.35.32।।निषादविषयं हत्वा शाखया पतगोत्तमः।प्रहर्षमतुलं लेभे मोक्षयित्वा महामुनीन्।।3.35.33।।
explanation: Righteous Garuda, the best among the birds, stood on one foot and ate the flesh (of elephant and tortoise) and  with the branch of the tree, destroyed the settlement of the demons. Over the destruction of the demons and deliverance of the great seers he felt immeasurable happiness.

content: स तेनैव प्रहर्षेण द्विगुणीकृतविक्रमः।अमृतानयनार्थं वै चकार मतिमान्मतिम्।।3.35.34।।
explanation: Quite happy, his energy redoubled, wise Garuda made up his mind to obtain nectar.

content: अयोजालानि निर्मथ्य भित्वा रत्नमयं गृहम्।महेन्द्रभवनाद्गुप्तमाजहारामृतं ततः।।3.35.35।।
explanation: Twisting and twirling the grills of the window, he broke open the room made of gems and quietly carried away the nectar from Indra's mansion.

content: तं महर्षिगणैर्जुष्टं सुपर्णकृतलक्षणम्।नाम्ना सुभद्रं न्यग्रोधं ददर्श धनदानुजः।।3.35.36।।
explanation: Ravana, the younger brother of Kubera, beheld that banyan tree called Subhadram ,which was a favoured resort of the sages bearing the ensignia of Garuda.

content: तं तु गत्वा परं पारं समुद्रस्य नदीपतेः।ददर्शाश्रममेकान्ते रम्ये पुण्ये वनान्तरे।।3.35.37।।
explanation: Ravana crossed over to the other side of the sea, the lord of rivers, and beheld a hermitage in a beautiful, secluded, sacred  place in the middle of the forest.

content: तत्र कृष्णाजिनधरं जटावल्कलधारिणम्।ददर्श नियताहारं मारीचं नाम राक्षसाम्।।3.35.38।।
explanation: There he saw a demon Maricha, by name, clad in dark deerskin and bark ,with matted hair and living on restricted food.

content: स रावणस्समागम्य विधिवत्तेन रक्षसा।मारीचेनार्चितो राजा सर्वकामैरमानुषैः।।3.35.39।।
explanation: When king Ravana reached there, Maricha received him  in accordance with tradition  and made worshipful offering to the king, fulfilling all his superhuman desires.

content: तं स्वयं पूजयित्वा तु भोजनेनोदकेन च।अर्थोपहितया वाचा मारीचो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।3.35.40।।
explanation: Maricha extended his hospitality with appropriate food and water and said with meaningful words:

content: कच्चित्सुकुशलं राजन्लङ्कायां राक्षसेश्वर।केनार्थेन पुनस्त्वं वै तूर्णमेवमिहागतः।।3.35.41।।
explanation: O king  O lord of the demons  hope all is well in Lanka. What brings you here again so soon ?

content: एवमुक्तो महातेजा मारीचेन स रावणः।ततः पश्चादिदं वाक्यमब्रवीद्वाक्यकोविदः।।3.35.42।।
explanation: Thus addressed by Maricha, the effulgent, eloquent Ravana replied with these words:इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे पञ्चत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyfifth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Ravana tells the story of Janasthana-- urges Maricha to help him in abducting Sita-- Maricha dissuades Ravana and describes the virtues of Rama.]मारीच श्रूयातां तात वचनं मम भाषतः।आर्तोऽस्मि मम चार्तस्य भवान्हि परमा गतिः।।3.36.1।।
explanation: O dear Maricha hear my words. I am distressed and you are my ultimate refuge.

content: जानीषे त्वं जनस्थाने यथा भ्राता खरो मम।दूषणश्च महाबाहु स्वसा शूर्पणखा च मे।।3.36.2।।त्रिशिराश्च महातेजा राक्षसः पिशिताशनः।अन्ये च बहवश्शूरा लब्धलक्षा निशाचराः।।3.36.3।।वसत्नि मन्नियोगेन नित्यवासं च राक्षसाः।बाधमाना महारण्ये मुनीन्वै धर्मचारिणः।।3.36.4।।
explanation: You know that my brothers, Khara and Dusana, the strongarmed heroes, my sister Surpanakha and  the mighty cannibal Trisira, and many other heroic demons successful in hitting their targets are bonafide residents. They have been harassing the followers of righteous path (the sages) at my behest.

content: चतुर्दश सहस्राणि रक्षसां भीमकर्मणाम्।शूराणां लब्धलक्षाणां खरचित्तानुवर्तिनाम्।।3.36.5।।
explanation: These fourteen thousand heroes, perpetrators of terrible deeds, skilled in hitting the targets had been acting according to the direction of Khara.

content: ते त्विदानीं जनस्थाने वसमाना महाबलाः।सङ्गताः परमायत्ता रामेण सह संयुगे।।3.36.6।।नानाप्रहरणोपेताः खरप्रमुखराक्षसाः।
explanation: These mighty demons, living in Janasthana, eqipped with different kinds of weapons, supported and led by Khara, met Rama in an encounter.

content: तेन सञ्जातरोषेण रामेण रणमूर्धनि।अनुक्त्वा परुषं किञ्चिच्छरैर्व्यापारितं धनुः।।3.36.7।।
explanation: With his wrath generated, Rama, without even speaking anything, used his bow and the arrows.

content: चतुर्दश सहस्राणि रक्षसामुग्रतेजसाम्।निहतानि शरैस्तीक्ष्णैर्मानुषेण पदातिना।।3.36.8।।
explanation: Being a human being who fought on foot, he killed fourteen thousand ferocious demons with his sharp arrows.

content: खरश्च निहतस्सङ्ख्ये दूषणश्च निपातितः।हतश्च त्रिशिराश्चापि निर्भया दण्डकाः कृताः।।3.36.9।।
explanation: Khara, Dusana and Trisira were killed in war.The residents of Dandaka forest are rendered safe and fearless.

content: पित्रा निरस्तः क्रुद्धेन सभार्यः क्षीणजीवितः।स हन्ता तस्य सैन्यस्य रामः क्षत्रियपांसनः।।3.36.10।।
explanation: Rama, a victim of his father's anger, banished into the forest with his wife, a shortlived mortal and a calumny on the kshatriyas has killed the army of demons.

content: दुश्शीलः कर्कशस्तीक्ष्णो मूर्खो लुब्धोऽजितेन्द्रियः।।3.36.11।।त्यक्तधर्मो ह्यधर्मात्मा भूतानामहिते रतः।
explanation: He is a man of bad conduct, harsh, sharptonged, stupid, miserly and a slave to his senses. He is immoral and unrighteous, one who is busy harming others.

content: येन वैरं विनाऽरण्ये सत्वमाश्रित्य केवलम्।।3.36.12।।कर्णनासापहरणाद्भगिनी मे विरूपिता।तस्यभार्यां जनस्थानात्सीतां सुरसुतोपमाम्।3.36.13।।आनयिष्यामि विक्रम्य सहायस्तत्र मे भव।
explanation: With no enmity whatsoever, merely because he has strength, he cut off the nose and ears of my sister and mutilated her. His wife Sita  is like the daughter of heaven. I would like to abduct her with force from Janasthana for which you should be my accomplice.

content: त्वया ह्यहं सहायेन पार्श्वस्थेन महाबल।।3.36.14।।भ्रातृभिश्च सुरान्युद्धे समग्रान्नाभिचिन्तये।तत्सहायो भव त्वं मे समर्थो ह्यसि राक्षस।।3.36.15।।
explanation: You are mighty. I do not care to fight even the gods when you and my brothers are by my side. Therefore, O demon, be my accomplice. (I know) you are capable of that.

content: वीर्ये युद्धे च दर्पे च न ह्यस्ति सदृशस्तव।उपायज्ञो महान्शूरस्सर्वमायाविशारदः।।3.36.16।।
explanation: In valour,  in war and in conceit there is no one equal to you. You know all means (of success). You are great. You are brave. You are an expert in all deceitful arts.

content: एतदर्थमहं प्राप्तस्त्वत्समीपं निशाचर।शृणु तत्कर्म साहाय्ये यत्कार्यं वचनान्मम।।3.36.17।।
explanation: I have come to you for this purpose seeking your help. Listen to  my words on what you should do:

content: सौवर्णस्त्वं मृगो भूत्वा चित्रो रजतबिन्दुभिः।आश्रमे तस्य रामस्य सीतायाः प्रमुखे चर।।3.36.18।।
explanation: Be a wonderful golden deer dappled with silver dots and roam in front of Sita in Rama's hermitage.

content: त्वां तु निस्संशयं सीता दृष्ट्वा तु मृगरूपिणम्।गृह्यतामिति भर्तारं लक्ष्मणं चाभिधास्यति।।3.36.19।।
explanation: Seeing you in the form of a deer, Sita will undoubtedly ask her husband and Lakshmana to capture you.

content: ततस्तयोरपाये तु शून्ये सीतां यथासुखम्।निराबाधो हरिष्यामि राहुश्चन्द्रप्रभामिव।।3.36.20।।
explanation: Then during their absence it will be easy for me to abduct Sita in an isolated place without obstruction, like Rahu eclipsing the light of the moon.

content: ततः पश्चात्सुखं रामे भार्याहरणकर्शिते।विस्रब्धः प्रहरिष्यामि कृतार्थेनान्तरात्मना।।3.36.21।।
explanation: Thereafter, when Rama with his soul afflicted due to his wife's abduction. I can freely, happily, successfully strike him down.

content: तस्य रामकथां श्रुत्वा मारीचस्य महात्मनः।शुष्कं समभवद्वक्त्रं परितप्ता बभूव ह।।3.36.22।।
explanation: At the mention of Rama's name, great Maricha's mouth dried up and he became concerned.

content: ओष्ठौ परिलिहञ्चुष्कौ नेत्रैरनिमिषैरिव।मृतभूत इवार्तस्तु रावणं समुदैक्षत।।3.36.23।।
explanation: Licking his dried up lips, as though his eyes stopped winking like those of the dead, Maricha stared at Ravana, distressed.

content: स रावणं त्रस्तविषण्णचेता महावने रामपराक्रमज्ञः।कृताञ्जलिस्तत्वमुवाच वाक्यं हितं च तस्मै हितमात्मनश्च।।3.36.24।।
explanation: Maricha who knows of Rama's valour was frightened and depressed at heart. He revealed to Ravana with folded hands some facts for mutual benefit.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीये आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे षट् त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtysixth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Maricha describes the qualities of Rama and Sita to Ravana --advises Ravana to give up the idea of abduction of Sita.]तच्छृत्वा राक्षसेन्द्रस्य वाक्यं वाक्यविशारदः।प्रत्युवाच महाप्राज्ञो मारीचो राक्षसेश्वरम्।।3.37.1।।
explanation: Having heard the words of Ravana, lord of the demons, wise Maricha who was also an eloquent speaker replied:

content: सुलभाः पुरुषा राजन्सततं प्रियवादिनः।अप्रियस्य तु पथ्यस्य वक्ता श्रोता च दुर्लभः।।3.37.2।।
explanation: O king, it is always easy to find men who speak pleasing words, but it is difficult to get a speaker and a listener who use words unpleasant (to the ears) but beneficial (in life).

content: न नूनं बुध्यसे रामं महावीर्यं गुणोन्नतम्।अयुक्तचारश्चपलो महेन्द्रवरुणोपमम्।।3.37.3।।
explanation: You  are fickleminded.  You have employed no spy ( who could have told you the truth about Rama's character). Rama is very brave and virtuous comparable to Indra and Varuna. Surely you are not able to know what Rama is.

content: अपि स्वस्ति भवेत्तात सर्वेषां भुवि रक्षसाम्।अपि रामो नासङ्क्रुद्धः कुर्याल्लोकमराक्षसम्।।3.37.4।।
explanation: O dear may there be good to all the demons in the world. If Rama gets enraged, he will make this world demonless.

content: अपि ते जीवितान्ताय नोत्पन्ना जनकात्मजा।अपि सीतानिमित्तं च न भवेद्व्यसनं मम।।3.37.5।।
explanation: Hope the daughter of Janaka is not born to put an end to your life. Hope I will not face any disaster on account of Sita.

content: अपि त्वामीश्वरं प्राप्य कामवृत्तं निरङ्कुशम्।न विनश्येत्पुरी लङ्का त्वया सह सराक्षसा।।3.37.6।।
explanation: I hope the city of Lanka along with the (entire) race of demons will not be destroyed, with a dictator like you who is a slave to sensual pleasure.

content: त्वद्विधः कामवृत्तो हि दुश्शीलः पापमन्त्रितः।आत्मानं स्वजनं राष्ट्रं स राजा हन्ति दुर्मतिः।।3.37.7।।
explanation: A king  who is a slave to passion, who is of bad conduct, of wicked thoughts, advised in evil ways destroys himself, his kith and kin and the entire kingdom.

content: न च पित्रा परित्यक्तो नामर्यादः कथञ्चन।न लुब्धो न च दुश्शीलो न च क्षत्रियपांसनः।।3.37.8।।न च धर्मगुणैर्हीनः कौसल्यानन्दवर्धनः।न तीक्ष्णो न च भूतानां सर्वेषामहिते रतः।।3.37.9।।
explanation: Rama, the delight of Kausalya, has not forsaken by his father. He has never crossed the limits of dharma. He is not miserly. He has no  bad conduct. He is not a slur on the kshatriyas. He does not lack in righteousness. He is not cruel nor is he engaged in doing harm to others.

content: वञ्चितं पितरं दृष्ट्वा कैकेय्या सत्यवादिनम्।करिष्यामीति धर्मात्मा तात प्रव्रजितो वनम्।।3.37.10।।
explanation: O dear, seeing that his truthful father was going to be deceived by Kaikeyi, righteous Rama himself offered to fulfil the promise of his father and came away to the forest.

content: कैकेय्याः प्रियकामार्थं पितुर्दशरथस्य च।हित्वा राज्यं च भोगांश्च प्रविष्टो दण्डकावनम्।।3.37.11।।
explanation: To satisfy the desire of Kaikeyi and to fulfil his father's word he came to Dandaka forest,  leaving the kingdom and all royal pleasures, behind.

content: न रामः कर्कशस्तात नाविद्वान्नाजितेन्द्रियः।अनृतं दुश्श्रुतं चैव नैव त्वं वक्तुमर्हसि।।3.37.12।।
explanation: O my dear, Rama is not harsh nor ignorant. It is not that he has no control over the senses. It is not proper  for you to say what is false. You are illinformed.

content: रामो विग्रहवान् धर्मस्साधुस्सत्यपराक्रमः।राजा सर्वस्य लोकस्य देवानां मघवानिव।।3.37.13।।
explanation: Rama is dharma incarnate. He is pious. His strength is truth. He is king of all the worlds like Indra to the gods.

content: कथं त्वं तस्य वैदेहीं रक्षितां स्वेन तेजसा।इच्छसि प्रसभं हर्तुं प्रभामिव विवस्वतः।।3.37.14।।
explanation: Sita is protected by the strength of her character. How do you desire to carry her away forcibly (from Rama) ? Can any one separate the radiance of the Sun from the Sun itself ?

content: शरार्चिषमाधृष्यं चापखङ्गेन्धनं रणे।रामाग्निं सहसा दीप्तं न प्रवेष्टुं त्वमर्हसि।।3.37.15।।
explanation: You should not enter into the unquenchable fire that is  Rama,  the fire that has the  arrows (of Rama) as its flames and his sword and bow as fuel.

content: धनुर्व्यादितदीप्तास्यं शरार्चिषममर्षणम्।चापबाणधरं तीक्ष्णं शत्रुसैन्यप्रहारिणम्।।3.37.16।।राज्यं सुखं च सन्त्यज्य जीवितं चेष्टमात्मनः।नात्यासादयितुं तात रामान्तकमिहार्हसि।।3.37.17।।
explanation: You should not give up happiness,your dear life and kingdom and come to Rama who is a variable god of death. His bow is  like on open burning mouth, and his flaming arrows are like fire. He is all anger. He is wielder of bow and arrows. He can strike the enemy army (alone).

content: अप्रमेयं हि तत्तेजो यस्य सा जनकात्मजा।न त्वं समर्थस्तां हर्तुं रामचापाश्रयं वने।।3.37.18।।
explanation: Immeasurable indeed is the power of Rama to whom Sita, daughter of Janaka belongs. You are not competent to kidnap her, for she is under the refuge of Rama's bow in the forest.

content: तस्य सा नरसिंहस्य सिंहोरस्कस्य भामिनी।प्राणेभ्योऽपि प्रियतरा भार्या नित्यमनुव्रता।।3.37.19।।
explanation: Beautiful Sita happens to be the wife of Rama who is like a lion among men. Rama has a broad chest like that of a lion. He loves Sita who is ever loyal to him, more than his life.

content: न सा धर्षयितुं शक्या मैथिल्योजस्विनः प्रिया।दीप्तस्येव हुताशस्य शिखा सीता सुमध्यमा।।3.37.20।।
explanation: Sita is the darling of mighty Rama. With her slender waist, she is like the leaping flames of blazing fire and it is not possible  for you to touch her.

content: किमुद्यममिमं व्यर्थं कृत्वा ते राक्षसाधिप।दृष्टश्चेत्वं रणे तेन तदन्तं तव जीवितम्।।3.37.21।।
explanation: O chief of the demons, why do you make this futile attempt ? The moment you are seen by Rama in war will be the last of your life.

content: जीवितं च सुखं चैव राज्यं चैव सुदुर्लभम्।यदीच्छसि चिरं भोक्तुं मा कृथा रामविप्रियम्।।3.37.22।।
explanation: If you want to enjoy your life, happiness and even the kingdom which is not easily attainable for long, do not incur the displeasure of Rama.

content: स सर्वैस्सचिवैस्सार्धं विभीषणपुरोगमैः।मन्त्रयित्वा तु धर्मिष्ठैः कृत्वा निश्चयमात्मनः।।3.37.23।।दोषाणां च गुणानां च सम्प्रधार्य बलाबलम्।आत्मनश्च बलं ज्ञात्वा राघवस्य च तत्वतः।।3.37.24।।हिताहितं विनिश्चित्य क्षमं त्वं कर्तुमर्हसि।
explanation: After consulting all your ministers and the righteous persons led by Vibhisana, you may take a decision. Assess the real strength and weakness, merits and demerits  of your own and of Rama. Decide what is good or bad for you and then take steps you deem proper.

content: अहं तु मन्ये तव न क्षमं रणे समागमं कोसलराजसूनुना।इदं हि भूयश्श़ृणु वाक्यमुत्तमं क्षमं च युक्तं च निशाचरेश्वर।।3.37.25।।
explanation: O Ravana  I think it is not good on your part to confront the prince of Kosala in a war. Listen to my words and consider what is good for you.इत्यार्षे श्री मद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे सप्तत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyseventh sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Maricha's narration of his experience of Rama's strength--explains to Ravana the consequences of waging a war with Rama.]कदाचिदप्यहं वीर्यात्पर्यटन्पृथिवीमिमाम्।बलं नागसहस्रस्य धारयन्पर्वतोपमः।।3.38.1।।नीलजीमूतसङ्काशस्तप्तकाञ्चनकुण्डलः।भयं लोकस्य जनयन्किरीटी परिघायुधः।।3.38.2।।व्यचरं दण्डकारण्ये ऋषिमांसानि भक्षयन्।
explanation: Once I was roaming the earth, like a mountain possessing the  strength of a thousand elephants, like a dark cloud, wearing bright gold earrings and crown,holding a spear in hand, terrorising the people. I was wandering in Dandaka forest feeding on the flesh of ascetics.

content: विश्वामित्रोऽथ धर्मात्मा मद्वित्रस्तो महामुनिः।।3.38.3।।स्वयं गत्वा दशरथं नरेन्द्रमिदमब्रवीत्।
explanation: Hence the great sage, righteous Visvamitra afraid of me, went to king Dasaratha  and said:

content: अद्य रक्षतु मां रामः पर्वकाले समाहितः।।3.38.4।।मारीचान्मे भयं घोरं समुत्पन्नं नरेश्वर।
explanation: 'O king Maricha has created in me a great fear. Spare the self possessed Rama to protect me while I do the sacrifice.'

content: इत्येवमुक्तो धर्मात्मा राजा दशरथस्तदा।।3.38.5।।प्रत्युवाच महाभागं विश्वामित्रं महामुनिम्।
explanation: When the great, venerable sage Visvamitra said so, the righteous king Dasaratha replied:

content: बालो द्वादशवर्षोऽयमकृतास्त्रश्च राघवः।।3.38.6।।कामं तु मम यत्सैन्यं मया सह गमिष्यति।
explanation: 'My son Rama is only twelve. He is not experienced in the use of weapons. I shall accompany you with my army.

content: बलेन चतुरङ्गेण स्वयमेत्य निशाचरान्।।3.38.7।।वधिष्यामि मुनिश्रेष्ठ शत्रूंस्ते मनसेप्सितान्।
explanation: 'O distinguished sage with the four divisions of my army I will slay the enemies you want me to.'

content: इत्येवमुक्तस्समुनी राजानमिदमब्रवीत्।।3.38.8।।रामान्नान्यद्बलं लोके पर्याप्तं तस्य रक्षसः।
explanation: When  the king thus responded to the sage,  he told him that none other than Rama in this world is a match for that demon.

content: देवतानामपि भवान् समरेष्वभिपालकः।।3.38.9।।आसीत्तव कृतं कर्म त्रिलोके विदितं नृप।
explanation: 'O king, you have protected even gods in wars and have been a guardian. Your deeds are very wellknown in the three worlds.

content: काममस्तु महत्सैन्यं तिष्ठत्विह परन्तप।।3.38.10।।बालोऽप्येष महातेजास्समर्थस्तस्य निग्रहे।गमिष्ये राममादाय स्वस्ति तेऽस्तु परन्तप।।3.38.11।।
explanation: 'O scourge of foes as you wish, let your great army wait here. Even though Rama is young he is glorious, and capable of subduing the enemy. I will take him. Be blessed.'

content: एवमुक्त्वा तु स मुनिस्तमादाय नृपात्मजम्।जगाम परमप्रीतो विश्वामित्रस्स्वमाश्रमम्।।3.38.12।।
explanation: Sage Visvamitra saying so took the son of the king and went back very happily to his hermitage.

content: तं तदा दण्डकारण्ये यज्ञमुद्दिश्य दीक्षितम्।बभूवोपस्थितो रामश्चित्रं विष्फारयन्धनुः।।3.38.13।।
explanation: Then Rama was initiated for the protection of sacrifices and stood on guard, stretching his wonderful bow.

content: अजातव्यञ्जनश्रीमान्पद्मपत्रनिभेक्षणः।एकवस्त्रधरो धन्वी शिखी कनकमालया।।3.38.14।।शोभयन् दण्डकारण्यं दीप्तेन स्वेन तेजसा।अदृश्यत ततो रामो बालचन्द्र इवोदितः।।3.38.15।।
explanation: Thereafter, handsome Rama, with eyes like lotus petals, beards ungrown, clad in a single garment with knotted hair on the head, wielding a bow, with a chain of gold, luminous with his own lustre enhanced the glory of Dandaka forest by looking like the young moon just risen.

content: ततोऽहं मेघसङ्काशस्तप्तकाञ्चनकुण्डलः।बली दत्तवरोदर्पादाजगाम तदाश्रमम्।।3.38.16।।
explanation: Then looking like a dark cloud, wearing bright golden earrings, proud of power bestowed on me with boons, I arrived at the hermitage.

content: तेन दृष्टः प्रविष्टोऽहं सहसैवोद्यतायुधः।मां तु दृष्ट्वा धनुस्सज्यमसम्भ्रान्तश्चकार सः।।3.38.17।।
explanation: I entered at once and lifted my weapons. Rama saw me and unperturbed, started stringing his bow.

content: अवजानन्नहं मोहाद्बालोऽयमिति राघवम्।विश्वामित्रस्य तां वेदिमभ्यधावं कृतत्वरः।।3.38.18।।
explanation: Out of my delusion I underestimated the young boy, and screaming, ran towards Visvamitra's sacrificial altar.

content: तेन मुक्तस्ततो बाणः शितश्शत्रुनिबर्हणः।तेनाहं त्वाहतः क्षिप्तस्समुद्रे शतयोजने।।3.38.19।।
explanation: Then Rama released a sharp arrow that could kill the enemy. It struck me and threw me at a distance of hundred yojanas into the sea.

content: नेच्छता तात मां हन्तुं तदा वीरेण रक्षितः।रामस्य शरवेगेन निरस्तोऽहमचेतनः।।3.38.20।।
explanation: O dear being thrown away by the speed of his dart I lost my consciousness. I was protected by Rama who did not want to kill me.

content: पातितोऽहं तदा तेन गम्भीरे सागराम्भसि।प्राप्य संज्ञां चिरात्तात लङ्कां प्रतिगतः पुरीम्।।3.38.21।।
explanation: O dear I was thrown into the deep sea and after a long time regained consciousness and  returned to the city of Lanka.

content: एवमस्मि तदा मुक्तस्सहायास्तु निपातिताः।अकृतास्त्रेण बालेन रामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा।।3.38.22।।
explanation: That way I was spared by the young boy who was not versed in archery and who could still accomplish the task with ease.Those who accompanied me were destroyed.

content: तन्मया वार्यमाणस्त्वं यदि रामेण विग्रहम्।करिष्यस्यापदं घोरां क्षिप्रं प्राप्स्यसि रावण।।3.38.23।।
explanation: If you pick up conflict with Rama even while being warned by me you will soon face a dreadful calamity.

content: क्रीडारतिविधिज्ञानां समाजोत्सवशालिनाम्।रक्षसां चैव सन्तापमनर्थं चाहरिष्यसि।।3.38.24।।
explanation: You will bring grief and disaster into the lives of demons who are sporting in love and who are in the habit of celebrating community festivals with joy.

content: हर्म्यप्रासादसम्बाधां नानारत्नविभूषिताम्।द्रक्ष्यसि त्वं पुरीं लङ्कां विनष्टां मैथिलीकृते।।3.38.25।।
explanation: You will see the city of Lanka dotted with magnificent royal mansions embellished  with different kinds of gems ruined for the sake of Sita.

content: अकुर्वन्तोऽपि पापानि शुचयः पापसंश्रयात्।परपापैर्विनश्यन्ति मत्स्या नागह्रदे यथा।।3.38.26।।
explanation: Even without committing any sin those pure souls because they keep company with sinners will be destroyed for the sins of others just like fishes in a pool of serpents.

content: दिव्यचन्दनदिग्धाङ्गान्दिव्याभरणभूषितान्।द्रक्ष्यस्यभिहतान्भूमौ तव दोषात्तु राक्षसान्।।3.38.27।।
explanation: You will see the demons who smear their limbs with sandal paste and unguents, who are adorned with excellent ornaments slain and laid on the ground for your mistakes.

content: हृतदारान् सदारांश्च दश विद्रवतो दिशः।हतशेषानशरणान्द्रक्ष्यसि त्वं निशाचरान्।।3.38.28।।
explanation: You will see the rest of the demons with their wives gone or fleeing in all directions helplessly with none to take care of them.

content: शरजालपरिक्षिप्तामग्निज्वालासमावृताम्।प्रदग्धभवनां लङ्कां द्रक्ष्यसि त्वं न संशयः।।3.38.29।।
explanation: You will undoubtedly see Lanka filled with arrows, surrounded by flames of fire and its buildings on fire.

content: परदाराभिमर्शात्तु नान्यत्पापतरं महत्।प्रमदानां सहस्रं च तव राजन्परिग्रहः।।3.38.30।।
explanation: O king there is no sin greater than violating the chastity of others wives, when you have married a thousand lovely women.

content: भव स्वदारनिरतस्वकुलं रक्ष राक्षस।मानमृद्धिं च राज्यं च जीवितं चेष्टमात्मनः।।3.38.31।।
explanation: Enjoy with your wives. Protect your race, prestige, kingdom, prosperity and your own dear life.

content: कलत्राणि च सौम्यानि मित्रवर्गं तथैव च।यदीच्छसि चिरं भोक्तं मा कृथा रामविप्रियम्।।3.38.32।।
explanation: If you wish to enjoy your beautiful wives and your good friends for long, do not create enmity with Rama.

content: निवार्यमाणस्सुहृदा मया भृशं प्रसह्य सीतां यदि धर्षयिष्यसि।गमिष्यसि क्षीणबलस्सबान्धवो यमक्षयं रामशरात्तजीवितः।।3.38.33।।
explanation: If you violate Sita forcibly notwithstanding my friendly warning, your life will be drained by the arrows of Rama and you will reach the abode of Yama with your kith and kin, your strength depleted.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे अष्टत्रिंशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the thirtyeighth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Maricha describes his escape to Dandaka forest -- advises Ravana against the idea of encountering Rama.]एवमस्मि तदा मुक्तः कथञ्चित्तेन संयुगे।इदानीमपि यद्वृत्तं तच्छृणुष्व निरुत्तरम्।।3.39.1।।
explanation: I was somehow saved by him this way in the combat.Listen without any reply to what has taken place recently.

content: राक्षसाभ्यामहं द्वाभ्यामनिर्विण्णस्तथा कृतः।सहितो मृगरूपाभ्यां प्रविष्टो दण्डकावनम्।।3.39.2।।
explanation: Having done so, I picked up courage and entered Dandaka forest, accompanied by the two other demons in the form of deer .

content: दीप्तजिह्वो महाकायस्तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्रो महाबलः।व्यचरं दण्डकारण्यं मांसभक्षो महामृगः।।3.39.3।।
explanation: I wandered in Dandaka forest in the form of a huge animal with a big and strong body, a flaming red tongue and sharp teeth feeding on flesh.

content: अग्निहोत्रेषु तीर्थेषु चैत्यवृक्षेषु रावण।अत्यन्तघोरो व्यचरं तापसान्सम्प्रधर्षयन्।।3.39.4।।
explanation: O Ravana, assuming a very dreadful form, I wandered about sacrificial spots, sacred places, river banks, under huge trees planted at quadranglestorturing the ascetics.

content: निहत्य दण्डकारण्ये तापसान्धर्मचारिणः।रुधिराणि पिबंस्तेषां तथा मांसानि भक्षयन्।।3.39.5।।
explanation: I wandered  about the Dandaka forest slaying righteous ascetics, drinking their blood and eating their flesh.

content: ऋषिमांसाशनः क्रूरस्त्रासयन्वनगोचरान्।तथा रुधिरमत्तोऽहं विचरन्धर्मदूषकः।।3.39.6।।
explanation: While thus roaming, I harmed the wanderers of the forest. Intoxicated with their blood I used to frighten the righteous.

content: आसादयं तदा रामं तापसं धर्मचारिणम्।वैदेहीं च महाभागां लक्ष्मणं च महारथम्।।3.39.7।।
explanation: I encountered again the righteous Rama who was in the form of an ascetic, with venerable Sita and the great warrior Lakshmana.

content: तापसं नियताहारं सर्वभूतहिते रतम्।सोऽहं वनगतं रामं परिभूय महाबलम्।।3.39.8।।तापसोऽयमिति ज्ञात्वा पूर्ववैरमनुस्मरन्।अभ्यधावं हि संक्रुद्धस्तीक्ष्ण शृङ्गो मृगाकृतिः।।3.39.9।।जिघांसुरकृतप्रज्ञस्तं प्रहारमनुस्मरन्।
explanation: Although Rama was very strong, he was living on restricted diet, engaged in the welfare of all beings. Treating him as a mere ascetic living in the forest, remembering my past hostility with him and disregarding his (fatal) blow, I ran towards him angrily, assuming the form of a sharphorned animal with an intention to kill him.

content: तेन मुक्तास्त्रयो बाणाश्शिताश्शत्रुनिबर्हणाः।।3.39.10।।विकृष्य बलवच्चापं सुपर्णानिलनिस्स्वनाः।
explanation: His mighty bow drawn, Rama released three sharp darts that came whizzing like Garuda or the wind. They could destroy the enemy.

content: ते बाणा वज्रसङ्काशास्सुमुक्ता रक्तभोजनाः।आजग्मुस्सहितास्सर्वे त्रयस्सन्नतपर्वणः।।3.39.11।।
explanation: All the three tightly jointed, welltargetted darts, strong as thunderbolt, and which could feed on blood came together all at once.

content: पराक्रमज्ञो रामस्य शठो दृष्टभयः पुरा।समुद्भान्तस्ततोमुक्तस्तावुभौ राक्षसौ हतौ।।3.39.12।।
explanation: Having known Rama's prowess earlier and experienced tremendous fear, I ran away in a bewildered state as I was deceitful. The other two demons (who had accompanied me) succumbed.

content: शरेण मुक्तो रामस्य कथञ्चित्प्राप्य जीवितम्।इह प्रव्राजितो युक्तस्तापसोऽहं समाहितः।।3.39.13।।
explanation: With my escape from Rama's darts I somehow got a fresh lease of life. Now I am composed. I have started living the life of a recluse here. I have turned an ascetic.

content: वृक्षे वृक्षे च पश्यामि चीरकृष्णाजिनाम्बरम्।गृहीतधनुषं रामं पाशहस्तमिवान्तकम्।।3.39.14।।
explanation: I see Rama in every tree, clad in bark and deerskin, wielding the bow, holding a noose in hand like the god of death.

content: अपि रामसहस्राणि भीतः पश्यामि रावण।रामभूतमिदं सर्वमरण्यं प्रतिभाति मे।।3.39.15।।
explanation: O Ravana I see in my fear thousands of Ramas. The entire forest appears to me as though filled with Rama.

content: राममेव हि पश्यामि रहिते राक्षसाधिप।दृष्ट्वा स्वप्नगतं राममुद्भ्रमामि विचेतनः।।3.39.16।।
explanation: O king of the demons  I see only Rama even in solitude. When I see him in a dream  I lose my senses in a state of bewilderment.

content: रकारादीनि नामानि रामत्रस्तस्य रावण।रत्नानि च रथाश्चैव त्रासं संजनयन्ति मे।।3.39.17।।
explanation: O Ravana, every name beginning with the letter 'Ra', such as Ratna (gems), Ratha (chariot), etc. strike terror in me.

content: अहं तस्य प्रभावज्ञो न युद्धं तेन ते क्षमम्।बलिं वा नमुचिं वापि हन्याद्धि रघुनन्दनः।।3.39.18।।
explanation: I know his power.It is not proper to wage a war with him. Rama, delight of the Raghu dynasty, can slay even Bali or Namuchi.

content: रणे रामेण युद्ध्यस्व क्षमां वा कुरु राक्षस ।न ते रामकथा कार्या यदि मां द्रष्टुमिच्छसि ।।3.39.19 ।।
explanation: Missing

content: बहवस्साधवो लोके युक्ता धर्ममनुष्ठिताः।परेषामपराधेन विनष्ठास्सपरिच्छदाः।।3.39.20।।
explanation: There were many pious men in this world who practise yoga and dharma .They have been destroyed along with their retinue due to mistakes committed by others.

content: सोऽऽहं तवापराधेन विनश्येयं निशाचर।कुरु यत्ते क्षमं तत्त्वमहं त्वा नानुयामि ह।।3.39.21।।
explanation: O demon   As such, I will perish due to your offence. You may do anything you deem appropriate. I will not follow you.

content: रामश्च हि महातेजा महासत्त्वो महाबलः।।3.39.22।।अपि राक्षसलोकस्य न भवेदन्तकोऽपि सः।
explanation: Rama is brilliant, powerful and strong. I hope he will not be the god of death for the world of demons.

content: यदि शूर्पणखाहेतोर्जनस्थानगतः खरः।।3.39.23।।अतिवृत्तो हतः पूर्वं रामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा।अत्र ब्रूहि यथातत्त्वं को रामस्य व्यतिक्रमः।।3.39.24।।
explanation: For the sake of Surpanakha, Khara of Janasthana committed excesses and got killed by Rama who can accomplish things with ease.Tell me truly if Rama did violate anything here.

content: इदं वचो बन्धुहितार्थिनामया यथोच्यमानं यदि नाभिपत्स्यसे।सबान्धवस्त्यक्ष्यसि जीवितं रणे हतोऽऽद्य रामेण शरैरजिह्मगैः।।3.39.25।।
explanation: If you do not follow my advice given for the welfare of our kith and kin, O Ravana, you are killed today. With your relations you will succumb to his straightmoving arrows.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकोनचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyninth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Ravana commands Maricha with the authority of a king-- threatens to kill him if he disobeyed determined Ravana indicates his plan of the golden deer.]मारीचेन तु तद्वाक्यं क्षमं युक्तं च निशाचरः।उक्तो न प्रतिजग्राह मर्तुकाम इवौषधम्।।3.40.1।।
explanation: The demon Ravana did not heed the appropriate advice of the competent Maricha just like a man wishing to die refuses medicine.

content: तं पथ्यहितवक्तारं मारीचं राक्षसाधिपः।अब्रवीत्परुषं वाक्यमयुक्तं कालचोदितः।।3.40.2।।
explanation: The king of the demons, driven by fate, replied with improper and harsh words to Maricha whose advice was salutary and beneficial to him :

content: यत्किलैतदयुक्तार्थं मारीच मयि कथ्यते।वाक्यं निष्फलमत्यर्थमुप्तं बीजमिवोषरे।।3.40.3।।
explanation: O Maricha, the words addressed to me are not appropriate.Your advice is extremely fruitless like a seed sown in saline, barren soil.

content: त्वद्वाक्यैर्न तु मां शक्यं भेत्तुं रामस्य संयुगे।पापशीलस्य मूर्खस्य मानुषस्य विशेषतः।।3.40.4।।
explanation: It is not possible to dissuade me from my encounter with Rama who is sinful, foolish and especially an ordinary human being.

content: यस्त्यक्त्वा सुहृदो राज्यं मातरं पितरं तथा।स्त्रीवाक्यं प्राकृतं श्रुत्वा वनमेकपदे गतः।।3.40.5।।
explanation: On hearing the casual words of a woman, (this) Rama came to the forest at once, leaving his friends, kingdom, mother and father.

content: अवश्यन्तु मया तस्य संयुगे खरघातिनः।प्राणैः प्रियतरा सीता हर्तव्या तव सन्निधौ।।3.40.6।।
explanation: In your very presence I will surely abduct Sita, wife of Rama who killed Khara in war, Sita whom he loves more than his life.

content: एवं मे निश्चिता बुद्धिर्हृदि मारीच वर्तते।न व्यावर्तयितुं शक्या सेन्द्रैरपि सुरासुरैः।।3.40.7।।
explanation: O Maricha  I have made up my mind that way. Even demons or deities including Indra cannot alter this decision of mine.

content: दोषं गुणं वा सम्पृष्टस्त्वमेवं वक्तुमर्हसि।अपायं वाप्युपायं वा कार्यस्यास्य विनिश्चये।।3.40.8।।
explanation: If I asked you the merits or demerits, the risks involved or the way out while deciding a case, you should have said what you did.

content: सम्पृष्टेन तु वक्तव्यं सचिवेन विपश्चिता।उद्यताञ्जलिना राज्ञे य इच्छेद्भूतिमात्मनः।।3.40.9।।
explanation: A wise counsellor should give advice to the king only when his opinion is sought and that too with folded hands, if he wishes his own prosperity.

content: वाक्यमप्रितकूलं तु मृदुपूर्वं हितं शुभम्।उपचारेण युक्तं च वक्तव्यो वसुधाधिपः।।3.40.10।।
explanation: A king should be addressed with politeness and decorum, with words not unfavourble intended for his good luck and wellbeing.

content: सावमर्दं तु यद्वाक्यं मारीच हितमुच्यते।नाभिनन्दति तद्राजा मानार्हो मानवर्जितम्।।3.40.11।।
explanation: A king who deserves honour does not feel happy to hear even good words of advice if said in disrespectful or authoritarian way, O Maricha

content: पञ्च रूपाणि राजानो धारयन्त्यमितौजसः।अग्नेरिन्द्रस्य सोमस्य वरुणस्य यमस्य च।।3.40.12।।
explanation: Very powerful kings assume five forms like fire, Indra, Moon, Varuna and Yama.

content: औष्ण्यं तथा विक्रमं च सौम्यं दण्डं प्रसन्नताम्।धारयन्ति महात्मानो राजानः क्षणदाचर।।3.40.13।।तस्मात्सर्वास्ववस्थासु मान्याः पूज्याश्च पार्थिवाः।
explanation: Great kings possess heat, (of the firegod), valour (of Indra), coolness (of the Moon), command (of Varuna) and grace (of the Lord of death). Therefore kings at all stages deserve respect and reverence.

content: त्वं तु धर्ममविज्ञाय केवलं मोहमास्थितः।अभ्यागतं मां दौरात्म्यात्परुषं वक्तुमिच्छसि।।3.40.14।।
explanation: You do not know your rightful duty.Because of delusion and an evil mind, you want to speak only harsh words to me, a guest who has come to you.

content: गुणदोषौ न पृच्छामि क्षमं चात्मनि राक्षस।मयोक्तं तव चैतावत्संप्रत्यमितविक्रमः।।3.40.15।।
explanation: O demon  O extremely valiant demon  I ask you(to do) this much now. I am not asking you whether it is good or bad or whether it is for my welfare or not.

content: अस्मिंस्तु त्वं महाकृत्ये साहाय्यं कर्तुमर्हसि।शृणु तत्कर्म साहाय्ये यत्कार्यं वचनान्मम।।3.40.16।।
explanation: You have to help me in accomplishing this great task .Hear me on the kind of work you have to do.

content: सौवर्णस्त्वं मृगो भूत्वा चित्रो रजतबिन्दुभिः । आश्रमे तस्य रामस्य सीतायाः प्रमुखे चर ।।3.40.17 ।।
explanation: Missing

content: सौवर्णस्त्वं मृगो भूत्वा चित्रो रजतबिन्दुभिः।आश्रमे तस्य रामस्य सीतायाः प्रमुखे चर।प्रलोभयित्वा वैदेहीं यथेष्टं गन्तुमर्हसि।।3.40.18।।
explanation: Transform yourself into a wonderful golden deer with silver spots and move about in front of Sita at the hermitage of Rama. After fascinating her, you may go whereever you desire.

content: त्वां तु मायामृगं दृष्ट्वा काञ्चनं जातविस्मया।आनयैनमिति क्षिप्रं रामं वक्ष्यति मैथिली।।3.40.19।।
explanation: Seeing the illusory golden deer, Sita, wonderstruck, will at once ask Rama to get the deer.

content: अपक्रान्ते तु काकुत्स्थे दूरं यात्वाप्युदाहर।हा सीते लक्ष्मणेत्येवं रामवाक्यानुरूपकम्।।3.40.20।।
explanation: Divert Rama to a faroff place and cry, 'Alas, Sita, Alas, Lakshmana',  imitating the voice of Rama.

content: तच्छ्रुत्वा रामपदवीं सीतया च प्रचोदितः।अनुगच्छति सम्भ्रान्तः सौमित्रिरपि सौहृदात्।।3.40.21।।
explanation: On hearing you, Lakshmana will be bewildered. Urged by Sita and out of love for Rama, Lakshmana will follow the same track as Rama.

content: अपक्रान्ते च काकुत्स्थे लक्ष्मणे च यथासुखम्।आनयिष्यामि वैदेहीं सहस्राक्षश्शचीमिव।।3.40.22।।
explanation: When Rama and Lakshmana are away I will comfortably abduct Vaidehi like the thousandeyed Indra brought Sachi.

content: एवं कृत्वा त्विदं कार्यं यथेष्टं गच्छ राक्षस।राज्यस्यार्धं प्रयच्छामि मारीच तव सुव्रत।।3.40.23।।
explanation: You may go wherever you want after accomplishing this task. I will give you, O demon of determination half my kingdom.

content: गच्छ सौम्य शिवं मार्गं कार्यस्यास्य विवृद्धये।अहं त्वानुगमिष्यामि सरथो दण्डकावनम्।।3.40.24।।
explanation: Go and accomplish this task. Let your path be auspicious. I will follow you on the chariot into the Dandaka forest.

content: प्राप्य सीतामयुद्धेन वञ्चयित्वा तु राघवम्।लङ्कां प्रतिगमिष्यामि कृतकार्यस्सह त्वया।।3.40.25।।
explanation: I will deceive Rama and obtain Sita, without waging a war. With the work done, I will return to Lanka along with you.

content: न चेत्करोषि मारीच हन्मि त्वामहमद्य वै।एतत्कार्यमवश्यं मे बलादपि करिष्यसि।राज्ञो हि प्रतिकूलस्थो न जातु सुखमेधते।।3.40.26।।
explanation: O Maricha if you do not do this, I will kill you now. Or, by force make you do this work. No one who goes against the king lives in comfort.

content: आसाद्य तं जीवितसंशयस्ते मृत्युर्ध्रुवो ह्यद्य मया विरुध्य।एतद्यथावत्प्रतिगृह्य बुद्ध्या यदत्र पथ्यं कुरु तत्तथा त्वम्।।3.40.27।।
explanation: Your survival is doubtful after facing Rama in combat. But your death is certain if you oppose me now. Think carefuly and do whatever is desirable for you in the present circumstances.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे चत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortieth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Maricha's admonitions and warnings to Ravana]आज्ञप्तो राजवद्वाक्यं प्रतिकूलं निशाचरः।अब्रवीत्परुषं वाक्यं मारीचो राक्षसाधिपम्।।3.41.1।।
explanation: At this royal command which was against his interest Maracha used harsh words to the demonking:

content: केनायमुपदिष्टस्ते विनाशः पापकर्मणा।सपुत्रस्य सराष्ट्रस्य सामात्यस्य निशाचर।।3.41.2।।
explanation: Who is that sinner who has given you this advice which will spell destruction on you, your sons, your kingdom and your ministers ?

content: कस्त्वया सुखिना राजन्नाभिनन्दति पापकृत्।केनेदमुपदिष्टं ते मृत्युद्वारमुपायतः।।3.41.3।।
explanation: Which sinner is not able to see you happy? O king by whom is this gate of death shown to you cunningly?

content: शत्रवस्तव सुव्यक्तं हीनवीर्या निशाचराः।इच्छन्ति त्वां विनश्यन्तमुपरुद्धं बलीयसा।।3.41.4।।
explanation: This is clear that your enemy demons are now powerless. Hence they want you to be engaged with a stronger power and be destroyed.

content: केनेदमुपदिष्टं ते क्षुद्रेणाहितवादिना।यस्त्वामिच्छति नश्यन्तं स्वकृतेन निशाचर।।3.41.5।।
explanation: O Ravana by which mean fellow is this advice given against your welfare? Who wants you to be destroyed by your own action.

content: वध्याः खलु न हन्यन्ते सचिवास्तव रावण।ये त्वामुत्पथमारूढं न निगृह्णन्ति सर्वशः।।3.41.6।।
explanation: O Ravana the ministers should have prevented you by all means from adopting this  wrong path. Since they have not done so, they deserve to be spain.

content: अमात्यैः कामवृत्तो हि राजा कापथमाश्रितः।निग्राह्यस्सर्वथा सदभिर्न निग्राह्यो निगृह्यसे।।3.41.7।।
explanation: Good ministrers should always prevent a lustful king from taking resourse to an evil path. Why were you not stopped, even though you deserve to be checked.

content: धर्ममर्थं च कामं च यशश्च जयतां वर।स्वामिप्रसादात्सचिवाः प्राप्नुवन्ति निशाचर।।3.41.8।।
explanation: O Ravana  the best among the successful ministers attain piety, prosperity, pleasures and fame by the grace of the king.

content: विपर्यये तु तत्सर्वं व्यर्थं भवति रावण।व्यसनं स्वामिवैगुण्यात्प्राप्नुवन्तीतरे जनाः।।3.41.9।।
explanation: Otherwise evrything will become useless, O Ravana  Others will suffer calamities on account of their master's vices.

content: राजमूलो हि धर्मश्च जयश्च जयतां वर।तस्मात्सर्वास्ववस्थासु रक्षितव्या नराधिपाः।।3.41.10।।
explanation: O Ravana, the best among the victorious indeed the king is at the root of righteousness and victory.Therefore, the king should be protected by all at every stage.

content: राज्यं पालयितुं शक्यं न तीक्ष्णेन निशाचर।न चापि प्रतिकूलेन नाविनीतेन राक्षस।।3.41.11।।
explanation: O nightwalking demon  a kingdom cannnot be governed by a king who is rude or hostile or impolite.

content: ये तीक्ष्णमन्त्रास्सचिवा भज्यन्ते सह तेन वै।विषमे तुरगा श्शीघ्रा मन्दसारथयो यथा।।3.41.12।।
explanation: Ministers who adopt improper strategies go down along with the king just like swift horses driven by a slow charioteer on a rugged terrain.

content: बहवस्साधवो लोके युक्ता धर्ममनुष्ठिताः।परेषामपराधेन विनष्टास्सपरिच्छदाः।।3.41.13।।
explanation: Persons who walk the righteous path go down in this world along with their kith and kin due to the mistakes committed by others .

content: स्वामिना प्रतिकूलेन प्रजास्तीक्ष्णेन रावण।रक्ष्यमाणा न वर्धन्ते मेषा गोमायुना यथा।।3.41.14।।
explanation: O Ravana, people who are ruled by a cruel and hostile king will not grow like the sheep protected by a jackal.

content: अवश्यं विनशिष्यन्ति सर्वे रावण राक्षसाः।येषां त्वं कर्कशो राजा दुर्बुद्धिरजितेन्द्रियः।।3.41.15।।
explanation: Under a rude, crooked king whose senses are not under his control the demons will surely perish.
