content: तदिदं काकतालीयं घोरमासादितं मया।अत्र किं शोचनीयस्त्वं ससैन्यो विनशिष्यसि।।3.41.16।।
explanation: I am faced with  this dreadful disaster accidentally. You will not only be in a miserable state because of your misdeeds, you will perish along with your army.

content: मां निहत्य तु रामश्च न चिरात्त्वां वधिष्यति।अनेन कृतकृत्योऽस्मि म्रियेयमरिणा हतः।।3.41.17।।
explanation: Rama will kill you not long after killing me.Hence even if I die in the hands of the enemy, my desire will be fulfilled.

content: दर्शनादेव रामस्य हतं मामवधारय।आत्मानं च हतं विद्धि हृत्वा सीतां सबान्धवम्।।3.41.18।।
explanation: Yu most understand that if I die at the very sight of Rama, you along with your relatives will perish with the abduction of Sita.

content: आनयिष्यसि चेत्सीतामाश्रमात्सहितो मया।नैवत्वमसि नाहं च नैव लङ्का न राक्षसाः।।3.41.19।।
explanation: If you bring Sita from the hermitage with my assistance, know that none of us will surviveyou nor I, nor Lanka , nor the demons.

content: निवार्यमाणस्तु मया हितैषिणा न मृष्यसे वाक्यमिदं निशाचर।परेतकल्पा हि गतायुषो नरा हितं न गृह्णन्ति सुहृद्भिरीरितम्।।3.41.20।।
explanation: O Ravana, you do not understand this word of warning coming from your wellwisher. Men who are going to die do not heed the advice given by their friends.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyfirst sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Maricha goes to Rama's cottage transformed into a wonderful deer and wanders-- Sita wonders at the deer.]एवमुक्त्वा तु वचनं मारीचो रावणं ततः।गच्छावेत्यब्रवीद्दीनो भयाद्रात्रिंचरप्रभोः।।3.42.1।।
explanation: Having thus spoken to the demonking, the distressed Maricha said out of fear, Let both of us go.

content: दृष्टश्चाहं पुनस्तेन शरचापासिधारिणा।मद्वधोद्यतशस्त्रेऽण विनष्टं जीवितं च मे।।3.42.2।।
explanation: If that warrior Rama carrying bow, arrows and sword sees me once again he will raise his weapon to kill me, and I will cease to be.

content: न हि रामं पराक्रम्य जीवन्प्रतिनिवर्तते।वर्तते प्रतिरूपोऽसौ यमदण्डहतस्य ते।।3.42.3।।
explanation: No one who exhibits his heroism before Rama will come back alive. To you, already hit by Yama's staff, he is another form of the same Yama.

content: किं नु शक्यं मया कर्तुमेवं त्वयि दुरात्मनि।एष गच्छाम्यहं तात स्वस्ति तेऽस्तु निशाचर।।3.42.4।।
explanation: What can I do if you remain evilminded? O dear demon, I am going. May your path be auspicious

content: प्रहृष्टस्त्वभवत्तेन वचनेन स रावणः।परिष्वज्य सुसंश्लिष्टमिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।3.42.5।।
explanation: Ravana was so overwhelmed with joy to hear those words that he embraced him tightly and said:.

content: एतच्छौण्डीर्ययुक्तं ते मच्छन्दवशवर्तिनः।इदानीमसि मारीचः पूर्वमन्यो निशाचरः।।3.42.6।।
explanation: Act according to my wish. It befits your valour. You were a different demon earlier. Now you are Maricha.

content: आरुह्यतामयं शीघ्रं रथो रत्नविभूषितः।मया सह तथा युक्तः पिशाचवदनैः खरैः।।3.42.7।।
explanation: Ascend quickly with me this chariot encrusted with gems and yoked with donkeys with devils' faces৷৷

content: प्रलोभयित्वा वैदेहीं यथेष्टं गन्तुमर्हसि।तां शून्ये प्रसभं सीतामानयिष्यामि मैथिलीम्।।3.42.8।।
explanation: You may go whereever you like after tempting Vaidehi. When the princess of Mithila  is alone, I will bring her by force.

content: ततो रावणमारीचौ विमानमिव तं रथम्।आरुह्य ययतुश्शीघ्रं तस्मादाश्रममण्डलात्।।3.42.9।।
explanation: Thereafter Ravana and Maricha ascended the chariot, which was like an aerial car, and quickly departed from that cluster of hermitages.

content: तथैव तत्र पश्यन्तौ पत्तनानि वनानि च।गीरींश्च सरितस्सर्वा राष्ट्राणि नगराणि च।।3.42.10।।
explanation: And likewise, they went past towns, forests, mountains, streams, states and cities.

content: समेत्य दण्डकारण्यं राघवस्याश्रमं ततः।ददर्श सह मारीचो रावणो राक्षसाधिपः।।3.42.11।।
explanation: Ravana, king of the demons, accompanied by Maricha, then reached Dandaka forest and saw Rama's hermitage.

content: अवतीर्य रथात्तस्मात्ततः काञ्चनभूषणात्।हस्ते गृहीत्वा मारीचं रावणो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।3.42.12।।
explanation: Then Ravana got off the chariot decorated with golden embellishments and, holding Maricha's hand, said:.

content: एतदाश्रमपदं दृश्यते कदलीवृतम्।क्रियतां तत्सखे शीघ्रं यदर्थं वयमागताः।।3.42.13।।
explanation: O friend here is the site of the hermitage surrounded by banana plants. Quickly get to work on the purpose for which we have come.

content: स रावणवचश्श्रुत्वा मारीचो राक्षसस्तदा।मृगो भूत्वाऽश्रमद्वारि रामस्य विचचार ह।।3.42.14।।
explanation: Hearing Ravana's words, Maricha transformed himself into a deer and started moving at the entrance of Rama's hermitage.

content: स तु तद्रूपमास्थाय महदद्भुतदर्शनम्।मणिप्रवरशृङ्गाग्रस्सितासितमुखाकृतिः।।3.42.15।।
explanation: Maricha assumed the form of a wonderful and magnificent deer with his antlers studded with the most precious gems, his face dappled with luminous spots of white and  black.

content: रक्तपद्मोत्पलमुख इन्द्रनीलोत्पलश्रवाः।किंचिदभ्युन्नतग्रीव इंद्रनीलदलाधरः।।3.42.16।।
explanation: The deer's face was like a pink lotus, his ears were like blue lotus. His neck slightly raised, his lips were like petals of blue lotus.

content: कुन्देन्दुवज्रसङ्काशमुदरं चास्य भास्वरम्।मधूकनिभपार्श्वश्च पद्मकिञ्जल्कसन्निभः।।3.42.17।।वैडूर्यसङ्काशखुरस्तनुजङ्घस्सुसंहतः।
explanation: His bright belly was shining like kunda flowers or the Moon or diamond. His flanks were like the golden madhuka flowers. comparable to the filaments of lotus. His hooves were like vaidurya, and his legs were slim and willshaped.

content: इन्द्रायुधसवर्णेन पुच्छेनोर्ध्वं विराजता।।3.42.18।।मनोहरस्स्निग्धवर्णो रत्नैर्नानाविधैर्वृतः।
explanation: His tail stood up looking magnificent like a colourful rainbow. Bedecked with various gems, he shone beautiful.

content: क्षणेन राक्षसो जातो मृगः परमशोभनः।।3.42.19।।वनं प्रज्वलयन्रम्यं रामाश्रमपदं च तत्।
explanation: Transformed into a most beautiful deer in a moment, Maricha brightened the beautiful forest and Rama's hermitage.

content: मनोहरं दर्शनीयं रूपं कृत्वा स राक्षसः।।3.42.20।।प्रलोभनार्थं वैदेह्या नानाधातुविचित्रितम्।विचरन्गच्छते तस्माच्छाद्वलानि समन्ततः।।3.42.21।।
explanation: Transfigured into a beautiful, magnificent form painted with the colours of different minerals in order to tempt Sita, Maricha roamed all around the grassland.

content: रूप्यैर्बिन्दुशतैश्चित्रो भूत्वा स प्रियदर्शनः।विटपीनां किसलयान्भङ्त्क्वाऽदन्विचचार ह।।3.42.22।।
explanation: That deer with hundreds of silver spots on the body appeared enchanting and pleasing to the eyes while he wandered about nibbling the tender leaves of trees.

content: कदलीगृहकं गत्वा कर्णिकारानितस्ततः।समाश्रयन्मन्दगतिस्सीतासन्दर्शनं तथा।।3.42.23।।
explanation: The deer went wandering about the banana groves surrounding Rama's hermitage and moved slowly towards the karnikara trees in order to catch the attention of Sita.

content: राजीवचित्रपृष्ठस्स विरराज महामृगः।रामाश्रमपदाभ्याशे विचचार यथासुखम्।।3.42.24।।
explanation: That magnificent deer glittered with the colour of blue lotus on its back, wandered merrily in the vicinity of Rama's hermitage.

content: पुनर्गत्वा निवृत्तश्च विचचार मृगोत्तमः।गत्वा मुहूर्तं त्वरया पुनः प्रतिनिवर्तते।।3.42.25।।
explanation: The wonderful deer moved to and fro, now disappearing and now swiftly returning.

content: विक्रीडंश्च क्वचिद्भूमौ पुनरेव निषीदति।आश्रमद्वारमागम्य मृगयूथानि गच्छति।।3.42.26।।
explanation: The deer is now sporting, now sitting on the ground, now standing at the entrance of the hermitage and now running with the herds of deer.

content: मृगयूथैरनुगतः पुनरेव निवर्तते।सीतादर्शनमाकांक्षन्राक्षसो मृगतां गतः।।3.42.27।।परिभ्रमति चित्राणि मण्डलानि विनिष्पतन्।
explanation: Followed by herds of deer and coming back to see Sita again and again, the deer cavorted and pranced and frisked in circles in a wonderful way.

content: समुद्वीक्ष्य च ते सर्वे मृगा ह्यन्ये वनेचराः।।3.42.28।।उपागम्य समाघ्राय विद्रवन्ति दिशो दश।
explanation: Seeing the deer, other animals wandering in the forest come near and sniffing him run away in all ten directions.

content: राक्षसस्सोऽपि तान्वन्यान्मृगान्मृगवधे रतः।।3.42.29।।प्रच्छादनार्थं भावस्य न भक्षयति संस्पृशन्।
explanation: The demon who was interested in killing wild deer touched and felt them but did not kill or feed on them in order to hide his intention.

content: तस्मिन्नेव ततः काले वैदेही शुभलोचना।।3.42.30।।कुसुमावचयव्यग्रा पादपानभ्यवर्तत।
explanation: In the mean time Sita who, with her auspicious looks, was busy plucking flowers drew near the trees.

content: कर्णिकारानशोकांश्च चूतांश्च मदिरेक्षणा।।3.42.31।।कुसुमान्यवचिन्वन्ती चचार रुचिरानना।
explanation: With her bewitching eyes and beautiful face, Sita, went about plucking flowers from karnikara, ashoka and mango trees.

content: अनर्हाऽरण्यवासस्य सा तं रत्नमयं मृगम्।।3.42.32।।मुक्तामणि विचित्राङ्गं ददर्श परमाङ्गना।
explanation: The great lady Sita, unworthy of dwelling in the forest, saw the wonderful deer decked with gems, with  spots of pearls all over the body.

content: सा तं रुचिरदन्तोष्ठी रूप्यधातुतनूरुहम्।।3.42.33।।विस्मयोत्फुल्लनयना सस्नेहं समुदैक्षत।
explanation: A lady with beautiful teeth and lips, Sita saw the deer having silver and mineral coloured hair on the body. She gazed at the animal with wonder and joy and love.

content: स च तां रामदयितां पश्यन्मायामयो मृगः।।3.42.34।।विचचार पुनश्चित्रं दीपयन्निव तद्वनम्।
explanation: That illusory deer saw Rama's wife and moved around wonderfully as if illuminating the forest with his radiance.

content: अदृष्टपूर्वं तं दृष्ट्वा नानारत्नमयं मृगम्।।3.42.35।।विस्मयं परमं सीता जगाम जनकात्मजा।
explanation: Seeing such  an unprecedented deer decorated with different gems, Sita, daughter of Janaka, stood amazed.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे द्विचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortysecond sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Sita pleads with Rama and Lakshmana to get the deer-- Lakshmana says it is the magic of Maricha-- Rama asks Lakshmana to take care of Sita and proceeds to catch the deer.]सा तं सम्प्रेक्ष्य सुश्रोणी कुसुमान्यपचिन्वती।हेमराजतवर्णाभ्यां पार्श्वाभ्यामुपशोभितम्।।3.43.1।।प्रहृष्टा चानवद्याङ्गी मृष्टहाटकवर्णिनी।भर्तारमपि चक्रन्द लक्ष्मणं चापि सायुधम्।।3.43.2।।
explanation: Sita while plucking flowers Sita who had fine hips, flawless beautiful limbs and pure golden complexion felt delighted to see the deer with gold and silver colours on both sides of his body. She called out to Rama and Lakshmana who were equipped with arms.

content: तयाऽऽहूतौ नरव्याघ्रौ वैदेह्या रामलक्ष्मणौ।वीक्षमाणौ तु तौ देशं तदा ददृशतुर्मृगम्।।3.43.3।।
explanation: When Sita called Rama and Lakshmana, the two tigers among men, they looked around and saw the deer.

content: शङ्कमानस्तु तं दृष्ट्वा लक्ष्मणो राममब्रवीत्।तमेवैनमहं मन्ये मारीचं राक्षसं मृगम्।।3.43.4।।
explanation: Seeing the deer, Lakshmana suspected him to be Maricha and said this to Rama.

content: चरन्तोमृगयां हृष्टाः पापेनोपाधिना वने।अनेन निहता राजन् राजानः कामरूपिणा।।3.43.5।।
explanation: Many kings, while on hunting expedition in the forest, have been deceitfully killed by malicious Maricha, who could assume any form at his free will.

content: अस्य मायाविदो मायामृगरूपमिदं कृतम्।भानुमत्पुरुषव्याघ्र गन्धर्वपुरसन्निभम्।।3.43.6।।
explanation: O tiger among men, this deceitful demon (Maricha) has been transformed into the illusory form of a radiant deer which does not exist.

content: मृगो ह्येवंविधो रत्नविचित्रो नास्ति राघव।जगत्यां जगतीनाथ मायैषा हि न संशयः।।3.43.7।।
explanation: O Rama, lord of the world nowhere on earth does exist this kind of wonderful deer sparkling with gems. That it is a mere trick, an illusion there is no doubt.

content: एवं ब्रुवाणं काकुत्स्थं प्रतिवार्य शुचिस्मिता।उवाच सीता संहृष्टा चर्मणा हृतचेतना।।3.43.8।।
explanation: Sita was too enchanted by the skin of the deer to retain her sense of discrimination. Intervening, she said to Rama joyfully with a pure smile on her face:

content: आर्यपुत्राभिरामोऽसौ मृगो हरति मे मनः।आनयैनं महाबाहो क्रीडार्थं नो भविष्यति।।3.43.9।।
explanation: O prince O longarmed one, this deer has captivated my mind. Fetch him for  me.This  will be our playmate.

content: इहाश्रमपदेऽस्माकं बहवः पुण्यदर्शनाः।मृगाश्चरन्ति सहिताश्चमरास्सृमरास्तथा।।3.43.10।।
explanation: Here at the hermitage there are many lovely deer, yaks and antelopes wandering in herds.

content: ऋक्षाः पृषतसङ्घाश्च वानराः किन्नरास्तथा।विचरन्ति महाबाहो रुपश्रेष्ठा मनोहराः।।3.43.11।।
explanation: O longarmed one, most beautiful animals like bears, antelopes and groups of monkeys and kinneras are wandering here.

content: न चास्य सदृशो राजन्दृष्टपूर्वो मृगो मया।तेजसा क्षमया दीप्त्या यथाऽयं मृगसत्तमः।।3.43.12।।
explanation: O prince  this kind of beautiful, tame and glittering deer I have never seen before.

content: नानावर्णविचित्राङ्गो रत्नबिन्दुसमाचितः।द्योतयन्वनमव्यग्रं शोभते शशिसन्निभः।।3.43.13।।
explanation: Its body glittering with different colours, speckled with gems of different kinds, is like the Moon shining and illuminating the forest.

content: अहो रूपमहो लक्ष्मीस्स्वरसम्पच्च शोभना।मृगोऽद्भुतो विचित्राङ्गो हृदयं हरतीव मे।।3.43.14।।
explanation: Oh what a beauty, Oh what rich call  what delightful, wonderful, graceful limbs  This deer captivates my heart.

content: यदि ग्रहणमभ्येति जीवन्नेव मृगस्तव।आश्चर्यभूतं भवति विस्मयं जनयिष्यति।।3.43.15।।
explanation: If this deer can be caught  alive, it will be thrilling, it will work wonders.

content: समाप्तवनवासानां राज्यस्थानां च नः पुनः।अन्तःपुरविभूषार्थो मृग एष भविष्यति।।3.43.16।।
explanation: After the completion  of exile in the forest, when we are back in the kingdom, this deer will add beauty to the harem.

content: भरतस्यार्यपुत्रस्य श्वश्रूणां मम च प्रभो।मृगरूपमिदं व्यक्तं विस्मयं जनयिष्यति।।3.43.17।।
explanation: O king this deer will create amazement in Bharata, in mothersinlaw, in you and in me as well.

content: जीवन्न यदि तेऽभ्येति ग्रहणं मृगसत्तमः।अजिनं नरशार्दूल रुचिरं मे भविष्यति।।3.43.18।।
explanation: O best among men, if this great deer cannot be captured alive, I will wear its beautiful skin.

content: निहतस्यास्य सत्त्वस्य जाम्बूनदमयत्वचि।शष्पबृस्यां विनीतायामिच्छाम्यहमुपासितुम्।।3.43.19।।
explanation: If this animal is killed and its golden skin is spread on a tender grass cushion, there will I like to sit.

content: कामवृत्तमिदं रौद्रं स्त्रीणामसदृशं मतम्।वपुषा त्वस्य सत्त्वस्य विस्मयो जनितो मम।।3.43.20।।
explanation: This kind of request arising out of a woman's desire may sound terrible, still then the beauty of this animal's skin has produced in me a wonder.

content: तेन काञ्चनवर्णेन मणिप्रवरशृङ्गिणा।तरुणादित्यवर्णेन नक्षत्रपथवर्चसा।।3.43.21।।बभूव राघवस्यापि मनो विस्मयमागतम्।
explanation: By his golden colour resembling the rising Sun, by  his horns with excellent gems shining like the milkyway, even Rama's mind was wonderstruck.

content: एवं सीतावचः श्रुत्वा तं दृष्ट्वा मृगमद्भुतम्।।3.43.22।।लोभितस्तेन रूपेण सीतया च प्रचोदितः।उवाच राघवो हृष्टो भ्रातरं लक्ष्मणं वचः।।3.43.23।।
explanation: On hearing Sita's words and seeing the wonderful deer, Rama was tempted by its appearance.Prompted by Sita,he joyfully said this to Lakshmana:

content: पश्य लक्ष्मण वैदेह्याः स्पृहां मृगगतामिमाम्।रूपश्रेष्ठतया ह्येष मृगोऽद्य न भविष्यति।।3.43.24।।न वने नन्दनोद्धेशे न चैत्ररथसंश्रये।कुतःपृथिव्यां सौमित्रे योऽस्य कश्चित्समो मृगः।।3.43.25।।
explanation: O Lakshmana, see the eagerness of Sita. Such a deer of exceptional beauty will not be found in this forest. There is no equal to this animal even in the Nandan garden of Indra, or the Chaitraratha, the garden of Kubera. Where can such an animal be found on earth?

content: प्रतिलोमानुलोमाश्च रुचिरा रोमराजयः।शोभन्ते मृगमाश्रित्य चित्राः कनकबिन्दवः।।3.43.26।।
explanation: The stretches of hair on the deer's body bent both in the natural order and in the opposite direction look beautiful. The spots of gold on the skin are wonderful.

content: पश्यास्य जृम्भमाणस्य दीप्तामग्निशिखोपमाम्।जिह्वां मुखान्निस्सरन्तीं मेघादिव शतह्रदाम्।।3.43.27।।
explanation: Look at his tongue stretched out of the mouth while yawning. It is glowing like flaming fire. It is like the lightning sparkling in the cloud.

content: मसारगल्लर्कमुखश्शङ्खमुक्तानिभोदरः।कस्य नामाभिरूप्योऽसौ न मनो लोभयेन्मृगः।।3.43.28।।
explanation: His face is a drinking pot of emerald, the belly is a conch or a pearl. Whose mind will not be attracted by this indescribable beauty ?

content: कस्य रूपमिदं दृष्ट्वा जाम्बूनद मयप्रभम्।नानारत्नमयं दिव्यं न मनो विस्मयं व्रजेत्।।3.43.29।।
explanation: Whose mind will not be filled with wonder on seeing this divine beauty glittering like lustrous gold and studded with a variety of gems ?

content: मांसहेतोरपि मृगान्विनोदार्थं च धन्वनः।घ्नन्ति लक्ष्मण राजानो मृगयायां महावने।।3.43.30।।
explanation: O Lakshmana kings who wield  bows  in hunting expeditions kill deer in the forest for  sport as well as for venison.

content: धनानि व्यवसायेन विचीयन्ते महावने।धातवो विविधाश्चापि मणिरत्नसुवर्णिनः।।3.43.31।।
explanation: From huge forests a variety of mineral wealth consisting of gems, stones and gold are collected with great effort.

content: तत्सारमखिलं नृ़णां धनं निचयवर्धनम्।मनसा चिन्तितं सर्वं यथा शुक्रस्य लक्ष्मण।।3.43.32।।
explanation: O Lakshmana the essence of forest wealth is mineral wealth, which helps the growth of the treasury. It is conceived mentally as in the case of Venus.

content: अर्थी येनार्थकृत्येन संव्रजत्यविचारयन्।तमर्थमर्थशास्त्रज्ञाः प्राहुरर्थ्याश्च लक्ष्मण।।3.43.33।।
explanation: A materialist moves about thoughtlessly for making money. Economists call it material wealth.

content: एतस्य मृगरत्नस्य परार्ध्ये काञ्चनत्वचि।उपवेक्ष्यति वैदेही मया सह सुमध्यमा।।3.43.34।।
न कादली न प्रियकी न प्रवेणी न चाविकी।भवेदेतस्य सदृशी स्पर्शनेनेति मे मतिः।।3.43.35।।
explanation: The skins of various types of deer like Priyaki, Kadali or goats or sheep cannot be compared in softness to the skin of this deer.

content: एष चैव मृगश्श्रीमान् यश्च दिव्यो नभश्चरः।उभावेतौ मृगौ दिव्यौ तारामृगमहीमृगौ।।3.43.36।।
explanation: This majestic deer and the deer flying in heaven (the deer's figure seen in the Moon called Mrgasira)  both the deer of the star in the sky and the deer of the earth are divine.

content: यदि वाऽयं तथा यन्मां भवेद्वदसि लक्ष्मण।मायैषा राक्षसस्येति कर्तव्योस्य वधो मया।।3.43.37।।
explanation: Lakshmana, as you say, if it is the illusion of a demon, even then it should be killed by me.

content: एतेन हि नृशंसेन मारीचेनाकृतात्मना।वने विचरता पूर्वं हिंसिता मुनिपुङ्गवाः।।3.43.38।।
explanation: The great sages were tortured and killed earlier by this cruel, evilminded Maricha while wandering in the forest.

content: उत्थाय बहवो येन मृगयायां जनाधिपाः।निहताः परमेष्वासास्तस्माद्वध्यस्त्वयं मृगः।।3.43.39।।
explanation: Many kings who were great archers who set out on hunting expedition were killed by him. Therefore, this animal deserves to be killed.

content: पुरस्तादिह वातापिः परिभूय तपस्विनः।उदरस्थो द्विजान्हन्तिस्वगर्भोऽश्वतरीमिव।।3.43.40।।
explanation: Earlier in this forest, Vatapi used to humiliate the ascetic brahmins and to kill them by entering into their stomach like a womb killing the female mule.

content: स कदाचिच्चिराल्लोभादाससाद महामुनिम्।अगस्त्यं तेजसा युक्तं भक्षस्तस्य बभूव ह।।3.43.41।।
explanation: That Vatapi after a long time, once greedily entered into the stomach of the great lustrous sage Agastya and became his food.

content: समुत्थाने व तद्रूपं कर्तुकामं समीक्ष्य तम्।उत्स्मयित्वा तु भगवान्वातापिमिदमब्रवीत्।।3.43.42।।
explanation: When the venerable sage Agastya got up (after eating), he observed Vatapi wishing to turn into his real form. So smiling at him, he said:

content: त्वयाऽविगण्य वातापे परिभूतास्स्वतेजसा।जीवलोके द्विजश्रेष्ठास्तस्मादसि जरां गतः।।3.43.43।।
explanation: 'O Vatapi you killed the best of brahmins living in this world, disregarding them because of your power. Hence you were digested by me.'

content: तदेवं न भवेद्रक्षोवातापिरिव लक्ष्मण।मद्विधं योऽतिमन्येत धर्मनित्यं जितेन्द्रियम्।।3.43.44।।भवेद्धतोऽयं वातापिरगस्त्येनेव मां गतः।
explanation: O Lakshmana just like Vatapi, this demon will not live. Whoever violates a person of my kind who is ever righteous and selfcontrolled will be killed

content: इह त्वं भव सन्नद्दो यन्त्रितो रक्ष मैथिलीम्।।3.43.45।।अस्यामायत्तमस्माकं यत्कृत्यं रघुनन्दन।
explanation: O Lakshmana, delight of the Raghu dynasty, be very alert and restrained and protect Sita. Whatever duty we have to perform depends on her protection.

content: अहमेनं वधिष्यामि ग्रहीष्याम्यपि वा मृगम्।।3.43.46।।यावद्गच्छामि सौमित्रे मृगमानयितुं द्रुतम्।
explanation: O Lakshmana I will go quickly and either kill the deer or catch it.  Now let me go.

content: पश्य लक्ष्मण वैदेहीं मृगत्वचि गतस्पृहाम्।।3.43.47।।त्वचा प्रधानया ह्येष मृगोऽद्य न भविष्यति।
explanation: See, how Vaidehi ardently longs for the skin of this deer  I will not let the animal live, O Lakshmana

content: अप्रमत्तेन ते भाव्यमाश्रमस्थेन सीतया।।3.43.48।।यावत्पृषतमेकेन सायकेन निहन्म्यहम्।हत्वैतच्चर्म चादाय शीघ्रमेष्यामि लक्ष्मण।।3.43.49।।
explanation: Keep vigil over Sita at the hermitage, O Lakshmana  I will certainly kill the speckled antelope with a single arrow, get his skin and come back quickly.

content: प्रदक्षिणेनातिबलेन पक्षिणा जटायुषा बुद्धिमता च लक्ष्मण।भवाप्रमत्तः परिगृह्य मैथिलीं प्रतिक्षणं सर्वत एव शङ्कितः।।3.43.50।।
explanation: O Lakshmana, be vigilant in guarding Sita, suspecting danger every moment from all directions. Take the help of Jatayu, the mighty and wise bird who will be on his rounds.इत्याषे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे त्रिचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortythird sarga in Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama chases the magic deer-- unable to catch, kills it -- gets stunned at the deer calling out Sita, Lakshmana imitating his voice--death of the deer--Rama returns to the hermitage.]तथा तु तं समादिश्य भ्रातरं रघुनन्दनः।बबन्धासिं महातेजा जाम्बूनदमयत्सरुम्।।3.44.1।।
explanation: The brilliant Rama, delight of the Raghu dynasty, thus instructed his brother and fastened a sword with a golden handle to his waist.

content: तत स्त्र्यवनतं चापमादायाऽत्मविभूषणम्।आबध्य च कलापौ द्वौ जगामोदग्रविक्रमः।।3.44.2।।
explanation: A man of indomitable prowess, he took the bow with three curves that was like an ornament to him, tied two quivers at the back and left.

content: तं वञ्चयानो राजेन्द्रमापतन्तं निरीक्ष्यवै।बभूवान्तर्हितस्त्रासात्पुनस्सन्दर्शनेऽभवत्।।च3.44.3।।बद्धासिर्धनुरादाय प्रदुद्राव यतो मृगः।
explanation: On seeing Rama approaching him, the deer disappeared due to fear and again came within sight. With his sword and the bow, Rama chased wherever the deer ran.

content: तं स्म पश्यति रूपेण द्योतमानमिवाग्रतः।।3.44.4।।अवेक्ष्यावेक्ष्य धावन्तं धनुष्पाणिर्महावने।अतिवृत्तमिषोः पाताल्लोभयानं कदाचन।।3.44.5।।शङ्कितन्तु समुद्भ्रान्तमुत्पतन्तमिवाम्बरे।दृश्यमानमदृश्यं च वनोद्देशेषु केषुचित्।।3.44.6।।छिन्नाभ्रैरिव संवीतं शारदं चन्द्रमण्डलम्।
explanation: Rama, wielder of the bow, saw that splendid animal ahead of him. Holding the bow he saw the deer running away, bewldered into the great forest looking at him again and again. The deer was getting out of the range of his arrow, while it enticed him now and then. Suspecting that he might be caught,  the deer was, as though jumping into the sky. Now it came within sight and now out of sight in the huge forest. It looked like the autumnal moon surrounded by clouds. (The clouds muffle the Moon and reveal him now and then).

content: मुहुर्तादेव ददृशे मुहुर्दूरात्प्रकाशते।।3.44.7।।दर्शनादर्शनादेवं सोऽपाकर्षत राघवम्।सुदूरमाश्रमस्यास्य मारीचो मृगतां गतः।।3.44.8।।
explanation: Maricha, transformed into a deer, was seen now near, now faroff. He pulled Rama away from the hermitage through his exits and entrances.

content: आसीत् क्रुद्धस्तु काकुत्स्थो विवशस्तेन मोहितः।अथावतस्थे संभ्रान्तश्चायामाश्रित्य शाद्वले।।3.44.9।।
explanation: Deluded by that deer, Rama got tired, perplexed and angry. Then bewidered, he waited on a grassland under a shade.

content: स तमुन्मादयामास मृगरूपो निशाचरः।मृगैः परिवृतो वन्यैरदूरात्प्रत्यदृश्यत।।3.44.10।।
explanation: That demon transformed himself into a deer and, surrounded by the animals of the forest at close range, attracted his attention.

content: गृहीतुकामं दृष्ट्वैवं पुनरेवाभ्यधावत।तत्क्षणादेव संत्रासात्पुनरन्तर्हितोऽभवत्।।3.44.11।।
explanation: Seeing Rama's  intention to catch him, the deer ran away once again out of fear and disappeared in a moment.

content: पुनरेव ततो दूराद्वृक्षषण्डाद्विनिस्सृतम्।दृष्ट्वा रामो महातेजास्तं हन्तुं कृतनिश्चयः।।3.44.12।।
explanation: Resplendent Rama saw the deer coming out of a cluster of trees at a distance and determined to kill him.

content: भूयस्तु शरमुद्धृत्य कुपितस्तत्र राघवः।सूर्यरश्मिप्रतीकाशं ज्वलन्तमरिमर्दनः।।3.44.13।।सन्धाय सुदृढे चापे विकृष्य बलवद्बली।तमेव मृगमुद्दिश्य श्वसन्तमिव पन्नगम्।।3.44.14।।मुमोच ज्वलितं दीप्तमस्त्रं ब्रह्मविनिर्मितम्।
explanation: Powerful Rama, destroyer of foes, lifted in a rage his arrow blazing like the light of  the Sun, strung it to his sturdy bow and drew it with all his force. He then aimed at the deer and released the shining  arrow created by Brahma which went hissing like a  serpent.

content: शरीरं मृगरूपस्य विनिर्भिद्य शरोत्तमः।।3.44.15।।मारीचस्यैव हृदयं बिभेदाशनिसन्निभः।
explanation: The great arrow which was like a thunderbolt first pierced into the body of Maricha who had assumed the form of a deer and then tore his heart.

content: तालमात्रमथोत्प्लुत्य न्यपतत्सशरातुरः।।3.44.16।।विनदन्भैरवं नादं धरण्यामल्पजीवितः।
explanation: And, hurt by the dart, Maricha roared frighteningly, leaped as high as a  palm tree  and dropped down on earth almost dead.

content: म्रियमाणस्तु मारीचो जहौ तां कृत्रिमां तनुम्।।3.44.17।।स्मृत्वा तद्वचनं रक्षो दध्यौ केन तु लक्ष्मणम्।इह प्रस्थापयेत्सीता शून्ये तां रावणो हरेत्।।3.44.18।।
explanation: Maricha gave up his false form of the deer and before breathing his last, remembered the words of Ravana. He thought over the means through which Sita could send Lakshmana to this spot so that  Ravana would abduct her when she is alone.

content: स प्राप्तकालमाज्ञाय चकार च तत स्वनम्।सदृशं राघवस्येह हा सीते लक्ष्मणेति च।।3.44.19।।
explanation: Then Maricha realised that the appropriate time had come. In a voice similar to Rama's, he shouted loudly 'Alas Sita, Alas Lakshmana '

content: तेन मर्मणि निर्विद्धं शरेणानुपमेन हि।मृगरूपं तु तत्त्यक्त्वा राक्षसं रूपमास्थितः।।3.44.20।।चक्रे स सुमहाकायं मारीचो जीवितं त्यजन्।
explanation: Struck in the vital part by Rama's matchless dart, Maricha gave up the form of the deer and assumed his huge body of the demon.

content: तं दृष्ट्वा पतितं भूमौ राक्षसं घोरदर्शनम्।।3.44.21।।रामो रुधिरसिक्ताङ्गं चेष्टमानं महीतले।जगाम मनसा सीतां लक्ष्मणस्य वचस्स्मरन्।।3.44.22।।
explanation: Seeing that terrific demon fallen on the ground, drenched in blood, and strring his limbs, Rama thought of Lakshmana's words and reached Sita mentally (thought of her).

content: मारीचस्य तु मायैषा पूर्वोक्तं लक्ष्मणेन तु।तत्तथा ह्यभवच्चाद्य मारीचोऽयं मया हतः।।3.44.23।।
explanation: This is an illusion created by Maricha. It happened exactly the way Lakshmana had said earlier. Maricha is now killed.

content: हा सीते लक्ष्मणेत्येवमाक्रुश्य च महास्वरम्।ममार राक्षसस्सोऽयं श्रुत्वा सीता कथं भवेत्।।3.44.24।।लक्ष्मणश्च महाबाहुः कामवस्थां गमिष्यति।इति सञ्चिन्त्य धर्मात्मा रामो हृष्टतनूरुहः।।3.44.25।।
explanation: This demon Maricha screamed aloud saying, 'Alas, Sita, Alas, Lakshmana'. He is now dead. How would Sita react to this voice? What would be the condition of Lakshmana? While righteous Rama reflected on this, his hair stood on end.

content: तत्र रामं भयं तीव्रमाविवेश विषादजम्।राक्षसं मृगरूपं तं हत्वा श्रुत्वा च तत्स्वरम्।।3.44.26।।
explanation: After killing the demon in the figure of a deer and hearing his voice, Rama was overtaken by intense fear born of despair.

content: निहत्य पृषतं चान्यं मांसमादाय राघवः।त्वरमाणो जनस्थानं ससाराभिमुखस्तदा।।3.44.27।।
explanation: Then Rama killed another deer, collected the venison and hastened to Janasthana.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे चतुश्चत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the fortyfourth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [There at the hermitage Sita asks Lakshmana to rush to Rama's help Lakshmana resists, stating Rama needs no help--Sita lashes at Lakshmana in harsh words.]आर्तस्वरं तु तं भर्तुर्विज्ञाय सदृशं वने।उवाच लक्ष्मणं सीता गच्छ जीनीहि राघवम्।।3.45.1।।
explanation: On hearing the voice in distress and recognising that it was similar to her husband's voice, Sita said to Lakshmana, 'Go and find out Rama's whereabouts'.

content: न हि मे हृदयं स्थाने जीवितं वाऽवतिष्ठति।क्रोशतः परमार्तस्य श्रुतश्शब्दो मया भृशम्।।3.45.2।।आक्रन्दमानं तु वने भ्रातरं त्रातुमर्हसि।
explanation: I clearly heard Rama calling out in great distress. Indeed, my heart as well as my life is not in its place (restless). You ought to go and protect your brother who is crying in pain in the forest.

content: तं क्षिप्रमभिधाव त्वं भ्रातरं शरणैषिणम्।।3.45.3।।रक्षसां वशमापन्नं सिंहानामिव गोवृषम्।
explanation: Like a bull caught by lions, your brother is seeking help caught by demons. You should run at once to your brother.

content: न जगाम तथोक्तस्तु भ्रातुराज्ञाय शासनम्।।3.45.4।।तमुवाच ततस्तत्र कुपिता जनकात्मजा।
explanation: When he did not budge in obedience to his brother's order (to protect Sita), the daughter of Janaka in a rage said :

content: सौमित्रे मित्ररूपेण भ्रातुस्त्वमसि शत्रुवत्।।3.45.5।।यस्त्वमस्यामवस्थायां भ्रातरं नाभिपत्स्यसे।
explanation: Since you, O son of Sumitra,  are not reaching out to your brother in this situation, you are an enemy to your brother in the guise of a friend৷৷

content: इच्छसि त्वं विनश्यन्तं रामं लक्ष्मण मत्कृते।।3.45.6।।लोभात्त्वं मत्कृते नूनं नानुगच्छसि राघवम्।
explanation: It is possess me that you wish Rama's death. You do not rush to him certainly because of greed for me.

content: व्यसनं ते प्रियं मन्ये स्नेहो भ्रातरिनास्तिते।।3.45.7।।तेन तिष्ठसि विश्रब्धंतमपश्यन्महाद्युतिम्।
explanation: I think Rama's adversity is welcome to you. You do not have any love towards your brother. It is for this that you stand unconcerned instead of proceeding to help your brilliant brother.

content: किं हि संशयमापन्ने तस्मिन्निह मया भवेत्।।3.45.8।।कर्तव्यमिह तिष्ठन्त्या यत्प्रधानस्त्वमागतः।
explanation: When he for whose service you have primary come here, has met with difficulty, what is the use of your being here? What purpose you serve by staying here with me ?

content: इति ब्रुवाणां वैदेहीं बाष्पशोकपरिप्लुताम्।।3.45.9।।अब्रवील्लक्ष्मणस्त्रस्तां सीतां मृगवधूमिव।
explanation: While Sita thus spoke, flooded with tears of sorrow, frightened like a doe, Lakshmana replied :

content: पन्नगासुरगन्धर्वदेवमानुषराक्षसैः।।3.45.10।।अशक्यस्तव वैदेहि भर्ता जेतुं न संशयः।
explanation: O Vaidehi there is no doubt that pannagas, asuras, gandharvas, gods, men or even demons cannot defeat him.

content: देवि देवमनुष्येषु गन्धर्वेषु पतत्रिषु।।3.45.11।।राक्षसेषु पिशाचेषु किन्नरेषु मृगेषु च।दानवेषु च घोरेषु स न विद्येत शोभने।।3.45.12।।यो रामं प्रतियुध्येत समरे वासवोपमम्।
explanation: O brilliant Devi  none  among gods or men, gandharvas, birds or goblins kinnaras, wild animals or dreadful demons can encounter Rama in war.

content: अवध्यस्समरे रामो नैवं त्वं वक्तुमर्हसि।।3.45.13।।न त्वामस्मिन्वने हातुमुत्सहे राघवं विना।
explanation: Rama is indestructible in war. It is not proper for you to say what you said. When he is not here I do not wish to leave you alone here in the forest.

content: अनिवार्यं बलं तस्य बलैर्बलवतामपि।।3.45.14।।त्रिभिर्लोकैस्समुद्युक्तैस्सेश्वरैरपि सामरैः।
explanation: He cannot be stopped by the strength of the mighty, or by Indra supported by gods or by the wellequipped armies of all the three worlds.

content: हृदयं निर्वृतं तेऽस्तुसन्तापस्त्यज्यतामयम्।।3.45.15।।आगमिष्यति ते भर्ता श्रीघ्रं हत्वा मृगोत्तमम्।
explanation: May your heart be relieved (of this fear)  Give up this grief. Your husband will soon return with the excellent deer killed.

content: न च तस्य स्वरो व्यक्तं मायया केन चित्कृतः।गन्धर्वनगरप्रख्या माया सा तस्य रक्षसः।।3.45.16।।
explanation: Surely it is not his voice. It is contrived by some one's illusory power. It is the illusion created by that demon, like the city of the gandharvas. (which does not exist.)

content: न्यासभूतासि वैदेहि न्यस्ता मयि महात्मना।।3.45.17।।रामेण त्वं वरारोहे न त्वां त्यक्तुमिहोत्सहे।
explanation: O best of women Vaidehi  great Rama has entrusted your safty to me. I do not wish to leave you here alone.

content: कृतवैराश्च वैदेहि वयमेतैर्निशाचरैः।।3.45.18।।खरस्य निधनादेव जनस्थानवधं प्रति।
explanation: O Vaidehi since the killing of Khara and the residents of Janasthana we have developed enmity with the demons.

content: राक्षसा विविधा वाचो विसृजन्ति महावने।।3.45.19।।हिंसाविहारा वैदेहि न चिन्तयितुमर्हसि।
explanation: These demons wander about tormenting others and spreading rumours of all kinds. You need not worry about them.

content: लक्ष्मणेनैवमुक्ता सा क्रुद्धा संरक्तलोचना।।3.45.20।।अब्रवीत्परुषं वाक्यं लक्ष्मणं सत्यवादिनम्।
explanation: Addressed thus by Lakshmana, Sita got mighty angry. Her eyes turned red and she spoke harshly to truthful Lakshmana

content: अनार्याकरणारम्भ नृशंस कुलपांसन।।3.45.21।।अहं तव प्रियं मन्ये रामस्य व्यसनं महत्।
explanation: O ignoble, cruel Lakshmana, you are a disgrace to your family. I think this great disaster of Rama is a pleasure to you.

content: रामस्य व्यसनं दृष्ट्वा तेनैतानि प्रभाषसे।।3.45.22।।नैतच्चित्रं सपत्नेषु पापं लक्ष्मण यद्भवेत्।त्वद्विधेषु नृशंसेषु नित्यं प्रच्छन्नचारिषु।।3.45.23।।
explanation: O Lakshmana,do you speak such words seeing the disaster of Rama?  No wonder that cruel men who always move like you in disguise will thus resort to sinful action against rivals.

content: सुदुष्टस्त्वं वने राममेकमेकोऽनुगच्छसि।मम हेतोः प्रतिच्छन्नः प्रयुक्तोभरतेन वा।।3.45.24।।
explanation: You are very wicked. You are hiding your true identity, and employed by Bharata, you are following Rama in the forest as he is alone.

content: तन्नसिध्यति सौमित्रे तव वा भरतस्य वा।कथमिन्दीवरश्यामं पद्मपत्रनिभेक्षणम्।।3.45.25।।उपसंश्रित्य भर्तारं कामयेयं पृथग्जनम्।
explanation: O Lakshmana such intention of yours or even of Bharata's will not be fulfilled. I have held the hands of Rama who has eyes like the lotus petal, who has the complexion of the blue lotus. How can I prefer some other man?

content: समक्षं तव सौमित्रे प्राणांस्त्यक्षे न संशयः।रामं विना क्षणमपि न हि जीवामि भूतले।।3.45.26।।
explanation: I will undoubtedly give up my life in your presence.I will not live even for a moment on earth without Rama, O son of Sumitra

content: इत्युक्तः परुषं वाक्यं सीतया रोमहर्षणम्।।3.45.27।।अब्रवील्लक्ष्मणस्सीतां प्राञ्जलिर्विजितेन्द्रियः।
explanation: The selfcontrolled Lakshmana with folded palms replied to Sita's harsh, horripilating words:

content: उत्तरं नोत्सहे वक्तुं दैवतं भवती मम।।3.45.28।।वाक्यमप्रतिरूपं तु न चित्रं स्त्रीषु मैथिलि।स्वभावस्त्वेष नारीणामेवं लोकेषु दृश्यते।।3.45.29।।
explanation: O princess from Mithila, I do not want to use such harsh words. To me you are a deity (worthy of adoration). It is not surprising that women of the world use such undeserving words. It is their nature.

content: विमुक्तधर्माश्चपलास्तीक्ष्णा भेदकराः स्त्रियः।न सहे हीदृशं वाक्यं वैदेहि जनकात्मजे।।3.45.30।।श्रोत्रयोरुभयोर्मेद्य तप्तनाराचसन्निभम्।
explanation: Women devoid dharma are fickle and inconsistent. They use sharp, piercing words. O daughter of Janaka, O princess from Videha, your words pierce my ears like redhot darts.I cannot tolerate them.

content: उपशृण्वन्तु मे सर्वे साक्षिभूता वनेचराः।।3.45.31।।न्यायवादी यथान्यायमुक्तोऽहं परुषं त्वया।
explanation: I speak what is just while you use harsh and unjust words. Let all beings who move in the forest bear witness.

content: धिक्त्वामद्य प्रणश्य त्वं यन्मामेवं विशङ्कसे।स्त्रीत्वलदुष्टं स्वभावेन गुरुवाक्ये व्यवस्थितम्।।3.45.32।।
explanation: Fie upon you. Like a woman of wicked nature you doubt me when I stood firm by my brother's words. You will go to ruin.

content: गमिष्ये यत्र काकुत्स्थ स्वस्ति तेऽस्तु वरानने।।3.45.33।।रक्षन्तु त्वां विशालाक्षि समग्रा वनदेवताः।
explanation: O beautiful lady, I will go to Rama wherever he may be. Be happy. O largeeyed one, may  all the deities of the forest protect you.

content: निमित्तानि च घोराणि यानि प्रादुर्भवन्ति मे।।3.45.34।।अपि त्वां सह रामेण पश्येयं पुनरागतः।न वेत्येतन्न जानामि वैदेहि जनकात्मजे।।3.45.35।।
explanation: O daughter of Janaka O princess from Videha, I see dreadful omens. I do not know whether I will see you when I am back with Rama.

content: लक्ष्मणेनैवमुक्ता सा रुदन्ती जनकात्मजा।प्रत्युवाच ततो वाक्यं तीव्रं बाष्पपरिप्लुता।।3.45.36।।
explanation: At these words of Lakshmana Sita started crying. With eyes filled with tears she replied with harshness :

content: गोदावरीं प्रवेक्ष्यामि विना रामेण लक्ष्मण।अबन्धिष्येऽथवा त्यक्ष्ये विषमे देहमात्मनः।।3.45.37।।
explanation: O Lakshmana without Rama I will drown myself in Godavari or hang myself or leap from a cliff into death.

content: पिबाम्यहं विषं तीक्ष्णं प्रवेक्ष्यामि हुताशनम्।न त्वहं राघवादन्यं पदापि पुरुषं स्पृशे।।3.45.38।।
explanation: I will drink deadly poison or enter fire and die, but will not touch any other man even with my feet.

content: इति लक्ष्मणमाक्रुश्य सीता दुःखसमन्विता।पाणिभ्यां रुदती दुःखादुदरं प्रजघान ह।।3.45.39।।
explanation: Thus Sita cried in distress, sadly hitting her belly with both the hands, blaming Lakshmana (all the time).

content: तामार्तरूपां विमना रुदन्तीं सौमित्रिरालोक्य विशालनेत्राम्।आश्वासयामास न चैव भर्तु स्तं भ्रातरंकिञ्चिदुवाच सीता।।3.45.40।।
explanation: Saumitri saw  the largeeyed, dejected Sita crying in distress.He pacified and consoled her but she did not say anything at all to her husband's brother.

content: ततस्तु सीतामभिवाद्य लक्ष्मणः कृताञ्जलिः किञ्चिदभिप्रणम्य च।अन्वीक्षमाणो बहुशश्च मैथिलीम् जगाम रामस्य समीपमात्मवान्।।3.45.41।।
explanation: Selfcomposed Lakshmana with joined palms saluted her with great reverence.And then, turning towards her again and again, left for Rama.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे पञ्जचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyfifth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Lakshmana departs from the hermitage -- Ravana arrives in a saint's robes -- praises Sita and enquires of her -- Sita reveals details about her family to Ravana.]तया परुषमुक्तस्तु कुपितो राघवानुजः।स विकाङ्क्षन्भृशं रामं प्रतस्थे नचिरादिव।।3.46.1।।
explanation: Lakshmana, brother of Rama, hurt by the harsh words of Sita, hastened with Rama's wellbeing in mind.

content: तदासाद्य दशग्रीवः क्षिप्रमन्तरमास्थितः।अभिचक्राम वैदेहीं परिव्राजकरूपधृक्।।3.46.2।।
explanation: The tenheaded Ravana who was in hiding assumed the guise of a wandering mendicant and approached Sita.

content: श्लक्ष्णकाषायसंवीतश्शिखी छत्री उपानही।वामे चांसेऽवसज्याथ शुभे यष्टिकमण्डलू।।3.46.3।।परिव्राजकरूपेण वैदेहीमन्वपद्यत।
explanation: And then Ravana wearing fine orange robes, with hair knotted on the head, carrying a parasol, wearing sandals, hanging a kamandalu (waterpot), and a staff on the auspicious left shoulder walked towards Vaidehi like a mendicant.

content: तामाससादातिबलो भ्रातृभ्यां रहितां वने।।3.46.4।।रहितां चन्द्रसूर्याभ्यां सन्ध्यामिव महत्तमः।
explanation: Mighty Ravana approached Sita deprived of both the brothers, Like darkness encompasses the evening twilight in the absence of the Sun and the Moon.

content: तामपश्यत्ततो बालां रामपत्नीं यशस्विनीम्।।3.46.5।।रोहिणीं शशिना हीनां ग्रहवद्भृशदारुणः।
explanation: The extremely cruel Ravana saw the illustrious young wife of Rama just as Ketu looks at Rohini star in the absence of the Moon.

content: तमुग्रतेजःकर्माणं जनस्थानरूहा द्रुमाः।।3.46.6।।समीक्ष्य सम्प्रकम्पन्ते न प्रवाति च मारुतः।
explanation: Seeing the ferocious Ravana, the huge trees at Janasthana shook vidently. Even the wind ceased to blow.

content: शीघ्रस्रोताश्च तं दृष्ट्वा वीक्षन्तं रक्तलोचनम्।।3.46.7।।स्तिमितं गन्तुमारेभे भयाद्गोदावरी नदी।
explanation: Seeing Ravana with his bloodred eyes, the swiftflowing river Godavari slowed down out of fear.

content: रामस्य त्वन्तरप्रेप्सुर्दशग्रीवस्तदन्तरे।।3.46.8।।उपतस्थे च वै देहीं भिक्षुरूपेण रावणः।
explanation: The tenheaded Ravana who was waiting for Rama's absence now got it. Disguised as a mendicant he stepped toward to where Sita was.

content: अभव्यो भव्यरूपेण भर्तारमनुशोचतीम्।।3.46.9।।अभ्यवर्तत वैदेहीं चित्रामिव शनैश्चरः।
explanation: The evilminded Ravana in the guise of a holy man, like Saturn moves towards Chitra star, came close to Sita who was brooding over her husband.

content: स पापो भव्यरूपेण तृणैः कूप इवावृतः।।3.46.10।।अतिष्ठत्प्रेक्ष्य वैदेहीं रामपत्निं यशस्विनीम्।
explanation: Just like a well is concealed by an overgrowth of grass, Ravana guised as a holy man stood looking at illustrious Sita, the wife of Rama.

content: शुभां रुचिरदन्तोष्ठीं पूर्णचन्द्रनिभाननाम्।।3.46.11।।आसीनां पर्णशालायां बाष्पशोकाभिपीडिताम्।स तां पद्मपलाशाक्षीं पीतकौशेयवासिनीम्।।3.46.12।।अभ्यगच्छत वैदेहीं दुष्टचेता निशाचरः।
explanation: The wicked demon came close to that auspicious princess from Videha sitting in the cottage Her face was like the full moon. Her teeth and lips were lovely. She was clad in yellow silk. Her eyes were like lotus petals tormented by tears of grief.

content: स मन्मथशराविष्टो ब्रह्मघोषमुदीरयन्।।3.46.13।।अब्रवीत्प्रश्रितं वाक्यं रहिते राक्षसाधिपः।
तामुत्तमां स्त्रियं लोके पद्महीनामिव श्रियम्।।3.46.14।।विभ्राजमानां वपुषा रावणः प्रशशंस ह।
explanation: Sita was the most lovely lady of the world shining in beauty. She was like the goddess of wealth (Laxmi) without her lotus. Ravana praised her thus:

content: का त्वं काञ्चनवर्णाभे पीतकौशेयवासिनि।।3.46.15।।कमलानां शुभां मालां पद्मिनीव हि बिभ्रती।
explanation: Who are you with a golden complexion, clad in yellow silk, and looking like a lotuspond and wearing an auspicious lotus garland?

content: ह्रीः कीर्तिः श्रीश्शुभा लक्ष्मीरप्सरा वा शुभानने।।3.46.16।।भूतिर्वा त्वं वरारोहे रतिर्वा स्वैरचारिणी।
explanation: O lady with a beautiful face, with lovely thighs, are you 'hri', shyness personified? Are you the auspicious lovely Lakshmi, the  goddess of wealth? Are you the goddess of fame? Are you an apsara? Are you Bhuti, the goddess of fortune? Or are you Rati, the goddess of love moving at your free will ?

content: समाश्शिखरिणस्स्निग्धाः पाण्डुरा दशनास्तव।।3.46.17।।विशाले विमले नेत्रे रक्तान्ते कृष्णतारके।
explanation: Your teeth are even and pointed, white and beautiful.Your eyes are large and clear and sparkling with dark pupils with a red tinge at the corner.

content: विशालं जघनं पीनमूरू करिकरोपमौ।।3.46.18।।एतावुपचितौ वृत्तौ संहतौ सम्प्रवल्गितौ।पीनोन्नतमुखौ कान्तौ स्निग्धौ तालफलोपमौ।।3.46.19।।मणिप्रवेकाभरणौ रुचिरौ ते पयोधरौ।
explanation: Your big hips are stout and strong, Your smooth thighs are like the trunk of an elephant, your breasts adorned with gems, are round and robust like palm fruits and drooping with heaviness with projected stiff nipples, shining and delightful, adding beauty.

content: चारुस्मिते चारुदति चारुनेत्रे विलासिनि।।3.46.20।।मनो हरसि मे कान्ते नदी कूलमिवाम्भसा।करान्तमितमध्यासि सुकेशी संहतस्तनी।।3.46.21।।
explanation: O lady with an elegant smile, beautiful teeth, lovely  eyes you are enticing.Your slender waist can be compassed by my fist.Your hair is beautiful and your large breasts are rubbing against each other.You are capturing my mind  just as the flow of water in a river  touches its banks.

content: नैव देवी न गन्धर्वी न यक्षी न च किन्नरी।नैवंरूपा मया नारी दृष्टपूर्वा महीतले।।3.46.22।।
explanation: O beautiful lady I have not seen such a beauty earlier either among goddesses or among gandharavis, or yakshis or even among kinneris.

content: रूपमग्र्यं च लोकेषु सौकुमार्यं वयश्चते।इह वासश्च कान्तारे चित्तमुन्मादयन्ति मे।।3.46.23।।
explanation: You are the most beautiful among women in the world. With all your tenderness and youth you are living in this forlorn forest. This maddens my heart.

content: सा प्रतिक्राम भद्रं ते नैवं वस्तुमिहार्हसि।राक्षसानामयं वासो घोराणां कामरूपिणाम्।।3.46.24।।
explanation: It is not safe for a lady like you to reside here. Move out at once. This is only fit for the dwelling of horrible demons who can change their form at will.

content: प्रासादाग्राणि रम्याणि नगरोपवनानि च।सम्पन्नानि सुगन्धीनि युक्तान्याचरितुं त्वया।।3.46.25।।
explanation: You deserve to stroll in the terraces of palaces, in beautiful, luxurious and fragrant city gardens.

content: वरं माल्यं वरं भोज्यं वरं वस्त्रं च शोभने।भर्तारं च वरं मन्ये त्वद्युक्तमसितेक्षणे।।3.46.26।।
explanation: O beautiful, blackeyed lady, I think you deserve the best of garlands, best of food, and clothes and a suitable husband.

content: का त्वं भवसि रुद्राणां मरुतां वा वरानने।वसूनां वा वरावोहे देवता प्रतिभासि मे।।3.46.27।।
explanation: O best of women O lady with beautiful buttocks  can you be one  of the Rudras or Maruts or Vasus? To me, you appear like a goddess.

content: नेह गच्छन्ति गन्धर्वा न देवा न च किन्नराः।राक्षसानामयं वासः कथं नु त्वमिहागता।।3.46.28।।
explanation: Neither gandharvas, nor kinnaras, nor gods move here. This is only a dwelling place for the demons. How did you come here ?

content: इह शाखामृगास्सिंहा द्वीपिव्याघ्रमृगास्तथा।ऋक्षास्तरक्षवः कङ्काः कथं तेभ्यो न बिभ्यसि।।3.46.29।।
explanation: There are monkeys, lions, panthers, tigers, hyenas, bears, kanka birds and other wild animals here. How is it that you are not afraid of them?

content: मदान्वितानां घोराणां कुञ्जराणां तरस्विनाम्।कथमेका महारण्ये न बिभेषि वरानने।।3.46.30।।
explanation: O Charming lady how is it that although alone you are not afraid of the dreadful, swift, powerful wild animals like elephants in rut ?

content: कासि कस्य कुतश्चित्त्वं किं निमित्तं च दण्डकान्।एका चरसि कल्याणि घोरान्राक्षससेवितान्।।3.46.31।।
explanation: Who are you, O auspicious lady ? Who are your people? Why are you here? From where have you come? For what reason are you going about alone in this fierce Dandaka tract, inhabited by demons?

content: इति प्रशस्ता वैदेही रावणेन दुरात्मना।द्विजातिवेशेण हि तं दृष्ट्वा रावणमागतम्।।3.46.32।।सर्वैरतिथिसत्कारैः पूजयामास मैथिली।
explanation: Seeing Ravana, a villain in the guise of a brahmin praising her, Sita, the princess of Videha, honoured him with all hospitality.

content: उपनीयासनं पूर्वं पाद्येनाभिनिमन्त्र्य च।।3.46.33।।अब्रवीत्सिद्धमित्येव तदा तं सौम्यदर्शनम्।
explanation: She offered the handsome guest a seat first and then water for washing his feet with, and then invited him for food.

content: द्विजातिवेषेण समीक्ष्य मैथिली समागतं पात्रकुसुम्भधारिणम्।अशक्यमुद्वेष्टुमपायदर्शनम् न्यमन्त्रयद्ब्राह्मणवत्तदाङ्गना।।3.46.34।।
explanation: Sita, being a lady, was unable to doubt him since he came in the guise of a brahmin, holding a bottlegourd and a begging bowl. Without knowing his illintention she invited him in, mistaking him for a brahmin.

content: इयं बृसी ब्राह्मण काममास्यतामिदं च पाद्यं प्रतिगृह्यतामिति।इदं च सिद्धं वनजातमुत्तमं त्वदर्थमव्यग्रमिहोपभुज्यताम्।।3.46.35।।
explanation: O brahmin, here is the seat for you. Feel free to sit. Here is water to wash your feet with. This is the best of food for you collected from the forest. Please partake this without hesitation.

content: निमन्त्र्यमाणः प्रतिपूर्णभाषिणीं नरेन्द्रपत्नीं प्रसमीक्ष्य मैथिलीम्।प्रसह्य तस्याहरणे धृतं मनः समर्पयत्स्वात्मवधाय रावणः।।3.46.36।।
explanation: Ravana was observing the princess from Mithila, wife of a king inviting him  and speaking to him in cordial manner. Looking at her, he resolved to  abduct her forcibly, inviting his own death.

content: ततः सुवेषं मृगयागतं पतिं प्रतीक्षमाणा सहलक्ष्मणं तदा।विवीक्षमाणा हरितं ददर्श तन्महद्वनं नैव तु रामलक्ष्णौ।।3.46.37।।
explanation: Sita looked out for the beautiful figure of Rama who had gone to hunt the deer along with Lakshmana. Waiting eagerly for her husband, she only saw the vast stretch of green forest  but not Rama and Lakshmana.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे षट्चत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortysixth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Ravana asks Sita to seek his hand -- Sita's refusal.]रावणेन तु वैदेही तदा पृष्टा जिहीर्षता।परिव्राजकरूपेण शशंसात्मानमात्मना।।3.47.1।।
explanation: Then Ravana in the guise of a mendicant with crooked intention to abduct her, asked Vaidehi to tell him about herself.

content: ब्राह्मणश्चातिथिश्चायमनुक्तो हि शपेत माम्।इति ध्यात्वा मुहूर्तं तु सीता वचनमब्रवीत्।।3.47.2।।
explanation: 'He is a brahmin and also a guest. If unanswered he may curse me'. Thinking this Sita thought for a moment and said:

content: दुहिता जनकस्याहं मैथिलस्य महात्मनः।सीता नाम्नास्मि भद्रं ते रामभार्या द्विजोत्तम।।3.47.3।।
explanation: O best of brahmins be pleased to know I am Sita by name, daughter of the great Janaka, king of Mithila and wife of Rama.

content: उषित्वा द्वादश समा इक्ष्वाकुणां निवेशने।भुञ्जाना मानुषान्भोगान्सर्वकामसमृद्धिनी।।3.47.4।।
explanation: I lived in the house of the Ikshvakus for twelve years and enjoyed all kinds of pleasures meant for mortals.

content: ततस्त्रयोदशे वर्षे राजामन्त्रयत प्रभुः।अभिषेचयितुं रामं समेतो राजमन्त्रिभिः।।3.47.5।।
explanation: In the thirteenth year, the king and lord Dasaratha consulted other kings and ministers to consecrate Rama.

content: तस्मिन्सम्भ्रियमाणे तु राघवस्याभिषेचने।कैकेयी नाम भर्तारमार्या सा याचते वरम्।।3.47.6।।
explanation: Arrangements for consecration were on when queen Kaikeyi sought a boon from the king.

content: प्रतिगृह्य तु कैकेयी श्वशुरं सुकृतेन मे।मम प्रव्राजनं भर्तुर्भरतस्याभिषेचनम्।।3.47.7।।द्वावयाचत भर्तारं सत्यसन्धं नृपोत्तमम्।
explanation: For the fulfilment of the promise made to Kaikeyi earlier by my truthful fatherin law, who, to my good luck, was the best of kings, she asked for two boons. One was banishment of my husband and second, consecration of Bharata.

content: नाद्य भोक्ष्ये न च स्वप्स्ये न पास्येच कथञ्चन।।3.47.8।।एष मे जीवितस्यान्तो रामो यद्यभिषिच्यते।
explanation: 'I shall not eat, or sleep or even drink if Rama is consecrated and I shall put an end to my life itself' (said Kaikeyi).

content: इति ब्रुवाणां कैकेयीं श्वशुरो मे स मानदः।।3.47.9।।अयाचतार्थैरन्वर्थैर्न च याञ्चां चकार सा।
explanation: The king, my fatherinlaw, who respected her offered riches. Which she did not accept.

content: मम भर्तामहातेजा वयसा पञ्चविंशकः।।3.47.10।।अष्टादश हि वर्षाणि मम जन्मनि गण्यते।
explanation: My husband who was very bold was twentyfive years and I had completed eighteen years since my birth.

content: रामेति प्रथितो लोके गुणवान्सत्यवान्शुचिः।।3.47.11।।विशालाक्षो महाबाहुस्सर्वभूतहिते रतः।
explanation: My husband known in the world as Rama is largeeyed, longarmed, virtuous, truthful, pure and is always engaged in the welfare of all beings.

content: कामार्तस्तु महातेजाः पिता दशरथस्स्वयम्।।3.47.12।।कैकेय्याः प्रियकामार्थं तं रामं नाभ्यषेचयत्।
explanation: The brilliant king, Dasaratha, father of Rama, overcome by passion,  did not consecrate Rama in order to please Kaikeyi.

content: अभिषेकाय तु पितुस्समीपं राममागतम्।।3.47.13।।कैकेयी मम भर्तारमित्युवाच धृतं वचः।
explanation: When my husband Rama approached his father for the consecration she said these unhesitating words:

content: तव पित्रा समाज्ञप्तं ममेदं शृणु राघव।।3.47.14।।भरताय प्रदातव्यमिदं राज्यमकण्टकम्।
explanation: 'O Rama, listen, your father has ordered that this kingdom be bestowed on Bharata without any obstacles.

content: त्वया हि खलु वस्तव्यं नव वर्षाणि पञ्च च।।3.47.15।।वने प्रव्रज काकुत्स्थ पितरं मोचयानृतान्।
explanation: 'O Rama of the Kakutstha dynasty, you should live in the forest for fourteen years and save your father from falsehood'.

content: तथेत्युक्त्वा च तां रामः कैकेयीमकुतोभयः।।3.47.16।।चकार तद्वचस्तस्या मम भर्ता दृढव्रतः।
explanation: My husband Rama, a man of fearlessness and firm resolution, said to Kaikeyi 'Be it so' and carried out her words.

content: दद्यान्न प्रतिगृह्णीयात्सत्यं ब्रूयान्न चानृतम्।।3.47.17।।एतद्ब्राह्मण रामस्य ध्रृवं व्रतमनुत्तमम्।
explanation: O brahmin this is his firm resolve and his great vow: 'One should give and never take one should speak the truth and nothing but he truth.'

content: तस्य भ्राता तु द्वैमात्रो लक्ष्मणो नाम वीर्यवान्।।3.47.18।।रामस्य पुरुषव्याघ्रस्सहायस्समरेरिहा।
explanation: Son to the second mother of Rama, his mighty halfbrother, by name, Lakshmana, a tiger among men and a  slayer of enemies in battle is a companion to him.

content: स भ्राता लक्ष्मणो नाम धर्मचारी दृढव्रतः।।3.47.19।।अन्वगच्छद्दनुष्पाणिः प्रव्रजन्तं मया सह।
explanation: Lakshmana, his brother, is righteous and steadfast. Bow in hand, he followed Rama along with me, into exile.

content: जटी तापसरूपेण मया सह सहानुजः।।3.47.20।।प्रविष्टो दण्डकारण्यं धर्मनित्यो जितेन्द्रियः।
explanation: Rama who is ever righteous and selfcontrolled entered the Dandaka forest with matted locks, his brother and me.

content: ते वयं प्रच्युता राज्यात्कैकेय्यास्तु कृते त्रयः।।3.47.21।।विचरामो द्विजश्रेष्ठ वनं गम्भीरमोजसा।
explanation: O best of brahmins three of us have been wandering with courage in the deep forest, dislodged from  the kingdom on account of  Kaikeyi.

content: समाश्वस मुहूर्तं तु शक्यं वस्तुमिह त्वया।।3.47.22।।आगमिष्यति मे भर्ता वन्यमादाय पुष्कलम्।रुरून्गोधा न्वराहांश्च हत्वाऽदायाऽमिषान्बहून्।।3.47.23।।
explanation: Rest here awhile. My husband will return with plenty of meat of many kinds from the forest, killing deer, alligators and wild boars.

content: स त्वं नाम च गोत्रञ्च कुलं चाचक्ष्व तत्त्वतः।एकश्च दण्डकारण्ये किमर्थं चरसि द्विज।।3.47.24।।
explanation: O brahmin, tell me your name, your gotra and your pedigree. And the purpose for which you are going about all alone in this Dandaka forest

content: एवं बृवन्त्यां सीतायां रामपत्न्यां महाबलः।प्रत्युवाचोत्तरं तीव्रं रावणो राक्षसाधिपः।।3.47.25।।
explanation: To these words of Sita, Rama's wife, Ravana, the powerful king of demons, replied  sharp:

content: येन वित्रासिता लोकास्सदेवासुरपन्नगाः।अहं तु रावणो नाम सीते रक्षोगणेश्वरः।।3.47.26।।
explanation: O Sita I am called Ravana, the lord of demons by whom all the worlds of demons, snakes and gods are frightened.

content: त्वां तु काञ्चनवर्णाभां दृष्ट्वा कौशेयवासिनीम्।रतिं स्वकेषु दारेषु नाधिगच्छाम्यनिन्दिते।।3.47.27।।
explanation: O flawless beauty of golden complexion seeing you clad in silk, I am not inclined to show any interest in my own wives.

content: बह्वीनामुत्तमस्त्रीणामाहृतानामितस्ततः।सर्वासामेव भद्रं ते ममाग्रमहिषी भव।।3.47.28।।
explanation: You will be the chief queen among the best of women I have won in wars. Be blessed.

content: लङ्कानाम समुद्रस्य मम मध्ये महापुरी।सागरेण परिक्षिस्ता निविष्टा नगमूर्धनि।।3.47.29।।
explanation: My great city  called Lanka is on the peak of a mountain surrounded by, and in the middle of, the sea.

content: तत्र सीते मया सार्धं वनेषु विहरिष्यसि।न चास्यारण्यवासस्य स्पृहयिष्यसि भामिनि।।3.47.30।।
explanation: O Sita, you can stroll with me in my pleasuregardens. O  beautiful lady, you will not like living in the forest (thereafter).

content: पञ्च दास्यस्सहस्राणि सर्वाभरणभूषिताः।सीते परिचरिष्यन्ति भार्या भवसि मे यदि।।3.47.31।।
explanation: O Sita  if you become my wife, five thousand female attendants adorned with all ornaments will attend on you.

content: रावणेनैवमुक्ता तु कुपिता जनकात्मजा।प्रत्युवाचानवद्याङ्गी तमनादृत्य राक्षसम्।।3.47.32।।
explanation: Thus addressed by Ravana, Janaki, a lady of blemishless limbs, got enraged and replied without caring for the demon:

content: महागिरिमिवाकम्प्यं महेन्द्रसदृशं पतिम्।महोदधिमिवाक्षोभ्यमहं राममनुव्रता।।3.47.33।।
explanation: I am devoted to Rama, my husband, who is unshakeable like a huge mountain, is comparable to lord Indra and is imperturbable like the mighty ocean.

content: सर्वलक्षणसम्पन्नं न्यग्रोधपरिमण्डलम्।सत्यसन्धं महाभागमहं राममनुव्रता।।3.47.34।।
explanation: I am the loyal wife of venerable Rama who is endowed with all excellences, a refuge to all like  a spreading banyan tree, and a votary of truth.

content: महाबाहुं महोरस्कं सिंहविक्रान्तगामिनम्।नृसिंहं सिंहसङ्काशमहं राममनुव्रता।।3.47.35।।
explanation: I am the faithful wife of the longarmed, broadchested  Rama,  a lion among men. His gait is the gait of an advancing, invincible lion.

content: पूर्णचन्द्राननं रामं राजवत्सं जितेन्द्रियम्।पृथुकीर्तिं महात्मानमहं राममनुव्रता।।3.47.36।।
explanation: I am the devoted wife of great Rama, whose face is like a fullmoon, who is the son of a king, who has conquered his senses and whose fame is widespread (on earth).

content: त्वं पुनर्जम्बुकस्सिंहीं मामिच्छसि सुदुर्लभाम्।नाहं शक्या त्वया स्प्रष्टुमादित्यस्य प्रभा यथा।।3.47.37।।
explanation: You are a jackal, and you want a lioness like me who is difficult to win. I am like the Sun's radiance whom you cannot even touch.

content: पादपान्काञ्चनान्नूनं बहून्पश्यसि मन्दभाक्।राघपस्य प्रियां भार्यां यस्त्वमिच्छसि रावण।।3.47.38।।
explanation: O luckless Ravana  you want the beloved wife of Rama.You will, for sure, see golden trees. (which those close to death do).

content: क्षुधितस्य हि सिंहस्य मृगशत्रोस्तरस्विनः।आशीविषस्य मुखाद्दंष्ट्रामादातुमिच्छसि।।3.47.39।।
explanation: You are seeking to pull the teeth from  the mouth of a hungry and powerful lion who is considered the enemy of the deer(which you are). You intend to pull the fang of a poisonous snake.

content: मन्दरं पर्वतश्रेष्ठं पाणिना हर्तुमिच्छसि।कालकूटं विषं पीत्वा स्वस्तिमान्गन्तुमिच्छसि।।3.47.40।।
explanation: You are trying to carry the greatest of mountains, the Mandara, with one hand. You are wishing to go safe after drinking deadly poison (produced from the churning of the ocean).

content: अक्षि सूच्या प्रमृजसि जिह्वया लेक्षि च क्षुरम्।राघवस्य प्रियां भार्यां योऽधिगन्तुं त्वमिच्छसि।।3.47.41।।
explanation: You wish to violate the loving wife of Rama. You are rubbing your eyes with a needle and licking the razor with your tongue.

content: अवसज्य शिलां कण्ठे समुद्रं तर्तुमिच्छसि।सूर्याचन्द्रमसौ चोभौ पाणिभ्यां हर्तुमिच्छसि।।3.47.42।।यो रामस्य प्रियां भार्यां प्रधर्षयितुमिच्छसि।
explanation: You want to assault Rama's dear wife. It is like girding a stone round the neck and trying to cross the sea.It is like intending to take the Sun and the Moon with both your hands.

content: अग्निं प्रज्वलितं दृष्ट्वा वस्त्रेणाहर्तुमिच्छसि।।3.47.43।।काल्याणवृत्तां रामस्य यो भार्यांहर्तुमिच्छसि।
explanation: You intend to assaut the wife of Rama, who is a lady of virtuous conduct. You wish to hold blazing fire in your cloth.

content: अयोमुखानां शूलानामग्रे चरितुमिच्छसि।।3.47.44।।रामस्य सदृशीं भार्यां योऽधिगन्तुं त्वमिच्छसि।
explanation: You want to acquire Rama's worthy wife. You wish to walk on sharp ironheaded spear.

content: यदन्तरं सिंहशृगालयोर्वने यदन्तरं स्यन्दिनिका समुद्रयोः।सुराग्र्य सौवीरकयोर्यदन्तरं तदन्तरं वै तव राघवस्य च।।3.47.45।।
explanation: The difference between you and Rama is the difference between a jackal and a lion in the forest, between a ditch and the sea, and between sour gruel and the best of wines.

content: यदन्तरं काञ्चनसीसलोहयोर्यदन्तरं चन्दनवारिपङ्कयोः।यदन्तरं हस्तिबिडालयोर्वने तदन्तरं दाशरथेस्तवैव च।।3.47.46।।
explanation: The difference between you and Rama is the difference  between gold and lead, sandal and slime, an elephant and a cat of the forest.

content: यदन्तरं वायसवैनतेययोर्यदन्तरं मद्गुमयूरयोरपि।यदन्तरं सारसगृध्रयोर्वने तदन्तरं दाशरथेस्तवैव च।।3.47.47।।
explanation: The difference between you and Dasaratha's son is the difference between a crow and Garuda, a watercrane and a peacock, a vulture and a swan in the forest.

content: तस्मिन्सहस्राक्षसमप्रभावे रामे स्थिते कार्मुकबाणपाणौ।हृतापि तेहं न जरां गमिष्ये वज्रं यथा मक्षिकयावगीर्णम्।।3.47.48।।
explanation: So long Rama, equal in prowess to the thousandeyed Indra stands with bow and arrows in hand, I will not, although abducted, wither away like a diamond gulped by an insect (fly).

content: इतीव तद्वाक्यमदुष्टभावा सुदुष्टमुक्त्वा रजनीचरं तम्।गात्रप्रकम्पाद्व्यथिता बभूव वातोद्धता सा कदलीव तन्वी।।3.47.49।।
explanation: Having said thus to the wicked nightwalker Ravana, Sita, pure in thought remained  distressed.Her slender body started trembling like a banana plant becomes shaken by a violent wind.

content: तां वेपमानामुपलक्ष्य सीतां स रावणो मृत्युसमप्रभावः।कुलं बलं नाम च कर्म चात्मनः समाचचक्षे भयकारणार्थम्।।3.47.50।।
explanation: Beholding Sita who was trembling, Ravana, powerful like death, started telling about himself, his clan, his strength and his deeds to instil more fear in her.इत्तयार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे सप्तचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyseventh sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Ravana takes on his true form -- speaks of his glory -- Sita abuses Ravana in harsh words.]एवं बृवन्त्यां सीतायां संरब्दः परुषं वचः।ललाटे भृकुटीं कृत्वा रावणः प्रत्युवाच ह।।3.48.1।।
explanation: Addressed thus by Sita, Ravana, his anger roused, knitted his eyebrows with a frown on his forehead and replied to her harshly:

content: भ्राता वैश्रवणस्याहं सापत्न्यो वरवर्णिनि।रावणो नाम भद्रं ते दशग्रीवः प्रतापवान्।।3.48.2।।
explanation: O paragon of beauty  I am the halfbrother of Kubera, born of his stepmother. I am known as the tenheaded, powerful Ravana. Be blessed

content: यस्य देवास्सगन्धर्वाः पिशाचपतगोरगाः।विद्रवन्ति भयाद्भीता मृत्योरिव सदा प्रजाः।।3.48.3।।
explanation: Just as people get scared of death, all (creatures) including gandharvas, gods, evil spirits, birds and snakes run away from me.

content: येन वैश्रवणो राजा द्वैमात्रः कारणान्तरे।द्वन्द्वमासादितः क्रोधाद्रणे विक्रम्य निर्जितः।।3.48.4।।
explanation: For some reason or other a duel took place between me and king Kubera. With my prowess, I defeated him in the duel.

content: यद्भयार्तः परित्यज्य स्वमधिष्ठानमृद्धिमत्।कैलासं पर्वतश्रेष्ठमध्यास्ते नरवाहनः।।3.48.5।।
explanation: Out of fear for me, Kubera is residing on the mighty mount Kailasa, leaving his own earlier prosperous place of residence.

content: यस्य तत्पुष्पकं नाम विमानं कामगं शुभम्।वीर्यादेवार्जितं भद्रे येन यामि विहायसम्।।3.48.6।।
explanation: O noble lady  with my valour I gained over from Kubera the aerial chariot 'Pushpaka', which can go wherever one desires and in which I move about in the sky.

content: मम सञ्जातरोषस्य मुखं दृष्ट्वैव मैथिलि।विद्रवन्ति परित्रस्तास्सुराश्शक्रपुरोगमाः।।3.48.7।।
explanation: O Princess from Mithila, seeing my angry face  even gods led by Indra take to their heels in fear.

content: यत्र तिष्ठाम्यहं तत्र मारुतो वाति शङ्कितः।तीव्रांशुश्शिशिरांशुश्च भयात्सम्पद्यते रविः।।3.48.8।।
explanation: Wherever I am, the Windgod blows with hesitation. So are the Sun and the Moon afraid of me. Afraid of me the Sun duly discharges his duties.

content: निष्कम्पपत्रास्तरवो नद्यश्च स्तिमितोदकाः।भवन्ति यत्र यत्राहं तिष्ठामि विचरामि च।।3.48.9।।
explanation: Wherever I stay or move about, the leaves of trees do not shake, and the waters in rivers remain still.

content: मम पारे समुद्रस्य लङ्का नाम पुरी शुभा।सम्पूर्णा राक्षसैर्घोरैर्यथेन्द्रस्यामरावती।।3.48.10।।
explanation: My city known as Lanka, teeming with terrific demons, is on the other side of the sea. It is  beautiful like the city of Indra's Amaravati.

content: प्राकारेण परिक्षिप्ता पाण्डुरेण विराजता।हेमकक्ष्या पुरी रम्या वैढूर्यमयतोरणा।।3.48.11।।
explanation: The beautiful city of Lanka  shines with its pale white ramparts and golden interiors. The entrance gates are encrusted with vaidurya (cat'seye).

content: हस्त्यश्वरथसम्बाधा तूर्यनादविनादिता।सर्वकालफलैर्वृक्षैस्सङ्कुलोद्द्यानशोभिता।।3.48.12।।
explanation: It is crowded with elephants, horses and chariots. It resounds with the music of trumpets. The trees in the delightful pleasuregardens yield fruits in all seasons.

content: तत्र त्वं वसती सीते राजपुत्रि मया सह।न स्मरिष्यसि नारीणां मानुषीणां मनस्विनि।।3.48.13।।
explanation: O highminded princess, O Sita while living with me, you will not even think of other women.

content: भुञ्जाना मानुषान्भोगान्दिव्यांश्च वरवर्णिनि।न स्मरिष्यसि रामस्य मानुषस्य गतायुषः।।3.48.14।।
explanation: O blessed lady of fine complexion, while enjoying both human and heavenly  pleasures with me there, you will not remember Rama who is a mortal of short lifespan.

content: स्थापयित्वा प्रियं पुत्रं राज्ञा दशरथेन यः।मन्दवीर्यस्सुतो ज्येष्ठस्ततः प्रस्थापितो वनम्।।3.48.15।।
explanation: Considering the eldest son a weakling, king Dasaratha has sent him away to the forest so that he could consecrate his dear son(Bharata).

content: तेन किं भ्रष्टराज्येन रामेण गतचेतसा।करिष्यसि विशालाक्षि तापसेन तपस्विना।।3.48.16।।
explanation: O largeeyed Sita dislodged from the kingdom, Rama has lost his capacity to think. He is doing penance, assuming an ascetic role. What can he do (for you)?

content: सर्वराक्षसभर्तारं कामात्स्वयमिहागतम्।न मन्मथशराविष्टं प्रत्याख्यातुं त्वमर्हसि।।3.48.17।।
explanation: I am lord of all the demons. You should not reject me I am here (only because I am) overcome by the arrows of the god of love.

content: प्रत्याख्याय हि मां भीरु परितापं गमिष्यसि।चरणेनाभिहत्येव पुरूरवसमूर्वशी।।3.48.18।।
explanation: O timid lady if you reject me, you will regret like Urvasi who kicked Pururava and regretted later.

content: अङ्गुल्या न समो रामो मम युद्धे स मानुषः।तव भाग्येन सम्प्राप्तं भजस्व वरवर्णिनि।।3.48.19।।
explanation: O lady of fine complexion, Rama is a (mere) mortal. In war he is no match (even) for my finger. It is your good fortune that you have got me here. Take refuge in me.

content: एवमुक्ता तु वैदेही क्रुद्धा संरक्तलोचना।अब्रवीत्परुषं वाक्यं रहिते राक्षसाधिपम्।।3.48.20।।
explanation: Thus addressed, Sita was enraged and her eyes turned red. She replied in harsh words to the chief of the demons in that solitary place:.

content: कथं वैश्रवणं देवं सर्वभूतनमस्कृतम्।भ्रातरं व्यपदिश्य त्वमशुभं कर्तुमिच्छसि।।3.48.21।।
explanation: Why do you wish to do something inauspicious by calling Lord Kubera who is worshipped by all beings your brother ?

content: अवश्यं विनशिष्यन्ति सर्वे रावण राक्षसाः।येषां त्वं कर्कशो राजा दुर्बुद्धिरजितेन्द्रियः।।3.48.22।।
explanation: O Ravana ,you are cruel and evilminded. You have no control over your senses. (And yet) you are the ruler of your breed. Surely they are going to be destroyed.

content: अपहृत्य शचीं भार्यां शक्यमिन्द्रस्य जीवितुम्।न च रामस्य भार्यां मामपनीयास्ति जीवितम्।।3.48.23।।
explanation: It may be possible (for some one) to live after abducting Indra's wife, Sachi, but it is not possible for any one to live after kidnapping the wife of Rama.

content: जीवेच्चिरं वज्रधरस्य हस्ताच्छचीं प्रधृष्याप्रतिरूपरूपाम्।न मादृशीं राक्षस दूशयित्वा पीतामृतस्यापि तवास्ति मोक्षः।।3.48.24।।
explanation: O demon, you may live long after forcibly snatching the most beautiful Sachi, from the hands of Indra, the wielder of the thunderbolt, but after abusing a woman like me, you will not be released from death even if you drink nectar.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे अष्टचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyeighty sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Ravana carries away Sita in his chariot-- she screams and wails aloud -- implores the animals, trees, mountains and rivers to tell Rama about her.] सीताया वचनं श्रुत्वा दशग्रीवः प्रतापवाम्।हस्ते हस्तं समाहत्य चकार सुमहद्वपुः।।3.49.1।।
explanation: On hearing the Sita's words, the powerful Ravana struck his palms one over the other and assumed a huge form (original figure).

content: स मैथिलीं पुनर्वाक्यं बभाषे च ततो भृशम्।नोन्मत्तया श्रुतौ मन्ये मम वीर्यपराक्रमौ।।3.49.2।।
explanation: Ravana again said to that princess from Mithila, I suppose you are too insane to disregard my strength and valour.

content: उद्वहेयं भुजाभ्यां तु मेदिनीमम्बरे स्थितः।आपिबेयं समुद्रं च हन्यां मृत्युं रणे स्थितः।।3.49.3।।
explanation: Standing in the sky, I can  lift the earth with my arms.  I can drink the oceans. I can kill even the god of death in a combat.

content: अर्कं ऱुन्ध्यां शरैस्तीक्ष्णैर्विभिन्द्या हि महीतलम्।कामरूपिणमुन्मत्ते पश्य मां कामदं पतिम्।।3.49.4।।
explanation: I can obstruct the Sun and shatter the earth with my sharp arrows. O mad woman I am a husband who can fulfil your desires, and can assume any form at my own free will. Look at me.

content: एवमुक्तवतस्तस्य सूर्यकल्पे शिखिप्रभे।क्रुद्धस्य हरिपर्यन्ते रक्ते नेत्रे बभूवतुः।।3.49.5।।
explanation: As Ravana exploded in anger, his ambercoloured eyes turned red like the radiance of the flaming fire, and almost as bright as the Sun.

content: सद्यस्सौम्यं परित्यज्य भिक्षुरूपं स रावणः।स्वं रूपं कालरूपाभं भेजे वैश्रवणानुजः।।3.49.6।।
explanation: Ravana, brother of Kubera, shed the gentle figure of a mendicant and assumed the form of the god of death.

content: संरक्तनयनश्श्रीमांस्तप्तकाञ्चनभूषणः।क्रोधेन महताविष्टो नीलजीमूतसन्निभः।।3.49.7।।दशास्यः कार्मुकी बाणी बभूव क्षणदाचरः।
explanation: Overcome by intense anger, Ravana's eyes reddened. The nightranger, stood armed with bow and arrows and shining with glittering gold ornaments, appeared like a black cloud.

content: स परिव्राजकच्छद्म महाकायो विहाय तत्।।3.49.8।।प्रतिपद्य स्वकं रूपं रावणो राक्षसाधिपः।संरक्तनयनः क्रोधाज्जीमूतनिचयप्रभः।।3.49.9।।रक्ताम्बरधरस्तस्थौ स्त्रीरत्नं प्रेक्ष्य मैथिलीम्।
explanation: Ravana, chief of the demons, shed the mendicant's form and assumed his real self. Clad in red garments, his eyes turned red in anger. Looking like layers of clouds, he stood in front of Sita, a gem among women.

content: स तामसितकेशान्तां भास्करस्य प्रभामिव।।3.49.10।।वसनाभरणोपेतां मैथिलीं रावणोऽब्रवीत्।
explanation: Ravana said to the princess from Mithila, whose black hair was shining, who was luminous like the Sun and was clad in the best of cothes and ornaments.

content: त्रिषु लोकेषु विख्यातं यदि भर्तारमिच्छसि।।3.49.11।।मामाश्रय वरारोहे तवाहं सदृशः पतिः।
explanation: O beautiful lady  if you desire a husband who is famous in the three worlds, take refuge in me. I am fit to be your husband.

content: मां भजस्व चिराय त्वमहं श्लाघ्यः प्रियस्तव।।3.49.12।।नैव चाहं क्वचिद्भद्रे करिष्ये तव विप्रियम्।त्यज्यतां मानुषे भावो मयि भावः प्रणीयताम्।।3.49.13।।
explanation: I am your praiseworthy husband. I will not cause any unpleasantness to you at any time. Abandon on your inclination towards, a (mere) mortal. Divert your love to me.

content: राज्याच्च्युतमसिद्धार्थं रामं परिमितायुषम्।कैर्गुणैरनुरक्तासि मूढे पण्डितमानिनि।।3.49.14।।यः स्त्रिया वचनाद्राज्यं विहाय ससुहृज्जनम्।अस्मिन्व्यालानुचरिते वने वसति दुर्मतिः।।3.49.15।।
explanation: O stupid woman you think you are very wise. What is there in Rama so that you are attached to him ? He has left the kingdom and his kith and kin due to the words of a woman. He has not accomplished anything (in life). He has a limited life span and now lives in this forest haunted by wild animals.

content: इत्युक्त्वा मैथिलीं वाक्यं प्रियार्हां प्रियवादिनीम्।अभिगम्य सुदुष्टात्मा राक्षसः काममोहितः।।3.49.16।।जग्राह रावणस्सीतां बुधः खे रोहिणीमिव।
explanation: Just as Budha (planet Mercury) catches Rohini (a cluster of five stars) in the sky, the evilminded, infatuated Ravana advanced towards the pitiable, pleasing Sita and caught hold of her.

content: वामेन सीतां पद्माक्षीं मूर्धजेषु करेण सः।।3.49.17।।ऊर्वोस्तु दक्षिणेनैव परिजग्राह पाणिना।
explanation: Ravana seized with his left hand the lotuseyed Sita by the hair and lifted her by the thighs with his right hand.

content: तं दृष्ट्वा मृत्युसङ्काशं तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्रं महाभुजम्।।3.49.18।।प्राद्रवन्गिरिसङ्काशं भयार्ता वनदेवताः।
explanation: The sylvan deities fled out of fear on seeing the dreadful appearance of Ravana who had sharp teeth and mighty arms. He looked like a mountain, a veritable god of death.

content: स च मायामयो दिव्यः खरयुक्तः खरस्वनः।।3.49.19।।प्रत्यदृश्यत हेमाङ्गो रावणस्य महारथः।
explanation: There arrived the great  golden chariot of Ravana, illusive and wonderful, harnessed with donkeys and braying like donkeys.

content: ततस्तां परुषैर्वाक्यैर्भर्त्सयन्स महास्वनः।।3.49.20।।अङ्केनादाय वैदेहीं रथमारोपयत्तदा।
explanation: Reproaching the princess from Videha loudly and harshly, Ravana took her on his lap and put her on the chariot.

content: सा गृहीता विचुक्रोश रावणेन यशस्स्विनी।।3.49.21।।रामेति सीता दुःखार्ता रामं दूरगतंवने।
explanation: Seized by Ravana, illustrious Sita screamed aloud Alas, Rama. for one who was far away in the forest.

content: तामकामां स कामार्तः पन्नगेन्द्रवधूमिव।।3.49.22।।विवेष्टमानामादाय उत्पपाताथ रावणः।
explanation: Passionate Ravana took hold of Sita who was not willing and was writhing in pain. He seized her  like (an eagle carrying away) a serpent queen and flew up.

content: ततस्सा राक्षसेन्द्रेण ह्रियमाणा विहायसा।।3.49.23।।भृशं चुक्रोश मत्तेव भ्रान्तचित्ता यथाऽऽतुरा।
explanation: While Sita was being carried off in the sky by the king of demons,   she screamed a lot in agony and anxiety like a mad woman in a bewildered state:

content: हा लक्ष्मण महाबाहो गुरुचित्तप्रसादक।।3.49.24।।ह्रियमाणां न जानीषे रक्षसा माममर्षिणा।
explanation: Alas, O longarmed Lakshmana, you who used to entertain your brother do not know that I am being carried away by this ruthless demon.

content: जीवितं सुखमर्थांश्च धर्महेतोः परित्यजन्।।3.49.25।।ह्रियमाणामधर्मेण मां राघव न पश्यसि।
explanation: O Rama, you have given up your life, pleasure and treasure for the sake of righteousness. Do you not see me carried off by an unrighteous fellow ?

content: ननु नामाविनीतानां विनेतासि परन्तप।।3.49.26।।कथमेवंविधं पापं न त्वं शासि हि रावणम्।
explanation: O scorcher of enemies you are the chastiser of the haughty. Why do you not punish such a sinner like Ravana.

content: ननु सद्योऽविनीतस्य दृश्यते कर्मणःफलम्।।3.49.27।।कालोऽप्यङ्गीभवत्यत्र सस्यानामिव पक्तये।
explanation: The effect of arrogant action cannot be seen right away. Just as the crop yields results only after ripening, in the same way it takes time. Time acts as a supporting factor.

content: त्वं कर्म कृतवानेतत्कालोपहतचेतनः।।3.49.28।।जीवितान्तकरं घोरं रामाद्व्यसनमाप्नुहि।
explanation: Time has taken a toll of your senses. This has made you do what you have done. A great calamity is awaiting you in the hands of Rama. It will end your life.

content: हन्तेदानीं सकामास्तु कैकेयी सह बान्धवैः।।3.49.29।।ह्रिये यद्धर्मकामस्य धर्मपत्नी यशस्विनः।
explanation: Alas, the lawful wife of the glorious and righteous Rama is being abducted now. Let Kaikeyi along with her relations be happy with her desire fulfilled.

content: आमन्त्रये जनस्थाने कर्णिकारान्सुपुष्पितान्।।3.49.30।।क्षिप्रं रामाय शंसध्वं सीतां हरति रावणः।
explanation: O karnikar trees in full bloom in Janasthana, tell Rama quickly that Ravana is kidnapping Sita.

content: माल्यवन्तं शिखरिणं वन्दे प्रस्रवणं गिरिम्।।3.49.31।।क्षिप्रं रामाय शंस त्वं सीतां हरति रावणः।
explanation: I salute to Malyavan and  Prasravana mountains. Tell Rama at once that Ravana is carrying away Sita.

content: हंसकारण्डवाकीर्णां वन्दे गोदावरीं नदीम्।।3.49.32।।क्षिप्रं रामाय शंस त्वं सीतां हरति रावणः।
explanation: O river Godavari abounding in swans and cranes, my salutations to you  Tell Rama immediately that Ravana is taking away Sita.

content: दैवतानि च यान्यस्मिन्वने विविधपादपे।।3.49.33।।नमस्करोम्यहं तेभ्योभर्तुश्शंसत मां हृताम्।
explanation: I offer my salutations to different deities residing in this forest abounding in trees of many kinds. Tell my husband about me that I am being whisked away.

content: यानि कानि चिदप्यत्र सत्त्वानि निवसन्त्युत।।3.49.34।।सर्वाणि शरणं यामि मृगपक्षिगणानपि।
explanation: I seek refuge in all those living beings as well as herds of animals and birds in the forest.

content: ह्रियमाणां प्रियां भर्तुः प्राणेभ्योऽपि गरीयसीम्।।3.49.35।।विवशाऽपहृता सीता रावणेनेति शंसत।
explanation: Tell Rama that his dear wife Sita whom he loves more than his life is abducted helplessly.

content: विदित्वा मां महाबाहुरमुत्रापि महाबलः।।3.49.36।।आनेष्यति पराक्रम्य वैवस्वतहृतामपि।
explanation: If he knows that I am abducted by Yama, the god of death, that mighty, longarmed hero will save me even from there by virtue of his valour.

content: सा तदा करुणा वाचो विलपन्ती सुदुःखिता।।3.49.37।।वनस्पतिगतं गृध्रं ददर्शाऽयतलोचना।
explanation: When the griefstricken, largeeyed Sita was lamenting piteously, she saw the vulture (Jatayu) seated on a tree.

content: सा तमुद्वीक्ष्य सुश्रोणी रावणस्य वशं गता।3.49.38।।समाक्रन्दद्भयपरा दुःखोपहतया गिरा।
explanation: The heavyhipped Sita felt frightened in the grip of Ravana. When she saw Jatayu she screamed, shaken by sorrow:

content: जटायो पश्य मामद्य ह्रियमाणामनाथवत्।।3.49.39।।अनेन राक्षसेन्द्रेण करुणं पापकर्मणा।
explanation: O Jatayu, see me now being carried away by the sinful king of demons in this pitiable condition as though I am an orphan.

content: नैष वारयितुं शक्यस्तव क्रूरो निशाचरः।।3.49.40।।सत्त्वाञ्जितकाशी च सायुधश्चैव दुर्मतिः।
explanation: This nightranger is equipped with weapons. Cruel, strong and evilminded, he has won wars. You cannot stop him.

content: रामाय तु यथातत्त्वं जटायो हरणं मम।।3.49.41।।लक्ष्मणाय च तत्सर्वमाख्यातव्यमशेषतः।
explanation: O Jatayu narrate to Rama and Lakshmana the exact facts of my abduction and all the details without any omission.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकोनपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyninth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Jatayu sees Ravana carrying Sita-- pleads with Ravana to return Sita-- Ravana pays no heed  Jatayu fights with Ravana.]तं शब्दमवसुप्तस्तु जटायुरथ शुश्रुवे।निरीक्ष्य रावणं क्षिप्रं वैदेहीं च ददर्श सः।।3.50.1।।
explanation: While reposing, Jatayu heard the cry and at once looked up and saw Ravana and Vaidehi.

content: ततः पर्वतकूटाभस्तीक्ष्णतुण्डः खगोत्तमः।वनस्पतिगतश्श्रीमान्व्याजहार शुभां गिरम्।।3.50.2।।
explanation: Glorious Jatayu, the best among the birds, looked like the peak of a mountain.His beak was sharp. His words were auspious. He spoke from the top of the tree:

content: दशग्रीव स्थितो धर्मे पुराणे सत्यसंश्रयः।जटायुर्नाम नाम्नाहं गृध्रराजो महाबलः।।3.50.3।।
explanation: O tenheaded Ravana, I am Jatayu, king of vultures. I am mighty. An eternal follower, of dharma, I am an adherent to truth.

content: राजा सर्वस्य लोकस्य महेन्द्रवरुणोपमः।लोकानां च हिते युक्तो रामो दशरथात्मजः।।3.50.4।।
explanation: Rama, Dasaratha's son, is the king of the entire world. He is equal to Indra and Varuna. He is ever engaged in the welfare of the entire world.

content: तस्यैषा लोकनाथस्य धर्मपत्नी यशस्विनी।सीता नाम वरारोहा यां त्वं हर्तुमिहेच्छसि।।3.50.5।।
explanation: The lady you want to abduct from here is the famous Sita, the lawful wife of Rama, the lord of the world.

content: कथं राजास्थितो धर्मे परदारान्परामृशेत्।रक्षणीया विशेषेण राजदारा महाबल।।3.50.6।।
explanation: How can a king who adheres to righteousness outrage another's wife ? O powerful one, a king's wife in particular should be protected.

content: निवर्तय मतिं नीचां परदाराभिमर्शनात्।न तत्समाचरेद्धीरो यत्परोऽस्य विगर्हयेत्।।3.50.7।।यथात्मनस्तथान्येषां दारा रक्ष्या विपश्चिता।
explanation: Refrain yourself from the vile thought of violating other's wives. Wise men do not adopt what is censured by others. Just like one's own, the wise should protect other's wives.

content: धर्ममर्थं वा कामं वा शिष्टाश्शास्त्रेष्वनागतम्।।3.50.8।।व्यवस्यन्त्यनु राजानं धर्मं पौलस्त्यनन्दन।
explanation: O son of Paulastya learned men determine the path of dharma artha and kama,  following a king's conduct even if  they are not declared in sastras.

content: राजा धर्मस्य कामस्य द्रव्याणां चोत्तमो निधिः।।3.50.9।।धर्मश्शुभं वा पापं वा राजमूलं प्रवर्तते।
explanation: A king is the best repository of rigteousness, material wealth and pleasures. The king is the root of dharma, virtue and sin.

content: पापस्वभावश्चपलः कथं त्वं रक्षसां वर।।3.50.10।।ऐश्वर्यमभिसम्प्राप्तो विमानमिव दुष्कृतिः।
explanation: O best of demons  by nature you are sinful, and fickleminded. You do all forbidden acts. Otherwise,how could you get this wealth, like the celestial chariot?

content: कामं स्वभावो यो यस्य न शक्यः परिमार्जितुम्।।3.50.11।।न हि दुष्टात्मनामार्यमावसत्यालये चिरम्।
explanation: Indeed, it is not possible to erase the nature of any one, whatever it be. Prosperity does not rest for long in the house of the evilminded.
