content: विषये वा पुरे वा ते यदा रामो महाबलः।।3.50.12।।नापराध्यति धर्मात्मा कथं तस्यापराध्यसि।
explanation: Powerful and righteous Rama has not offended you, your kingdom or your city. Why do you offend him?

content: यदि शूर्पणखाहेतोर्जनस्थानगतः खरः।।3.50.13।।अतिवृत्तो हतः पूर्वं रामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा।अत्र ब्रूहि यथातत्त्वं को रामस्य व्यतिक्रमः।।3.50.14।।यस्य त्वं लोकनाथस्य भार्यां हृत्वा गमिष्यसि।
explanation: On account of Surpanakha, Khara trespassed into Janasthana and got killed by Rama, without much effort. Tell me truly, what transgression (of dharma) did he commit for which you are stealing away the wife of Rama who is the lord of this world?.

content: क्षिप्रं विसृज वैदेहीं मा त्वा घोरेण चक्षुषा।।3.50.15।।दहेद्दहनभूतेन वृत्रमिन्द्राशनिर्यथा।
explanation: Leave Vaidehi at once lest with her fierce looks you should be burnt down like demon Vrtra by the thunderbolt of Indra.

content: सर्पमाशीविषं बद्ध्वा वस्त्रान्ते नावबुध्यसे।।3.50.16।।ग्रीवायां प्रतिसक्तं च कालपाशं न पश्यसि।
explanation: You are not aware that you are tying a venomous snake with the skirt of your cloth. worn by you. You are not able to see the noose of death tightened around your neck.

content: स भारस्सौम्य भर्तव्यो यो नरं नावसादयेत्।।3.50.17।।तदन्नमपि भोक्तव्यं जीर्यते यदनामयम्।
explanation: O gentle Ravana one should carry that much of weight which does not tire him. One should eat only that wholesome food which can be easily digested.

content: यत्कृत्वा न भवेद्धर्मो न कीर्तिर्न यशो भुवि।।3.50.18।।शरीरस्य भवेत्खेदः कस्तत्कर्म समाचरेत्।
explanation: Who will do such a deed which cannot beget dharma, fame or glory in the world? Who will do such deeds that bring only exhaustion to the body?

content: षष्टिर्वर्षसहस्राणि मम जातस्य रावण।।3.50.19।।पितृपैतामहं राज्यं यथावदनुतिष्ठतः।
explanation: Sixty thousand years ago I was born, O Ravana  Since then I have ruled justly my hereditary kingdom.

content: वृद्धोऽहं त्वं युवा धन्वी सशरः कवची रथी।।3.50.20।।तथाप्यादाय वैदेहीं कुशली न गमिष्यसि।
explanation: I am old, you are young, wielding a bow and arrows, with shield to protect and chariot to ride. Even then I will not let you go safe with Vaidehi kidnapped.

content: न शक्तस्त्वं बलाद्धर्तुं वैदेहीं मम पश्यतः।।3.50.21।।हेतुभिर्न्यायसंसिद्धैद्धृवां वेदश्रुतीमिव।
explanation: You cannot carry Vaidehi by force within my very sight just as the everlasting revelations of the Vedas cannot be robbed by mere logic of reason.

content: युद्ध्यस्व यदि शूरोऽसि मुहूर्तं तिष्ठ रावण।।3.50.22।।शयिष्यसे हतो भूमौ यथापूर्वं खरस्तथा।
explanation: O Ravana, if you are brave, fight with me. In a moment, you will be killed like Khara and lie down on the ground.

content: असकृत्संयुगे येन निहता दैत्यदानवाः।।3.50.23।।नचिराच्चीरवासास्त्वां रामो युधि वधिष्यति।
explanation: Clad in bark garments, Rama, who has often slain demons in the past will soon kill you in war.

content: किं नु शक्यं मया कर्तुं गतौदूरं नृपात्मजौ।।3.50.24।।क्षिप्रं त्वं नश्यसे नीच तयोर्भीतो न संशयः।
explanation: What can I do? O mean fellow the two princes have gone far away.You will soon be destroyed out of fear for them. There is no doubt.

content: न हि मे जीवमानस्य नयिष्यसि शुभामिमाम्।।3.50.25।।सीतां कमलपत्राक्षीं रामस्य महिषीं प्रियाम्।
explanation: I will not let you take away the auspicious, lotuseyed Sita, the dear consort of Rama as long as I am alive.

content: अवश्यं तु मया कार्यं प्रियं तस्य महात्मनः।।3.50.26।।जीवितेनापि रामस्य तथा दशरथस्य च।
explanation: I should do this important work of those great souls, Rama and Dasaratha, even if it claims my life.

content: तिष्ठ तिष्ठ दशग्रीव मुहूर्तं पश्य रावण।।3.50.27।।युद्धातिथ्यं प्रदास्यामि यथाप्राणं निशाचर।वृन्तादिव फलं त्वां तु पातयेयं रथोत्तमात्।।3.50.28।।
explanation: O ten headed Ravana stay, stay for a while. O demon  as long as I am alive I will treat you with the hospitality of war. You will be pulled down from this best of the chariots like a ripe fruit drops from the stalk.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे पञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftieth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Jatayu fights Ravana -- wounded Ravana clips Jatayu's wings and carries away Sita.]इत्युक्तस्य यथान्यायं रावणस्य जटायुषा।क्रुद्धस्याग्निनिभास्सर्वा रेजुर्विंशतिदृष्टयः।।3.51.1।।
explanation: Ravana's twenty eyes glowed like fire in anger after Jatayu thus rightly said.

content: संरक्तनयनः कोपात्तप्तकाञ्चनकुण्डलः।राक्षसेन्द्रोऽभिदुद्राव पतगेन्द्रममर्षणः।।3.51.2।।
explanation: As the bright gold earrings of the intolerant king of demons glittered, his eyes turned red in rage and he pounced upon Jatayu, the lord of birds.

content: स सम्प्रहारस्तुमुल स्तयोस्तस्मिन्महावने।बभूव वातोद्धतयोर्मेघयोर्गगने यथा।।3.51.3।।
explanation: The clash between them was tumultuous and it appeared like the clash of two pieces of clouds in the sky raised by stormy winds.

content: तद्बभूवाद्भुतं युद्धं गृध्रराक्षसयोस्तदा।सपक्षयोर्माल्यवतोर्महापर्वतयोरिव।।3.51.4।।
explanation: The duel between Ravana and Jatayu looked as though it was a fight between two huge winged mountains of Malyavan range.

content: ततो नालीकनाराचैस्तीक्ष्णाग्रैश्च विकर्णिभिः।अभ्यवर्षन्महाघोरैर्गृध्रराजं महाबलः।।3.51.5।।
explanation: Then the mighty Ravana rained sharp, dreadful shafts, spears and Vikarnis at Jatayu,  king of vultures.

content: स तानि शरजालानि गृध्रः पत्त्ररथेश्वरः।जटायुः प्रतिजग्राह रावणास्त्राणि संयुगे।।3.51.6।।
explanation: Jatayu, lord of the birds, faced the arrows and other weapons showered  by Ravana.

content: तस्य तीक्ष्णनखाभ्यां तु चरणाभ्यां महाबलः।चकार बहुधा गात्रे व्रणान्पतगसत्तमः।।3.51.7।।
explanation: The mighty, virtuous vulture with his sharp claws wounded many parts of the body of Ravana.

content: अथ क्रोधाद्धशग्रीवो जग्राह दश मार्गणान्।मृत्युदण्डनिभान्घोरान्छत्रुमर्दनकाङ्क्षया।।3.51.8।।
explanation: Ravana in a rage took ten dreadful darts (looking) like the staff of death with a desire to crush the enemy.

content: स तैर्बाणैर्महावीर्यः पूर्णमुक्तैरजिह्मगैः।बिभेद निशितैस्तीक्ष्णैर्गृध्रं घोरैश्शिलीमुखैः।।3.51.9।।
explanation: The mighty Ravana fully released his dreadful, sharp arrows that went straight and pierced the vulture.

content: स राक्षसरथे पश्यन्जानकीं बाष्पलोचनाम्।अचिन्तयित्वा तान्बाणान्राक्षसं समभिद्रवत्।।3.51.10।।
explanation: Seeing Sita, daughter of Janaka, on the demon's chariot with eyes full of tears, Jatayu without minding the arrows renewed his attack.

content: ततोऽस्य सशरं चापं मुक्तामणिविभूषितम्।चरणाभ्यां महातेजा बभञ्ज पतगेश्वरः।।3.51.11।।
explanation: The glorious lord of birds crushed with his feet the bow and arrow of Ravana with pearls and gems encrusted.

content: ततोऽन्यद्धनुरादाय रावणः क्रोधमूर्छितः।ववर्ष शरवर्षाणि शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः।।3.51.12।।
explanation: Overcome with anger, Ravana took another bow and rained (on him) hundreds and thousands of arrows.

content: शरैरावारितस्तस्य संयुगे पतगेश्वरः।कुलायमुपसम्प्राप्तः पक्षीव प्रबभौ तदा।।3.51.13।।
explanation: Jatayu, shot with arrows on all sides in the combat, shone like the bird that returned to its nest.

content: स तानि शरवर्षाणि पक्षाभ्यां च विधूयच।चरणाभ्यां महातेजा बभञ्जास्य महद्धनुः।।3.51.14।।
explanation: Powerful Jatayu scattered the shower of arrows with his wings and broke down the great bow with his claws.

content: तच्चाग्निसदृशं दीप्तं रावणस्य शरावरम्।पक्षाभ्यां स महावीर्यो व्याधुनोत्पतगेश्वरः।।3.51.15।।
explanation: Mighty Jatayu, lord of the birds, shattered with his wings the armour of Ravana that was glowing like fire.

content: काञ्चनोरश्छदान्दिव्यान्पिशाचवदनान्खरान्।तांश्चास्य जवसम्पन्नाञ्जघान समरे बली।।3.51.16।।
explanation: Powerful Jatayu killed in the combat, the splendid, swiftmoving, devilfaced asses with  golden shields yoked to the chariot.

content: वरं त्रिवेणुसम्पन्नं कामगं पावकार्चिषम्।मणिहेमविचित्राङ्गं बभञ्ज च महारथम्।।3.51.17।।
explanation: Then he(Jatayu) broke down the great chariot(of Ravana) glowing like fire, glittering with gold and gems, made of three bamboo reeds, and capable of flying wherever the rider willed.

content: पूर्णचन्द्रप्रतीकाशं छत्रं च व्यजनैस्सह।पातयामास वेगेन ग्राहिभी राक्षसैस्सह।।3.51.18।।
explanation: Jatayu violently pulled down the parasol shining like the full moon and the fans of the chariot along with the demons holding them.

content: सारथेश्चास्य वेगेन तुण्डेनैव महच्छिरः।पुनर्व्यपाहरच्छ्रीमान्पक्षिराजो महाबलः।।3.51.19।।
explanation: Again the glorious, powerful king of birds swiftly shattered the huge head of the charioteer with his beak.

content: स भग्नधन्वा विरथो हताश्वो हतसारथिः।अङ्केनादाय वैदेहीं पपात भुवि रावणः।।3.51.20।।
explanation: With the bow broken, the chariot destroyed, asses (drawing the chariot) and the charioteer dead,  Ravana fell down on the ground holding Vaidehi on his lap.

content: दृष्ट्वा निपतितं भूमौ रावणं भग्नवाहनम्।साधुसाध्विति भूतानि गृध्रराजमपूजयन्।।3.51.21।।
explanation: Seeing Ravana fallen on the ground with his broken chariot, all beings honoured the king of the birds, saying, Well done Well done

content: परिश्रान्तं तु तं दृष्टवा जरया पक्षियूथपम्।उत्पपात पुनर्हृष्टो मैथिलीं गृह्य रावणः।।3.51.22।।
explanation: Seeing the lord of the flocks of birds exhausted due to age still fighting, Ravana felt glad. He flew back into the sky taking Sita, princess of Mithila, with him.

content: तं प्रहृष्टं निधायाङ्के गच्छन्तं जनकात्मजाम्।गृध्रराजस्समुत्पत्य समभिद्रुत्य रावणम्।।3.51.23।।समावार्य महातेजा जटायुरिदमब्रवीत्।
explanation: Seeing Sita, Janaka's daughter, happily carried away into the sky by Ravana on his lap. Jatayu, the mighty king of vultures chased him, and obstructing his path said :

content: वज्रसंस्पर्शबाणस्य भार्यां रामस्य रावण।।3.51.24।।अल्पबुद्धे हरस्येनां वधाय खलु रक्षसाम्।
explanation: Foolish Ravana, you are kidnapping this lady, wife of Rama, whose arrows can hit like a thunderbolt. This will lead to the destruction of all demons.

content: समित्रबन्धुस्सामात्यस्सबलस्सपरिच्छदः।।3.51.25।।विषपानं पिबस्येतत्पिपासित इवोदकम्।
explanation: You are drinking poison along with all your friends, relatives, ministers, the army and  your allies. like a thirsty man drinks water.

content: अनुबन्धमजानन्तः कर्मणामविचक्षणाः।।3.51.26।।शीघ्रमेव विनश्यन्ति यथा त्वं विनशिष्यसि।
explanation: Fools who do not know the consequences of their action perish soon. Similarly you are going to die soon.

content: बद्धस्त्वं कालपाशेन क्व गतस्तस्य मोक्ष्यसे।।3.51.27।।वधाय बडिशं गृह्य सामिषं जलजो यथा।
explanation: You are bound by the noose of death like a fish holding on to the bait of the fishing hook. Where can you go now?

content: न हि जातु दुराधर्षौ काकुत्स्थौ तव रावण।।3.51.28।।धर्षणं चाश्रमस्यास्य क्षमिष्येते तु राघवौ।
explanation: O Ravana  know that Rama and Lakshmana, the Kakutsthas, are invincible. They will not forgive the asssault you have made on their hermitage.

content: यथा त्वया कृतं कर्म भीरुणा लोकगर्हितम्।।3.51.29।।तस्कराचरितो मार्गो नैव वीरनिषेवितः।
explanation: Your cowardly action will be condemned by the whole world. The path you have chosen is the path of a thief and not of a hero.

content: युध्यस्व यदि शूरोऽसि मुहूर्तं तिष्ठरावण।।3.51.30।।शयिष्यसे हतो भूमौ यथा भ्राता खरस्तथा।
explanation: O Ravana if you are courageous, tarry awhile and fight with me. Like your brother Khara, you will lie on the ground dead.

content: परेतकाले पुरुषो यत्कर्म प्रतिपद्यते।।3.51.31।।विनाशायात्मनोऽधर्म्यं प्रतिपन्नोऽसि कर्म तत्।
explanation: You have resorted to unrighteous action like a dying man. This will spell your destruction.

content: पापानुबन्धो वै यस्य कर्मणः कर्मको नु तत्।।3.51.32।।कुर्वीत लोकाधिपतिस्स्वयंभूर्भगवानपि।
explanation: If the consequences of an action be sin, who will do it ? Even the selfborn lord of the world may not.

content: एवमुक्त्वा शुभं वाक्यं जटायुस्तस्य रक्षसः।।3.51.33।।निपपात भृशं पृष्ठे दशग्रीवस्य वीर्यवान्।
explanation: Brave Jatayu having thus said these cautious words to the demon dashed against his back again and again.

content: तं गृहीत्वा नखैस्तीक्ष्णैर्विददार समन्ततः।।3.51.34।।अधिरूढो गजारोहो यथा स्याद्दुष्टवारणम्।
explanation: Thereafter, seizing Ravana, Jatayu ascended on his back and pierced his body all over with his sharp claws just as a rider goads an unruly elephant.

content: विददार नखैरस्य तुण्डं पृष्ठे समर्पयन्।।3.51.35।।केशांश्चोत्पाटयामास नखपक्षमुखायुधः।
explanation: Jatayu who had  his claws, wings and beak as the only weapons  pierced and pricked  Ravana all over with his nails by pressing his beak on his back and pulled out his hair.

content: स तथा गृध्रराजेन क्लिश्यमानो मुहुर्मुहुः।।3.51.36।।अमर्षस्फुरितोष्ठस्सन्प्राकम्पत च रावणः।
explanation: Thus tormented again and again by the king of vultures, Ravana shook with anger, his lips quivering.

content: स परिष्वज्य च वैदेहीं वामेनाङ्केन रावणः।।3.51.37।।तलेनाभिजघानाशु जटायुं क्रोधमुर्छीतः।
explanation: Losing his senses, with rage, Ravana held Vaidehi (Sita) with his left arm and hit Jatayu with his palm.

content: जटायुस्तमभिक्रम्य तुण्डेनास्य खगाधिपः।।3.51.38।।वामबाहून्दश तदा व्यपाहरदरिन्दमः।
explanation: Then Jatayu, lord of the birds, subduer of enemies, overpowered Ravana and dismembered his ten left arms with his beak.

content: सञ्छिन्नबाहोस्सद्यैव बाहवस्सहसाभवन्।।3.51.39।।विषज्वालावलीयुक्ता वल्मीकादिव पन्नगाः।
explanation: As the left arms were cut off, there came out from them all the ten arms instantaneously like serpents emitting poisonous flames from anthills

content: ततः क्रोधाद्दशग्रीवस्सीतामुत्सृज्य रावणः।।3.51.40।।मुष्टिभ्यां चरणाभ्यां च गृध्रराजमपोथयत्।
explanation: Then the tenheaded Ravana left Sita and attacked Jatayu with his fists and feet out of anger.

content: ततो मुहूर्तं सङ्ग्रामो बभूवातुल्यवीर्ययोः।।3.51.41।।राक्षसानां च मुख्यस्य पक्षिणां प्रवरस्य च।
explanation: Between the warriors of unequal valour, Ravana and Jatayu, the chief of the demons and the foremost of the birds, the fight took place for a moment.

content: तस्य व्यायच्छमानस्य रामस्यार्थे स रावणः।।3.51.42।।पक्षौ पार्श्वौ च पादौ च खड्गमुद्धृत्य सोऽच्छिनत्।
explanation: Ravana lifted his sword and cut off both the wings and feet of Jatayu who was fighting relentlessly (for Rama's sake).

content: स च्छिन्नपक्षस्सहसा रक्षसा रौद्रकर्मणा।।3.51.43।।निपपात हतो गृद्रो धरण्यामल्पजीवितः।
explanation: (Seriously) wounded and almost dead,the vulture fell down on the ground all at once, when his wings were chipped by the demon of terrible deeds.

content: तं दृष्ट्वा पतितं भूमौ क्षतजार्द्रं जटायुषम्।।3.51.44।।अभ्यधावत वैदेही स्वबन्धुमिव दुःखिता।
explanation: Sita, princess of Videha, saw the wounded Jatayu fallen on the ground drenched in blood. Grieving, she ran towards him as if he was her relative.

content: तं नीलजीमूतनिकाशकल्पं सुपाण्डुरोरस्कमुदारवीर्यम्।ददर्श लङ्काधिपतिः पृथिव्यां जटायुषं शान्तमिवाग्निदावम्।।3.51.45।।
explanation: Lord of Lanka saw that very bold Jatayu of dark blue colour of the cloud, fair chest, fallen on the ground, looking like the forest fire that had been put out.

content: ततस्तु तं पत्ररथं महीतले निपातितं रावणवेगमर्दितम्।पुनः परिश्वज्य शशिप्रभानना रुरोद सीता जनकात्मजातदा।।3.51.46।।
explanation: Sita, daughter of Janaka, whose face was radiant like the Moon once again embraced  Jatayu, the winged warrior, fallen on the ground, crushed by Ravana's onslaught and wept.इतयार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyfirst sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Ravana carries away  Sita-- Sita calls out for Rama and Lakshmana again and again.]सा तु ताराधिपमुखी रावणेन समीक्ष्य तम्।गृध्रराजं विनिहतं विललाप सुदुःखिता।।3.52.1।।
explanation: Sita,whose face was like the lord of the stars (Moon), saw Jatayu, king of birds, struck down by Ravana, and lamented in extreme grif :

content: निमित्तं लक्षणज्ञानं शकुनिस्वरदर्शनम्।अवश्यं सुखदुःखेषु नराणां प्रतिदृश्यते।।3.52.2।।
explanation: People, for sure, foresee weal and woe in life from auspicious symptoms and ominous sounds.

content: नूनं राम न जानासि महद्व्यसनमात्मनः।धावन्ति नूनं काकुत्स्थं मदर्थं मृगपक्षिणः।।3.52.3।।
explanation: O Rama you are, indeed, unaware of the great disaster that has befallen you. All the animals and birds are running for my sake to tell you about me, O scion  of the Kakutsthas.

content: अयं हि पापचारेण मां त्रातुमभिसङ्गतः।शेते विनिहतो भूमौ ममाभाग्याद्विहंगमः।।3.52.4।।
explanation: 'This bird that came forward to save me is hit by the sinner(Ravana) and lies down on the ground, as ill luck would have it.

content: त्राहि मामद्य काकुत्स्थ लक्ष्मणेति वराङ्गना।सुसन्त्रस्ता समाक्रन्दच्छृण्वतां तु यथान्तिके।।3.52.5।।
explanation: Terribly frightened, the beautiful lady (Sita) cried bitterly, 'O Rama, O Lakshmana, save me', as if they were close by and were listening to her.

content: तां क्लिष्टमाल्याभरणां विलपन्तीमनाथवत्।अभ्यधावत् वैदेहीं रावणो राक्षसाधिपः।।3.52.6।।
explanation: Ravana, king of the demons, ran towards Sita who was weeping like an orphan with her garlands and ornaments crushed.

content: तां लतामिव वेष्टन्तीमालिङ्गन्तीं महाद्रुमान्।मुञ्च मुञ्चेति बहुशः प्रवदन्राक्षसाधिपः।।3.52.7।।क्रोशन्तीं राम रामेति रामेण रहितां वने।जीवितान्ताय केशेषु जग्राहान्तकसन्निभः।।3.52.8।।
explanation: Separated from Rama in the forest, Sita hugged huge trees, running round and round like a creeper coiled, crying loudly, 'Rama, O Rama' . The king of the demons, like Yama, caught hold of her hair only to invite his death, all the time saying, Leave it, Leave it  (Leave the tree).

content: प्रधर्षितायां सीतायां बभूव सचराचरम्।जगत्सर्वममर्यादं तमसान्धेन संवृतम्।।3.52.9।।न वाति मारुतस्तत्र निष्प्रभोऽभूद्दिवाकरः।
explanation: While Sita was being assaulted, the earth with the animate and the inanimate crossed all limits of moral law and became enveloped in blinding darkness. The wind  ceased to blow and the Sun, to shine.

content: दृष्ट्वा सीतां परामृष्टां दीनां दिव्येन चक्षुषा।।3.52.10।।कृतं कार्यमिति श्रीमान्व्याजहार पितामहः।
explanation: Brahma, the glorious Grandfather, saw with his divine eyes, Sita in a desperate state caught by the enemy and said, 'The task is accomplished.

content: प्रहृष्टा व्यथिताश्चासन्सर्वे ते परमर्षयः।।3.52.11।।दृष्ट्वा सीतां परामृष्टां दण्डकारण्यवासिनः।रावणस्य विनाशं च प्राप्तं बुद्ध्वा यदृच्छया।।3.52.12।।
explanation: All the great seers residing in Dandaka forest felt both happy and sad, happy because the destruction of Ravana is at hand and sad because Sita was in distress.

content: स तु तां राम रामेति रुदन्तीं लक्ष्मणेति च।जगामादाय चाकाशं रावणो राक्षसाधिपः।।3.52.13।।
explanation: While Sita was crying, 'O Rama, O Lakshmana', Ravana, lord of the demons, carried her back into the sky.

content: तप्ताभरणजुष्टाङ्गी पीतकौशेयवासिनी।रराजराजपुत्री तुविद्युत्सौदामिनी यथा।।3.52.14।।
explanation: SIta who had put on pure gold ornaments on her body and who was clad in yellow silk  shone like lightning.

content: उद्धूतेन च वस्त्रेण तस्याः पीतेन रावणः।अधिकं परिबभ्राज गिरिर्दीप्त इवाग्निना।।3.52.15।।
explanation: Ravana was shining all the more with(her) yellow clothes blowing in the air, and looked like a mountain shining with fire burning around.

content: तस्याः परमकल्याण्यास्ताम्राणि सुरभीणि च।पद्मपत्राणि वैदेह्या अभ्यकीर्यन्त रावणम्।।3.52.16।।
explanation: The red lotus petals worn by the most auspicious Sita, princess of Videha, were showered on Ravana.

content: तस्याः कौशेयमुद्धूतमाकाशे कनकप्रभम्।बभौ चादित्यरागेण ताम्रमभ्रमिवातपे।।3.52.17।।
explanation: As the goldencoloured garment worn by Sita blew in the wind, it looked like a coppercoloured cloud illumined by the evening Sun in the sky.

content: तस्यास्तत्सुनसं वक्त्रमाकाशे रावणाङ्कगम्।न रराज विना रामं विनालमिव पङ्कजम्।।3.52.18।।
explanation: Sita's face with her beautiful nose on Ravana's lap and not on Rama's, shone no more like a lotus without its stalk.

content: बभूव जलदं नीलं भित्त्वा चन्द्र इवोदितः।सुललाटं सुकेशान्तं पद्मगर्भाभमव्रणम्।।3.52.19।।शुक्लैस्सुविमलैर्दन्तै प्रभावद्भिरलङ्कृतम्।तस्यास्तद्विमलं वक्त्रमाकाशे रावणाङ्कगम्।।3.52.20।।रुदितं व्यपमृष्टास्रं चन्द्रवत्प्रियदर्शनम्।सुनासं चारुताम्रोष्ठमाकाशे हाटकप्रभम्।।3.52.21।।
explanation: Sita's face looked beautiful with her smooth forehead, shining hair and spotless complexion like the inside of a lotus, with clean, white, shining teeth, a nice nose and lovely red lips. She was continuously weeping and wiping her tears. Her face which was pleasing like the Moon on the lap of Ravana appeared as though the Moon was rising through dark clouds.

content: राक्षसेन समाधूतं तस्यास्तद्वदनं शुभम्।शुशुभे न विना रामंदिवा चन्द्र इवोदितः।।3.52.22।।
explanation: Shaken up by the demon and deprived of Rama's company, Sita's beautiful face looked like the Moon during daytime without any glow.

content: सा हेमवर्णा नीलाङ्गं मैथिली राक्षसाधिपम्।शुशुभे काञ्चनी काञ्ची नीलं मणिमिवाश्रिता।।3.52.23।।
explanation: Goldencomplexioned Sita, princess of Mithila, held by the darkcoloured king of the demons, shone like a girdle resting on a dark blue sapphire.

content: सा पद्मगौरी हेमाभा रावणं जनकात्मजा।विद्युद्घनमिवाविश्य शुशुभे तप्तभूषणा।।3.52.24।।
explanation: Bright like a golden lotus, adorned with gold ornaments, Sita, the daughter of Janaka, held by Ravana, looked like a streak of lightning shining bright in a dark cloud.

content: तस्या भूषणघोषेण वैदेह्या राक्षसाधिपः।बभौ सचपलो नीलस्सघोष इव तोयदः।।3.52.25।।
explanation: The lord of the demons by the side of Sita, princess of Videha with her jingling ornaments looked like the darkblue raincloud with its lightning and thunder.

content: उत्तमाङ्गाच्च्युता तस्याः पुष्पवृष्टिस्समन्ततः।सीताया ह्रिममाणायाः पपात धरणीतले।।3.52.26।।
explanation: As Sita was being carried away, the shower of flowers dropped from her head and scattered on the earth.

content: सा तु रावणवेगेन पुष्पवृष्टिः समन्ततः।समाधूता दशग्रीवं पुनरेवाभ्यवर्तत।।3.52.27।।
explanation: The shower of flowers that fell flew towards the tenheaded Ravana again in the swirling motion (of the chariot).

content: अभ्यवर्तत पुष्पाणां धारा वैश्रवणानुजम्।नक्षत्रमाला विमला मेरुं नगमिवोन्नतम्।।3.52.28।।
explanation: The shower of flowers that dropped went round towards Ravana, brother of Vaisravana, like the bright garland of stars move towards mount Meru.

content: चरणान्नूपुरं भ्रष्टं वैदेह्या रत्नभूषितम्।विद्युन्मण्डलसङ्काशं पपात मधुरस्वनम्।।3.52.29।।
explanation: The gemstudded anklet of Sita, looking like an orb of lightning, dropped with a gentle sound.

content: तरुप्रवालरक्ता सा नीलाङ्गं राक्षसेश्वरम्।प्राशोभयत वैदेही गजं कक्ष्येव काञ्चनी।।3.52.30।।
explanation: With her golden girdle, Sita whose complexion resembled tender leaves looked like a golden chain to bind an elephant with. (Here Ravana is the elephant).

content: तां महोल्कामिवाकाशे दीप्यमानां स्वतेजसा।जहाराऽकाशमाविस्य सीतां वैश्रवणानुजः।।3.52.31।।
explanation: The younger brother of Vaisravana (Ravana), like a massive comet, carried Sita, who was glowing in the radiance of her own beauty, and entered the sky.

content: तस्यास्तान्यग्निवर्णानि भूषणानि महीतले।सघोषाण्यवकीर्यन्त क्षीणास्तारा इवाम्बरात्।।3.52.32।।
explanation: Like the dim stars falling from the sky, her ornaments, bright as flame, scattered on the groundtinkling.

content: तस्यास्स्तनान्तराद्भ्रष्टो हारस्ताराधिपद्युतिः।वैदेह्या निपतन्भाति गङ्गेव गगनाच्च्युता।।3.52.33।।
explanation: Sita's necklace shining like the bright Moon slipped from between her breasts like the river Ganga falling down from the sky.

content: उत्पातवाताभिहता नानाद्विजगणायुताः।माभैरिति विधूताग्रा व्याजह्रुरिव पादपाः।।3.52.34।।
explanation: The trees filled with birds of all kinds, shaken at the top by stormy winds seemed to be saying to Sita, 'Be not afraid'.

content: नलिन्यो ध्वस्तकमलास्त्रस्तमीनजलेचराः।सखीमिव गतोच्छ्वासामन्वशोचन्त मैथिलीम्।।3.52.35।।
explanation: Lotusponds with withering lotuses and with disturbed aquatic life like fishes in fright were as if grieving for Sita as one would grieve for a companion who is unable to breathe.

content: समन्तादभिसम्पत्य सिंहव्याघ्रमृगद्विजाः।अन्वधावंस्तदा रोषात्सीतां छायानुगामिनः।।3.52.36।।
explanation: Then the lions, tigers, deer and birds gathered together in anger (also anguish) and ran after Sita's shadow.

content: जलप्रपातास्रमुखाश्शृङ्गैरुच्छ्रितबाहुभिः।सीतायां ह्रियमाणायां विक्रोशन्तीव पर्वताः।।3.52.37।।
explanation: The  mountains were  shedding tears in the form of waterfalls, and  crying with hands lifted up in the form of peaks, while Sita was being carried away.

content: ह्रियमाणां तु वैदेहीं दृष्ट्वा दीनो दिवाकरः।प्रतिध्वस्तप्रभश्श्रीमानासीत्पाण्डरमण्डलः।।3.52.38।।
explanation: Seeing Sita abducted, the glorious Sun looked lustreless and distraught. He developed a pale white disk around him.

content: नास्ति धर्मः कुतस्सत्यं नार्जवं नानृशंसता।यत्र रामस्य वैदेहीं भार्यां हरति रावणः।।3.52.39।।इति सर्वाणि भूतानि गणशः पर्यदेवयन्।
explanation: When Rama's consort, the princess of Videha, is being carried away by Ravana, how can there be rightousness or truth or uprightness or compassion for men? Thus bewailed all beings in groups.

content: वित्रस्तका दीनमुखा रुरुदुर्मृगपोतकाः।।3.52.40।।उद्वीक्ष्योद्वीक्ष्य नयनैरस्रपाताविलेक्षणाः।
explanation: The young deer full of fear and distress looked again and again with eyes blurred with tears at the direction in which Sita went. And wept.

content: सुप्रवेपितगात्राश्च बभूवुर्वनदेवताः।।3.52.41।।विक्रोशन्तीं दृढं सीतां दृष्ट्वा दुःखं तथा गताम्।
explanation: The  sylvan deities shivered, seeing Sita's grief and cried aloud.

content: तां तु लक्ष्मण रामेति क्रोशन्तीं मधुरस्वरम्।।3.52.42।।अवेक्षमाणां बहुशो वैदेहीं धरणीतलम्।स तामाकुलकेशान्तां विप्रमृष्टविशेषकाम्।।3.52.43।।जहारात्म विनाशाय दशग्रीवो मनस्स्विनीम्।
explanation: The ten headed Ravana abducted Sita who was calling out, O Rama, O Lakshmana with her sweet voice, weeping , looking down on the earth her hair dishevelled and auspicious, (vermilion) mark on the forehead erased. Ravana abducted this highminded Sita for his own destruction.

content: ततस्तु सा चारुदती शुचिस्मिता विनाकृता बन्धुजनेन मैथिली।अपश्यती राघवलक्ष्मणावुभौ विवर्णवक्त्राभयभारपीडिता।।3.52.44।।
explanation: Then Sita  whose teeth were  beautiful and smile, sweet was distanced from her kins, and, unable to see both Rama and Lakshmana, grew pale in intense fear.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे द्विपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftysecond sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Sita reproaches Ravana--pleads, threatens Ravana with dire consequences.]खमुत्पतन्तं तं दृष्ट्वा मैथिली जनकात्मजा।दुःखिता परमोद्विग्ना भये महति वर्तिनी।।3.53.1।।
explanation: Sita, daughter of Janaka, princess of Mithila felt miserable, looking at Ravana taking off and got very  much agitated out of fear.

content: रोषरोदनताम्राक्षी भीमाक्षं राक्षसाधिपम्।रुदन्ती करुणं सीता ह्रियमाणेदमब्रवीत्।।3.53.2।।
explanation: While being carried away, Sita wept piteously and her eyes went red with tears of anger and grief. Looking at the frightening eyes of the king of the demons, she said these words :

content: न व्यपत्रपसे नीच कर्मणानेन रावण।ज्ञात्वा विरहितां यन्मां चोरयित्वा पलायसे।।3.53.3।।
explanation: O mean Ravana, are you not ashamed of kidnapping me when I was separated (from my husband)?

content: त्वयैव नूनं दुष्टात्मन् भीरुणा हर्तुमिच्छता।ममापवाहितो भर्ता मृगरूपेण मायया।।3.53.4।।
explanation: O wicked fellow, with an intention to abduct me you enticed my husband to a distance deceitfully in the form of a deer.

content: यो हि मामुद्यतस्त्रातुं सोऽप्ययं विनिपातितः।गृध्रराजः पुराणोऽसौ श्वशुरस्य सखा मम।।3.53.5।।
explanation: This Jatayu, an old friend of my fatherinlaw tried to protect me but he too has fallen a prey.

content: परमं खलु ते वीर्यं दृश्यते राक्षसाधम।विश्राव्य नामधेयं हि युद्धे नास्मि जिता त्वया।।3.53.6।।
explanation: O lowly demon, you have, indeed, shown your heroism  (in killing this old vulture). You have not won me in a battle declared by you.

content: ईदृशं गर्हितं कर्म कथं कृत्वा न लज्जसे।स्त्रियाश्च हरणं नीच रहिते च परस्य च।।3.53.7।।
explanation: O lowly fellow how is it that you are not ashamed of commiting such a despicable act  abducting another's wife when she is alone ?

content: कथयिष्यन्ति लोकेषु पुरुषाः कर्म कुत्सितम्।सुनृशंसमधर्मिष्ठं तव शौण्डीर्यमानिनः।।3.53.8।।
explanation: You consider yourself to be brave after committing such a cruel, despicable and unrighteous act for which people of the world will condemn you.

content: धिक्ते शौर्यं च सत्त्वं च यत्त्वं कथितवांस्तदा।कुलाक्रोशकरं लोके धिक्ते चारित्रमीदृशम्।।3.53.9।।
explanation: Fie upon your heroism and strength about which you boasted. Fie upon your character that would bring calumny to the race and the world. I condemn such behaviour of yours.

content: किं कर्तुं शक्यमेवं हि यज्जवेनैव धावसि।मुहूर्तमपि तिष्ठस्व न जीवन्प्रतियास्यसि।।3.53.10।।
explanation: Tarry a little, you will not go back with life. What can be done now since you are running away so swiftly?

content: न हि चक्षुष्पथं प्राप्य तयोः पार्थिवपुत्रयोः।ससैन्योऽपि समर्थस्त्वं मुहूर्तमपि जीवितुम्।।3.53.11।।
explanation: If you come within sight of these two princes, it will not be possible for you to live for a moment even if you are with your entire army.

content: न त्वं तयोश्शरस्पर्शं सोढुं शक्तः कथञ्चन।वने प्रज्वलितस्येव स्पर्शमग्नेर्विहंगमः।।3.53.12।।
explanation: Just as a bird cannot bear the touch of forest fire, you will not be able to endure the mere touch of arrows of the two heroes indeed.

content: साधु कुर्वाऽऽत्मनः पथ्यं साधु मां मुञ्च रावण।मत्प्रधर्षणरुष्टो हि भ्रात्रा सह पतिर्मम।।3.53.13।।विधास्यति विनाशाय त्वं मां यदि न मुञ्चसि।
explanation: O Ravana be good and do whatever is beneficial to you. It is proper for you to release me. If you do not, enraged over my assault, my husband along with his brother, will bring about your destruction.

content: येन त्वं व्यवसायेन बलान्मां हर्तुमिच्छसि।।3.53.14।।व्यवसायस्स ते नीच भविष्यति निरर्थकः।
explanation: O vile creature, the effort you are making to abduct me forcibly will be fruitless.

content: न ह्यहं तमपश्यन्ती भर्तारं विबुधोपमम्।।3.53.15।।उत्सहे शत्रुवशगा प्राणान्धारयितुं चिरम्।
explanation: I will not be eager to hold on to my life for long to live at the mercy of the enemy without being able to see my godlike husband.

content: न नूनं चात्मनः पथ्यं श्रेयो वा समवेक्षसे।।3.53.16।।मृत्युकाले यथा मर्त्यो विपरीतानि सेवते।
explanation: At the time of death, mortals behave very differently. They act contrary to their own welfare. Likewise you are not able to foresee what is beneficial and good for you.

content: मुमूर्षूणां हि सर्वेषां यत्पथ्यं तन्न रोचते।।3.53.17।।पश्याम्यद्य हि कण्ठेत्वां कालपाशावपाशितम्।
explanation: Those who wish to die, do not like anything salutary. I see the noose of death wound round your neck now.

content: यथा चास्मिन्भयस्थाने न बिभेषि दशानन।।3.53.18।।व्यक्तं हिरण्मयान् हि त्वं सम्पश्यसि महीरुहान्।
explanation: O tenheaded Ravana, since you do not fear the source of fear, evidently you see golden trees. (a symptom of death).

content: नदीं वैतरणीं घोरां रुधिरौघनिवाहिनीम्।।3.53.19।।असिपत्रवनं चैव भीमं पश्यसि रावण।
explanation: O Ravana, you see the dreadful river Vaitarani with torrents of blood flowing and frightening forest of trees with swords as leaves.

content: तप्तकाञ्चनपुष्पां च वैडूर्यप्रवरच्छदाम्।।3.53.20।।द्रक्ष्यसे शाल्मलीं तीक्ष्णामायसैः कण्टकैश्चिताम्।
explanation: You will see a log of salmali tree with bright golden flowers and excellent vaidurya stone with pointed iron thorns.

content: न हि त्वमीदृशं कृत्वा तस्यालीकं महात्मनः।।3.53.21।।धरितुं शक्ष्यसि चिरं विषं पीत्वेव निर्घृणः।
explanation: You are pitiless. You will not be able to survive for long after deceiving such noble Rama just as man cannot survive after drinking poison.

content: बद्धस्त्वं कालपाशेन दुर्निवारेण रावण।।3.53.22।।क्वगतो लप्स्यसे शर्म भर्तुर्मम महात्मनः।
explanation: O Ravana you are bound by the inevitable noose of death. Where shall you get away from great Rama, my husband to obtain peace.

content: निमेषान्तरमात्रेण विना भ्रात्रा महावने।।3.53.23।।राक्षसा निहता येन सहस्राणि चतुर्दश।स कथं राघवो वीरस्सर्वास्त्रकुशलो बली।।3.53.24।।न त्वां हन्याच्छरैस्तीक्ष्णैरिष्टभार्यापहारिणम्।
explanation: Rama has killed fourteen thousand demons alone without his brother within a moment. He is a strong warrior and wellversed in the use of all kinds of weapons. You have stolen his loving wife. How can he live without killing you.

content: तच्चान्यच्च परुषं वैदेही रावणाङ्कगा।।3.53.25।।भयशोकसमाविष्टा करुणं विललाप ह।
explanation: Sita, daughter of Videha, full of sorrow and fear under Ravana's grip uttered these partly harsh and partly piteous wordsweeping.

content: तथा भृशार्तां बहुचैव भाषिणीं विलापपूर्वं करुणं च भामिनीम्।जहार पापः करुणं विचेष्टतीं नृपात्मजामागतगात्रवेपथुम्।।3.53.26।।
explanation: Sinful Ravana carried away the beautiful princess trembling with great fear, struggling helplessly, crying pathetically and pleading in many mournful ways.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे त्रिपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftythird sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Sita puls a few ornaments in bundles and throws them down in the midst of vanaras-- she hopes somebody will communicate this to Rama.]ह्रियमाणा तु वैदेही कञ्चिन्नाथमपश्यती।ददर्श गिरिशृङ्गस्थान्पञ्च वानरपुङ्गवान्।।3.54.1।।
explanation: While Sita was being kidnapped, she saw no one to protect her. Only five great monkeys stood on the top of a mountain.

content: तेषां मध्ये विशालाक्षी कौशेयं कनकप्रभम्।उत्तरीयं वरारोहा शुभान्याभरणानि च।।3.54.2।।मुमोच यदि रामाय शंसेयुरिति मैथिली।
explanation: Largeeyed, bright and beautiful Sita dropped her upper silk garment shining like gold and auspicious ornaments in their midst with a hope they may report this  to Rama.

content: वस्त्रमुत्सृज्य तन्मध्ये निक्षिप्तं सहभूषणम्।।3.54.3।।सम्भ्रमात्तु दशग्रीवस्तत्कर्म न स बुद्धवान्।
explanation: In his excitement Ravana failed to notice when Sita dropped down that garment along with ornaments in their midst.

content: पिङ्गाक्षास्तां विशालाक्षीं नेत्रैरनिमिषैरिव।।3.54.4।।विक्रोशन्तीं तथा सीतां ददृशुर्वानरर्षभाः।
explanation: The best among the tawneyeyed monkeys gazed, without blinking, at the  largeeyed Sita lamenting.

content: स च पम्पामतिक्रम्य लङ्कामभिमुखः पुरीम्।।3.54.5।।जगाम रुदतीं गृह्य वैदेहीं राक्षसेश्वरः।
explanation: Ravana crossed the lake Pampa and flew towards the city of Lanka carrying with him lamenting daughter of Videha.

content: तां जहार सुसंहृष्टो रावणो मृत्युमात्मनः।।3.54.6।।उत्सङ्गेनेव भुजगीं तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्रां महाविषाम्।
explanation: Delighted Ravana, carried off Sita, the very embodiment of his death, like one carrying a highly poisonous sharpfanged female snake on his lap.

content: वनानि सरितश्शैलांत्सरांसि च विहायसा।।3.54.7।।स क्षिप्रं समतीयाय शरश्चापादिव च्युतः।
explanation: Like an arrow released from the bow, Ravana went through the sky, at once crossing forests, rivers mountains and tanks.

content: तिमिनक्रनिकेतं तु वरुणालयमक्षयम्।।3.54.8।।सरितां शरणं गत्वा समतीयाय सागरम्।
explanation: Ravana soon crossed the refuge of rivers, the abode of Varuna, god of the sea, inexhaustible ocean, and the home for whales and crocodiles.

content: सम्भ्रमात्परिवृत्तोर्मी रुद्धमीनमहोरगः।।3.54.9।।वैदेह्यां ह्रियमाणायां बभूव वरुणालयः।
explanation: While Sita, princess of Videha was being carried away, the ocean, abode of Varuna  got bewildered, waves rolled back, the movement of big serpents and fishes stopped.

content: अन्तरिक्षगता वाचस्ससृजुश्चारणास्तदा।।3.54.10।।एतदन्तो दशग्रीव इति सिद्धास्तदाब्रुवन्।
explanation: The charanas and siddhas moving in the sky said, O tenheaded Ravana this is your  end .

content: स तु सीतां विवेष्टन्तीमङ्केनादाय रावणः।।3.54.11।।प्रविवेश पुरीं लङ्कां रूपिणीं मृत्युमात्मनः।
explanation: Ravana entered the city of Lanka holding Sita who was tossing from side to side and who was the very embodiment of his death.

content: सोऽभिगम्य पुरीं लङ्कां सुविभक्तमहापथाम्।।3.54.12।।संरूढकक्ष्याबहुलं स्वमन्तःपुरमाविशत्।
explanation: Ravana went through the well laidout roads of the city of Lanka and through the well many guarded halls of the palace and entered the inner apartment.

content: तत्र तामसितापाङ्गां शोकमोहपरायणाम्।।3.54.13।।निदधे रावणस्सीतां मयो मायामिवस्त्रियम्।
explanation: Sita, with her dark eye lashes and lost in utter sorrow was kept in the harem by Ravana, like demon Maya kept Mayamayi.

content: अब्रवीच्च दशग्रीवः पिशाचीर्घोरदर्शनाः।।3.54.14।।यथा नेमां पुमान् स्त्री वा सीतां पश्यत्यसम्मतः।
explanation: Ravana ordered the female goblins of fearful appearance,'Let no outsider whether man or woman, see her, without my permission'.

content: मुक्तामणिसुवर्णानि वस्त्राण्याभरणानि च।।3.54.15।।यद्यदिच्छेत्तदेवास्या देयं मच्छन्दतो यथा।
explanation: Pearls, gems or gold, clothes or ornaments, whatever she desires, be made available to her without any hesitation.

content: या च वक्ष्यति वैदेहीं वचनं  किञ्चिदप्रियम्।।3.54.16।।अज्ञानाद्यदि वा ज्ञानान्न तस्या जीवितं प्रियम्।
explanation: Whoever utters any unpleasant words knowingly or unknowingly to Sita, princess of Videha is not worthy to survive (must be killed).

content: तथोक्त्वा राक्षसीस्तास्तु राक्षसेन्द्रः प्रतापवान्।।3.54.17।।निष्क्रम्यान्तः पुरात्तस्मात्किंकृत्यमिति चिन्तयन्।ददर्शाष्टौ महावीर्यान्राक्षसान्पिशिताशनान्।।3.54.18।।
explanation: The courageous lord of the demons, having said so to the demonesses, came out of the inner apartment. While contemplating the future course of action, he saw eight powerful, carnivorous demons.

content: स तान्दृष्ट्वा महावीर्यो वरदानेन मोहितः।उवाचैतानिदं वाक्यं प्रशस्य बलवीर्यतः।।3.54.19।।
explanation: The mighty Ravana, deluded by the boons, praised the strength and valour of the demons and said :

content: नानाप्रहरणाः क्षिप्रमितो गच्छत सत्वराः।जनस्थानं हतस्थानं भूतपूर्वं खरालयम्।।3.54.20।।
explanation: Armed with different weapons, proceed at once to Janasthana where Khara lived and died.

content: तत्रोष्यतां जनस्थाने शून्ये निहतराक्षसे।पौरुषं बलमाश्रित्य त्रासमुत्सृज्य दूरतः।।3.54.21।।
explanation: Go and there in the desolate Janasthana where all demons had been killed, leaving all your apprehensions and relying on your strength and vigour.

content: बलं हि सुमहद्यन्मे जनस्थाने निवेशितम्।सदूषणखरं युद्धे हतं रामेण सायकैः।।3.54.22।।
explanation: I had stationed a great army at Janasthana, who were all killed along with Khara and Dusana by Rama's arrows.

content: तत क्रोधो ममामर्षाद्धैर्यस्योपरि वर्तते।वैरं च सुमहज्जातं रामं प्रति सुदारुणम्।।3.54.23।।
explanation: My anger engineered by my intolerance has crossed the limits of my patience. It has created in me a terrific enmity against Rama.

content: निर्यातयितुमिच्छामि तच्च वैरमहं रिपोः।न हि लप्स्याम्यहं निद्रामहत्वा संयुगे रिपुम्।।3.54.24।।
explanation: I want to take revenge on my foe. I shall not sleep until I kill him in a combat.

content: तं त्विदानीमहं हत्वा खरदूषणघातिनम्।रामं शर्मोपलप्स्यामि धनं लब्ध्वेव निर्धनः।।3.54.25।।
explanation: I will be happy only after killing the destroyer of Khara and Dusana, just as a poor man feels happy only on acquiring wealth.

content: जनस्थाने वसद्भिस्तु भवद्भीराममाश्रिता।प्रवृत्तिरुपनेतव्या किञ्करोतीति तत्त्वतः।।3.54.26।।
explanation: While dwelling at Janasthana, all of you should collect exact information about the activities of Rama.

content: अप्रमादाच्च गन्तव्यं सर्वैरपि निशाचरैः।कर्तव्यश्च सदा यत्नो राघवस्य वधं प्रति।।3.54.27।।
explanation: All of you, O nightrangers, should be on the alert there and it should be always your duty to try to kill Rama.

content: युष्माकं च बलज्ञोऽहं बहुशो रणमूर्धनि।अतश्चास्मिन् जनस्थाने मया यूयं नियोजिताः।।3.54.28।।
explanation: I have seen your strength on many war fronts. That is why you have been assigned this  duty at Janasthana.

content: ततः प्रियं वाक्यमुपेत्य राक्षसा महार्थमष्टावभिवाद्य रावणम्।विहाय लङ्कां सहिताः प्रतस्थिरे यतो जनस्थानमलक्ष्यदर्शनाः।।3.54.29।।
explanation: The eight demons were glad to hear the pleasing and meaningful words of Ravana. They offered him salutations and left Lanka in the direction of Janasthana without being seen by any one.

content: ततस्तु सीतामुपलभ्य रावणः सुसम्प्रहृष्टः परिगृह्य मैथिलीम्।प्रसज्य रामेण च वैरमुत्तमं बभूव मोहान्मुदितस्सराक्षसः।।3.54.30।।
explanation: Then the demon Ravana felt greatly happy for getting Sita, princess of Mithila, without knowing in his delusion that he had created the bitterest enmity with Rama.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वामलीकीये आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे चतुःपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyfourth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Ravana takes Sita to his palace -- shows her round the mansion, the wealth, attendants etc. to lure her -- persuades her to accept him.]सन्दिश्य राक्षसान्घोरान् रावणोऽष्टौ महाबलान्।आत्मानं बुद्धिवैक्लब्यात्कृतकृत्यममन्यत।।3.55.1।।
explanation: After ordering the eight most fierce  and powerful demons, Ravana had a sense of accomplishment within himself because of his perverse intellect.

content: स चिन्तयानो वैदेहीं कामबाणसमर्पितः।प्रविवेश गृहं रम्यं सीतां द्रष्टुमभित्वरन्।।3.55.2।।
explanation: Thinking about Vaidehi and hit by the arrows of Cupid (the god of love). Ravana hastened to see Sita and entered the beautiful home.

content: स प्रविश्य तु तद्वेश्म रावणो राक्षसाधिपः।अपश्यद्राक्षसीमध्ये सीतां शोकपरायणाम्।।3.55.3।।
explanation: Ravana, lord of the demons, entered his residence and saw Sita full of grief in the midst of the demonesses.

content: अश्रुपूर्णमुखीं दीनां शोकभाराभिपीडिताम्।वायुवेगैरिवाक्रान्तां मज्जन्तीं नावमर्णवे।।3.55.4।।मृगयूथपरिभ्रष्टां मृगीं श्वभिरिवावृताम्।अधोमुखमुखीं सीतामभ्येत्य च निशाचरः।।3.55.5।।तां तु शोकपरां दीनामवशां राक्षसाधिपः।स बलाद्दर्शयामास गृहं देवगृहोपमम्।।3.55.6।।
explanation: The demon Ravana forcibly took Sita, her face full of tears, to show her his heavenlike home. Inflicted with grief she looked wretched. She resembled a female deer hounded out of the herd. With her head bent in grief, she looked pathetic like one not under her control, like a boat sinking under the sea driven by the wind.

content: हर्म्यप्रासादसम्बाधं स्त्रीसहस्रनिषेवितम्।नानापक्षिगणैर्जुष्टं नानारत्नसमन्वितम्।।3.55.7।।दान्तकैस्तापनीयैश्च स्फाटिकै राजतैरपि।वज्रवैडूर्यचित्रैश्च स्तम्भैर्दृष्टिमनोहरैः।।3.55.8।।दिव्यदुन्दुभिनिर्ह्रादं तप्तकाञ्चनतोरणम्।
explanation: His home was a complex of palaces and mansions served by thousands of women. It was an abode of different flocks of birds. It had captivating pillars studded with gold, crystals, silver, diamonds and vaiduryas. It resounded with wonderful sounds of drums. Its golden entrances were glittering.

content: सोपानं काञ्चनं चित्रमारुरोह तया सह।।3.55.9।।दान्तका राजताश्चैव गवाक्षाः प्रियदर्शनाः।हेमजालावताश्चासन्स्तत्र प्रासादपङ्क्तयः।।3.55.10।।
explanation: He ascended the wonderful golden staircase taking Sita along with him.Beautiful looked the rows of mansions with silver and ivory windows and golden trellis.

content: सुधामणिविचित्राणि भूमिभागानि सर्वशः।दशग्रीवस्स्वभवने प्रादर्शयत मैथिलीम्।।3.55.11।।
explanation: The tenheaded Ravana showed Sita, the princess from Mithila the floors with wonderful crystals.

content: दीर्घिकाः पुष्करिण्यश्च नानावृक्षसमन्विताः।रावणो दर्शयामास सीतां शोकपरायणाम्।।3.55.12।।
explanation: Ravana showed Sita who was overwhelmed with sorrow, stepwells surrrounded by various trees and tanks.

content: दर्शयित्वा तु वैदेह्याः कृत्स्नं तद्भवनोत्तमम्।उवाच वाक्यं पापात्मा सीतां लोभितुमिच्छया।।3.55.13।।
explanation: The sinful Ravana showed Sita, princess of Videha, the best of all his mansions in order to allure her, saying:

content: दश राक्षसकोट्यश्च द्वाविंशतिरथापराः।तेषां प्रभुरहं सीते सर्वेषां भीमकर्मणाम्।।3.55.14।।वर्जयित्वा जरावृद्धान्बालांश्च रजनीचरान्।
explanation: O Sita, leaving aside children and the aged, I am the lord of crores of nightrangers in addition to ten crore demons and twentytwo crore terrorists.

content: सहस्रमेकमेकस्य मम कार्यपुरस्सरम्।।3.55.15।।यदिदं राजतन्त्रं मे त्वयि सर्वं प्रतिष्ठितम्।जीवितं च विशालाक्षि त्वं मे प्राणैर्गरीयसी।।3.55.16।।
explanation: For me alone there are a thousand attendants.The  administration of the kingdom and all my subjects will be under your control. O largeeyed Sita you are dearer to me than my life.

content: बहूनांस्त्रीसहस्राणां मम योऽसौ परिग्रहः।तासां त्वमीश्वरा सीते मम भार्या भव प्रिये।।3.55.17।।
explanation: O Sita dear  be my chief queen among the many thousands of women I have married.

content: साधु किं तेऽन्यया बुद्ध्या रोचयस्व वचो मम।भजस्वमाभितप्तस्य प्रसादं कर्तुमर्हसि।।3.55.18।।
explanation: Do not think otherwise. Be good and accept my request. I am consumed by thoughts of you. You should be gracious to me.

content: परिक्षिप्ता समुद्रेण लङ्केयं शतयोजना।नेयं धर्षयितुं शक्या सेन्द्रैरपि सुरासुरैः।।3.55.19।।
explanation: This Lanka extending to a hundred yojanas and surrounded by the sea is vulnerable to neither demons nor gods including Indra.

content: न देवेषु न यक्षेषु न गन्धर्वेषु पक्षिषु।अहं पश्यामि लोकेषु यो मे वीर्यसमो भवेत्।।3.55.20।।
explanation: I do not see any one equal to me in valour among gods, or yakshas or gandharvas or birds.

content: राज्यभ्रष्टेन दीनेन तापसेन गतायुषा।किं करिष्यसि रामेण मानुषेणाल्पतेजसा।।3.55.21।।
explanation: Of what use is Rama who has lost his kingdom, who is depressed and leads an ascetic life and who is a shortlived, lacklustre human being.

content: भजस्व सीते मामेव भर्ताहं सदृशस्तव।यौवनं ह्यध्रुवं भीरु रमस्वेह मया सह।।3.55.22।।
explanation: O Sita take refuge only in me. I am a befitting husband to you. O timid one youth is impermanent. Enjoy (your life) with me while it lasts.

content: दर्शने माकृथा बुद्धिं राघवस्य वरानने।कास्य शक्तिरिहागन्तुमपि सीते मनोरथैः।।3.55.23।।
explanation: O lovely Sita, give up the thought of seeing Rama. Where does he possess the power to reach this place even on the mental plane ?

content: न शक्यो वायुराकाशे पाशैर्बद्धुं महाजवः।दीप्यमानस्य वाप्यग्नेर्गृहीतुं विमलां शिखाम्।।3.55.24।।
explanation: It is not possible to bind  the wind blowing at high speed in the sky. Similarly it is not possible to catch the brilliant glow of flaming fire.

content: त्रयाणामपि लोकानां न तं पश्यामि शोभने।विक्रमेण नयेद्यस्त्वां मद्बाहुपरिपालिताम्।।3.55.25।।
explanation: O lovely lady, I do not see any one in these three worlds who can, by his valour, take you away from me guarded by my arms.

content: लङ्कायां सुमहद्राज्यमिदं त्वमनुपालय।त्वत्प्रेष्या मद्विधाश्चैव देवाश्चापि चराचराः।।3.55.26।।
explanation: Rule this vast kingdom of Lanka. People like me, even gods and all beings, mobile and immobile, will be at your beck and call.

content: अभिषेकोदकक्लिन्ना तुष्टा च रमयस्व माम्।दुष्कृतं यत्परा कर्म वनवासेन तद्गतम्।।3.55.27।।यश्च ते सुकृतो धर्मस्तस्येह फलमाप्नुहि।
explanation: Drenched with the waters of consecration, entertain me. The effect of the bad deeds done in the past are over with your dwelling in the forest. Now enjoy the fruits  of your  good and righteous deeds here with me.

content: इह माल्यानि सर्वाणि दिव्यगन्धानि मैथिलि।।3.55.28।।भूषणानि च मुख्यानि सेवस्व च मया सह।।
explanation: O princess from Mithila, put on all garlands of wonderful fragrance and finest of jewels here with me.

content: पुष्पकं नाम सुश्रोणि भ्रातुर्वैश्रवणस्य मे।।3.55.29।।विमानं सूर्यसङ्काशं तरसा निर्जितं मया।
explanation: O finehipped lady, I won by my strength from my brother Vaisravana (Kubera) an aerial chariot called Pushpaka shining with the radiance of the Sun.

content: विशालं रमणीयं च तद्विमानमनुत्तम्।।3.55.30।।तत्र सीते मया सार्धं विहरस्व यथासुखम्।
explanation: O Sita that excellent chariot is big and beautiful. Where on you can roam happily along with me.

content: वदनं पद्मसङ्काशममलं चारुदर्शनम्।शोकार्तंतु वरारोहे न भ्राजति वरानने।।3.55.31।।
explanation: O heavyhipped lady your face which is a clean lotus pleasing to the eye has lost its shine, stricken with grief.

content: एवं वदति तस्मित्सा वस्त्रान्तेन वराङ्गना।पिधायेन्दुनिभं सीता मुखमश्रूण्यवर्तयत्।।3.55.32।।
explanation: As Ravana went on speaking thus, Sita covered her beautiful, moonlike face with the edge of her garment and stood shedding tears.

content: ध्यायन्तीं तामिवास्वस्थां दीनां चिन्ताहतप्रभाम्।उवाच वचनं पापो रावणो राक्षसेश्वरः।।3.55.33।।
explanation: While Sita was lost in thought, feeling ill at lase, looking wretched with her beauty dulled by her anxiety, the sinful lord of the demons continued :

content: अलं व्रीडेन वैदेहि धर्मलोपकृतेन च।।3.55.34।।आर्षोऽयं दैवनिष्यन्दो यस्त्वामभिगमिष्यति।
explanation: O Sita you need not feel shamed that it is a violation of righteous conduct. Take it as godsend which has the approval of sages.

content: एतौ पादौ मया स्निग्धौ शिरोभिः परिपीडितौ।।3.55.35।।प्रसादं कुरु मे क्षिप्रं वश्यो दासोऽहमस्मिते।
explanation: I am bowing down, pressing my heads at your shining feet. I am at your mercy. Grant me your favourI will remain your slave and remain ever under your control.

content: इमाश्शून्य मया वाचश्शुष्यमाणेन भाषिताः।।3.55.36।।न चापि रावणः काञ्चिन्मूर्ध्ना स्त्रीं प्रणमेत ह।
explanation: My throat has dried up. I have spoken these words in a forlorn state. Ravana has never bowed down to a woman in obeisance.

content: एवमुक्त्वा दशग्रीवो मैथिलीं जनकात्मजाम्।।3.55.37।।कृतान्तवशमापन्नो ममेयमिति मन्यते।
explanation: Having said this to the daughter of Janaka, the tenheaded Ravana who had fallen under the control of Yama, lord of death, misconceived that she had become his own.इतयार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे पञ्चपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyfifth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Sita ridicules Ravana-- not willing to reply directly speaks to a blade of grass about Rama's might and Ravana's destruction-- Ravana sends Sita to Asoka garden.]सा तथोक्ता तु वैदेही निर्भया शोककर्शिता।तृणमन्तरतः कृत्वा रावणं प्रत्यभाषत।।3.56.1।।
explanation: Thus addressed by Ravana, Sita, immersed in deep sorrow and unafraid of him, placed  a blade of grass between her and him (intending not to speak to him  straight) and replied:

content: राजा दशरथो नाम धर्मसेतुरिवाचलः।सत्यसन्धः परिज्ञातो यस्य पुत्रस्सराघवः।।3.56.2।।
explanation: Rama is a son of  the renowned king Dasaratha, who was a firm ambankment (protector) of righteousness and was true to his promise.

content: रामो नाम स धर्मात्मा त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुतः।दीर्घबाहुर्विशालाक्षो दैवतं हि पतिर्मम।।3.56.3।।
explanation: The longarmed, largeeyed Rama is famous in all the three worlds. He is my husband, a righteous soul and a god to all.

content: इक्ष्वाकूणां कुले जातस्सिंहस्कन्धो महाद्युतिः।लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा यस्ते प्राणान्हरिष्यति।।3.56.4।।
explanation: The brilliant Rama of the Ikshvaku dynasty with the lion's shoulders will come with his brother Lakshmana and take away your life.

content: प्रत्यक्षं यद्यहं तस्य त्वया स्यां धर्षिता बलात्।शयिता त्वं हतस्संख्ये जनस्थाने यथा खरः।।3.56.5।।
explanation: Had you abducted me forcibly in his presence, you would have been lying down dead just as Khara in Janasthana.

content: य एते राक्षसाः प्रोक्ता घोररूपा महाबलाः।राघवे निर्विषास्सर्वे सुपर्णे पन्नगा यथा।।3.56.6।।
explanation: Those dreadful, mighty demons you have described are ineffective in his presence just like the serpents who with their venom are ineffective  in the presence of  Suparna (Garuda).

content: तस्य ज्याविप्रमुक्तास्ते शराः काञ्चनभूषणाः।शरीरं विधमिष्यन्ति गङ्गाकूलमिवोर्मयः।।3.56.7।।
explanation: The goldtipped arrows released from his bowstring will shatter your body like the waves erode the banks of river Ganga.

content: असुरैर्वा सुरैर्वा त्वं यद्यवध्योऽसि रावण।उत्पाद्य सुमहद्वैरं जीवंस्तस्य न मोक्ष्यसे।।3.56.8।।
explanation: O Ravana, even if you stand invulnerable to gods and demons, you will not come out alive in the combat with Rama with whom you have earned great enmity.

content: स ते जीवितशेषस्य राघवोऽन्तकरो बली।पशोर्यूपगतस्येव जीवितं तव दुर्लभम्।।3.56.9।।
explanation: Powerful Rama will put an end to whatever little life you are left with. Just as a beast tied to a sacrificial post, you will not  survive.

content: यदि पश्येत्स रामस्त्वां रोषदीप्तेन चक्षुषा।रक्षस्त्वमद्य निर्धग्धो गच्छेस्सद्यः पराभवम्।।3.56.10।।
explanation: O demon, you will be completely consumed if Rama looks at you with eyes burning in anger.

content: यश्चन्द्रं नभसो भूमौ पातयेन्नाशयेत वा।सागरं शोषयेद्वापि स सीतां मोचयेदिह।।3.56.11।।
explanation: He who can bring down the Moon to the earth from the sky or even dash it down, he who can drain the sea dry will definitely release me from here.

content: गतायुस्त्वं गतश्रीको गतसत्त्व गतेन्द्रियः।लङ्का वैधव्यसंयुक्ता त्वत्कृतेन भविष्यति।।3.56.12।।
explanation: Your life is coming to an end. Your fortunes will wane, your strength will be sapped. Your senses will be dissipated. By your deeds Lanka will attain widowhood.

content: न ते पापमिदं कर्म शुखोदर्कं भविष्यति।याऽहं नीता विनाभावं पतिपार्श्वात्त्वया वने।।3.56.13।।
explanation: This evil deed(of abduction) will not yield happy results.You have brought me from my husband from the forest without any forethought.

content: स हि दैवतसंयुक्तो मम भर्ता महाद्युतिः।निर्भयो वीर्यमाश्रित्य शून्ये वसति दण्डके।।3.56.14।।
explanation: My effulgent, valiant husband armed with divine power resides fearlessly in the desolate Dandaka.

content: स ते दर्पं बलं वीर्यमुत्सेकं च तथाविधम्।अपनेष्यति गात्रेभ्यश्शरवर्षेण संयुगे।।3.56.15।।
explanation: He will remove your pride, your power, your valour and haughtiness from your limbs with a shower of arrows in the fight.

content: यदा विनाशो भूतानां दृश्यते कालचोदितः।तदा कार्ये प्रमाद्यन्ति नराः कालवशं गताः।।3.56.16।।
explanation: When destruction draws near, people being prompted by time start commiting blunders in their deeds.

content: मां प्रधृष्य स ते कालः प्राप्तोऽयं राक्षसाधम।आत्मनो राक्षसानां च वधायान्तःपुरस्य च।।3.56.17।।
explanation: You vilest of demons, since you have assaulted me, the time of your death and destruction of all demons and of all women in the harem has drawn near.

content: न शक्या यज्ञमध्यस्था वेदी सृग्भाण्डमण्डिता।द्विजातिमन्त्रपूता च चण्डालेनावमर्दितुम्।।3.56.18।।
explanation: The sacrificial altar adorned with ladles and vessels and sanctified by the sacred mantras recited by brahmins cannot be defiled by a chandala (man of lowest caste).

content: तथाऽहं धर्मनित्यस्य धर्मपत्नी पतिव्रता।त्वया स्पृष्टुं न शक्यास्मि राक्षसाधम पापिना।।3.56.19।।
explanation: O lowly demon  similarly I am a chaste woman and wife of the ever righteous Rama who cannot be defiled by a sinner like you.

content: क्रीडन्ती राजहंसेन पद्मषण्डेषु नित्यदा।हंसी सा तृणषण्डस्थं कथं पश्येत मद्गुकम्।।3.56.20।।
explanation: How can a female swan ever sporting in lotusponds in the company of a royal swan look at the watercrow resting on a grassy land?

content: इदं शरीरं निस्संज्ञं बन्ध वा खातयस्व वा।नेदं शरीरं रक्षयं मे जीवितं वापि राक्षस।।3.56.21।।न तु शक्ष्याम्युपक्रोशं पृथिव्यां दातुमात्मनः।
explanation: O demon  this body has (now) no consciousness. You may bind it or bury it. I do not think that this body or even this life need to be protected. But at no cost can I make this an object of censure on earth (must not be branded an unchaste woman).

content: एवमुक्त्वा तु वैदेही क्रोधात्सुपरुषं वचः।।3.56.22।।रावणं मैथिली तत्र पुनर्नोवाच किञ्चन।
explanation: Having uttered these very harsh words out of anger, the daughter of Videha, the princess from Mithila spoke no more.

content: सीताया वचनं श्रुत्वा परुषं रोमहर्षणम्।।3.56.23।।प्रत्युवाच ततस्सीतां भयसन्दर्शनं वचः।
explanation: Having heard such harsh, horripilating words from Sita, Ravana replied in a way designed to create fear in her:

content: शृणु मैथिलि मद्वाक्यं मासान्द्वादश भामिनि।।3.56.24।।कालेनानेन नाभ्येषि यदि मां चारुहासिनि।ततस्त्वां प्रातराशार्थं सूदाश्छेत्स्यन्ति लेशशः।।3.56.25।।
explanation: O comely princess from Mithila, O lady with a sweet smile listen to my words. If you do not accept my hand in the course of twelve months, the cooks will cut you off into small bits for the (my) breakfast.

content: इत्युक्त्वा परुषं वाक्यं रावणश्शत्रुरावणः।राक्षसीश्च ततः क्रुद्ध इदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।3.56.26।।
explanation: Enraged Ravana, who used to make enemies wail, turned to the demonesses and said these words.

content: शीघ्रमेव हि राक्षस्यो विकृता घोरदर्शनाः।दर्पमस्या विनेष्यध्वं मांसशोणितभोजनाः।।3.56.27।।
explanation: Addressing the flesheating, blooddrinking, loathsome and fearful demonesses Ravana said, Humble her pride at once.

content: वचनादेव तास्तस्य सुघोरा राक्षसीगणाः।कृतप्राञ्जलयो भूत्वा मैथिलीं पर्यवारयन्।।3.56.28।।
explanation: No sooner had Ravana said it than the dreadful demonesses offered obeisance to him with folded hands and surrounded Sita.

content: स ताः प्रोवाच राजा तु रावणो घोरदर्शनः।प्रचाल्य चरणोत्कर्षैर्दारयन्निव मेदिनीम्।।3.56.29।।
explanation: Stamping his feet and shaking the ground as if tearing the earth, Ravana said to those fiercelooking demonesses:

content: अशोकवनिकामध्ये मैथिली नीयतामियम्।तत्रेयं रक्ष्यतां गूढं युष्माभिः परिवारिता।।3.56.30।।
explanation: Let this Sita be led into the Asoka grove. There sit round her and protect her in secret (her presence there should not be made public).

content: तत्रैनां तर्जनैर्घोरैः पुनस्सान्त्वैश्च मैथिलीम्।आनयध्वं वशं सर्वा वन्यां गजवधूमिव।।3.56.31।।
explanation: There you all bring her under control through forcing and cajoling as one would do to tame a wild sheelephant.

content: इति प्रतिसमादिष्टा राक्षस्यो रावणेन ताः।अशोकवनिकां जग्मुर्मैथिलीं परिगृह्य तु।।3.56.32।।सर्वकालफलैर्वृक्षैर्नानापुष्पफलैर्वृताम्।सर्वकालमदैश्चापि द्विजैस्समुपसेविताम्।।3.56.33।।
explanation: Thus instructed by Ravana, the demonesses took Sita into the Asoka grove, which was full of perenmal fruits and flowers of different kinds, where trees yielded fruits of all seasons and birds were always cheerful.

content: सा तु शोकपरीताङ्गी मैथिली जनकात्मजा।राक्षसीवशमापन्ना व्याघ्रीणां हरिणी यथा।।3.56.34।।
explanation: Sita, daughter of Janaka, engulfed in grief found herself like a doe under the control of tigresses.

content: शोकेन महता ग्रस्ता मैथिली जनकात्मजा।न शर्म लभते भीरुः पाशबद्धा मृगी यथा।।3.56.35।।
explanation: Sita, daughter of Janaka, immersed in deep grief knew no peace just like a doe caught in a snare.

content: न विन्दते तत्र तु शर्म मैथिली विरूपनेत्राभिरतीव तर्जिता।पतिं स्मरन्ती दयितं च देवतं विचेतनाऽभूद्भयशोकपीडिता।।3.56.36।।
explanation: Sita had no peace as she was threatened excessively by those women of deformed  looks. Remembering her beloved husband who was also her god, and overtaken by fear and grief , she fell unconscious.इतयार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे षटपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftysixth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama returns after killing Maricha-- sees bad omens on the way-- sees sad face of Lakshmana midway--blames Lakshmana for leaving Sita alone-- doubts Sita's safety-- experiences bad omens again.]राक्षसं मृगरूपेण चरन्तं कामरूपिणम्।निहत्य रामो मारीचं तूर्णं पथि न्यवर्तत।।3.57.1।।
explanation: Rama killed Maricha, the demon assuming the form of the deer as per his will and swiftly took the return path.

content: तस्य सन्त्वरमाणस्य द्रष्टुकामस्य मैथिलीम्।क्रूरस्वनोऽथ गोमायुर्विननादास्य पृष्ठतः।।3.57.2।।
explanation: While Rama was hasting to see Sita, he heard from behind the ghastly howl of a jackal.

content: स तस्य स्वरमाज्ञाय दारुणं रोमहर्षणम्।चिन्तयामास गोमायोस्स्वरेण परिशङ्कितः।।3.57.3।।
explanation: Rama knew it was the horrible, horripilating cry of a jackal which made him apprehensive . It made him think.

content: अशुभं बत मन्येऽहं गोमायुर्वाश्यते यथा।स्वस्ति स्यादपि वैदेह्या राक्षसैर्भक्षणं विना।।3.57.4।।
explanation: 'The way the jackal is howling appears ominous. May Sita be safe without being eaten up by demons

content: मारीचेन तु विज्ञाय स्वरमालम्ब्य मामकम्।विक्रुष्टं मृगरूपेण लक्ष्मणश्शृणुयाद्यदि।।3.57.5।।स सौमित्रिस्स्वरं श्रुत्वा तां च हित्वाच मैथिलीम्।तयेह प्रहितः क्षिप्रं मत्सकाशमिहैष्यति।।3.57.6।।
explanation: 'If  Lakshmana listens to Maricha imitating my voice in the form of a deer, he, sent by Sita will come for me at once, leaving her behind.

content: राक्षसैस्सहितैर्नूनं सीताया ईप्सितो वधः।काञ्चनश्च मृगो भूत्वा व्यपनीयाश्रमात्तु माम्।।3.57.7।।दूरं नीत्वा तु मारीचो राक्षसोऽभूच्छरा हतः।हा लक्ष्मण हतोऽस्मीति यद्वाक्यं व्याजहार ह।।3.57.8।।
explanation: 'Hence the murder of Sita must have been jointly planned by the demons. Maricha who had assumed the form of a golden deer, took me away from the hermitage to a faroff place where, killed by my arrows, he turned a demon uttering the words, Alas, Lakshmana, I am killed.

content: अपि स्वस्ति भवेत्ताभ्यां रहिताभ्यां महावने।जनस्थाननिमित्तं हि कृतवैरोऽस्मि राक्षसैः।।3.57.9।।निमित्तानि च घोराणि दृश्यन्तेऽद्य बहूनि च।
explanation: 'On account of living in this dense forest in Janasthana I have earned enmity with the demons. Will Lakshmana and Sita be safe without my protection? I see many terrible portents.'

content: इत्येवं चिन्तयन्रामश्श्रुत्वा गोमायुनिस्स्वनम्।।3.57.10।।आत्मनश्चापनयनान्मृगरूपेण रक्षसा।आजगाम जनस्थानं राघवः परिशङ्कितः।।3.57.11।।
explanation: On hearing the jackal's howl, Rama began thinking how the demon in the form of a deer drew him away. Thus in the midst of apprehensions he reached Janasthana.

content: तं दीनमनसो दीनमासेदुर्मृगपक्षिणः।सव्यं कृत्वा महात्मानं घोरांश्च ससृजुस्स्वरान्।।3.57.12।।
explanation: Dejected at heart, the birds and animals piteously kept the great soul (Rama) to the left and produced a dreadful cacophony.

content: तानि दृष्ट्वा निमित्तानि महाघोराणि राघवः।न्यवर्तताथ त्वरितो जवेनाश्रममात्मनः।।3.57.13।।
explanation: On seeing such dreadfu omens at that time, Rama hurried back to his hermitage.

content: सीतां स तु वरारोहां लक्ष्मणं च महाबलम्।आजगाम जनस्थानं चिन्तयन्नेव राघवः।।3.57.14।।
explanation: Rama arrived at Janasthana thinking (of the safety) of charming Sita and mighty Lakshmana.

content: ततो लक्ष्मणमायान्तं ददर्श विगतप्रभम्।ततोऽविदूरे रामेण समीयाय स लक्ष्मणः।।3.57.15।।विषण्णस्सुविषण्णेन दुःखितो दुःखभागिना।
explanation: He then saw Lakshmana coming towards him with a cheerless face. When the sad, depressed Lakshmana came near, he saw Rama (equally) despondent and griefstricken.

content: सञ्जगर्हेऽथ तं भ्राता ज्येष्ठो लक्ष्मणमागतम्।।3.57.16।।विहाय सीतां विजने वने राक्षससेविते।
explanation: In this situation Rama the elder brother rebuked Lakshmana for having left Sita behind in a desolate forest infested with demons.

content: गृहीत्वा च करं सव्यं लक्ष्मणं रघुनन्दनः।।3.57.17।।उवाच मधुरोदर्कमिदं परुषमार्तिमत्।
explanation: Rama, the delight of the Raghus, took hold of Lakshmana's left hand, and in sadness said these sweet harsh words :

content: अहो लक्ष्मण गर्ह्यं ते कृतं यस्त्वं विहाय ताम्।।3.57.18।।सीतामिहाऽगतस्सौम्य कच्चित्स्वस्ति भवेदिह।
explanation: O gentle Lakshmana you are to blame for coming here, leaving Sita behind. Alas will she be safe now?

content: न मेऽस्ति संशयो वीर सर्वथा जनकात्मजा।।3.57.19।।विनष्टा भक्षिता वापि राक्षसैर्वनचारिभिः।अशुभान्येव भूयिष्ठं यथा प्रादुर्भवन्ति मे।।3.57.20।।
explanation: O heroic Lakshmana I see many inauspicious omens. I think Sita might have been lost or eaten away by the demons of the forest. There is no doubt about it.

content: अपि लक्ष्मण सीतायास्सामग्र्यं प्राप्नुयावहे।जीवन्त्याः पुरुषव्याघ्र सुताया जनकस्य वै।।3.57.21।।
explanation: O Lakshmana, a tiger among men, will we be able to see the daughter of Janaka, living in a state of total wellbeing? Will we be able to get her back ?

content: यथा वै मृगसङ्घाश्च गोमायुश्चैव भैरवम्।वाश्यन्ते शकुनाश्चापि प्रदीप्तामभितो दिशम्।।3.57.22।।अपि स्वस्ति भवेत्तस्या राजपुत्र्या महाबल।
explanation: O  mighty Lakshmana  from the way the beasts, jackals and birds too have turned in the bright direction of the Sun, crying in a frightful manner, can we hope princess Sita is safe ?

content: इदं हि रक्षो मृगसन्निकाशं प्रलोभ्य मां दूरमनुप्रयान्तम्।हतं कथञ्चिन्महता श्रमेण स राक्षसोऽभून्म्रियमाण एव।।3.57.23।।
explanation: Appearing in the guise of a deer, this demon allured me to a great distance. With much effort he was somehow killed. but he assumed his demoniac form while dying.

content: मनश्च मे दीनमिहाप्रहृष्टं चक्षुश्च सव्यं कुरुते विकारम्।असंशयं लक्ष्मण नास्ति सीता हृता मृता वा पथि वर्तते वा।।3.57.24।।
explanation: With my heart dejected and depressed, my left eye throbbing, O Lakshmana, I have no doubt that Sita is either abducted or dead or abandoned on the way.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे सप्तपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyseventh sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama wails -- doubts Sita's existenceblames Lakshmana -- looks out for Sita around the cottage.]स दृष्ट्वा लक्ष्मणं दीनं शून्ये दशरथात्मजः।पर्यपृच्छत धर्मात्मा वैदेहीमागतं विना।।3.58.1।।
explanation: Rama, son of Dasaratha, the righteous self, saw Lakshmana downcast and dejected. Seeing him  without Sita, Rama enquired:

content: प्रस्थितं दण्डकारण्यं या मामनुजगाम ह।क्व सा लक्ष्मण वैदेही यां हित्वा त्वमिहागतः।।3.58.2।।
explanation: Where is that princess from Videha who accompanied me when I entered Dandaka forest ? Why have you come here leaving her behind ?

content: राज्यभ्रष्टस्य दीनस्य दण्डकान्परिधावतः।क्व सा दुःखसहाया मे वैदेही तनुमध्यमा।।3.58.3।।
explanation: Where is that princess from Videha, a sharer of my sorrows, Sita of slender waist who followed this hapless prince disloged from the kingdom into the Dandaka forest?

content: यां विना नोत्सहे वीर मुहूर्तमपि जीवितुम्।क्व सा प्राणसहाया मे सीता सुरसुतोपमा।।3.58.4।।
explanation: O warrior Lakshmana where is that Sita without whom I have no interest to live for a moment, who was like the daughter of a god and a sustainer of my life?

content: पतित्वममराणां वा पृथिव्याश्चापि लक्ष्मण।तां विना तपनीयाभां नेच्छेयं जनकात्मजाम्।।3.58.5।।
explanation: O Lakshmana I desire no lordship of the gods  or of the entire earth without that daughter of Janaka, that lady of golden complexion.

content: कच्चिज्जीवति वैदेहि प्राणैः प्रियतरा मम।कच्चित्प्रव्राजनं सौम्य न मे मिथ्या भविष्यति।।3.58.6।।
explanation: O gentle Lakshmana I wonder if Vaidehi, who is dearer to me than my life is still alive I hope my banishment from the kingdom is not going to prove false.

content: सीतानिमित्तं सौमित्रे मृते मयि गते त्वयि।कच्चित्सकामा सुखिता कैकेयी सा भविष्यति।।3.58.7।।
explanation: O Saumitri when I am dead on account of Sita, and you are back, Kaikeyi with her desire fulfilled will be happy, indeed.

content: सपुत्रराज्यां सिद्धार्थां मृतपुत्रा तपस्विनी।उपस्थास्यतिकौसल्या कच्चित्सौम्य न केकयीम्।।3.58.8।।
explanation: O handsome one  I wonder if that lady of renunciation, Kausalya with her son dead, will have to serve Kaikeyi whose desire would be fulfilled, and who will enjoy the power of the throne in the company of her son

content: यदि जीवति वैदेही गमिष्याम्याश्रमं पुनः।सुवृत्ता यदि वृत्ता प्राणांस्त्यक्ष्यामि लक्ष्मण।।3.58.9।।
explanation: O Lakshmana, only if Vaidehi is alive will I enter the cottage again or else I will give up my life if that virtuous lady is no more.

content: यदि मामाश्रमगतं वैदेही नाभिभाषते।पुनः प्रहसिता सीता विनशिष्यामि लक्ष्मण।।3.58.10।।
explanation: I will die if Sita, princess from Videha, is not there to speak to me with her sweet smile when I return to the cottage, O Lakshmana

content: ब्रूहि लक्ष्मण वैदेही यदि जीवति वा न वा।त्वयि प्रमत्ते रक्षोभिर्भक्षिता वा तपस्विनी।।3.58.11।।
explanation: Tell me, O Lakshmana   if Sita is alive or not, whether she was eaten up by demons when you were off your guard.

content: सुकुमारी च बाला च नित्यं चादुःखदर्शिनी।मद्वियोगेन वैदेही व्यक्तं शोचति दुर्मनाः।।3.58.12।।
explanation: Vaidehi is delicate, young and she has never faced any sorrow.She will be certainly disheartened due to separation from me.

content: सर्वदा रक्षसा तेन जिह्मेन सुदुरात्मना।वदता लक्ष्मणेत्युच्चैस्तवापि जनितं भयम्।।3.58.13।।
explanation: The evilminded, wicked demon calling out loudly 'O Lakshmana' must have by all means instilled fear in your mind.

content: श्रुतस्तु शङ्के वैदेह्या स स्वरस्सदृशो मम।त्रस्तया प्रेषितस्त्वं च द्रष्टुं मां शीघ्रमागतः।।3.58.14।।
explanation: I am afraid, Vaidehi, frightened by hearing the voice which was like mine sent you to see me, and you came all at once.

content: सर्वथा तु कृतं कष्टं सीतामुत्सृजता वने।प्रतिकर्तुं नृशंसानां रक्षसां दत्तमन्तरं।।3.58.15।।
explanation: You have definitely done a great mistake by leaving Sita alone in the forest. This has given a chance to the cruel demons to wreak revenge.

content: दुःखिताः खरघातेन राक्षसाः पिशिताशनाः।तैस्सीता निहता घोरैर्भविष्यति न संशयः।3.58.16।।
explanation: The dreadful, carnivorous demons aggrieved over my murder of Khara must have undoubtedly killed Sita.

content: अहोऽस्मिन् व्यसने मग्नस्सर्वथा शत्रुसूदन।किं न्विदानीं करिष्यामि शङ्के प्राप्तव्यमीदृशम्।।3.58.17।।
explanation: O destroyer of enemies  I am completely drowned in sorrow. What can I do at this moment. Alas, I am destined to suffer.

content: इति सीतां वरारोहां चिन्तयन्नेव राघवः।आजगाम जनस्थानं त्वरया सह लक्ष्मणः।।3.58.18।।
explanation: While thus brooding over the beautiful Sita, the scion of the Raghus along with Lakshmana hurried towards Janasthana.

content: विगर्हमाणोऽनुजमार्तरूपं क्षुधा श्रमाच्चैव पिपासया च।विनिश्श्वसन् शुष्कमुखो विवर्णः प्रतिश्रयं प्राप्य समीक्ष्य शून्यम्।।3.58.19।।स्वमाश्रमं सम्प्रविगाह्य वीरो विहारदेशाननुसृत्य कांश्चित्।एतत्तदित्येव निवासभूमौ प्रहृष्टरोमा व्यथितो बभूव।।3.58.20।।
explanation: Thus blaming his dejected brother, the valiant Rama entered the hermitage, sighing deeply, his face pale and his throat dried up with hunger, exhaustion and thirst. Reaching his dwellingplace, he found it empty. He thoroughly searched the hermitage and the places where she used to move about on the premises. And 'so it has happened', he sadly said to himself, his hair raised on end.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे अष्टपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyeighth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama enquires Lakshmana the reason for leaving Sita alone-- Lakshmana tells him about Sita goading him to leave immediately.]अथाश्रमादुपावृत्तमन्तरा रघुनन्दनः।परिपप्रच्छ सौमित्रिं रामो दुःखार्दितं पुनः।।3.59.1।।
explanation: Rama, the delight of the Raghus, once again questioned Lakshmana who had come out of the hermitage, deeply hurt:

content: तमुवाच किमर्थं त्वमागतोऽपास्य मैथिलीम्।यदा सा तव विश्वासाद्वने विरहिता मया।।3.59.2।।
explanation: Why did you come, leaving the princess from Mithila alone in the forest when I had left her under your trust ?

content: दृष्ट्वैवाभ्यागतं त्वां मे मैथिलीं त्यज्य लक्ष्मण।शङ्कमानं महत्पापं यत्सत्यं व्यथितं मनः।।3.59.3।।
explanation: When I saw you, O Lakshmana, coming without Sita, my mind was oppressed with evil thought which have come true.

content: स्फुरते नयनं सव्यं बाहुश्च हृदयं च मे।दृष्ट्वा लक्ष्मण दूरे त्वां सीताविरहितं पथि।।3.59.4।।
explanation: O Lakshmana, as I saw you from a distance without Sita, my left eye, my shoulder and my heart throbbed.

content: एवमुक्तन्तु सौमित्रिर्लक्ष्मणश्शुभलक्षणः।भूयो दुःखसमाविष्टो दुःखितं राममब्रवीत्।।3.59.5।।
explanation: Thus addressed, virtuous Lakshmana, overwhelmed with sorrow replied to the grief stricken Rama:

content: न स्वयं कामकारेण तां त्यक्त्वाहमिहागतः।प्रचोदित स्तयैवोग्रैस्त्वत्सकाशमिहागतः।।3.59.6।।
explanation: I did not leave her on my own nor have I  come here of my own accord. I came to you, provoked by her angry  words.

content: आर्येणेव पराक्रुष्टं हासीते लक्ष्मणेति च।परित्राहीति यद्वाक्यं मैथिल्यास्तच्छ्रुतिं गतम्।।3.59.7।।
explanation: Uttered loudly, 'Alas Sita, Alas, Lakshmana, save me', as if these were the words of your noble self, reached Sita's ears.

content: सा तमार्तस्वरं श्रुत्वा तव स्नेहेन मैथिली।गच्छ गच्छेति मामाह रुदन्ती भयविह्वला।।3.59.8।।
explanation: The princess from Mithila heard this cry of pain and, wild with fear, urged me out of her love for you to go.

content: प्रचोद्यमानेन मया गच्छेति बहुशस्तया।प्रत्युक्ता मैथिली वाक्यमिदं त्वत्प्रत्ययान्वितम्।3.59.9।।
explanation: When I was repeated asked to go, I said this in order to instil confidence in the princess from Mithila :

content: न तत्पश्याम्यहं रक्षो यदस्य भयमावहेत्।निर्वृता भव नास्त्येतत्केनाप्येवमुदाहृतम्।।3.59.10।।
explanation: 'No one  can cause fear in Rama. I do not see any demon who can hold a threat to him. Give up fear. Some one might have said it.

content: विगर्हितं च नीचं च कथमार्योऽभिधास्यति।त्राहीति वचनं सीते यस्त्रायेत्रिदशानपि।।3.59.11।।
explanation: 'How can Rama who is capable of saving even gods speak such unworthy, demeaning words, 'Save me, O Sita'

content: किं निमित्तं तु केनापि भ्रातुरालम्ब्य मे स्वरम्।राक्षसेनेरितं वाक्यं त्राहि त्राहीति शोभने।।3.59.12।।
explanation: O fair lady, for some reason some demon  has uttered these words 'Save me, save me' adapting my brother's voice.

content: विस्वरं व्याहृतं वाक्यं लक्ष्मण त्राहि मामिति।न भवत्या व्यथा कार्या कुनारीजनसेविता।।3.59.13।।
explanation: 'Lakshmana, save me' are the words uttered in an altered tone. Like an ordinary, lowborn woman you are not to feel concerned for this.

content: अलं वैक्लब्यमालम्ब्य स्वस्था भव निरुत्सुका।न सोऽस्ति त्रिषु लोकेषु पुमान्वै राघवं रणे।।3.59.14।।जातो वा जायमानो वा संयुगे यः पराजयेत्।न जय्यो राघवो युद्धे देवैश्शक्रपुरोगमैः।।3.59.15।।
explanation: 'You should not feel agitated or dispirited. Be composed. There is no one either born or going to be born in the three worlds who can defeat Rama in war. He cannot be conquered in a battle even by gods led by indra.'

content: एवमुक्ता तु वैदेही परिमोहितचेतना।उवाचाश्रूणि मुञ्चन्ती दारुणं मामिदं वचः।।3.59.16।।
explanation: Deluded by her senses, Vaidehi said these words, shedding tears when I  tried to console  her:

content: भावो मयि तवात्यर्थं पाप एव निवेशितः।विनष्टे भ्रातरि प्राप्तुं न च त्वं मामवाप्स्यसि।।3.59.17।।
explanation: 'You have an extremely sinful intention of getting me  when your brother is dead. But you will not be able to gain me.

content: सङ्केताद्भरतेन त्वं रामं समनुगच्छसि।क्रोशन्तं हि यथात्यर्थं नैवमभ्यवपद्यसे।।3.59.18।।
explanation: 'Since you are not reaching out to Rama who is helplessly crying for his rescue, you must have followed Rama, instructed by Bharata (to do him harm)'৷৷

content: रिपुः प्रच्छन्नचारी त्वं मदर्थमनुगच्छसि।राघवस्यान्तरप्रेप्सुस्तथैनं नाभिपद्यसे।।3.59.19।।
explanation: 'You are an enemy moving in disguise with an interest in me. You are waiting for an opportunity to set aside Rama. That is why you are not rushing to him.'

content: एवमुक्तो हि वैदेह्या संरब्धो रक्तलोचनः।क्रोधात्प्रस्फुरमाणोष्ठ आश्रमादभिनिर्गतः।।3.59.20।।
explanation: At these words from the princess of Videha, I came out of the hermitage in an agitated mood with my eyes turned red and lips quivering in anger.

content: एवं ब्रुवाणं सौमित्रिं रामस्सन्तापमोहितः।अब्रवीद्दुष्कृतं सौम्य तां विना यत्त्वमागतः।।3.59.21।।
explanation: To Lakshmana thus reporting, Rama, overcome with grief, said,(Even then) O noble brother your coming here, leaving her behind, is a wrong step taken.

content: जानन्नपि समर्थं मां रक्षसां विनिवारणे।अनेन क्रोधवाक्येन मैथिल्या निस्सृतो भवान्।।3.59.22।।
explanation: You have come out of the hermitage provoked by Maithili's angry words, even though you are aware that I am capable of warding off the demons.

content: न हि ते परितुष्यामि त्यक्त्वा यद्यासि मैथिलीम्।क्रुद्धायाः परुषं श्रुत्वा तां विहाय त्वमागतः।।3.59.23।।
explanation: I am not happy with you as you have come here deserting Sita on the plea that she was angry and spoke harsh words.

content: सर्वथा त्वविनीतं ते सीतया यत्प्रचोदितः।क्रोधस्य वशमापन्नो नाकरोश्शासनं मम।।3.59.24।।
explanation: Provoked by the words of Sita spoken in anger you came without respecting my orders. It is definitely an act of disobedience.

content: असौ हि राक्षसश्शेते शरेणाभिहतो मया।मृगरूपेण येनाहमाश्रमादपवाहितः।।3.59.25।।
explanation: This demon who misled me in the guise of a deer and took me away from the hermitage, lies dead, killed by my arrow.

content: विकृष्य चापं परिधाय सायकं सलीलबाणेन च ताडितो मया।मार्गीं तनुं त्यज्य स विक्लबस्वरो बभूव केयूरधरस्सराक्षसः।।3.59.26।।
explanation: Bending the bow I fixed the arrow and released it at ease. Hit by that arrow he gave up his guise of the deer and assuming the form of a demon with a bracelet on his arm fell down groaning.

content: शराहतेनैव तदार्तया गिरा स्वरं समालम्ब्य सुदूरसुश्रवम्।उदाहृतं तद्वचनं सुदारुणं त्वमागतो येन विहाय मैथिलीम्।।3.59.27।।
explanation: Hit by the arrow, the demon imitating my voice cried out in desperation which could be clearly audible even from a distance. On hearing the dreadful words you deserted Sita and came here.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकोनषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyninth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama's sorrow -- goes from tree to tree enquiring about Sita -- Rama and Lakshmana go in search of Sita.]भृशमाव्रजमानस्य तस्याधो वामलोचनम्।प्रास्फुरच्चास्खलद्रामो वेपथुश्चाप्य जायत।।3.60.1।।
explanation: As  Rama was returning( to the hermitage), his left eye throbbed repeatedly  and he stumbled and his body trembled.

content: उपालक्ष्य निमित्तानि सोऽशुभानि मुहुर्मुहुः।अपि क्षेमं नु सीताया इति वै व्याजहार च।।3.60.2।।
explanation: As inauspicious omens appeared again and again, doubting if all is well with Sita, he said to himself, Can Sita be safe?

content: त्वरमाणो जगामाथ सीतादर्शनलालसः।शून्यमावसथं दृष्ट्वा बभूवोद्विग्नमानसः।।3.60.3।।
explanation: Anxious to see Sita, he hastened to the hermitage and finding it empty, became restless.

content: उद्भ्रमन्निव वेगेन विक्षिपन्रघुनन्दनः।तत्र तत्रोटजस्थानमभिवीक्षय समन्ततः।।3.60.4।।ददर्श पर्णशालां च रहितां सीतया तदा।श्रिया विरहितां ध्वस्तां हेमन्ते पद्मिनीमिव।।3.60.5।।
explanation: Rama, the delight of the Raghu dynasty, hurtled in, turning round, throwing his hands to and fro, casting his looks all around the cottage where she used to move. The cottage, devoid of Sita looked like a lotuspond, the beauty of its lotuses destroyed by winter.

content: रुदन्तमिव वृक्षैश्च म्लानपुष्पमृगद्विजम्।श्रिया विहीनं विध्वस्तं सन्त्यक्तवनदेवतम्।।3.60.6।।विप्रकीर्णाजिनकुशं विप्रविद्धब्रुसीकटम्।दृष्ट्वा शून्यं निजस्थानं विललाप पुनः पुनः।।3.60.7।।
explanation: The trees with flowers withered, the animals and birds turned pale looked as if they were weeping. Bereft of their beauty they wore a ruinous look. The sylvan deities had left.  The deerskin and kusa grass were strewn here and there, the grass cushions and straw mats lay scattered. Seeing his cottage so desolate Rama wept again and again.

content: हृता मृता वा नष्टा वा भक्षिता वा भविष्यति।निलीनाप्यथवा भीरुरथवा वनमाश्रिता।।3.60.8।।
explanation: 'Timid Sita might have been abducted or dead or crushed or eaten up by demons. Or, she may be hiding for protection in the forest'

content: गता विचेतुं पुष्पाणि फलान्यपि च वा पुनः।अथवा पद्मिनीं याता जलार्थं वा नदीं गता।।3.60.9।।
explanation: 'Maybe she has gone to pluck flowers or fruits. Or to the lotuspond or river to  fetch water.'

content: यत्नान्मृगयमाणस्तु नाससाद वने प्रियाम्।शोकरक्तेक्षणश्शोकादुन्मत्त इव लक्ष्यते।।3.60.10।।
explanation: He ransacked the forest, yet did not find his beloved. He  appeared like a mad man, his eyes turned red with tears of sorrow.

content: वृक्षाद्वृक्षं प्रधावन्सगिरेश्चाद्रिं नदान्नदीम्।बभूव विलपन्रामश्शोकार्णवपरिप्लुतः।।3.60.11।।
explanation: Running from tree to tree, hill to hill, and river to river and weeping, Rama was immersed in a sea of sorrow.

content: अपि काचित्त्वया दृष्टा सा कदम्बप्रिया प्रिया।कदम्ब यदि जानीषे शंस सीतां शुभाननाम्।।3.60.12।।
explanation: O Kadamba tree, tell me if you have seen my beloved with a fair face and with love for kadamba flowers.

content: स्निग्धपल्लवसङ्काशा पीतकौशेयवासिनी।शंसस्व यदि वा दृष्टा बिल्व बिल्वोपमस्तनी।।3.60.13।।
explanation: O Bilva tree, tell me if you have seen a lady delicate like your tender leaf, dressed in yellow silk, a lady whose breasts are round like Bilva fruits.

content: अथवाऽर्जुन शंस त्वं प्रियां तामर्जुनप्रियाम्।जनकस्य सुता भीरुर्यदि जीवति वा न वा।।3.60.14।।
explanation: O Arjuna tree, tell me if you know a timid lady, daughter of Janaka and my beloved, fond of Arjuna tree. Is the living or not ?

content: ककुभः ककुभोरूं तां व्यक्तं जानाति मैथिलीम्।यथा पल्लवपुष्पाढ्यो भाति ह्येष वनस्पतिः।।3.60.15।।
