explanation: This Kakubha tree rich with tender leaves and flowers (perhaps)knows Maithili whose thighs are beautiful like the trunk of the Kakubha tree.

content: भ्रमरैरुपगीतश्च यथा द्रुमवरो ह्ययम्।एष व्यक्तं विजानाति तिलकस्तिलकप्रियाम्।।3.60.16।।
explanation: This great Tilaka tree round which bees bumble surely knows the lady who loves to put tilaka marks on the forehead.

content: अशोक शोकापनुद शोकोपहतचेतसम्।त्वन्नामानं कुरु क्षिप्रं प्रियासन्दर्शनेन माम्।।3.60.17।।
explanation: O Ashoka tree, dispeller of sorrow, by quickly showing me my darling make me ashoka (free from sorrow) as I am griefstricken at heart.

content: यदि ताल त्वया दृष्टा पक्वतालफलस्तनी।कथयस्व वरारोहां कारुण्यं यदि ते मयि।।3.60.18।।
explanation: O Palmyra tree be kind to me and tell me if you have seen my beautiful beloved who has breasts like ripe palmyra fruit?

content: यदि दृष्टा त्वया सीता जम्बु जम्बूफलोपमा।प्रियां यदि विजानीषे निःशङ्कं कथयस्व मे।।3.60.19।।
explanation: O Jambu tree, do not hesitate to tell me if you know Sita whose body shines lovely like gold.

content: अहो त्वं कर्णिकाराद्य सुपुष्पैश्शोभसे भृशम्।कर्णिकारप्रिया साध्वी शंस दृष्टा प्रिया यदि।।3.60.20।।
explanation: O Karnikara tree with flowers in full bloom, tell me if you have seen my faithful beloved who is fond of karnikara flowers.

content: चूतनीपमहासालान्पनसान्कुरवान्धवान्।दाडिमाननसान्गत्वा दृष्ट्वा रामो महायशाः।।3.60.21।।मल्लिका माधवीश्चैव चम्पकान्केतकीस्तथा।पृच्छन्रामो वने भान्तः उन्मत्त इव लक्ष्यते।।3.60.22।।
explanation: Renowned Rama, like a madman confused, approached the Mango, Kadamba , Sal and Jackfruit, Dhava, Champak, Ketaki trees and Pomegranate, Jasmine and Madhavi creepers, in order to make similar queries.

content: अथवा मृगशाबाक्षीं मृग जानासि मैथिलीम्।मृगविप्रेक्षणी कान्ता मृगीभिस्सहिता भवेत्।।3.60.23।।
explanation: Or,  O deer do you know about Maithili who has the eyes of a fawn? My beloved who has the restless eyes of a doe may be found in their company.

content: गज सा गजनासोरूर्यदि दृष्टा त्वया भवेत्।तां मन्ये विदितां तुभ्यमाख्याहि वरवारण।3.60.24।।
explanation: O elephant tell me if you have seen her whose thighs are like the trunk of an elephant. O best of elephants, tell me if you know her.

content: शार्दूल यदि सा दृष्टा प्रिया चन्द्रनिभानना।मैथिली मम विस्रब्धं कथयस्व न ते भयम्।।3.60.25।।
explanation: O tiger tell me freely and fearlessly if you have seen my beloved princess from Mithila with a face like the moon.

content: किं धावसि प्रिये दूरे दृष्टासि कमलेक्षणे।वृक्षैराच्छाद्य चात्मानं किं मां न प्रतिभाषसे।।3.60.26।।
explanation: O lotus eyed darling, why are you running away? I have already seen you.  Why are you hiding behind trees and not replying to me?

content: तिष्ठ तिष्ठ वरारोहे न तेऽस्ति करुणा मयि।नात्यर्थं हास्यशीलासि किमर्थं मामुपेक्षसे।।3.60.27।।
explanation: O my beautiful beloved, stay, stay  Have you no compassion for me ? You are so fond of fun. Why do you avoid me?

content: पीतकौशेयकेनासि सूचिता वरवर्णिनि।धावन्त्यपि मया दृष्टा तिष्ठ यद्यस्ति सौहृदम्।।3.60.28।।
explanation: O lady of lovely complexion, I can see your yellow silk (flying), while you are running away. If you have love for me, stay on.

content: नैव सा नूनमथवा हिंसिता चारुहासिनी।कृच्छ्रप्राप्तं न मां नूनं यथोपेक्षितुमर्हति।।3.60.29।।
explanation: O lady with a sweet smile I have never hurt you. When I am in difficulty it does not behove you to ignore me.

content: व्यक्तं सा भक्षिता बाला राक्षसैः पिशिताशनैः।विभज्याङ्कानि सर्वाणि मया विरहिता प्रिया।।3.60.30।।
explanation: It is clear that separated from me, the body of my young beloved is torn off and eaten away by carnivorous demons.

content: नूनं तच्छुभदन्तोष्ठं सुनासं चारुकुण्डलम्।पूर्णचन्द्रनिभं ग्रस्तं मुखंनिष्प्रभतां गतम्।।3.60.31।।
explanation: Her beautiful face with her sparkling teeth and lips, wellshaped nose, shining earrings has been like the full moon, eclipsed and rendered pale.

content: सा हि चम्पकवर्णाभा ग्रीवा ग्रैवेयशोभिता।कोमला विलपन्त्यास्तु कान्ताया भक्षिता शुभा।।3.60.32।।
explanation: That delicate, beautiful neck of my beloved having the complexion of a champak flower and adorned with necklaces was perhaps eaten up.

content: नूनं विक्षिप्यमाणौ तौ बाहू पल्लवकोमलौ।भक्षितौ वेपमानाग्रौ सहस्ताभरणाङ्गदौ।।3.60.33।।
explanation: Her arms, delicate like tender leaves, their tips (fingers) quivering, adorned with armlets and bracelets have surely been eaten away.

content: मया विरहिता बाला रक्षसां भक्षणाय वै।सार्धेनेव परित्यक्ता भक्षिता बहुबान्धवा।।3.60.34।।
explanation: The young lady having many relations, forsaken by me, has been (perhaps) picked up by a demon for food and later abandoned halfeaten.

content: हा लक्ष्मण महाबाहो पश्यसि त्वं प्रियां क्वचित्।हा प्रिये क्व गता भद्रे हा सीतेति पुनः पुनः।।3.60.35।।
explanation: O longarmed Lakshmana, are you able to see my beloved anywhere? O noble lady, O darling, where have you gone? O Sita  SIta

content: इत्येवं विलपन्रामः परिधावन्वनाद्वनम्।क्वचिदुद्भ्रमते वेगात्क्वचिद्विभ्रमते बलात्।।3.60.36।।क्वचिन्मत्त इवाभाति कान्तान्वेषणतत्परः।
explanation: Rama ran from forest to forest, now jumping, now taking strong strides, but all the time weeping, a madman busy in search of his beloved.

content: स वनानि नदीश्शैलान् गिरिप्रस्रवणानि च।।3.60.37।।काननानि च वेगेन भ्रमत्यपरिसंस्थितः।
explanation: He rushed through forests, rivers, hills and mountain streams and through dense jungles with an unstable mind.

content: तथा स गत्वा विपुलम् महद्वनं परीत्य सर्वं त्वथ मैथिलीं प्रति।अनिष्ठिताशस्सचकार मार्गणे पुनः प्रियायाः परमं परिश्रमम्।।3.60.38।।
explanation: Rama went about the vast forest searching for the princess from Mithila all over not giving up hope of finding her. He continued to make great efforts for searching his beloved.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे षष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtieth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Unable to find Sita, Rama gets restless -- Lakshmana consoles him -- Rama's speculation about Sita.]दृष्ट्वाश्रमपदं शून्यं रामो दशरथात्मजः।रहितां पर्णशालां च विध्वस्तान्यासनानि च।।3.61.1।।अदृष्ट्वा तत्र वैदेहीं सन्निरीक्ष्य च सर्वशः।उवाच रामः प्राक्रुश्य प्रगृह्य रुचिरौ भुजौ।।3.61.2।।
explanation: Rama, son of Dasaratha, saw the empty cottage devoid of Sita. The mats were displaced. He searched everywhere but unable to see Vaidehi lifted his lovely arms and said:

content: क्व नु लक्ष्मण वैदेही कं वा देशमितो गता।केनाहृता वा सौमित्रे भक्षिता केन वा प्रिया।।3.61.3।।
explanation: O son of Sumitra, where is my beloved ? Where did she go? By whom was she abducted? Or, devoured? O Lakshmana

content: वृक्षेणाच्छाद्य यदि मां सीते हसितुमिच्छसि।अलं ते हसितेनाद्य मां भजस्व सुदुःखितम्।।3.61.4।।
explanation: O Sita if you intend to make fun by hiding behind a tree, I tell you it is enough. Stop it and come to this extremely sorrowful man.

content: यैस्सह क्रीडसे सीते विश्वस्तैर्मृगपोतकैः।एते हीनास्त्वया सौम्ये ध्यायन्त्यस्राविलेक्षणाः।।3.61.5।।
explanation: O gentle  Sita those fawns who trusted you and played with you, are now separated from you. Brooding over you, their eyes are brimming with tears.

content: सीतया रहितोऽहं वै न हि जीवामि लक्ष्मण।मृतं शोकेन महता सीताहरणजेन माम्।।3.61.6।।परलोके महाराजो नूनं द्रक्ष्यति मे पिता।
explanation: O Lakshmana, I cannot live without Sita. I am filled with deep grief on account of Sita's abduction. My late father, the king will certainly see me in the other world (I will definitely commit suicide).

content: कथं प्रतिज्ञां संश्रुत्य मया त्वमभियोजितः।।3.61.7।।अपूरयित्वा तं कालं मत्सकाशमिहागतः।कामवृत्तमनार्यं मां मृषावादिनमेव च।।3.61.8।।धिक्त्वामिति परे लोके व्यक्तं वक्ष्यति मे पिता।
explanation: My father say will surely in the other world: Without completing the appointed period of the vow taken, how could you come here ? Fie upon you  You are irresponsible. You are ignoble. You are a liar.

content: विवशं शोकसन्तप्तं दीनं भग्नमनोरथम्।।3.61.9।।मामिहोत्सृज्य करुणं कीर्तिर्नरमिवानृजुम्।क्व गच्छसि वरारोहे मां नोत्सृज सुमध्यमे।।3.61.10।।त्वया विरहितश्चाहं मोक्ष्ये जीवितमात्मनः।
explanation: O lovely lady where have you gone, leaving me here like fame deserting a crook? I am helpless griefstricken, pitiable, pathetic and disappointed. O lady of slender waist, leave me not. Separated from you, I will give up my life.

content: इतीव विलपन्रामस्सीतादर्शनलालसः।।3.61.11।।न ददर्श सुदुःखार्तो राघवो जनकात्मजाम्।
explanation: Deeply distressed, Rama who was anxious to see Sita, daughter of Janaka, wailed and wailed but could not see her.

content: अनासादयमानं तं सीतां दशरथात्मजम्।।3.61.12।।पङ्कमासाद्य विपुलं सीदन्तमिव कुञ्जरम्।लक्ष्मणो राममत्यर्थमुवाच हितकाम्यया।।3.61.13।।
explanation: Lakshmana, dedicated to his wellbeing, spoke to Rama, son of Dasaratha, who was sinking like an elephant into the quagmire, when he failed to trace Sita.

content: मा विषादं महाबाहो कुरु यत्नं मया सह।इदं च हि वनं शूर बहुकन्दरशोभितम्।।3.61.14।।
explanation: O longarmed, heroic Rama, do not grieve. This forest is full of caves. Let us try together.

content: प्रियकाननसञ्चारा वनोन्मत्ता च मैथिली।सा वनं वा प्रविष्टा स्यान्नलिनीं वा सुपुष्पिताम्।।3.61.15।।
explanation: Sita is madly in love with the forest. She might have entered deep into the jungle or into a fully blossomed lotuspond.

content: सरितं वापि सम्प्राप्ता मीनवञ्जुलसेविताम्।स्नातुकामा निलीना स्याद्धासकामा वने क्वचित्।।3.61.16।।
explanation: Maybe she has gone to take a dip in the river full of reeds and fishes  Or has hidden somewhere for the sake of fun.

content: वित्रासयितुकामा वा लीना स्यात्कानने क्वचित्।जिज्ञासमाना वैदेही त्वां मां च पुरुषर्षभ।।3.61.17।।तस्याह्यन्वेषणे श्रीमन् क्षिप्रमेव यतावहे।
explanation: O best of men, maybe Vaidehi has hidden in the forest intending to scare you and me. She wishes to test our love. O blessed Rama let us ransack the forest immediately.

content: वनं सर्वं विचिनुवो यत्र सा जनकात्मजा।।3.61.18।।मन्यसे यदि काकुत्स्थ मा स्म शोके मनः कृथाः।
explanation: O scion of the Kakutsthas, let us search all over the forest if you please. Do not indulge in sorrow.

content: एवमुक्तस्तु सौहार्दाल्लक्ष्मणेन समाहितः।।3.61.19।।सह सौमित्रिणा रामो विचेतुमुपचक्रमे।
explanation: When Lakshmana consoled him so affectionately Rama became composed. He continued the search with Lakshmana, son of Sumitra.

content: तौ वनानि गिरींश्चैव सरितश्च सरांसि च।।3.61.20।।निखिलेन विचिन्वानौ सीतां दशरथात्मजौ।
explanation: The two sons of Dasaratha went on searching for Sita in forests, mountains, rivers, ponds everywhere.

content: तस्य शैलस्य सानूनि गुहाश्च शिखराणि च।।3.61.21।।निखिलेन विचिन्वानौ नैव तामभिजग्मतुः।
explanation: They were not able to find Sita even though they searched all over the mountain slopes, caves and peaks.

content: विचित्य सर्वतश्शैलं रामो लक्ष्मणमब्रवित्।।3.61.22।।नेह पश्यामि सौमित्रे वैदेहीं पर्वते शुभाम्।
explanation: After searching her all over, Rama said  Saumitri, I am unable to find the noble Vaidehi on the mountain

content: ततो दुःखाभिसन्तप्तो लक्ष्मणो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।3.61.23।।विचरन्दण्डकारण्यं भ्रातरं दीप्ततेजसम्।
explanation: Going about the Dandaka forest Lakshmana, consumed by sorrow, said  to his brother, glowing with brilliance:

content: प्राप्स्यसि त्वं महाप्राज्ञ मैथिलीं जनकात्मजाम्।।3.61.24।।यथा विष्णुर्महाबाहुर्बलिं बद्ध्वा महीमिमाम्।
explanation: O longarmed brother O wise sire  just as Visnu obtained the earth by binding Bali you will obtain Sita certainly.

content: एवमुक्तस्तु सौहार्दाल्लक्ष्मणेन स राघवः।।3.61.25।।उवाच दीनया वाचा दुःखाभिहतचेतनः।
explanation: Having been addressed thus by Lakshmana, Raghava with a griefstriken heart said these piteous words :'Lakshmana,having  spoken like that very affectionately to Rama,who was disturbed by excessive grief said these words piteously:

content: वनं सर्वं सुविचितं पद्मिन्यः फुल्लपङ्कजाः।।3.61.26।।गिरिश्चायं महाप्राज्ञ बहुकन्दरनिर्झरः।न हि पश्यामि वैदेहीं प्राणेभ्योऽपि गरीयसीम्।।3.61.27।।
explanation: O wise Lakshmana I have searched the entire forest, the ponds with fully blossomed lotuses, the mountains with many caves and streams. But could not see Vaidehi who is dearer to me than my life.

content: एवं स विलपन्रामस्सीताहरणकर्शितः।दीनश्शोकसमाविष्टो मुहूर्तं विह्वलोऽभवत्।।3.61.28।।
explanation: Thus tormented by the abduction of Sita, Rama felt dejected and cried.Overpowered by grief he lost his consciousness for a moment.

content: सन्तप्तो ह्यवसन्नाङ्गो गतबुद्धिर्विचेतनः।निषसादातुरो दीनो निश्श्वस्याशीतमायतम्।।3.61.29।।
explanation: By grief tormented, limbs enervated, intellect atrophied, senses switched off, he felt anxious and depressed and sighed long and hot.

content: बहुलं स तु निश्श्वस्य रामो राजीवलोचनः।हा प्रियेति विचुक्रोश बहुशो बाष्पगद्गदः।।3.61.30।।
explanation: Rama, his throat choked, shed propuse tears, sighing, O my darling.

content: तं ततस्सान्त्वयामास लक्ष्मणः प्रियबान्धवः।बहुप्रकारं धर्मज्ञः प्रश्रितं प्रश्रिताञ्जलिः।।3.61.31।।
explanation: Then Lakshmana, the knower of dharma and a dear friend offered obeisance most humbly with folded palms and consoled Rama in many ways.

content: अनादृत्य तु तद्वाक्यं लक्ष्मणोष्ठपुटाच्च्युतम्।अपश्यंस्तां प्रियां सीतां प्राक्रोशत्स पुनः पुनः।।3.61.32।।
explanation: Without caring  for the words from the lips of Lakshmana, Rama sobbed loudly, unable to see his beloved Sita.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyfirst sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama's lamentation.]सीतामपश्यन्धर्मात्मा शोकोपहतचेतनः।विललाप महाबाहू रामः कमललोचनः।।3.62.1।।
explanation: The righteous, the longarmed,lotuseyed Rama, unable to see Sita wept with his senses overwhilmed by grief.

content: पश्यन्निव च तां सीतामपश्यन्मदनार्दितः।उवाच राघवो वाक्यं विलापाश्रयदुर्वचम्।।3.62.2।।
explanation: Under the spell of Cupid, Rama uttered such words in grief which are otherwise unutterable. As if he was seeing Sita (before him) which was not a fact.

content: त्वमशोकस्य शाखाभिः पुष्पप्रियतया प्रिये।आवृणोषि शरीरं ते मम शोकविवर्धिनी।।3.62.3।।
explanation: O my beloved  as you love flowers you are hiding your body behind the branches of the Ashoke tree that enhances my sorrow (paradoxically).

content: कदलीस्कन्धसदृशौ कदल्या संवृतावुभौ।ऊरू पश्यामि ते देवि नासि शक्ता निगूहितुम्।।3.62.4।।
explanation: O Devi I can see both your thighs which resemble banana trunk hidden behind a banana plant. It is not possible for you to hide them from me.

content: कर्णिकारवनं भद्रे हसन्ती देवि सेवसे।अलं ते परिहासेन मम बाधावहेन वै।।3.62.5।।
explanation: O gentle one  you are wandering in the karnikara garden, laughing and making fun. Enough of this , that causes my pain.

content: परिहासेन किं सीते परिश्रान्तस्य मे प्रिये।अयं स परिहासोऽपि साधु देवि न रोचते।।3.62.6।।
explanation: O my dear Sita, why are you joking when I am exhausted? Such fun cannot be relished  now.

content: विशेषेणाश्रमस्थाने हासोऽयं न प्रशस्यते।अवगच्छामि ते शीलं परिहासप्रियं प्रिये।।3.62.7।।आगच्छ त्वं विशालाक्षि शून्योऽयमुटजस्तव।
explanation: O darling  joking specially in a hermitage  is not appreciated. I know your nature.You love fun. O largeeyed Sita, come here. This cottage of yours is empty.

content: सुव्यक्तं राक्षसैस्सीता भक्षिता वा हृतापि वा।।3.62.8।।न हि सा विलपन्तं मामुपसम्प्रैति लक्ष्मण।
explanation: O Lakshmana surely Sita is either devoured by demons or abducted. When I am weeping like this she is not coming to me.

content: एतानि मृगयूथानि साश्रुनेत्राणि लक्ष्मण।।3.62.9।।शंसन्तीव हि वैदेहीं भक्षितां रजनीचरैः।
explanation: O Lakshmana, these herds of deer with their eyes filled with tears are as if telling me that she is eaten away by the demons.

content: हा ममार्ये क्व यातासि हा साध्वि वरवर्णिनि।।3.62.10।।हा सकामा त्वया देवी कैकेयी सा भविष्यति।
explanation: Alas, my noble lady, where have you gone? O chaste lady of excellent complexion, that queen Kaikeyi's desire will be fulfilled now.

content: सीतया सह निर्यातो विना सीतामुपागतः।।3.62.11।।कथं नाम प्रवेक्ष्यामि शून्यमन्तःपुरं पुनः।
explanation: I left home with Sita. How can I reenter the inner apartment without her ?

content: निर्वीर्य इति लोको मां निर्दयश्चेति वक्ष्यति।।3.62.12।।कातरत्वं प्रकाशं हि सीतापनयनेन मे।
explanation: By Sita's abduction it will be  clear to the world that I lack manliness and compassion. My cowardly nature will clearly manifest.

content: निवृत्तवनवासश्च जनकं मिथिलाधिपम्।।3.62.13।।कुशलं परिपृच्छन्तं कथं शक्ष्ये निरीक्षितुम्।
explanation: After completing the period of my exile when Janaka , king of Mithila, enquires of her welfare how can I face him?

content: विदेहराजो नूनं मां दृष्ट्वा विरहितं तया।।3.62.14।।सुतास्नेहेन सन्तप्तो मोहस्य वशमेष्यति।
explanation: If the king of Videha sees me without her, he will surely be distressed and will fall into a swoon for the love of his daughter.

content: अथवा न गमिष्यामि पुरीं भरतपालिताम्।।3.62.15।।स्वर्गोऽपि सीतया हीनश्शून्य एव मतो मम।
explanation: Or else, I will not go to the city ruled by Bharata. Without Sita even heaven will be empty for me.

content: मामिहोत्सृज्य हि वने गच्छायोध्यां पुरीं शुभाम्।।3.62.16।।न त्वहं तां विना सीतां जीवेयं हि कथञ्चन।
explanation: Go to the auspicious city of Ayodhya, leaving me here in the woods. I can never live without Sita.

content: गाढमाश्लिष्य भरतो वाच्यो मद्वचनात्त्वया।।3.62.17।।अनुज्ञातोऽसि रामेण पालयेति वसुन्धराम्।
explanation: While embracing Bharata tightly, repeat my words, 'You are permitted by Rama to rule the earth.'

content: अम्बा च मम कैकेयी सुमित्रा च त्वया विभो।।3.62.18।।कौसल्या च यथान्यायमभिवाद्या ममाऽज्ञया।रक्षणीया प्रयत्नेन भवता सूक्तकारिणा।।3.62.19।।
explanation: My mother Kaikeyi, Sumitra and Kausalya  should also be offered due obeisance. You should protect them with great effort, carrying out my instructions.

content: सीतायाश्च विनाशोऽयं मम चामित्रकर्शन।विस्तरेण जनन्या मे विनिवेद्यस्त्वया भवेत्।।3.62.20।।
explanation: O Lakshmana, subduer of the enemy this loss of Sita and me should be explained in detail to my mother.

content: इति विलपति राघवे सुदीने वनमुपगम्य तया विना सुकेश्या।भयविकलमुखस्तु लक्ष्मणोऽपि व्यथितमना भृशमातुरो बभूव।।3.62.21।।
explanation: When Rama, devoid of  Sita, the lady with beautiful hair, wailed piteously after reaching the forest, Lakshmana too, his face pale out of fear and mind dejected, felt extremely agitated.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे द्विषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtysecond sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama recalls the events starting from exile--  describes Sita's beauty, virtues and gentleness--drifts back to sorrow--Lakshmana tells Rama to think of a way of finding Sita.]स राजपुत्रः प्रियया विहीनः शोकेन मोहेन च पीड्यमानः।विषादयन्भ्रातरमार्तरूपो भूयो विषादं प्रविवेश तीव्रम्।।3.63.1।।
explanation: Prince Rama, separated from his beloved, lost his senses out of sorrow. Seeing his brother in a distressed state, he sank again into intense grief.

content: स लक्ष्मणं शोकवशाभिपन्नं शोके निमग्नो विपुले तु रामः।उवाच वाक्यं व्यसनानुरूपमुष्णं विनिश्श्वस्य रुदंत्सशोकम्।।3.63.2।।
explanation: Plunged in deep grief, Rama heaved hot sighs and said these words to griefstricken Lakshmanaweeping:

content: न मद्विधो दुष्कृतकर्मकारी मन्ये द्वितीयोऽस्ति वसुन्धरायाम्।शोकेन शोको हि परम्पराया मा मेति भिन्दन्हृदयं मनश्च।।3.63.3।।
explanation: I think there is none on earth like me who has performed such forbidden acts.  One grief after the other is successively piercing my heart and my mind.

content: पूर्वं मया नूनमभीप्सितानि पापानि कर्माण्यसकृत्कृतानि।तत्रायमद्यापतितो विपाको दुःखेन दुःखं यदहं विशामि।।3.63.4।।
explanation: In the past I had certainly done some sinful deeds I often liked the consequences of which have descended on me now as I am experiencing one sorrow after another.

content: राज्यप्रणाशस्स्वजनैर्वियोगः पितुर्विनाशो जननीवियोगः।सर्वाणि मे लक्ष्मण शोकवेगमापूरयन्ति प्रविचिन्तितानि।।3.63.5।।
explanation: O Lakshmana, loss of kingdom, separation from kith and kin, death of father, separation from mother--all these thoughts augment my sorrow faster and in greater measure.

content: सर्वं तु दुःखं मम लक्ष्मणेदं शान्तं शरीरे वनमेत्य शून्यम्।सीतावियोगात्पुनरप्युदीर्णं काष्ठैरिवाग्निस्सहसा प्रदीप्तः।।3.63.6।।
explanation: O Lakshmana, all this sorrow calmed down when I came to this solitary forest. But with Sita's separation, it was rekindled just as fire blazes forth again with logs of wood.

content: सा नूनमार्या मम राक्षसेन बलाद्दृता खं समुपेत्य भीरुः।अपस्वरं सस्वरविप्रलापा भयेन विक्रन्दितवत्यभीक्ष्णम्।।3.63.7।।
explanation: The timid princess of mine forcibly carried away into the sky by a demon must have again and again cried aloud out of fear in a broken voice.

content: तौ लोहितस्य प्रियदर्शनस्य सदोचितावुत्तमचन्दनस्य।वृत्तौ स्तनौ शोणितपङ्कदिग्धौ नूनं प्रियाया मम नाभिभातः।।3.63.8।।
explanation: Her captivating copper coloured skin, smeared with the best of red sandal paste would not be surely pleasing now, drenched in blood and mud.

content: तच्छलक्ष्णसुव्यक्तमृदुप्रलापं तस्या मुखं कुञ्चितकेशभारम्।रक्षोवशं नूनमुपागताया न भ्राजते राहुमुखे यथेन्दुः।।3.63.9।।
explanation: Her face with her clear, sweet and gentle words and her curly hair falling will no more look bright coming under the grip of demons like the moon eclipsed by Rahu.

content: तां हारपाशस्य सदोचिताया ग्रीवां प्रियाया मम सुव्रतायाः।रक्षांसि नूनं परिपीतवन्ति विभिद्य शून्ये रुधिराशनानि।।3.63.10।।
explanation: The bloodthirsty demons must have drunk the blood of my faithful beloved in a lonely place breaking her neck that used to wear beautiful necklaces.

content: मया विहीना विजने वने या रक्षोभिराहृत्य विकृष्यमाणा।नूनं निनादं कुररीव दीना सा मुक्तवत्यायतकान्तनेत्रा।।3.63.11।।
explanation: The lovely, largeeyed lady separated from me in the desolate forest, abducted and dragged by demons must have cried at that time desperately like a female osprey.

content: अस्मिन्मयासार्धमुदारशीला शिलातले पूर्वमुपोपविष्टा।कान्तस्मिता लक्ष्मण जातहासा त्वामाह सीता बहुवाक्यजातम्।।3.63.12।।
explanation: On this rock, O Lakshmana, my goodnatured lady with her lovely smile sat with me in the past and chatted with you.

content: गोदावरीयं सरितां वरिष्ठा प्रिया प्रियाया मम नित्यकालम्।अप्यत्र गच्छेदिति चिन्तयामि नैकाकिनी याति हि सा कदाचित्।।3.63.13।।
explanation: Would she have gone to Godavari, the foremost of the rivers so dear at all times to my beloved ? But I think she has not gone there alone at any time.

content: पद्मानना पद्मविशालनेत्रा पद्मानि वानेतुमभिप्रयाता।तदप्ययुक्तं न हि सा कदाचिन्मया विना गच्छति पङ्कजानि।।3.63.14।।
explanation: The lady whose face was like the lotus, whose large eyes were like lotus petals could  have gone to fetch lotuses (but) that also is not possible as she has never gone there without me.

content: कामं त्विदं पुष्पितवृक्षषण्डं नानाविधैः पक्षिगणैरुपेतम्।वनं प्रयाता नु तदप्ययुक्त मेकाकिनी सातिबिभेति भीरुः।।3.63.15।।
explanation: Could she have gone to the forest where there are many kinds of trees in full bloom inhabited by a variety of birds? That is also not possible as she is timid and too scared to go there alone.

content: आदित्य भो लोककृताकृतज्ञ लोकस्य सत्यानृतकर्मसाक्षिन्।मम प्रिया सा क्व गता हृता वा शंसस्व मे शोकवशस्य नित्यम्।।3.63.16।।
explanation: O Sungod, you know all the happenings of the world. You are witness to all the deeds of the people, true and false. Tell me where my beloved Sita has gone or has been carried off. My grief never ceases.

content: लोकेषु सर्वेषु च नास्ति किञ्चिद्यत्ते न नित्यं विदितं भवेत्तत्।शंसस्व वायो कुलशालिनीं तां हृता मृता वा पथि वर्तते वा।।3.63.17।।
explanation: O Windgod, there is nothing that you know not in all the worlds. Do tell me if  that lady of a noble race has been abducted or dead or is on the way.

content: इतीव तं शोकविधेयदेहं रामं विसंज्ञं विलपन्तमेवम्।उवाच सौमित्रिरदीनसत्त्वो न्याये स्थितः कालयुतं च वाक्यम्।।3.63.18।।
explanation: While Rama was thus in tears, in a state of sorrow and swoon, Lakshmana who was rational and courageous spoke to him words appropriate to the time :

content: शोकं विमुञ्चार्य धृतिं भजस्व सोत्साहता चास्तु विमार्गणेऽस्याः।उत्साहवन्तो हि नरा न लोके सीदन्ति कर्मस्वतिदुष्करेषु।।3.63.19।।
explanation: O noble prince, give up grief. Take courage. Show enthusiasm to search and find Sita. Enthusiastic people will not get despondent in carrying out the  most difficult tasks.

content: इतीव सौमित्रिमुदग्रपौरुषं ब्रुवन्तमार्तो रघुवंशवर्धनः।न चिन्तयामास धृतिं विमुक्तवान्पुनश्च दुःखं महदभ्युपागमत्।।3.63.20।।
explanation: Rama who carries on the (glorious) progeny of the Raghu dynasty, did not (however) consider seriously the words of Lakshmana, a man of great prowess. Forsaking his courage he was once again overtaken by deep sorrow.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे त्रिषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtythird sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama and Lakshmana continue their search for Sita -- find signs of ornaments and footprints of Sita,broken pieces of bow, shield and parasol -- Rama ventilates his anger towards all in the three worlds -- concludes that Sita has been hijacked by a demon.] स दीनो दीनया वाचा लक्ष्मणं वाक्यमब्रवीत्।शीघ्रं लक्ष्मण जानीहि गत्वा गोदावरीं नदीम्।।3.64.1।।अपि गोदावरीं सीता पद्मान्यानयितुं गता।
explanation: Rama in dejection said these pitiable words to Lakshmana,O Lakashmana, go swiftly to the river Godavari and find out if Sita has gone there to get lotuses.

content: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण लक्ष्मणः परवीरहा।।3.64.2।।नदीं गोदावरीं रम्यां जगाम लघुविक्रमः।
explanation: Lakshmana, destroyer of enemywarriors, went to the beautiful river Godavari with quick steps following the instruction of Rama.

content: तां लक्ष्मणस्तीर्थवती विचित्वा राममब्रवीत्।।3.64.3।।नैनां पश्यामि तीर्थेषु क्रोशतो न शृणोति मे।
explanation: Searching for Sita at the landings of river Godavari, Lakshmana said to Rama, I am unable to find her at these landings.No one responds to my call.

content: कं नु वा देशमापन्ना वैदेही क्लेशनाशिनी।।3.64.4।।न ह्यहं वेद तं देशं यत्र सा जनकात्मजा।
explanation: Where could Vaidehi, destroyer of sorrow, go? I wonder. I am unable to trace the spot where the daughter of Janaka could be found.

content: लक्ष्मणस्य वचश्श्रुत्वा दीनस्सन्तापमोहितः।।3.64.5।।रामस्समभिचक्राम स्वयं गोदावरीं नदीम्।स तामुपस्थितो रामः क्व सीतेत्येवमब्रवीत्।।3.64.6।।
explanation: Overwhelmed with grief on hearing Lakshmana's words, Rama himself went to river Godavari, and shouted, where are you, Sita?

content: भूतानि राक्षसेन्द्रेण वधार्हेण हृतामिति।न तां शशंसू रामाय तथा गोदावरी नदि।।3.64.7।।
explanation: Like the elements of Nature, river Godavari did not disclose Rama that Sita had been abducted by the king of demons who deserved death.

content: ततः प्रचोदिता भूतैश्शंसास्मैतां प्रियामिति।न तु साभ्यवदतसितां पृष्टा रामेण शोचता।।3.64.8।।
explanation: River Godavari (although) prompted by creatures (of Nature) to tell him about his beloved did not respond to brooding Rama.

content: रावणस्य तु तद्रूपं कर्माणि च दुरात्मनः।ध्यात्वा भयात्तु वैदेहीं सा नदी न शशंस ताम्।।3.64.9।।
explanation: Remembering the evilminded Ravana's appearance and action, the river revealed nothing about Vaidehi out of fear.

content: निराशस्तु तया नद्या सीताया दर्शने कृतः।उवाच रामस्सौमित्रिं सीतादर्शनकर्शितः।।3.64.10।।
explanation: Disappointed by the river and emaciated by not being able to see Sita, Rama said to Lakshmana :

content: एषा गोदावरी सौम्य किंचिन्न प्रति भाषते।किं नु लक्ष्मण वक्ष्यामि समेत्य जनकं वचः।।3.64.11।।मातरं चैव वैदेह्या विना तामहमप्रियम्।
explanation: O handsome Lakshmana this Godavari does not at all respond. How can I go to Janaka and my mother without Sita and break this unhappy news?

content: या मे राज्यविहीनस्य वने वन्येन जीवतः।।3.64.12।।सर्वं व्यपनयेच्छोकं वैदेही क्व नु सा गता।
explanation: Where could have gone that Vaidehi, who  removed all my sorrows and sufferings when I lost my kingdom and survived on food available in the forest?

content: ज्ञातिपक्षविहीनस्य राजपुत्रीमपश्यतः।।3.64.13।।मन्ये दीर्घा भविष्यन्ति रात्रयो मम जाग्रतः।
explanation: Away from relatives and away from the princess, I keep awake during nights which seem too long.

content: गोदावरीं जनस्थानमिमं प्रस्रवणं गिरिम्।।3.64.14।।सर्वाण्यनुगमिष्यामि यदि सीता हि दृश्यते।
explanation: I will roam about the river Godavari, Janasthana and this mount Prasravana till I find Sita.

content: एते मृगा महावीर्य मामीक्षन्ते मुहुर्मुहुः।।3.64.15।।वक्तुकामा इव हि मे इङ्गितान्युपलक्षये।
explanation: O mighty Lakshmana these deer are looking at me again and again indicating that they wish to tell me something.

content: तांस्तु दृष्ट्वा नरव्याघ्रो राघवः प्रत्युवाच ह।।3.64.16।।क्व सीतेति निरीक्षन्वै बाष्पसंरुद्धया दृशा।
explanation: With his vision blurred by tears, Rama, the best among men, looked at them and asked them 'Where is Sita'?

content: एवमुक्ता नरेन्द्रेण ते मृगास्सहसोत्थिताः।।3.64.17।।दक्षिणाभिमुखास्सर्वे दर्शयन्तो नभस्थलम्।मैथिली ह्रियमाणा सा दिशं यामन्वपद्यत।।3.64.18।।तेन मार्गेण धावन्तो निरीक्षन्ते नराधिपम्।
explanation: Thus asked by the prince, all the deer got up suddenly, and pointed towards the southern sky, the direction in which the princess from Mithila was carried off. Looking at the Lord of men (Rama), they started running in that direction.

content: येन मार्गं च भूमिं च निरीक्षन्ते स्म ते मृगाः।।3.64.19।।पुनश्च मार्गमिच्छन्ति लक्ष्मणेनोपलक्षिताः।
explanation: Even Lakshmana marked that the deer were showing and looking at the path lying in that direction.

content: तेषां वचनसर्वस्वं लक्षयामास चेङ्गितम्।।3.64.20।।उवाच लक्ष्मणो ज्येष्ठं धीमान्भ्रातरमार्तवत्।
explanation: Observing intelligently their indications and understanding the meaning of their message, Lakshmana said to his distressed elder brother:

content: क्व सितेति त्वया पृष्टा यथेमे सहसोत्थिताः।।3.64.21।।दर्शयन्ति क्षितिं चैव दक्षिणां च दिशं मृगाः।साधु गच्छावहे देव दिशमेतां हि नैऋतिम्।।3.64.22।।यदि स्यादागमः कश्चिदार्या वा साऽथ लक्ष्यते।
explanation: O lord these deer are indicating the land on the southern side.Therefore it will be proper for both of us to proceed in the southwestern direction. Maybe we will get some clue or find that noble Sita.

content: बाढमित्येव काकुत्स्थः प्रस्थितो दक्षिणां दिशम्।।3.64.23।।लक्ष्मणानुगतश्शीमन्वीक्षमाणो वसुन्धराम्।
explanation: Handsome Rama said, 'yes'and started in southern direction, carefully looking at the ground, followed by Lakshmana.

content: एवं सम्भाषमाणौ तावन्योन्यं भ्रातरावुभौ।।3.64.24।।वसुन्धरायां पतितं पुष्पमार्गमपश्यताम्।
explanation: Talking with each other, the two brothers took the path on earth strewn with flowers.

content: तां पुष्पवृष्टिं पतितां दृष्ट्वा रामो महीतले।।3.64.25।।उवाच लक्ष्मणं वीरो दुःखितो दुःखितं वचः।
explanation: Seeing showers of flowers fallen on the ground, valiant Rama sadly said these words to sorrowful Lakshmana:

content: अभिजानामि पुष्पाणि तानीमानीह लक्ष्मण।।3.64.26।।पिनद्धानि हि वैदेह्या मया दत्तानि कानने।
explanation: O Lakshmana, here are the same flowers I had given Vaidehi to wear in the forest. I can recognize them.

content: मन्ये सूर्यश्च वायुश्च मेदिनी च यशस्विनी।।3.64.27।।अभिरक्षन्ति पुष्पाणि प्रकुर्वन्तो मम प्रियम्।
explanation: I think the Sun, the wind  and the famed earth have done me a favour by preserving these flowers.

content: एवमुक्त्वा महाबाहुं लक्ष्मणं पुरुषर्षभः।।3.64.28।।उवाच रामो धर्मात्मा गिरिं प्रस्रवणाकुलम्।
explanation: Rigteous Rama, the best among men, having said these words to the longarmed Lakshmana, asked mount Prasravana, full of streams:

content: कच्चित् क्षितिभृतां नाथ दृष्टा सर्वाङ्गसुन्दरी।।3.64.29।।रामा रम्ये वनोद्देशे मया विरहिता त्वया।
explanation: O king of the mountains have you seen a lady with beautiful limbs separated from me in this forest tract ?

content: क्रुद्धोऽब्रवीद्गिरिं तत्र सिंहः क्षुद्रमृगं यथा।।3.64.30।।तां हेमवर्णां हेमाभां सीतां दर्शय पर्वत।यावत्सानूनि सर्वाणि न ते विध्वंसयाम्यहम्।।3.64.31।।
explanation: Like a lion aiming at a petty animal, angry Rama  said, O Mountain before I destroy  all your slopes show me that goldenhued Sita with lustre like gold.

content: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण पर्वतो मैथिलीं प्रति।शंसन्निव ततस्सीतां नादर्शयत राघवे।।3.64.32।।
explanation: Thus addressed by Rama, the mountain echoed as if it was telling about Sita but did not show her to Rama.

content: ततो दाशरथी राम उवाच च शिलोच्चयम्।मम बाणाग्निनिर्दग्धो भस्मीभूतो भविष्यसि।।3.64.33।।असेव्यः सततं चैव निस्तृणद्रुमपल्लवः।
explanation: Rama, Dasaratha's son said to the mountain, The fire of my arrows will reduce you to ashes.You will have no grass, no tree, no twig. You will be unfit to be served any more.

content: इमां वा सरितं चाद्य शोषयिष्यामि लक्ष्मण।।3.64.34।।यदि नाख्याति मे सीतामार्यां चन्द्रनिभाननाम्।
explanation: O Lakshmana if this river does not tell me about that noble Sita with countenance like the moon, I will drain it dry right now.

content: एवं स रुषितो रामो दिधक्षन्निव चक्षुषा।।3.64.35।।ददर्श भूमौ निष्क्रान्तं राक्षसस्य पदं महत्।त्रस्ताया रामकाङ्क्षिण्याः प्रधावन्त्या इतस्ततः।।3.64.36।।राक्षसेनानुवृत्ताया मैथिल्याश्च पदान्यथ।
explanation: While Rama was angry with his eyes burning, he saw on the ground as he advanced large footprints of a demon and then the footprints of Maithili which signified as if chased by the demon, she was frightened and was running hither and thither, longing to see Rama.

content: स समीक्ष्य परिक्रान्तं सीताया राक्षसस्य च।।3.64.37।।भग्नं धनुश्च तूणी च विकीर्णं बहुधा रथम्।सम्भ्रान्तहृदयो रामश्शशंस भ्रातरंप्रियम्।।3.64.38।।
explanation: Bewildered to see the broken bow and quiver and many splinters of the chariot scattered all over, Rama said to his loving brother Lakshmana:

content: पश्य लक्ष्मण वैदेह्याशशीर्णाः कनकबिन्दवः।भूषणानां हि सौमित्रे माल्यानि विविधानि च।।3.64.39।।
explanation: O Saumitri  see the many broken bits of gold ornaments and garlands.

content: तप्तबिन्दुनिकाशैश्च चित्रैः क्षतजबिन्दुभिः।आवृतं पश्य सौमित्रे सर्वतो धरणीतलम्।3.64.40।।
explanation: See, O Lakshmana, the patches of blood looking like drops of shining gold spread all over the ground.

content: मन्ये लक्ष्मण वैदेही राक्षसैः कामरूपिभिः।भित्वाभित्वा विभक्ता वा भक्षिता वा भविष्यति।।3.64.41।।
explanation: O Lakshmana, Vaidehi might have been cut into pieces, and eaten up by the demons who can assume any form at their free will.

content: तस्या निमित्तं वैदेह्या द्वयोर्विवदमानयोः।बभूव युद्धं सौमित्रे घोरं राक्षसयोरिह।।3.64.42।।
explanation: O Lakshmana, two demons might have fought a dreadful duel at this place contesting with each other for the sake of Vaidehi.

content: मुक्तामणिमयं चेदं तपनीयविभूषितम्।धरण्यां पतितं सौम्य कस्य भग्नं महद्धनुः।।3.64.43।।
explanation: O handsome Lakshmana whose is this huge bow embedded with pearls and gems and adorned with gold fallen on the ground?

content: तरुणादित्यसङ्काशं वैडूर्यगुलिकाचितम्।विशीर्णं पतितं भूमौ कवचं कस्य काञ्चनम्।।3.64.44।।
explanation: Whose is this shield of gold studded with Vaidurya, broken and strewn all over the ground, shining like the morning Sun?

content: छत्रं शतशलाकं च दिव्यमाल्योपशोभितम्।भग्नदण्डमिदं कस्य भूमौ सम्यङ्निपातितम्।।3.64.45।।
explanation: Whose parasol is this with a hundred spokes, festooned with wonderful flowers thrown down on the ground with broken staff ?

content: काञ्चनोरश्छदा श्चेमे पिशाचवदनाः खराः।भीमरूपा महाकायाः कस्य वा निहता रणे।।3.64.46।।
explanation: Whose are these donkeys, with golden chestcoverings, with the devil's face, fierceful and huge and slain in the encounter ?

content: दीप्तपावकसङ्काशो द्युतिमान्समरध्वजः।अपविद्धश्च भग्नश्च कस्य साङ्ग्रामिको रथः।।3.64.47।।
explanation: Whose war chariot with a battle flag is this, shining like burning fire, turned upside down and broken?

content: रथाक्षमात्रा विशिखास्तपनीयविभूषणाः।कस्येमेऽभिहता बाणाः प्रकीर्णा घोरकर्मणः।।3.64.48।।
explanation: Whose are these pointless arrows of the size of a chariot axle adorned with bright gold destroyed and scattered ? Who is he that has performed such terrible deeds?

content: शरावरौ शरैः पूर्णौ विध्वस्तौ पश्य लक्ष्मण।प्रतोदाभीशुहस्तो वै कस्यायं सारथिर्हतः।।3.64.49।।
explanation: O Lakshmana  look at these two quivers filled with arrows and lying shattered.  The charioteer is holding a whip and reins in his hands and is lying dead. To whom do they belong?

content: कस्येमौ पुरुषव्याघ्र शयाते निहतौ युधि।चामरग्राहिणौ सौम्य सोष्णीषमणिकुण्डलौ।।3.64.50।।
explanation: O best among men, O handsome Lakshmana see these carriers of fans with head dress and earrings studded with gems lying slain in the combat. Whose are they ?

content: पदवीपुरुषस्यैषा व्यक्तं कस्यापि रक्षसः।वैरं शतगुणं पश्य ममेदं जीवितान्तकम्।।3.64.51।।
explanation: This indeed is the path the man or the demon has traversed. My enmity with him now has become hundredfold. This will end only with the extermination of his life.

content: सुघोरहृदयैस्सौम्य राक्षसैः कामरूपिभिः।हृता मृता वा सीता सा भक्षिता वा तपस्विनी।।3.64.52।।नधर्मस्त्रायते सीतां ह्रियमाणां महावने।
explanation: O handsome one, those demons can change their form at will and are of dreadful nature. Have they abducted or devoured or killed her in this great forest. Even her righteousness could not protect the helpless Sita.

content: भक्षितायां हि वैदेह्यां हृतायामपि लक्ष्मण।।3.64.53।।के हि लोके प्रियं कर्तुं शक्तास्सौम्य ममेश्वराः।
explanation: If Sita has been devoured or kidnapped, none in this world or even gods could do anything to make me happy, O handsome Lakshmana

content: कर्तारमपि लोकानां शूरं करुणवेदिनम्।।3.64.54।।अज्ञानादवमन्येरत्सर्वभूतानि लक्ष्मण।
explanation: O Lakshmana even the compassionate and heroic Creator of the worlds will be disrespected by all beings, however ignorantly (if such things are allowed to happen).

content: मृदुं लोकहिते युक्तं दान्तं करुणवेदिनम्।।3.64.55।।निर्वीर्य इति मन्यन्ते नूनं मां त्रिदशेश्वराः।
explanation: The gods will certainly consider me a man engaged in the welfare of the world, a man of selfrestraint and compassion, but at the same time a weak man.

content: मां प्राप्य हि गुणो दोषस्संवृत्तः पश्य लक्ष्मण।।3.64.56।।अद्यैव सर्वभूतानां रक्षसामभवाय च।संहृत्यैव शशिज्योत्स्नां महान्सूर्य इवोदितः।।3.64.57।।संहृत्यैव गुणान्सर्वान्मम तेजः प्रकाशते।
explanation: O Lakshmana even demerits turn into merits when they come in contact with me. Just as the Sun shines, effacing the moonlight, my brilliance will outshine my demerits of exterminating all (wicked) beings including the demons.

content: नैव यक्षा न गन्धर्वा न पिशाचा न राक्षसाः।।3.64.58।।किन्नरा वा मनुष्या वा सुखं प्राप्स्यन्ति लिक्ष्मण।
explanation: O Lakshmana, neither yakshas, nor goblins nor demons nor kinneras nor humans  will be in peace now.

content: ममास्त्रबाणसम्पूर्णमाकाशं पश्य लक्ष्मण।।3.64.59।।निस्सम्पातं करिष्यामि ह्यद्य त्रैलोक्यचारिणाम्।
explanation: O Lakshmana, just see, I will fill the sky with all my weapons and arrows and make all movements impossible in the three worlds.

content: सन्निरुद्धग्रहगणमावारितनिशाकरम्।।3.64.60।।विप्रणष्टानलमरुद्भास्करद्युतिसंवृतम्।विनिर्मथितशैलाग्रं शुष्यमाणजलाशयम्।।3.64.61।।ध्वस्तद्रुमलतागुल्मं विप्रणाशितसागरम्।त्रैलोक्यं तु करिष्यामि संयुक्तं कालकर्मणा।।3.64.62।।
explanation: I will obstruct the movement of planets and the Moon, destroy the radiance of the Sun, the fire and block the wind crush the mountain tops, dry up the tanks, destroy the trees shrubs and creepers and annihilate the oceans. I shall bring about this fatal change at once in the three worlds.

content: न तां कुशलिनीं सीतां प्रदास्यन्ति ममेश्वराः।अस्मिन्मुहूर्ते सौमित्रे मम द्रक्ष्यन्ति विक्रमम्।।3.64.63।।
explanation: If the gods do not return my Sita safely to me, O Lakshmana  they will witness my power right now.

content: नाकाशमुत्पतिष्यन्ति सर्वभूतानि लक्ष्मण।मम चापगुणोन्मुक्तैर्बाणजालैर्निरन्तरम्।।3.64.64।।
explanation: Lakshmana no beings will be able to move in the sky, blocked by arrows released from my bowstring there will be no space left there.

content: अर्दितं मम नाराचैर्ध्वस्तभ्रान्तमृगद्विजम्।समाकुलममर्यादं जगत्पश्याद्य लक्ष्मण।।3.64.65।।
explanation: O Lakshmna now beasts and birds will be confused and destroyed by my darts.You will see them crossing all limits of propriety.

content: आकर्णपूर्णैरिषुभिर्जीवलोकं दुरावरैः।करिष्ये मैथिलीहेतोरपिशाचमराक्षसम्।।3.64.66।।
explanation: For the sake of Maithili I will render this world devoid of goblins and demons with my irresistible arrows pulled up to my ears.

content: मम रोषप्रयुक्तानां सायकानां बलं सुराः।द्रक्ष्यन्त्यद्य विमुक्तानामतिदूरातिगामिनाम्।।3.64.67।।
explanation: Now the gods will witness the power of my arrows released in great rage which can hit distant targets.

content: नैव देवा न दैतेया न पिशाचा न राक्षसाः।भविष्यन्ति मम क्रोधात्त्रैलोक्ये विप्रणाशिते।।3.64.68।।
explanation: My anger will destroy all the gods, demons and evil spirits. They will be extinghished from the three worlds.

content: देवदानवयक्षाणां लोका ये रक्षसामपि।बहुधा न भविष्यन्ति बाणौघैश्शकलीकृताः।।3.64.69।।
explanation: The worlds of gods, yakshas or even demons torn into shreds by my arrows will not  survive.

content: निर्मर्यादानिमान्लोकान्करिष्याम्यद्य सायकैः।हृतां मृतां वा सौमित्रे न दास्यन्ति ममेश्वराः।।3.64.70।।
explanation: If the gods do not hand over Sita to me either carried away or dead I will transgress these worlds, O Lakshmana

content: तथारुपां हि वैदेहीं न दास्यन्ति यदि प्रियाम्।नाशयामि जगत्सर्वं त्रैलोक्यं सचराचरम्।।3.64.71।।
explanation: If my beloved Vaidehi is not given back to me in her true form I will destroy the three worlds with all animate and inanimate beings.

content: इत्युक्त्वा रोषताम्राक्षो रामो निष्पीड्य कार्मुकम्।शरमादाय सन्दीप्तं घोरमाशीविषोपमम्।।3.64.72।।सन्धाय धनुषि श्रीमान्रामः परपुरञ्जयः।युगान्ताग्निरिव क्रुद्ध इदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।3.64.73।।
explanation: After speaking these words, handsome Rama, his eyes red with anger, pressed his bow, took out the glowing arrow that was dreadful like a poisonous serpent, fixed it to his bow and said these words in a rage like the fire at the time of dissolution of the world.

content: यथा जरा यथा मृत्युर्यथा कालो यथा विधिः।नित्यं न प्रतिहन्यन्ते सर्वभूतेषु लक्ष्मण।।3.64.74।।तथाहं क्रोधसंयुक्तो न निवार्योऽस्मि सर्वथा।
explanation: Just as all beings in this world cannot avoid age and death, or defy time and fate so also none can prevent me at all when I am  angry, O Lakshmana

content: पुरेव मे चारुदंतीमनिन्दितां दिशन्ति सीतां यदि नाद्य मैथिलीम्।सदेवगन्धर्वमनुष्यपन्नगं जगत्सशैलं परिवर्तयाम्यहम्।।3.64.75।।
explanation: I will topsyturvy this entire world including the gods, the gandharvas, human beings, serpents and mountains if they do not show me the princess from Mithila, who is blemishless and whose teeth are beautifulइत्यार्शे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकेय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे चतुष्षष्टिमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyfourth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Lakshmana pacifies Rama -- explains that destruction of the world is not proper -- initiates the search.]तप्यमानं तथा रामं सीताहरणकर्शितम्।लोकानामभवे युक्तं सांवर्तकमिवानलम्।।3.65.1।।वीक्षमाणं धनुस्सज्यं निश्श्वसन्तं पुनः पुनः।दग्धुकामं जगत्सर्वं युगान्ते च यथा हरम्।।3.65.2।।अदृष्टपूर्वं सङ्क्रुद्धं दृष्ट्वा रामं तु लक्ष्मणः।अब्रवीत्प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यं मुखेन परिशुष्यता।।3.65.3।।
explanation: Tormented and emaciated due to Sita's abduction, resembling the fire at the time of dissolution of the creation, ready to destroy the world, Rama looked at his bow strung again and again, breathing hot sighs like Lord Siva at the end of the creation, wishing to burn down the world in a rage. Lakshmana who had never seen Rama in such anger before said to him with folded hands and parched throat.

content: पुरा भूत्वा मृदुर्दान्तस्सर्वभूतहिते रतः।न क्रोधवशमापन्नः प्रकृतिं हातुमर्हसि।।3.65.4।।
explanation: Earlier you were gentle, self restrained and engaged in the welfare of all beings. (Now) it is not proper for you to give up your natural composure in anger.

content: चन्द्रे लक्ष्मीः प्रभा सूर्ये गतिर्वायौ भुवि क्षमा।एतत्तु नियतं सर्वं त्वयि चानुत्तमं यशः।।3.65.5।।
explanation: In you are always present the grace of the Moon, the radiance of the Sun, the motion of the wind, the forbearance of the earth and reputation.

content: एकस्य नापराधेन लोकान् हन्तुं त्वमर्हसि।न तु जानामि कस्यायं भग्नस्साङ्ग्रामिको रथः।।3.65.6।।केन वा कस्य वा हेतोस्सायुधस्सपरिच्छदः।
explanation: To destroy the world for the mistake of a single person is not proper. Why and by whom is this warchariot broken with weapons and all its accesories I do not know.

content: खुरनेमिक्षतश्चायं सिक्तो रुधिरबिन्धुभिः।।3.65.7।।देशो निर्वृत्तसङ्ग्रामस्सुघोरः पार्थिवात्मज।
explanation: O prince, this place is damaged by the hooves of the horses and the rims of the chariot. It is soaked with drops of blood.Very dreadful must have been the fight here.

content: एकस्य तु विमर्धोऽयं न द्वयोर्वदतांवर।।3.65.8।।न हि वृत्तं हि पश्यामि बलस्य महतः पदम्।
explanation: O, best of the eloquent  this fight involves only one and not two. I do not see the footprints of a big army.

content: नैकस्य तु कृते लोकान्विनाशयितुमर्हसि।।3.65.9।।युक्तदण्डा हि मृदवः प्रशान्ता वसुधाधिपाः।
explanation: To destroy the entire world for one individual is not right. The lords of the earth should remain gentle, peaceful and punish only the deserving.

content: सदा त्वं सर्वभूतानां शरण्यः परमा गतिः।।3.65.10।।को नु दारप्रणाशं ते साधु मन्येत राघव।
explanation: You are the ultimate resort and refuge of all beings. Who would like that your wife should be abducted ?

content: सरितस्सागराश्शैला देवगन्धर्वदानवाः।।3.65.11।।नालं ते विप्रियं कर्तुं दीक्षितस्येव साधवः।
explanation: Just as pious men do not do anything disagreeable towards persons who observe religious vows, so also rivers, seas and mountains, gods, gandharvas and demons are not capable of causing unhappiness to you.

content: येन राजन्हृता सीता तमन्वेषितुमर्हसि।।3.65.12।।मद्वितीयो धनुष्पाणिस्सहायैः परमर्षिभिः।
explanation: O king bow in hands, followed by me and with the help of great sages you should search for the one who has abducted Sita.

content: समुद्रं च विचेष्यामः पर्वतांश्च वनानि च।।3.65.13।।गुहाश्च विविधा घोरा नदी पद्मवनानि च।
explanation: We will search oceans, mountains, forests and several dreadful caves, rivers and lotusponds.

content: देवगन्धर्वलोकांश्च विचेष्यामस्समाहिताः।।3.65.14।।यावन्नाधिगमिष्यामस्तव भार्यापहारिणम्।
explanation: We will search relentlessly for the abductor of your wife everywhere including the world of gods and gandharvas till we find her.

content: न चेत्साम्ना प्रदास्यन्ति पत्नीं ते त्रिदशेश्वराः।।3.65.15।।कोसलेन्द्र ततः पश्चात्प्राप्तकालं करिष्यसि।
explanation: O lord of Kosala when gods do not restore Sita on request, then you can think of taking action at the appropriate time.

content: शीलेन साम्ना विनयेन सीतां नयेन न प्राप्स्यसि चेन्नरेन्द्र।ततस्समुत्सादय हेमपुङ्खै र्महेन्द्रवज्रप्रतिमैश्शरौघैः।।3.65.16।।
explanation: O king if you fail to get Sita through appeasement, through humility or diplomacy then you destroy (the three worlds) by your goldtipped stream of arrows comparable to Indra's thunderbolt.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे पञ्चषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyfifth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Lakshmana asks Rama to bear sorrow -- pleads with Rama to think rightly-- arouses Rama's wisdom.]तं तथा शोकसन्तप्तं विलपन्तमनाथवत्।मोहेन महताविष्टं परिद्यूनमचेतनम्।।3.66.1।।ततस्सौमित्रिराश्वास्य मुहूर्तादिव लक्ष्मणः।रामं सम्बोधयामास चरणौ चाभिपीडयन्।।3.66.2।।
explanation: Lakshmana, son of Sumitra, consoling the mighty miserable Rama, who was afflicted with sorrow, and was weeping helplessly like an orphan, drowned in great delusion, devoid of consciousness, pressed his feet and addressed him:

content: महता तपसा राम महता चापि कर्मणा।राज्ञा दशरथेनासि लब्धोऽमृतमिवामरैः।।3.66.3।।
explanation: O Rama king Dasaratha begot you by doing a great penance and performing great deeds, just as gods begot the nectar.

content: तव चैव गुणैर्बद्धस्त्वद्वियोगान्महीपतिः।राजा देवत्वमापन्नो भरतस्य यथाश्रुतम्।।3.66.4।।
explanation: King Dasaratha, impelled by your virtues, and separation from you attained godhood as heard from Bharata.

content: यदि दुःखमिदं प्राप्तं काकुत्स्थ न सहिष्यसे।प्राकृतश्चाल्पसत्त्वश्च इतरः कस्सहिष्यति।।3.66.5।।
explanation: O Rama, if you cannot bear this sorrow that has befallen you, how can weak and ordinary persons endure (such suffering)?

content: दुःखितो हि भवान्लोकांस्तेजसा यदि धक्ष्यते।आर्ताः प्रजा नरव्याघ्र क्व नु यास्यन्ति निर्वृतिम्।।3.66.6।।
explanation: O best of men  if you grieve and burn the world with your brilliance, wherefrom will the (ordinary) afflicted people get relief?

content: लोकस्वभाव एवैष ययातिर्नहुषात्मजः।गतश्शक्रेण सालोक्यमनयस्तं समस्पृशत्।।3.66.7।।
explanation: It is the go of the world. Yayati, son of Nahusa, shared heaven with Indra but because of his curse (for his bad conduct) suffered misfortune.

content: महर्षिर्यो वसिष्ठस्तु यः पितुर्नः पुरोहितः।अह्ना पुत्रशतं जज्ञे तथैवास्य पुनर्हतम्।।3.66.8।।
explanation: To sage Vasistha, our father's priest, were born a hundred sons in a day.But all of them were killed in one day the same way.

content: या चेयं जगतां माता देवी लोकनमस्कृता।अस्याश्च चलनं भूमेर्दृश्यते सत्यसंश्रव।।3.66.9।।
explanation: You (rigidly) adhere to truth.(Like you) the mother earth who is adored by all the worlds, is unshakeable. Yet she is seen to be shaking at times.

content: यौ धर्मौ जगतां नेत्रौ यत्र सर्वं प्रतिष्ठितम्।आदित्यचन्द्रौ ग्रहणमभ्युपेतौ महाबलौ।।3.66.10।।
explanation: The powerful Sun and Moon, righteous entities, who are the two eyes of these worlds and on whom everything rests firmly, also suffer eclipses sometimes.

content: सुमहान्त्यपि भूतानि देवाश्च पुरुषर्षभ।न दैवस्य प्रमुञ्चन्ति सर्वभूतानि देहिनः।।3.66.11।।
explanation: O best among men  Fate spares none. Great beings, every creature, even the gods cannot escape fate.

content: शक्रादिष्वपि देवेषु वर्तमानौ नयानयौ।श्रूयेते नरशार्दूल न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि।।3.66.12।।
explanation: It is I heard that Indra and other deities are also governed by the principle of justice. Therefore, you should not bewail, O tiger among men.

content: नष्टायामपि वैदेह्यां हृतायामपि चानघशोचितुं नार्हसे वीर यथान्यः प्राकृतस्तथा।।3.66.13।।
explanation: Even if Vaidehi is killed or abducted, you should not grieve like ordinary men, O sinless hero

content: त्वव्दिधा न हि शोचन्ति सततं सत्यदर्शिनः।सुमहत्स्वपि कृच्छ्रेषु रामानिर्विण्णदर्शनाः।।3.66.14।।
explanation: O Rama, you always see the truth. So  in the face of great difficulties men like you, whose vision is not blurred, should not lose heart.

content: तत्त्वतो हि नरश्रेष्ठ बुद्ध्या समनुचिन्तय।बुध्द्या युक्ता महाप्राज्ञा विजानन्ति शुभाशुभे।।3.66.15।।
explanation: O best among men  judge the facts rightly with your intellect. The wise apply their minds and know what is right and what is wrong.

content: अदृष्टगुणदोषाणामध्रुवाणां तु कर्मणाम्।नान्तरेण क्रियां तेषां फलमिष्टं प्रवर्तते।।3.66.16।।
explanation: Good results are not expected from the actions of persons who cannot distinguish between their virtues and vices, from those who are unstable in their deeds.

content: त्वमेव हि पुरा राम मामेवं बहुशोऽन्वशाः।अनुशिष्याद्धि को नु त्वामपि साक्षाद्बृहस्पतिः।।3.66.17।।
explanation: O Rama you yourself in the past have instructed me many times that way. Who can be your adviser in this matter ? You are indeed like Brihaspati.

content: बुद्धिश्च ते महाप्राज्ञ देवैरपि दुरन्वया।शोकेनाभिप्रसुप्तं ते ज्ञानं सम्बोधयाम्यहम्।।3.66.18।।
explanation: Even gods cannot fathom your intellect. I am only trying to rouse your wisdom your sorrow has sent to sleep.

content: दिव्यं च मानुषं च त्वमात्मनश्च पराक्रमम्।इक्ष्वाकुवृषभावेक्ष्य यतस्व द्विषतां वधे।।3.66.19।।
explanation: O bull among the Ikshvakus, weigh your divine and human prowess before you try to kill your enemies.

content: किं तेन सर्वनाशेन कृतेन पुरुषर्षभ।तमेव त्वं रिपुं पापं विज्ञायोद्धर्तुमर्हसि।।3.66.20।।
explanation: O best among men  where is the good in the destruction of all? Know your sinful enemy before you uproot him.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकेय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे षट्षष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtysixth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama and Lakshmana see the wounded Jatayu with wings clipped.]पूर्वजोऽप्युक्तमात्रस्तु लक्ष्मणेन सुभाषितम्।सारग्राही महासारं प्रतिजग्राह राघवः।।3.67.1।।
explanation: Even though Rama was elder, he could grasp the quintessence of the wise counsel only after Lakshmana had said it.

content: सन्निगृह्य महाबाहुः प्रवृत्तं कोपमात्मनः।अवष्टभ्य धनुश्चित्रं रामो लक्ष्मणमब्रवीत्।।3.67.2।।
explanation: Restraining his anger, the longarmed Rama leaned over  his wonderful bow and spoke to Lakshmana:

content: किं करिष्यावहे वत्स क्व वा गच्छाव लक्ष्मण।केनोपायेन गच्छेयं सीतामिति विचिन्तय।।3.67.3।।
explanation: O dear Lakshmana, what shall we do? Where do we go ? Think of some means by which we can reach Sita.

content: तं तथा परितापार्तं लक्ष्मणो राममब्रवीत्।इदमेव जनस्थानं त्वमन्वेषितुमर्हसि।।3.67.4।।राक्षसैर्बहुभिः कीर्णं नानाद्रुमलतायुतम्।
explanation: Lakshmana said to Rama, afflicted with grief, It is proper for you to (first) search in this Janasthana, covered with different kinds of trees and creepers, and teeming with demons.

content: सन्तीह गिरिदुर्गाणि निर्दराः कन्दराणि च।।3.67.5।।गुहाश्च विविधा घोरा नानामृगगणाकुलाः।आवासाः किन्नराणां च गन्धर्वभवनानि च।।3.67.6।।
explanation: Here are difficult mountains, caves, valleys, dreadful caves full of different animals, dwellingplaces of kinneras and mansions of gandharvas.

content: तानि युक्तो मया सार्धं त्वमन्वेषितुमर्हसि।त्वद्विधा बुद्धिसम्पन्ना महात्मानो नरर्षभ।।3.67.7।।आपत्सु न प्रकम्पन्ते वायुवेगैरिवाचलाः।
explanation: Accompanied by me you should search for her in those spots. Great people endowed with wisdom do not destabilise in difficulties just as mountains are not shaken by the speed of the wind.

content: इत्युक्तस्तद्वनं सर्वं विचचार सलक्ष्मणः।।3.67.8।।क्रुद्धो रामश्शरं घोरं सन्धाय धनुषि क्षुरम्।
explanation: Thus advised, the angry Rama fixed a sharp arrow to his bow and roamed in the forest accompanied by Lakshmana.

content: ततः पर्वतकूटाभं महाभागं द्विजोत्तमम्।।3.67.9।।ददर्श पतितं भूमौ क्षतजार्द्रं जटायुषम्।
explanation: Then he saw the great Jatayu, a wonderful bird, looking like a mountain top, drenched in blood and fallen on the ground.

content: तं दृष्ट्वा गिरिशृङ्गाभं रामो लक्ष्मणमब्रवीत्।।3.67.10।।अनेन सीता वैदेही भक्षिता नात्र संशयः।
explanation: On seeing Jatayu looking like the peak of a mountain, Rama said to Lakshmana, There is no doubt that this bird has devoured Vaidehi.

content: गृध्ररूपमिदं रक्षो व्यक्तं भवति कानने।।3.67.11।।भक्षयित्वा विशालाक्षीमास्ते सीतां यथासुखम्।एनं वधिष्ये दीप्तास्यैर्घोरैर्बाणैरजिह्मगैः।।3.67.12।।
explanation: This demon in the guise of a vulture has evidently eaten away the largeeyed Sita and is happily relaxing in the forest. With my terrific arrows with burning tips that can go straight I will kill him.

content: इत्युक्त्वाभ्यपतद्गृध्रं सन्धाय धनुषि क्षुरम्।क्रुद्धो रामस्समुद्रान्तां कम्पयन्निव मेदिनीम्।।3.67.13।।
explanation: Having siad so, Rama took his bow, fixed the sharp arrow, and aimed at the vulture. The seabound earth trembled.

content: तं दीनं दीनया वाचा सफेनं रुधिरं वमन्।अभ्यभाषत पक्षी तु रामं दशरथात्मजम्।।3.67.14।।
explanation: But the vulture who was in a piteous state, vomitting foamy blood, spoke these words pathetically to Rama, son of Dasaratha:

content: यामोषधिमिवायुष्मन्नन्वेषसि महावने।सा देवी मम च प्राणा रावणेनोभयं हृतम्।।3.67.15।।
explanation: O Longlived one  she who you are searching in the forest like herbal medicine has been carried away by Ravana along with my life.

content: त्वया विरहिता देवी लक्ष्मणेन च राघव।ह्रियमाणा मया दृष्टा रावणेन बलीयसा।।3.67.16।।
explanation: I have seen her snatched from you and from Lakshmana and carried off by powerful Ravana.

content: सीतामभ्यवपन्नोऽहं रावणश्च रणे मया।विध्वंसितरथश्चात्र पातितो धरणीतले।।3.67.17।।
explanation: I descended down to protect Sita, and in the battle with Ravana his chariot destroyed fell down here on the ground.

content: एतदस्य धनुर्भग्नमेतदस्य शरावरम्।अयमस्य रथो राम भग्नसाङ्ग्रामिको मया।।3.67.18।।
explanation: O Rama this is his broken bow, this is his quiver and this is his warchariot all devastated by me.

content: अयं तु सारथिस्तस्य मत्पक्षनिहतो युधि।परिश्रान्तस्य मे पक्षौ छित्त्वा खड्गेन रावणः।।3.67.19।।सीतामादाय वैदेहीमुत्पपात विहायसम्।रक्षसा निहतं पूर्वं न मां हन्तुं त्वमर्हसि।।3.67.20।।
explanation: He is Ravana's charioteer slain by my wings in the battle.  As I was exhausted in the encounter Ravana clipped my wings,  took Sita, and flew into the sky. You need not kill me. I am already slain by the demon.

content: रामस्तस्य तु विज्ञाय बाष्पपूर्णमुखस्तदा।द्विगुणीकृततापार्तस्सीतासक्तां प्रियां कथाम्।।3.67.21।।
explanation: Having known from Jatayu the story of his beloved Sita, Rama was full of tears, his grief redoubled.

content: गृध्रराजं परिष्वज्य परित्यज्य महद्धनुः।निपपातावशो भूमौ रुरोद सहलक्ष्मणः।।3.67.22।।
explanation: Rama dropped the bow and embraced the king of birds. He fell down despondent on the ground and began crying along with Lakshmana.

content: एकमेकायने दुर्गे निश्श्वसन्तं कथञ्चन।समीक्ष्य दुःखिततरो रामस्सौमित्रिमब्रवीत्।।3.67.23।।
explanation: Rama saw Jatayu breathing with difficulty in that solitary, inaccessible place.Overcome by greater grief  he said to Lakshmana:

content: राज्यं भ्रष्टं वने वासस्सीता नष्टा हतो द्विजः।ईदृशीयं ममालक्ष्मीर्निर्दहेदपि पावकम्।।3.67.24।।
explanation: I have been expelled from the kingdom. I am made to stay in the forest. I have lost Sita (my beloved wife). This bird (who was my wellwisher) has been slain. Such misfortune will burn even fire.

content: सम्पूर्णमपि चेदद्य प्रविशेयं महोदधिम्।सोऽपि नूनं ममालक्ष्म्या विशुष्येत्सरितांपतिः।।3.67.25।।
explanation: Now if I enter even the great sea, the lord of the rivers filled with water, it will also dry up due to my misfortune.

content: नास्त्यभाग्यतरो लोके मत्तोऽस्मिन्सचराचरे।येनेयं महती प्राप्ता मया व्यसनवागुरा।।3.67.26।।
explanation: In this world of the animate and the inanimate there is no one more unfortunate than me fallen into the trap of adversities.

content: अयं पितृवयस्यो मे गृध्रराजो जरान्वितः।शेते विनिहतो भूमौ मम भाग्यविपर्ययात्।।3.67.27।।
explanation: This aged king of birds is my father's friend. To my illluck, he is struck down and is lying on the ground.

content: इत्येवमुक्त्वा बहुशो राघवस्सहलक्ष्मणः।जटायुषं च पस्पर्श पितृस्नेहं विदर्शयन्।।3.67.28।।
explanation: Saying such words and showing filial affection, he caressed Jatayu repeatedly with Lakshmana.

content: निकृत्तपक्षं रुधिरावसिक्तं स गृध्रराजं परिरभ्य रामः।क्व मैथिली प्राणसमा ममेति विमुच्य वाचं निपपात भूमौ।।3.67.29।।
explanation: Rama hugged the king of vultures with servered wings, drenched in blood and asking him where Sita who was as dear to him as his life was, he dropped him and fell down on the ground.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे सप्तषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyseventh sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Jatayu informs Rama about his combat with Ravana and Sita's abduction-- Jatayu's death-- cremation ]रामस्सम्प्रेक्ष्य तं गृध्रं भुवि रौद्रेण पातितम्।सौमित्रिं मित्रसम्पन्नमिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।3.68.1।।
explanation: Seeing the vulture lying on the ground thrown down by the fierce demon, Rama said to friendly Lakshmana:

content: ममायं नूनमर्थेषु यतमानो विहङ्गमः।राक्षसेन हतस्संख्ये प्राणांस्त्यक्ष्यति दुस्त्यजान्।।3.68.2।।
explanation: Struck down by the demon in the combat on my account this bird is going to give up his life which is indeed difficult.

content: अयमस्य शरीरेऽस्मिन्प्राणो लक्ष्मण विद्यते।तथा हि स्वरहीनोऽयं विक्लबस्समुदीक्ष्यते।।3.68.3।।
explanation: O Lakshmana, it appears he is frightened and is experiencing excruciating pain in the body. His voice sounds faint, too.

content: जटायो यदि शक्नोषि वाक्यं व्याहरितुं पुनः।सीतामाख्याहि भद्रं ते वधमाख्याहि चात्मनः।।3.68.4।।
explanation: O Jatayu If you are still able to speak, tell me about Sita and about how you have been struck down.

content: किं निमित्तोऽहरत्सीतां रावणस्तस्य किं मया।अपराद्धं तु यं दृष्ट्वा रावणेन हृता प्रिया।।3.68.5।।
explanation: Why did Ravana abduct Sita? What fault did he find with me so that he kidnapped my beloved ?

content: कथं तच्चन्द्रसङ्काशं मुखमासीन्मनोहरम्।सीतया कानि चोक्तानि तस्मिन्काले द्विजोत्तम।।3.68.6।।
explanation: O best of birds how did her delightful, Moonlike face look when she was hijacked. What did she say at that time?

content: कथं वीर्यः कथं रूपः किं कर्मा स च राक्षसः।क्व चास्य भवनं तात ब्रूहि मे परिपृच्छतः।।3.68.7।।
explanation: O father  how powerful is that demon ? How does he look?What work does he do? Where does he dwell? Do answer my questions?

content: तमुद्वीक्ष्याथ दीनात्मा विलपन्तमनन्तरम्।वाचातिसन्नया रामं जटायुरिदमब्रवीत्।।3.68.8।।
explanation: Thereafter Jatayu, a piteous soul, looked up at Rama who was  crying incessantly and said this in a feeble voice:

content: हृता सा राक्षसेन्द्रेण रावणेन विहायसा।मायामास्थाय विपुलां वातदुर्दिनसङ्कुलाम्।।3.68.9।।
explanation: Ravana, the lord of the demons created violent winds through terrific magic and whisked her away in the sky.

content: परिश्रान्तस्य मे तात पक्षौ छित्वा स राक्षसः।सीतामादाय वैदेहीं प्रयातो दक्षिणां दिशम्।।3.68.10।।
explanation: O my child  when I was exhausted, that demon cut off my wings and carried Sita off in the southern direction.

content: उपरुध्यन्ति मे प्राणा दृष्टिर्भ्रमति राघव।पश्यामि वृक्षान्सौवर्णानुशीरकृतमूर्धजान्।।3.68.11।।
explanation: O scion of the Raghu race, I am gasping for breath. My eyes are reeling. I see root hair growing on the tops of golden trees.

content: येन याति मुहूर्तेन सीतामादाय रावणः।विप्रणष्टं धनं क्षिप्रं तत्स्वामी प्रतिपद्यते।।3.68.12।।विन्दो नाम मुहूर्तोऽयं स च काकुत्स्थ नाबुधत्।
explanation: The time Ravana kidnapped Sita is known as 'Vinda'. The effect (of that time), is that her husband will regain his lost wealth. O scion of the Kakutstha race  he (Ravana )did not know it.

content: त्वत्प्रियां जानकीं हृत्वा रावणो राक्षसेश्वरः।।3.68.13।।झषवद्बडिशं गृह्य क्षिप्रमेव विनश्यति।
explanation: Ravana, king of the demons, will perish soon for running away with your beloved Janaki just like a fish carrying away a fishhook (which causes its destruction).

content: न च त्वया व्यथा कार्या जनकस्य सुतां प्रति।।3.68.14।।वैदेह्या रंस्यसे क्षिप्रं हत्वा तं राक्षसं रणे।
explanation: You need not worry about Janaka's daughter. You will soon enjoy the company of your beloved, Vaidehi after killing that demon.

content: असम्मूढस्य गृध्रस्य रामं प्रत्यनुभाषतः।।3.68.15।।आस्यात्सुस्राव रुधिरं म्रियमाणस्य सामिषम्।
explanation: As he(Jatayu) was speaking to Rama with an alert mind even while dying, blood mixed with flesh started oozing from Jatayu's mouth.

content: पुत्रो विश्रवसस्साक्षाद्भ्राता वैश्रवणस्य च।।3.68.16।।इत्युक्त्वा दुर्लभान्प्राणान्मुमोच पतगेश्वरः।
explanation: Ravana was Visrava's son and Vaisravana's (Kubera's) brother, said Jatayu and gave up his rare life.

content: ब्रूहि ब्रूहीति रामस्य ब्रुवाणस्य कृताञ्जलेः।।3.68.17।।त्वक्त्वा शरीरं गृध्रस्य जग्मुः प्राणा विहायसम्।
explanation: As Rama was saying to the vulture with folded palms 'Tell me, tell me'( about Ravana) the life breath of the vulture soared into the sky leaving the body.

content: स निक्षिप्य शिरो भूमौ प्रसार्य चरणौ तदा।।3.68.18।।विक्षिप्य च शरीरं स्वं पपात धरणीतले।
explanation: Then Jatayu dropped his head down, his feet thrown about, his body outstretched on earth.

content: तं गृध्रं प्रेक्ष्य ताम्राक्षं गतासुमचलोपमम्।।3.68.19।।रामस्सुबहुभिर्दुःखैर्दीनस्सौमित्रिमब्रवीत्।
explanation: Stricken with deep grief, his eyes red (with tears) Rama saw the vulture looking like a mountain. Seeing him dead, he said to Lakshmana:

content: बहूनि रक्षसां वासे वर्षाणि वसता सुखम्।।3.68.20।।अनेन दण्डकारण्ये विशीर्णमिह पक्षिणा।
explanation: Dwelling for many years happily in Dandaka forest, the abode of demons, the bird lost his life (on our account).

content: अनेकवार्षिको यस्तु चिरकालसमुत्थितः।।3.68.21।।सोऽयमद्य हतश्शेते कालो हि दुरतिक्रमः।
explanation: This Jatayu, who lived for long years, is lying dead now. (The dictate of) destiny is inescapable.

content: पश्य लक्ष्मण गृध्रोऽयमुपकारी हतश्च मे।।3.68.22।।सीतामभ्यवपन्नो वै रावणेन बलीयसा।
explanation: O Lakshmana, see this Jatayu, my benefactor, killed by the powerful Ravana while he was reaching out to help Sita.

content: गृध्रराज्यं परित्यज्य पितृपैतामहं महत्।।3.68.23।।मम हेतोरयं प्राणान्मुमोच पतगेश्वरः।
explanation: This lord of the birds left his ancestral kingdom of viltures and gave up life for my sake.

content: सर्वत्र खलु दृश्यन्ते साधवो धर्मचारिणः।।3.68.24।।शूराश्शरण्यास्सौमित्रे तिर्यग्योनिगतेष्वपि।
explanation: O Lakshmana valiant souls and protectors, being righteous and honest are found even among animals and birds.

content: सीताहरणजं दुःखं न मे सौम्य तथाविधम्।।3.68.25।।यथा विनाशे गृध्रस्य मत्कृते च परन्तप।
explanation: O scorcher of enemies, O handsome Lakshmana the grief I experience due to Jatayu's death on my account is more intense than Sita's abduction.

content: राजा दशरथश्श्रीमान्यथा मम महायशाः।।3.68.26।।पूजनीयश्च मान्यश्च तथाऽयं पतगेश्वरः।
explanation: This lord of the birds for me is as worthy of reverence and honour as the famous and prosperous king Dasaratha.

content: सौमित्रे हर काष्ठानि निर्मथिष्यामि पावकम्।।3.68.27।।गृध्रराजं दिधक्षामि मत्कृते निधनं गतम्।
explanation: O Saumitri  fetch firewood. I shall generate fire by rubbing them and cremate the king of the birds who has laid down his life for my sake.

content: नाथं पतगलोकस्य चितामारोप्य राघव।।3.68.28।।इमं धक्ष्यामि सौमित्रे हतं रौद्रेण रक्षसा।
explanation: O scion of the Raghus  I will place the body of the lord of the world of birds, killed by the fierce demon, on the funeral pyre and crimate him with honour.

content: या गतिर्यज्ञशीलानामाहिताग्नेश्च या गतिः।।3.68.29।।अपरावर्तिनां या च या च भूमिप्रदायिनाम्।मया त्वं समनुज्ञातो गच्छ लोकाननुत्तमान्।।3.68.30।।गृध्रराज महासत्त्व संस्कृतश्च मया व्रज।
explanation: O mighty lord of the birds  by my grace attain the state of those who perform sacrifices, who kindle and maintain sacrificial fires, who beat no retreat from the battlefield and who offer land in charity. Purified by my offering of fire, you may depart for the best of the worlds.

content: एवमुक्त्वा चितां दीप्तामारोप्य पतगेश्वरम्।।3.68.31।।ददाह रामो धर्मात्मा स्वबन्धुमिव दुःखितः।
explanation: Thus said, righteous Rama laid him on the pyre and sadly cremated the lord of the birds as one would do to his own relative.

content: रामोऽथ सहसौमित्रिर्वनं गत्वा स वीर्यवान्।।3.68.32।।स्थूलान्हत्वा महारोहीननुतस्तार तं द्विजम्।
explanation: Then the mighty Rama, accompanied by Saumitri, got into the forest and killed a huge deer, brought it and spread it as an offering (to the dead Jatayu).

content: रोहिमांसानि चोत्कृत्य पेशीकृत्य महायशाः।।3.68.33।।शकुनाय ददौ रामो रम्ये हरितशाद्वले।
explanation: Tearing the flesh of the deer to pieces and making them  into balls, the celebrated Rama laid it on a lovely, green grassy land as offering to the bird.

content: यत्तत्प्रेतस्य मर्त्यस्य कथयन्ति द्विजातयः।।3.68.34।।तत्स्वर्गगमनं तस्य पित्र्यं रामो जजाप ह।
explanation: Rama muttered the mantras recommended by brahmins for dead mortals as one would do for his father, to help him ascend to heaven.

content: ततो गोदावरीं गत्वा नदीं नरवरात्मजौ।।3.68.35।।उदकं चक्रतुस्तस्मै गृध्रराजाय तावुभौ।
explanation: Then both the princes went down to river Godavari and offered libations for the king of vultures.

content: शास्त्रदृष्टेन विधिना जले गृध्राय राघवौ।।3.68.36।।स्नात्वा तौ गृध्रराजाय उदकं चक्रतुस्तदा।
explanation: Thereafter both the scions of the Raghu dynasty bathed in water, offered libations for the king of vultures as ordained in the scriptures.

content: स गृध्रराजः कृतवान्यशस्करं सुदुष्करं कर्म रणे निपातितः।महर्षिकल्पेन च संस्कृतस्तदा जगाम पुण्यां गतिमात्मनश्शुभाम्।।3.68.37।।
explanation: The king of vultures had performed a very difficult and glorious feat by laying down his life fighting. Sanctified by Rama's offering as laid down in scriptures by the seers, he attained a holy, auspicious and divine state of the self.

content: कृतोदकौ तावपि पक्षिसत्तमे स्थिरां च बुद्धिं प्रणिधाय जग्मतुः।प्रवेश्य सीताधिगमे ततो मनो वनं सुरेन्द्रविव विष्णुवासवौ।।3.68.38।।
explanation: Rama and Lakshmana, like two lords of gods, Indra and Visnu, offered libations for the great bird with their settled minds and concentrated and then entered deeper into the forest turning their attention to the search for Sita.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे अष्टषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyeighth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama and Lakshmana proceed to search Sita -- Lakshmana punishes Ayomukhi -- Kabandha seizes Rama and Lakshmana -- Rama's lamentations at the calamity -- Lakshmana gets unnerved]कृत्वैवमुदकं तस्मै प्रस्थितौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।अवेक्षन्तौ वने सीतां पश्चिमां जग्मतुर्दिशम्।।3.69.1।।
explanation: Rama and Lakshmana offered libations (for Jatayu) and went westward, looking for Sita in the forest.

content: तौ दिशं दक्षिणां गत्वा शरचापासिधारिणौ।अविप्रहतमैक्ष्वाकौ पन्थानं प्रतिपेदतुः।।3.69.2।।
explanation: Wielding bow, arrows and sword, both the princes of the Ikshvaku race went southward and entered an untrodden (densely wooded) tract.

content: गुल्मैर्वृक्षैश्च बहुभिर्लताभिश्च प्रवेष्टितम्।आवृतं सर्वतो दुर्गं गहनं घोरदर्शनम्।।3.69.3।।
explanation: It was a dense, impenetrable and dreadful forest covered with shrubs, trees and creepers spread all over.

content: व्यतिक्रम्य तु वेगेन व्यालसिंहनिषेवितम्।सुभीमं तन्महारण्यं व्यतियातौ महाबलौ।।3.69.4।।
explanation: The two mighty heroes swiftly forged through the great forest, which was an abode of serpents and lions.

content: ततः परं जनस्थानातत्रिक्रोशं गम्य राघवौ।क्रौञ्चारण्यं विविशतुर्गहनं तौ महौजसौ।।3.69.5।।
explanation: Both the mighty princes of the Raghu dynasty covered a distance of three krosas from Janasthana and entered the impassable kraunchaforest.

content: नानामेघघनप्रख्यं प्रहृष्टमिव सर्वतः।नानापक्षिगणैर्युक्तं नानाव्यालमृगैर्युतम्।।3.69.6।।दिदृक्षमाणौ वैदेहीं तद्वनं तौ विचिक्यतुः।तत्र तत्रावतिष्ठन्तौ सीताहरणकर्शितौ।।3.69.7।।
explanation: Tormented due to abduction of Sita, the two princes anxious to see her searched all over the dense forest stopping here and there on the way. The thick forest looked like a conglomeration of big clouds. It was filled with different kinds of birds, snakes and animals.

content: ततः पूर्वेण तौ गत्वा त्रिक्रोशं भ्रातरौ तदा।क्रौञ्चारण्यमतिक्रम्य मतङ्गाश्रममन्तरा।।3.69.8।।दृष्ट्वा तु तद्वनं घोरं बहुभीममृगद्विजम्।ननासत्त्वसमाकीर्णं सर्वं गहनपादपम्।।3.69.9।।ददृशाते तु तौ तत्र दरीं दशरथात्मजौ।पातालसमगम्भीरां तमसा नित्यसंवृताम्।।3.69.10।।
explanation: Then both the sons of Dasaratha, went further east, crossed the kraunchaforest after three krosas. They saw a dreadful forest which was full of fierce animals and birds near the hermitage of sage Matanga. It was densely covered with trees. They saw there a cave perpetually enveloped in darkness which was as deep as the netherworld.

content: आसाद्य तौ नरव्याघ्रौ दर्यास्तस्याविदूरतः।ददृशाते महारूपां राक्षसीं विकृताननाम्।।3.69.11।।
explanation: Both the princes,the best among men, reached the cave and saw a huge demoness with a disfigured face not far from the cave.

content: भयदामल्पसत्त्वानां बीभत्सां रौद्रदर्शनाम्।लम्बोदरीं तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्रां करालीं परुषत्वचम्।।3.69.12।।भक्षयन्तीं मृगान्भीमान्विकटां मुक्तमूर्धजाम्।प्रैक्षेतां तौ ततस्तत्र भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।।3.69.13।।
explanation: Then the two brothers saw a fearful demoness who could strike terror in the mind of the timid, an uncouth figure with huge curved skins, with a big stomach, dishevelled hair, sharp and long teeth, devouring wild animals.

content: सा समासाद्य तौ वीरौ व्रजन्तं भ्रातुरग्रतः।एहि रंस्यावहेत्युक्त्वा समालम्बत लक्ष्मणम्।।3.69.14।।
explanation: She came close to them, held Lakshmana who was walking ahead of his brother and said Come, let us enjoy.

content: उवाच चैनं वचनं सौमित्रिमुपगूह्य सा।अहं त्वयोमुखी नाम लब्धा ते त्वमसि प्रियः।।3.69.15।।नाथ पर्वतकूटेषु नदीनां पुलिनेषु च।आयुश्शेषमिमं वीर त्वं मया सह रंस्यसे।।3.69.16।।
explanation: Taking hold of Saumitri the demoness said 'I am Ayomukhi and I have been obtained by you. You got me, O hero, O lord  For the rest of your life you will sport with me on the lofty hills and river banks.'

content: एवमुक्तस्तु कुपितः खड्गमुद्धृत्य लक्ष्मणः।कर्णनासास्तनं तस्या निचकर्तारिसूदनः।।3.69.17।।
explanation: Thus addressed, Lakshmana, subduer of enemies, became angry, took out the sword and cut off her ears, nose and breasts.

content: कर्णनासे निकृत्ते तु विस्वरं सा विनद्य च।यथागतं प्रदुद्राव राक्षसी भीमदर्शना।।3.69.18।।
explanation: When the ears and nose of the frightening demoness were cut off she shouted in a fierce tone and ran away in the direction she had come from.

content: तस्यां गतायां गहनं व्रजन्तौ वनमोजसा।आसेदतुरमित्रघ्नौ भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।।3.69.19।।
explanation: The destroyers of enemies, Rama and Lakshmana of great valour went through the dense forest after she ran away.

content: लक्ष्मणस्तु महातेजास्सत्त्ववान् शीलवान् शुचिः।अब्रवीत्प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यं भ्रातरं दीप्ततेजसम्।।3.69.20।।
explanation: Lakshmana of great brilliance and power, of good conduct and pure character spoke to his highly effulgent brother with folded hands:

content: स्पन्दते च दृढं बाहुरुद्विग्नमिव मे मनः।प्रायशश्चाप्यनिष्टानि निमित्तान्युपलक्षये।।3.69.21।।
explanation: My arm is throbbing heavily. My mind is agitated. The omens I see foretell some undesirable events.

content: तस्मात्सज्जीभवार्य त्वं कुरुष्व वचनं हितम्।ममैव हि निमित्तानि सद्यश्शंसन्ति सम्भ्रमम्।।3.69.22।।
explanation: O noble brother be alert. Heed my words of good advice. The bad omens I see presage perils.

content: एष वञ्चुलको नाम पक्षी परमदारुणः।आवयोर्विजयं युद्धे शंसन्निव विनर्दति।।3.69.23।।
explanation: This vanchulaka bird's loud and dreadful screams suggest our triumph in war.

content: तयोरन्वेषतोरेवं सर्वं तद्वनमोजसा।संजज्ञे विपुलः शब्दो प्रभञ्जन्निव तद्वनम्।।3.69.24।।
explanation: As both the brothers with great prowess were searching for Sita all over, a huge sound exploded as if shattering the forest.

content: संवेष्टितमिवात्यर्थं गगनं मातरिश्वना।वनस्य तस्य शब्दोऽभूद्दिवमापूरयन्निव।।3.69.25।।
explanation: It appeared as though a fierce wind rose from the forest and filled the sky.

content: तं शब्दं काङ्क्षमाणस्तु रामः कक्षे सहानुजः।ददर्श सुमहाकायं राक्षसं विपुलोदरम्।।3.69.26।।
explanation: While looking for the sound, Rama with his brother saw a demon with a huge body and a big belly.

content: आसेदतुस्ततस्तत्र तावुभौ प्रमुखे स्थितम्।विवृद्धमशिरोग्रीवं कबन्धमुदरे मुखम्।।3.69.27।।
explanation: Then both the brothers saw a very tall figure with a trunk that stood facing them. He had neither neck nor head. His face was in the stomach.

content: रोमभिर्निचितैस्तीक्ष्णैर्महागिरिमिवोछ्रितम्।नीलमेघनिभं रौद्रं मेघस्तनितनिस्वनम्।।3.69.28।।
explanation: With sharp bristled hair all over the body, he was a mammoth figure who looked like a mountain  resembling a dark cloud with his voice like the thunder.

content: अग्निज्वालानिकाशेन ललाटस्थेन दीप्यता।महापक्ष्मेण पिङ्गेन विपुलेनायतेन च।।3.69.29।।एकेनोरसि घोरेण नयनेनाशुदर्शिना।महादंष्ट्रोपपन्नं तल्लेलिहानं महामुखम्।।3.69.30।।
explanation: He had a single eye that was reddishbrown in colour resembling flaming fire. It was fixed in the chest. His eyelashes glowed. He had instant vision with massive fangs in his huge mouth. He was licking his lips.

content: भक्षयन्तं महाघोरानृक्षसिंहमृगद्विपान्।घोरौ भुजौ विकुर्वाणमुभौ योजनमायतौ।।3.69.31।।
explanation: The terrific demon kept eating bears, lions, deer and elephants, catching with both his arms stretching up to one yojana.

content: कराभ्यां विविधान्गृह्यऋक्षान्पक्षिगणान्मृगान्।आकर्षन्तं विकर्षन्तमनेकान्मृगयूथपान्।।3.69.32।।स्थितमावृत्य पन्थानं तयोर्भ्रात्रोः प्रपन्नयोः।
explanation: He stood rooted there, catching bears, flocks of birds and deer with both his hands stretching up to one yojana, pulling and pushing them. (Now) he obstructed the path of the two brothers.

content: अथ तौ समभिक्रम्य क्रोशमात्रे ददर्शतुः।।3.69.33।।महान्तं दारुणं भीमं कबन्धं भुजसंवृम्।कबन्धमिव संस्थानादतिघोरप्रदर्शनम्।।3.69.34।।
explanation: Then the brothers after covering one krosa (2 miles) saw a cruel, fierce, mighty monster named Kabandha looking like a trunk. He had a dreadful appearance and his arms encircled the area.

content: स महाबाहुरत्यर्थं प्रसार्य विपुलौ भुजौ।जग्राह सहितावेव राघवौ पीडयन्बलात्।।3.69.35।।
explanation: The longarmed demon spread his hands and caught hold of Rama and Lakshmana together by pressing them with all his force.

content: खड्गिनौ दृढधन्वानौ तिग्मतेजोवपुर्धरौ।    भ्रातरौ विवशं प्राप्तौ कृष्यमाणौ महाबलौ।।3.69.36।।
explanation: The two mighty brothers who wielded swords and strong bows and whose bodies were of fiery splendour became helpless, seized by the hands of Kabandha.

content: तत्र धैर्येण शूरस्तु राघवो नैव विव्यथे।बाल्यादनाश्रयत्वाच्च लक्ष्मणस्त्वतिविव्यथे।।3.69.37।।उवाच स विषण्णस्सन्राघवं राघवानुजः।
explanation: Of the two heroes, Rama being courageous was not worried but Lakshmana being younger and not having as much courage, was very much concerned and depressed. He said to Rama:

content: पश्य मां वीर विवशं राक्षसस्य वशं गतम्।।3.69.38।।मयैकेन विनिर्युक्तः परिमुञ्चस्व राघव।
explanation: O heroic Rama see how helpless I am under the control of the demon. Set yourself free, leaving me alone and using me as an offering.

content: मां हि भूतबलिं दत्वा पलायस्व यथासुखम्।।3.69.39।।अधिगन्तासि वैदेहीमचिरेणेति मे मतिः।
explanation: Giving me to this monstor as an offering, you may run away happily. I think you will soon obtain Vaidehi.

content: प्रतिलभ्य च काकुत्स्थ पितृपैतामहीं महीम्।।3.69.40।।तत्र मां राम राज्यस्थस्स्मर्तुमर्हसि सर्वदा।
explanation: O scion of the Kakutstha dynasty, on getting the hereditary kingdom and ruling over it you should always remember me.

content: लक्ष्मणेनैवमुक्तस्तु रामस्सौमित्रिमब्रवीत्।।3.69.41।।मा स्म त्रासं कृथा वीर न हि त्वादृग्विषीदति।
explanation: O  valiant Lakshmana, a hero like you should not get desparate. said Rama to Saumitri when he was thus entreated by Lakshmana.

content: एतस्मिन्नन्तरे क्रूरो भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।।3.69.42।।पप्रच्छ घननिर्घोषः कबन्धो दानवोत्तमः।
explanation: In the meanwhile the foremost of the demons, Kabandha, rumbling like thunder questioned the brothers, Rama and Lakshmana:

content: कौ युवां वृषभस्कन्धौ महाखड्गधनुर्धरौ।।3.69.43।।घोरं देशमिमं प्राप्तौ मम भक्षावुपस्थितौ।
explanation: Who are you with bulllike shoulders, wielding big swords, bows and arrows? By coming to this place you have become my food.

content: वदतं कार्यमिह वां किमर्थं चागतौ युवाम्।।3.69.44।।इमं देशमनुप्राप्तौ क्षुधार्तस्येह तिष्ठतः।
explanation: For what purpose have you come? What work have you here ? You have come at the right time as my food, since I am hungry.

content: सबाणचापखड्गौ च तीक्ष्णशृङ्गाविवर्षभौ।।3.69.45।।ममास्यमनुसम्प्राप्तौ दुर्लभं जीवितं पुनः।
explanation: Holding bows, arrows and swords, looking like bulls with pointed horns you have entered my mouth. It is impossible for you to live any more.

content: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा कबन्धस्य दुरात्मनः।।3.69.46।।उवाच लक्ष्मणं रामो मुखेन परिशुष्यता।
explanation: On hearing the words of the evilminded Kabandha, Rama said to Lakshmana with dried up mouth:

content: कृच्छ्रात् कृच्छ्रतरं प्राप्य दारुणं सत्यविक्रमः।।3.69.47।।व्यसनं जीवितान्ताय प्राप्तमप्राप्य तां प्रियाम्।
explanation: O Lakshmana, your valour is truth.We have gone through from one calamity to a greater one without finding the beloved Sita. Now we have landed into a terrible crisis which will put an end to our own life.

content: कालस्य सुमहद्वीर्यं सर्वभूतेषु लक्ष्मण।।3.69.48।।त्वां च मां च नरव्याघ्र व्यसनैः पश्य मोहितौ।
explanation: O tiger among men see how powerful the might of time is for all beings Just see  yourself and myself afflicted wth this great calamity.

content: नातिभारोस्ति कालस्य सर्वभूतेषु लक्ष्मण।।3.69.49।।शूराश्च बलवन्तश्च कृतास्त्राश्च रणाजिरे।कालाभिपन्नास्सीदन्ति यथा वालुकसेतवः।।3.69.50।।
