explanation: O Lakshmana look at the power of time over all creatures There is nothing too heavy for time. Even those who know the use of arms in war, or are brave or strong enough, cannot  withstand the force of time like the barriers built with sand.

content: इति ब्रुवाणो दृढसत्यविक्रमो महायशा दाशरथिः प्रतापवान्।अवेक्ष्य सौमित्रिमुदग्रपौरुषं स्थिरां तदा स्वां मतिमात्मनाऽकरोत्।।3.69.51।।
explanation: Firm in the strength of truth, famous and powerful Rama, son of Dasaratha,  determined to act with a steadfast mind, spoke to Lakshmana of mighty manliness on seeing him. इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकोनसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyninth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama and Lakshmana sever the arms of Kabandha-- reveal their identity to him-- Kabandha welcomes Rama and Lakshmana-- his lamentation.]तौ तु तत्र स्थितौ दृष्ट्वा भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।बाहुपाशपरिक्षिप्तौ कबन्धो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।3.70.1।।
explanation: Kabandha saw the brothers, Rama and Lakshmana, stand there bound by the shackles of his arms and said:

content: तिष्ठतः किं नु मां दृष्ट्वा क्षुधार्तं क्षत्रियर्षभौ।आहारार्थं तु सन्दिष्टौ दैवेन गतचेतसौ।।3.70.2।।
explanation: O bulls among the kshatriyas You are sent by destiny as food to appease my hunger. Seeing me hungry, why do you stand there with your senses switched off ?

content: तच्छ्रुत्वा लक्ष्मणो वाक्यं प्राप्तकालं हितं तदा।उवाचाऽर्तिं समापन्नो विक्रमे कृतलक्षणः।।3.70.3।।
explanation: Having heard this, Lakshmana, who was greatly suffering gathered courage at appropriate time and said these salutary words:

content: त्वां च मां च पुरा तूर्णमादत्ते राक्षसाधमः।तस्मादसिभ्यामस्याशु बाहू छिन्दावहै गुरू।।3.70.4।।
explanation: Before this vile demon gulps you and me let us cut off his long arms with our swords.

content: भीषणोऽयं महाकायो राक्षसो भुजविक्रमः।लोकं ह्यतिजितं कृत्वा ह्यावां हन्तुमिहेच्छति।।3.70.5।।
explanation: This huge, horrible demon with the strength of his arms has conquered the world, and now intends to kill us here.

content: निश्चेष्टानां वधो राजन्कुत्सितो जगतीपतेः।क्रतुमध्योपनीतानां पशूनामिव राघव।।3.70.6।।
explanation: O prince of the Raghu race  just as the animal brought in the midst of a sacrifice should not be killed, so also for a king to kill any harmless creature is despicable.

content: एतत्सञ्जल्पितं श्रुत्वा तयोः क्रुद्धस्तु राक्षसः।विदार्याऽस्यं तदा रौद्रस्तौ भक्षयितुमारभत्।।3.70.7।।
explanation: The cruel, ferocious demon heard them talk. He opened his mouth and attempted to eat both of them.

content: ततस्तौ देशकालज्ञौ खड्गाभ्यामेव राघवौ।अच्छिन्दतां सुसंविग्नौ बाहू तस्यांसदेशतः।।3.70.8।।
explanation: Then the agitated brothers, aware of time and space, quickly pulled out their swords and cut off both his arms from the shoulders.

content: दक्षिणो दक्षिणं बाहुमसक्तमसिना ततः।चिच्छेद रामो वेगेन सव्यं वीरस्तु लक्ष्मणः।।3.70.9।।
explanation: While standing on the right, Rama cut off his right arm and the brave Lakshmana cut off the left.

content: स पपात महाबाहुश्छिन्नबाहुर्महास्वनः।खं च गां च दिशश्चैव नादयञ्जलदो यथा।।3.70.10।।
explanation: The strongarmed demon, his arms severed, rumbling like a raincloud filling the sky, the earth and the quarters, fell down.

content: स निकृत्तौ भुजौ दृष्ट्वा शोणितौघपरिप्लुतः।दीनः पप्रच्छ तौ वीरौ कौ युवामिति दानवः।।3.70.11।।
explanation: The demon with his arms amputated, drenched in a pool of blood  looked pathetic and asked them, Who are you?

content: इति तस्य ब्रुवाणस्य लक्ष्मणश्शुभलक्षणः।शशंस राघवं तस्य कबन्धस्य महात्मनः।।3.70.12।।
explanation: Imbued with auspicious signs, Lakshmana revealed the identity of Rama to great Kabandha.

content: अयमिक्ष्वाकुदायादो रामो नाम जनैश्श्रुतः।अस्यैवावरजं विद्दि भ्रातरं मां च लक्ष्मणम्।।3.70.13।।
explanation: Here is Rama, an heir of the Ikshvaku family, known to the people and I am his younger brother Lakshmana for your information.

content: अस्य देवप्रभावस्य वसतो विजने वने।रक्षसाऽपहृता पत्नी यामिच्छन्ताविहागतौ।।3.70.14।।
explanation: He is equal to a god in prowess. While living in this desolate forest his wife has been carried off by a demon. We both came here searching for her.

content: त्वं तु को वा किमर्थं वा कबन्धसदृशो वने।आस्येनोरसि दीप्तेन भग्नजङ्घो विचेष्टसे।।3.70.15।।
explanation: Who are you with only the trunk of the body, and a glittering mouth in the chest with your calf muscles broken rolling down in the forest?

content: एवमुक्तः कबन्धस्तु लक्ष्मणेनोत्तरं वचः।उवाच परमप्रीत स्तदिन्द्रवचनं स्मरन्।।3.70.16।।
explanation: While hearing Lakshmana, Kabandha, reminded of Indra's words, replied to him in great joy :

content: स्वागतं वां नरव्याघ्रौ दिष्ट्या पश्यामि चाप्यहम्।दिष्ट्या चेमौ निकृत्तौ मे युवाभ्यां बाहुबन्धनौ।।3.70.17।।
explanation: O tigers among men you are welcome. It is my good luck that I am able to see you. It is my good luck also that the arms that bound you have been amputated.

content: विरूपं यच्च मे रूपं प्राप्तं ह्यविनयाद्यथा।तन्मे शृणु नरव्याघ्र तत्त्वतश्शंसतस्तव।।3.70.18।।
explanation: O best among men hear how I have been deformed due to my haughtiness.इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे सप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventieth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Kabandha narrates his story-- promises to help Rama in finding Sita-- attains his true form after his cremation.]पुरा राम महाबाहो महाबलपराक्रम।रूपमासीन्ममा चिन्त्यं त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुतम्।।3.71.1।।यथा सोमस्य शक्रस्य सूर्यस्य च यथा वपुः।
explanation: O longarmed, mighty and powerful Rama in the past I was handsome like the Moon or Indra or the Sun inconceivable to all the three worlds.

content: सोऽहं रूपमिदं कृत्वा लोकवित्रासनं महत्।।3.71.2।।ऋषीन्वनगतान्राम त्रासयामि ततस्ततः।
explanation: With my appearance, I was a great nuisance to the world and used to terrorise the sages living in the forest.

content: ततस्स्थूलशिरा नाम महर्षिः कोपितो मया।।3.71.3।।सञ्चिन्वन्विविधं वन्यं रूपेणानेन धर्षितः।
explanation: With my appearance I invited the wrath of Sthulasira who I assaulted among the many seers, while he was collecting food in the forest.

content: तेनाहमुक्तः प्रेक्ष्यैवं घोरशापाभिधायिना।।3.71.4।।एतदेव नृशंसं ते रूपमस्तु विगर्हितम्।
explanation: Seeing me he pronounced a dreadful curse on me saying, 'You will get a cruel, despicable form.'

content: स मया याचितः क्रुद्धश्शापस्योन्तो भवेदिति।।3.71.5।।अभिशापकृतस्येति तेनेदं भाषितं वचः।
explanation: When I sought to know how the curse angrily pronounced on me would come to an end, he said:

content: यदा छित्त्वा भुजौ रामस्त्वां दहेद्विजने वने।।3.71.6।।तदा त्वं प्राप्स्यसे रूपं स्वमेव विपुलं शुभम्।
explanation: 'When Rama gets your arms in a desolate forest amputated and your body cremated, you would get back your gloriously auspicious form.'

content: श्रिया विराजितं पुत्रं दनोस्त्वं विद्धि लक्ष्मण।।3.71.7।।इन्द्रकोपादिदं रूपं प्राप्तमेवं रणाजिरे।
explanation: O Lakshmana know that I was the prosperous son of demon Danu. By the wrath of Indra in the battlefeild I obtained this form.

content: अहं हि तपसोग्रेण पितामहमतोषयम्।।3.71.8।।दीर्घमायुस्स मे प्रादात्ततो मां विभ्रमोऽस्पृशत्।
explanation: I pleased the creator Brahma with great penance. He blessed me with long life. Then this pride and confusion overtook me.

content: दीर्घमायुर्मया प्राप्तं किं मे शक्रः करिष्यति।।3.71.9।।इत्येवं बुद्धिमास्थाय रणे शक्रमधर्षयम्।
explanation: Having been blessed with long life and thinking, what can Indra do to me?, I attacked him.

content: तस्य बाहुप्रयुक्तेन वज्रेण शतपर्वणा।।3.71.10।।सक्थिनी चैव मूर्धा च शरीरे सम्प्रवेशितम्।
explanation: The thunderbolt having a hundred nodes deployed by Indra pierced my thighs and my head.

content: स मया याच्यमानस्सन्नानयद्यमसादनम्।।3.71.11।।पितामहवचस्सत्यं तदस्त्विति ममाब्रवीत्।
explanation: Entreated, he did not send me to the abode of Yama ( lord of death) and said, 'Let the words of the creator be true' .

content: अनाहारः कथं शक्तो भग्नसक्थिशिरोमुखः।।3.71.12।।वज्रेणाभिहतः कालं सुदीर्घमपि जीवितुम्।
explanation: Hit by the thunderbolt, my thighbones, head and face were broken. Somehow I could manage to live for a long time without food.

content: एवमुक्तस्तु मे शक्रो बाहू योजनमायतौ।।3.71.13।।प्रादादास्यं च मे कुक्षौ तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्रमकल्पयत्।
explanation: Having been entreated, Indra created in me two long arms extending upto a yojana and set my mouth with sharp teeth in the stomach.

content: सोऽहं भुजाभ्यां दीर्घाभ्यां संकृष्यास्मिन्वने चरान्।।3.71.14।।सिंहव्दिपमृगव्याघ्रान् भक्षयामि समन्ततः।
explanation: Stretching the long arms in the forest, I dragged creatures like lions, tigers, elephants and deer moving in the forest and ate them.

content: स तु मामब्रवीदिन्द्रो यदा रामस्सलक्ष्मणः।।3.71.15।।छेत्स्यते समरे बाहू तदा स्वर्गं गमिष्यसि।
explanation: Indra too had said, 'When Rama along with Lakshmana cuts off your arms in a fight,  you would reach heaven.'

content: अनेन वपुषा राम वनेऽस्मिन्राजसत्तम।।3.71.16।।यद्यत्पश्यामि सर्वस्य ग्रहणं साधु रोचये।
explanation: O Rama, the best of kings I thought it was only proper in this forest and with this body to catch whatever creature I saw.

content: अवश्यं ग्रहणं रामो मन्येऽहं समुपैष्यति।।3.71.17।।इमां बुद्धिं पुरस्कृत्य देहन्यासकृतश्रमः।
explanation: O Rama, I was struggling to preserve my body all the time thinking that some day you would certainly come into my arms.

content: स त्वं रामोऽसि भद्रं ते नाहमन्येन राघव।।3.71.18।।शक्यो हन्तुं यथातत्त्वमेवमुक्तं महर्षिणा।
explanation: You are that Rama. Be blessed. As stated by the seer I cannot be really killed by any one except you.

content: अहं हि मतिसाचिव्यं करिष्यामि नरर्षभ।।3.71.19।।मित्रं चैवोपदेक्ष्यामि युवाभ्यां संस्कृतोऽग्निना।
explanation: O best among men I will help you with my wisdom and give you friendly advice when I am purified by you both through cremation on the funeral pyre.

content: एवमुक्तस्तु धर्मात्मा दनुना तेन राघवः।।3.71.20।।इदं जगाद वचनं लक्ष्मणस्योपशृण्वतः।
explanation: Rigteous Rama spoke the following words in response to the story of Danu within Lakshmana's earshot:

content: रावणेन हृता भार्या मम सीता यशस्स्विनी।।3.71.21।।निष्क्रान्तस्य जनस्थानात्सहभ्रात्रा यथासुखम्।
explanation: My illlustrious wife Sita was carried away by Ravana comfortably when I was away from Janasthana along with my brother.

content: नाममात्रं तु जानामि न रूपं तस्य रक्षसः।।3.71.22।।निवासं वा प्रभावं वा वयं तस्य न विद्महे।
explanation: I only know his name. We do not know how he looks, where he lives and what influence he has.

content: शोकार्तानामनाथानामेवं विपरिधावताम्।।3.71.23।।कारुण्यं सदृशं कर्तुमुपकारे च वर्तताम्।
explanation: Creatures like you may help those who, like orphans, run here and there, stricken with sorrow.

content: काष्ठान्यादाय शुष्काणि काले भग्नानि कुञ्जरैः।।3.71.24।।धक्ष्यामस्त्वां वयं वीर श्वभ्रे महति कल्पिते।
explanation: O hero we will cremate you in a huge pit to be prepared for this occasion, collecting dry logs of wood broken by elephants.

content: स त्वं सीतां समाचक्ष्व येन वा यत्र वा हृता।।3.71.25।।कुरु कल्याणमत्यर्थं यदि जानासि तत्त्वतः।
explanation: If you really know where SIta has been kidnapped and by whom, tell me. You will be doing a great service.

content: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण वाक्यं दनुरनुत्तमम्।।3.71.26।।प्रोवाच कुशलो वक्तुं वक्तारमपि राघवम्।
explanation: Danu who was proficient in speech spoke with chosen words to Rama who was a great speaker himself:

content: दिव्यमस्ति न मे ज्ञानं नाभिजानामि मैथिलीम्।।3.71.27।।यस्तां ज्ञास्यति तं वक्ष्ये दग्धस्स्वं रूपमास्थितः।
explanation: I do not have divine wisdom (now). Nor do I know Sita. When you cremate me, I shall assume my original form and will tell you the name of the person who knows it.

content: अदग्धस्य तु विज्ञातुं शक्तिरस्ति न मे प्रभो।।3.71.28।।राक्षसं तं महावीर्यं सीता येन हृता तव।
explanation: O lord before I am cremated, I do not have the ability to know  about that powerful demon by whom Sita has been abducted.

content: विज्ञानं हि मम भ्रष्टं शापदोषेण राघव।।3.71.29।।स्वकृतेन मया प्राप्तं रूपं लोकविगर्हितम्।
explanation: O Rama due to the curse I have lost my wisdom. By my own deed, I have attained this form despicable to the world.

content: किं तु यावन्न यात्यस्तं सविता श्रान्तवाहनः।।3.71.30।।तावन्मामवटे क्षिप्त्वा दह राम यथाविधि।
explanation: Before the Sun  disappears with his tired horses drop me into a pit and cremate me in accordance with tradition, O Rama

content: दग्धस्त्वयाहमवटे न्यायेन रघुनन्धन।।3.71.31।।वक्ष्यामि तमहं वीर यस्तं ज्ञास्यति राक्षसम्।
explanation: O heroic Rama, delight of the Raghus, if you drop me in a pit and cremate me as per custom, I will tell you about him who knows the demon.

content: तेन सख्यं च कर्तव्यं न्याय्यवृत्तेन राघव।।3.71.32।।कल्पयिष्यति ते प्रीतस्साहाय्यं लघुविक्रमः।
explanation: O Rama you should establish friendship with him in a just manner. That hero of swift action will help you when he is pleased.

content: न हि तस्यास्त्यविज्ञातं त्रिषु लेकेषु राघव।।3.71.33।।सर्वान्परिसृतो लोकान्पुरासौ कारणान्तरे।
explanation: O Rama, there is nothing that he does not know in the three worlds. In the past for a different reason he roamed all the (three) worlds.इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventyfirst sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Cremation of Kabandha-- his reappearance in the sky-- tells Rama to make friendship with Sugriva.]एवमुक्तौतु तौ वीरौ कबन्धेन नरेश्वरौ।                गिरिप्रदरमासाद्य पावकं विससर्जतुः।।3.72.1।।
explanation: Thus said by Kabandha, the two lords of men, the heroes reached a cave in the mountain and lighted the fire.

content: लक्ष्मणस्तु महोल्काभिर्ज्वलिताभिस्समन्ततः।चितामादीपयामास सा प्रजज्वाल सर्वतः।।3.72.2।।
explanation: Lakshmana lit the pyre with big meteorlike logs on all sides and it burned.

content: तच्छरीरं कबन्धस्य घृतपिण्डोपमं महत्।मेदसा पच्यमानस्य मन्दं दहति पावकः।।3.72.3।।
explanation: As the flesh of Kabandha's body decomposed, if burnt slowly in the fire although it was like a huge mass of fat.

content: स विधूय चितामाशु विधूमोऽग्निरिवोत्थितः।अरजे वाससी बिभ्रन्मालां दिव्यां महाबलः।।3.72.4।।
explanation: Mighty Kabandha shook himself off the funeral pyre and rose like smokeless fire, wearing a pair of clean clothes and a divine garland.

content: ततश्चिताया वेगेन भास्वरो विमलाम्बरः।उत्पपाताशु संहृष्टस्सर्वप्रत्यङ्गभूषणः।।3.72.5।।
explanation: Thereafter shining brightly in pure clothes and wearing ornaments all over the body, Kabandha hurtled out happily and instantaneously from the pyre.

content: विमाने भास्वरे तिष्ठन्हंसयुक्ते यशस्करे।प्रभया च महातेजा दिशो दश विराजयन्।।3.72.6।।सोऽन्तरिक्षगतो रामं कबन्धो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।शृणु राघव तत्त्वेन यथा सीतामवाप्स्यसि।।3.72.7।।
explanation: The effulgent Kabandha rose into the sky on a famous aerial chariot harnessed to swans. Seated on it, he illuminated all ten directions and spoke from the sky,'O Raghava I will truly tell you how you will get Sita, listen to me'.

content: राम षड्युक्तयो लोके याभिस्सर्वं विमृश्यते।परिमृष्टो दशान्तेन दशाभागेन सेव्यते।।3.72.8।।
explanation: O Rama there are six expedients (peace,war,marching,neutrality, alliance, making peace with one and waging war with another, for attaining your goal in the world. Only the unlucky can help the unfortunate.

content: दशाभागगतो हीनस्त्वं हि राम सलक्ष्मणः।यत्कृते व्यसनं प्राप्तं त्वया दारप्रधर्षणम्।।।3.72.9।।
explanation: Along with Lakshmna you are passing through a bad period on account of which your wife has been kidnapped and you, lying low, are experiencing great grief, O Rama

content: तदवश्यं त्वया कार्यस्ससुहृत्सुहृदां वर।अकृत्वा हि न ते सिद्धिमहं पश्यामि चिन्तयन्।।3.72.10।।
explanation: O Rama, the best of friends  you should certainly make friendship with him. As I think over the matter, I do not see any success if you do not adopt this method.

content: श्रूयतां राम वक्ष्यामि सुग्रीवो नाम वानरः।भ्रात्रा निरस्तः क्रुद्धेन वालिना शक्रसूनुना।।3.72.11।।
explanation: O Rama, listen. I shall tell you. A monkey named Sugriva has been banished from the kingdom in a fit of anger by his brother Vali, the son of Indra.

content: ऋश्यमूके गिरिवरे पम्पापर्यन्तशोभिते।निवसत्यात्मवान्वीरश्चतुर्भिस्सह वानरैः।।3.72.12।।
explanation: A hero of great selfrespect, he lives with four monkeys on a beautiful mountain Rishyamuka extending up to lake Pampa.

content: वानरेन्द्रो महावीर्यस्तेजोवानमितप्रभः।सत्यसन्धो विनीतश्च धृतिमान्मतिमान्महान्।।3.72.13।।
explanation: This king of monkeys is energetic with great strength and limitless lustre. He is humble and truthful, valiant, patient and intelligent. He is great.

content: दक्षः प्रगल्भो द्युतिमान्महाबलपराक्रमः।भ्रात्रा विवासितो राम राज्यहेतोर्महाबलः।।3.72.14।।
explanation: He is efficient, eloquent, brilliant. He is mighty and strong. (But) he is banished by his brother from the kingdom, O Rama

content: स ते सहायो मित्रं च सीतायाः परिमार्गणे।भविष्यति हिते राम मा च शोके मनः कृथाः।।3.72.15।।
explanation: O Rama he will help you as a benevolent friend in searching out Sita. Do not indulge in sorrow.

content: भवितव्यं हि यच्चापि न तच्छक्यमिहान्यथा।कर्तुमिक्ष्वाकुशार्दूल कालो हि दुरतिक्रमः।।3.72.16।।
explanation: O best of the Ikshvaku race whatever is due to happen cannot be otherwise.  It is not possible to transgress time (fate).

content: गच्छ श्रीघ्रमितो राम सुग्रीवं तं महाबलम्।वयस्यं तं कुरु क्षिप्रमितो गत्वाऽद्य राघव।।3.72.17।।अद्रोहाय समागम्य दीप्यमाने विभावसौ।
explanation: O Rama, immediately proceed today from here to mighty Sugriva. Having reached him, make him your friend without malice in the presence of burning fire.

content: स च ते नावमन्तव्यस्सुग्रीवो वानराधिपः।।3.72.18।।कृतज्ञः कामरूपी च सहायार्थी च वीर्यवान्।
explanation: Thinking that Sugriva is only a vanara king, he should not be disrespected. He has a sense of gratitude. He can take any form at will. He is in need of your help although he is very strong.

content: शक्तौह्यद्य युवां कर्तुं कार्यं तस्य चिकीर्षितम्।।3.72.19।।कृतार्थो वाऽकृतार्थो वा कृत्यं तव करिष्यति।
explanation: You are both young and able to do the work he wants. Whether his work is done or not, he will fulfil your task.

content: स ऋक्षरजसः पुत्रः पम्पामटति शङ्कितः।।.3.72.20।।भास्करस्यौरसः पुत्रो वालिना कृतकिल्बिषः।
explanation: Born of Riksharaja, he is the offspring of the Sungod. He has developed enmity with Vali, and is roaming about the banks of Pampa, suspecting danger from Vali.

content: सन्निधायायुधं क्षिप्रमृष्यमूकालयं कपिम्।।3.72.21।।कुरु राघव सत्येन वयस्यं वनचारिणम्।
explanation: O Rama, with your weapons kept ready, go to Sugriva, king of the monkeys, a resident of Rishyamuka. He is wandering in the forest. Establish friendship with him.

content: स हि स्थानानि सर्वाणि कार्त्स्न्येन कपिकुञ्जरः।।3.72.22।।नरमांसाशिनां लोके नैपुण्यादधिगच्छति।
explanation: He is the foremost of the monkeys. He knows well by his wisdom all the dwellingplaces of the carnivorous demons in the world.

content: न तस्याविदितं लोकेकिञ्चिदस्ति हि राघव।।3.72.23।।यावत्सूर्यः प्रतपति सहस्रांशुररिन्दम।
explanation: There is nothing unknown to Sugriva in this world as far as the Sun shines, O subduer of enemies

content: स नदीर्विपुलान्शैलान् गिरिदुर्गाणि कन्दरान्।।3.72.24।।अन्वीक्ष्य वानरैस्सार्धं पत्नीं तेऽधिगमिष्यति।
explanation: Along with his monkeys, he will search all rivers, mountains and caves and will find out your consort.

content: वानरांश्च महाकायान्प्रेषयिष्यति राघव।।3.72.25।।दिशो विचेतुं तां सीतां त्वद्वियोगेन शोचतीम्।स ज्ञास्यति वरारोहां निर्मलां रावणालये।।3.72.26।।
explanation: Sugriva will find out the lady of purity and chastity brooding over you in separation in the abode of Ravana. He can send gigantic monkeys in different directions in order to search for her.

content: स मेरुशृङ्गाग्रगतामनिन्दितां प्रविश्य पातालतलेऽपि वा श्रिताम्।प्लवङ्गमानां प्रवरस्तव प्रियां निहत्य रक्षांसि पुनः प्रदास्यति।।3.72.27।।
explanation: Sugriva, king of the monkeys, will reach the demons  and restore you that blameless, beloved consort of yours, even if she is there on top of mount Meru or in the deep underworld. इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे द्विसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventysecond sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Kabandha gives Rama the direction to Rishyamuka--  disappears, bidding farewell to Rama and Lakshmanadescription of nature  at Pampa ]निदर्शयित्वा रामाय सीतायाः प्रतिपादने।वाक्यमन्वर्थमर्थज्ञः कबन्धः पुनरब्रवीत्।।3.73.1।।
explanation: Having shown Rama the means to find Sita, Kabandha spoke again these significant words:

content: एष राम शिवः पन्था यत्रैते पुष्पिता द्रुमाः।प्रतीचीं दिशमाश्रित्य प्रकाशन्ते मनोरमाः।।3.73.2।।जम्बूप्रियालपनसप्लक्षन्यग्रोधतिन्धुकाः।अश्वत्थाः कर्णिकाराश्च चूताश्चान्ये च पादापाः।।3.73.3।।धन्वना नागवृक्षाश्च तिलका नक्तमालकाः।नीलाशोकाः कदम्बाश्च करवीराश्च पुष्पिताः।।3.73.4।।अग्निमुख्या अशोकाश्च सुरक्ताः पारिभद्रकाः।
explanation: O Rama the delightful path going westward is auspicious for you. It is shining with trees in bloom. There are jambu (rose apple) trees, priyala trees, jackfruit trees, banyan trees, plaksha trees (a tree from which milky latex oozes out), tinduka trees, holy fig trees, karnikaras (of red and white flowers), mango trees and other trees like dryland, thorny trees, tilaka trees, trees that bloom at night, agnimukhya and asoka trees of blue flowers, kadamba trees, karavira trees, red ashoka trees, and paribhadraka trees.

content: तानारुह्याथवा भूमौ पातयित्वा च तान्बलात्।।3.73.5।।फलान्यमृतकल्पानि भक्षयन्तौ गमिष्यथः।
explanation: Climbing those trees or else pulling them down with your strength, both of you eat the nectarlike sweet fruits and proceed ahead.

content: तदतिक्रम्य काकुत्स्थ वनं पुष्पितपादपम्।।3.73.6।।नन्दनप्रतिमं चान्यत्कुरवो ह्युत्तरा इव।
explanation: O scion of the Kakutstha race  proceeding further you will find another forest of the North Kuru state with trees in bloom resembling the pleasuregardens of Nandana.

content: सर्वकालफला यत्र पादपास्तु मधुस्रवाः।।3.73.7।।सर्वे च ऋतवस्तत्र वने चैत्ररथे यथा।
explanation: The trees in that garden with fruits of all seasons drip honey. Like the Chaitraratha garden (of Kubera), it bears fruits of all seasons.

content: फलभारानतास्तत्र महाविटपधारिणः।।3.73.8।।शोभन्ते सर्वतस्तत्र मेघपर्वतसन्निभाः।
explanation: The trees with huge branches bent down with fruits look like mountains or clouds.

content: तानारुह्याथवा भूमौ पातयित्वा यथासुखम्।।3.73.9।।फलान्यमृतकल्पानि लक्ष्मणस्ते प्रदास्यति।
explanation: Lakshmana will get you the nectarlike fruits either by climbing the trees or by pulling them down.

content: चङ्क्रमन्तौ वरान्देशान्शैलाच्छैलं वनाद्वनम्।।3.73.10।।ततः पुष्करिणीं वीरौ पम्पां नाम गमिष्यथः।
explanation: O brave men, pass from hill to hill, forest to forest in great countries until you reach a lake named Pampa.

content: अशर्करामविभ्रंशां समतीर्थामशैवलाम्।।3.73.11।।राम सञ्जातवालूकां कमलोत्पलशालिनीम्।
explanation: The slopes of Pampa are without stones or pebbles, O Rama   They are not slippery slopes. They are without moss. The water is neither deep nor shallow. It has smooth beds of sand on the banks and it is full of lotuses and lilies.

content: तत्र हंसाः प्लवाः क्रौञ्चाः कुरराश्चैव राघव।।3.73.12।।वल्गुस्वना विकूजन्ति पम्पासलिलगोचराः।
explanation: Moving in the waters of Pampa you will see swans, ducks, krauncha birds and curlews cackling and cooing, O Son of the Raghus.

content: नोद्विजन्ते नरान्दृष्ट्वा वधस्याकोविदाश्शुभाः।।3.73.13।।घृतपिण्डोपमान् स्थूलांस्तान्द्विजान्भक्षयिष्यथः।
explanation: Not knowing that they may be killed, the innocent creatures will not be scared of human beings. Both of you can kill and eat the fat birds comparable to balls of ghee.

content: रोहितान्वक्रतुण्डांश्च नडमीनांश्च राघव।।3.73.14।।पम्पायामिषुभिर्मत्स्यांस्तत्र राम वरान्हतान्।निस्त्वक्पक्षानयस्तप्तानकृशानेककण्टकान्।।3.73.15।।तव भक्त्या समायुक्तो लक्ष्मणस्सम्प्रदास्यति।
explanation: O Rama, scion of the Raghu dynasty  there at Pampa, by shooting an arrow at the choicest  fishes with a single bone, prawns and big fishes, crookedfaced fishes, fishes without scales and fins, baked on iron skewers and cooked will be offered to you by faithful Lakshmana.

content: भृशते खादतो मत्स्यान्पम्पायाः पुष्पसञ्चये।।3.73.16।।पद्मगन्धि शिवं वारि सुखशीतमनामयम्।उद्धृत्य सतताक्लिष्टं रौप्यस्फाटिकसन्निभम्।।3.73.17।।असौ पुष्करपर्णेन लक्ष्मणः पाययिष्यति।
explanation: While you delightedly eat the fishes, Lakshmana will fetch you water in a lotus leaf from the Pampa to drink. The waters of Pampa full of lotuses carry their scent, It  is enjoyable, cool, healthy and clear, resembling silver and crystal.

content: स्थूलान्गिरिगुहाशय्यान्वराहान्वनचारिणः।।3.73.18।।अपां लोभादुपावृत्तान्वृषभानिव नर्दतः।रूपावनितांश्च पम्पायांद्रक्ष्यसि त्वं नरोत्तम।।3.73.19।।
explanation: O best of men you will see huge boars of delightful appearance that roar like bulls resting in mountain caves, roaming in the forest and coming to Pampa for its water.

content: सायाह्ने विचरन्राम विटपीन्माल्यधारिणः।शीतोदकं च पम्पाया दृष्ट्वा शोकं विहास्यसि।।3.73.20।।
explanation: When you stroll in the evening, you will see the trees laden with blossoms and lake Pampa full of cool water. You will forget your grief.

content: सुमनोभिश्चितांस्तत्र तिलकान्नक्तमालकान्।उत्पलानि च फुल्लानि पङ्कजानि च राघव।।3.73.21।।
explanation: O son of the Raghus  there you will see tilaka trees, night jasmines full of flowers. You will also see blossoming water lilies and lotuses in Pampa.

content: न तानि कश्चिन्माल्यानि तत्रारोपयिता नरः।न च वै म्लानतां यान्ति न च शीर्यन्ति राघव।।3.73.22।।
explanation: There is no one to wear those flowers. Those garlands do not wilt or wither O Rama

content: मतङ्गशिष्यास्तत्राऽसन्नृषयस्सुसमाहिताः।तेषां भाराभितप्तानां वन्यमाहरतां गुरोः।।3.73.23।।ये प्रपेतुर्महीं तूर्णं शरीरात्स्वेदबिन्दवः।तानि जातानि माल्यानि मुनीनां तपसा तदा।।3.73.24।।स्वेदबिन्दुसमुत्थानि न विनश्यन्ति राघव।
explanation: While drops of sweat from the bodies of sage Matanga's disciples fell on earth under the heavy load of forest products they carried for their preceptor, they remained in a calm state. Those drops of sweat turned into flowers and those flowers do not wither due to the power of penance of the sages.

content: तेषां गतानामद्यापि दृश्यते परिचारिणी।।3.73.25।।श्रमणी शबरी नाम काकुत्स्थ चिरजीविनी।
explanation: O Kakutstha  even now their attendant, named Sabari, an old ascetic is there even though they have left long ago.

content: त्वां तु धर्मे स्थिता नित्यं सर्वभूतनमस्कृतम्।।3.73.26।।दृष्ट्वा देवोपमं राम स्वर्गलोकं गमिष्यति।
explanation: O Rama, she is established in righteousness, and you are godlike, and revered by all beings. When she sees you, she will attain heaven.

content: ततस्तद्राम पम्पायास्तीरमासाद्य पश्चिमम्।।3.73.27।।आश्रमस्थानमतुलं गुह्यं काकुत्स्थ पश्यसि।
explanation: O Rama of the Kakutstha family, you will see on reaching the western bank of Pampa an incomparable site of hermitage concealed in a remote place.

content: न तत्राक्रमितुं नागाश्शक्नुवन्ति तमाश्रमम्।।3.73.28।।विविधास्तत्र वै नागा वने तस्मिंश्च पर्वते।ऋषेस्तत्र मतङ्गस्य विधानात्तच्च काननम्।।3.73.29।।
explanation: The elephants of the forest and on the mountains do not attack the hermitage forbidden by sage Matanga.

content: तस्मिन्नन्दनसङ्काशे देवारण्योपमे वने।नानाविहगसङ्कीर्णे रंस्यसे राम निर्वृतः।।3.73.30।।
explanation: O Rama, you will enjoy your stay in that forest which is like Nandana garden, the garden of the gods, full of various birds.

content: ऋष्यमूकश्च पम्पायाः पुरस्तात्पुष्पितद्रुमः।सुदुःखारोहणो नाम शिशुनागाभिरक्षितः।।3.73.31।।उदारो ब्रह्मणा चैव पूर्वकाले विनिर्मितः।
explanation: Mount Rishyamuka situated on the bank of Pampa has trees filled with blossoms. It is difficult to climb and is protected by young elephants.This lofty mountain was created by Brahma in olden days.

content: शयानः पुरुषो राम तस्य शैलस्य मूर्धनि।।3.73.32।।यत्स्वप्ने लभते वित्तं तत्प्रबुद्धोऽधिगच्छति।
explanation: Whatever wealth one dreams of in sleep on top of that mountain he will get on waking up, O Rama

content: नत्वेनं विषमाचार पापकर्माऽधिरोहति।।3.73.33।।यस्तु तं विषमाचारः पापकर्माऽधिरोहति।तत्रैव प्रहऱन्त्येनं सुप्तमादाय राक्षसाः।।3.73.34।।
explanation: If an evildoer or a sinner ascends the (Rishyamuka) mountain, he, in his sleep, will be thrown down with asleep by the demons from there itself. A sinner does not climb this mountain of uneven terrain.

content: तत्रापि शिशुनागानामाक्रन्धश्श्रूयते महान्।क्रीडतां राम पम्पायां मतङ्गारण्यवासिनाम्।।3.73.35।।
explanation: O Rama, the trumpeting of the young playful elephants inhabiting sage Matanga's forest can be heard at Pampa.

content: सिक्ता रुधिरधाराभिस्संहृत्य परमद्विपाः।प्रचरन्ति पृथक्कीर्णा मेघवर्णास्तरस्विनः।।3.73.36।।
explanation: The great, nimble elphants, dark like clouds, drenched with the flow of ichor come together and then separate and scatter.

content: ते तत्र पीत्वा पानीयं विमलं शीतमव्ययम्।निर्वृतास्संविगाहन्ते वनानि वनगोचराः।।3.73.37।।
explanation: The wandering elephants of the forest drink plentiful water, pure and cool, from Pampa and contented, plunge into the forest.

content: ऋक्षांश्च द्वीपिनश्चैव नीलकोमलकप्रभान्।रुरूनपेतापजयान् दृष्ट्वा शोकं जयिष्यसि।।3.73.38।।
explanation: When you see, shining like sapphires, the bears, tigers, antelopes who know no defeat, you will get over your grief.

content: राम तस्य तु शैलस्य महती शोभते गुहा।शिलापिधाना काकुत्स्थ दुःखं चास्याः प्रवेशनम्।।3.73.39।।
explanation: O son of the Kakutstha family, there is a beautiful cave in that mountain covered with a slab of stone. It is difficult to enter.

content: तस्या गुहायाः प्राग्द्वारे महान्शीतोदको ह्रदः।फलमूलान्वितो रम्यो नानामृगसमावृतः।।3.73.40।।
explanation: At the eastern entrance of the cave there is a cool watertank. On its bank teeming with various animals are delightful fruits and roots.

content: तस्यां वसति सुग्रीवश्चतुर्भिस्सह वानरैः।कदाचिच्छिखरे तस्य पर्वतस्यावतिष्ठते।।3.73.41।।
explanation: Sugriva dwells in that cave with four other monkeys. At times he sits on the top of the mountain.

content: कबन्धस्त्वनुशास्यैवं तावुभौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।स्रग्वी भास्करवर्णाभः खे व्यरोचत वीर्यवान्।।3.73.42।।
explanation: Having instructed both Rama and Lakshmana, courageous Kabandha, wearing a flowergarland, shone brightly like the Sun in the sky.

content: तं तु खस्थं महाभागं कबन्धं रामलक्ष्मणौ।प्रस्थितौ त्वं व्रजस्वेति वाक्यमूचतुरन्तिके।।3.73.43।।
explanation: Both Rama and Lakshmana, ready to depart, went near the glorious Kabandha waiting in the sky and said, You may go now.

content: गम्यतां कार्यसिद्ध्यर्थमिति तावब्रवीत्स च।सुप्रीतौ तावनुज्ञाप्य कबन्धः प्रस्थितस्तदा।।3.73.44।।
explanation: Then Kabandha said to the brothers satisfied, You may go now to accomplish your task. Then he took leave.

content: स तत्कबन्धः प्रतिपद्य रूपं वृतश्श्रिया भास्करतुल्यदेहः।निदर्शयन्राममवेक्ष्य खस्थः सख्यं कुरुष्वेति तदाभ्युवाच।।3.73.45।।
explanation: Kabandha assumed his true form, his body shining like the radiance of the Sun. He stood in the sky showing his form and looking at Rama, said, Make friendship with Sugriva.इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे त्रिसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventythird sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama and Lakshmana visit  the hermitage of Sabari-- Sabari's hospitalitythey go round the forest and hermitage of sage Matanga-- Sabari casts her body into the fire and ascends to heaven.]तौ कबन्धेन तं मार्गं पम्पाया दर्शितं वने।प्रतस्थतुर्दिशं गृह्य प्रतीचीं नृवरात्मजौ।।3.74.1।।
explanation: The two princes set forth in the western direction towards Pampa shown by Kabandha.

content: तौ शैलेष्वाचितानेकान् क्षौद्रकल्पफलान्द्रुमान्।वीक्षन्तौ जग्मतुर्ध्रष्टुं सुग्रीवं रामलक्ष्मणौ।।3.74.2।।
explanation: Observing the trees loaded with honeysweet fruits on the mountain, Rama and Lakshmana   went to see Sugriva.

content: कृत्वा च शैलपृष्ठे तु तौ वासं रामलक्ष्मणौ।पम्पायाः पश्चिमं तीरं राघवावुपतस्थतुः।।3.74.3।।
explanation: Rama and Lakshmana halted on the slope of the mountain and then departed for the western bank of Pampa.

content: तौ पुष्करिण्याः पम्पायास्तीरमासाद्य पश्चिमम्।अपश्यतां ततस्तत्र शबर्या रम्यमाश्रमम्।।3.74.4।।
explanation: Both reached the west bank of lake Pampa and saw the delightful hermitage of Sabari.

content: तौ तमाश्रममासाद्य द्रुमैर्बहुभीरावृतम्।सुरम्यमभिवीक्षन्तौ शबरीमभ्युपेयतुः।।3.74.5।।
explanation: Both reached the beautiful hermitage full of many kinds of trees. There they saw Sabari, and went towards her.

content: तौ च दृष्ट्वा तदा सिद्धा समुत्थाय कृताञ्जलिः।रामस्य पादौ जग्राह लक्ष्मणस्य च धीमतः।।3.74.6।।
explanation: On seeing them both, Sabari, an accomplished ascetic, got up with folded hands and touched the feet of the sagacious Rama and Lakshmana.

content: पाद्यमाचमनीयं च सर्वं प्रादाद्यथाविधि।तामुवाच ततो रामश्श्रमणीं संशितव्रताम्।।3.74.7।।
explanation: She offered them water to wash their feet and water to sip as per tradition. Then Rama spoke to Sabari who used to perform austere penance:

content: कच्चित्ते निर्जिता विघ्नाः कच्चित्ते वर्धते तपः।कच्चित्ते नियतः क्रोध आहारश्च तपोधने।।3.74.8।।
explanation: O ascetic   hope you have overcome your obstacles to penance, you have controlled your anger and your desire for food. Is your austerity in progress.

content: कच्चित्ते नियमाः प्राप्ताः कच्चित्ते मनसः सुखम्।कच्चित्ते गुरुशुश्रूषा सफला चारुभाषिणि।।3.74.9।।
explanation: O Sweettongued Sabari, have you achieved selfcontrol? Has your mind attained peace ? Have your services to the preceptor yielded results?

content: रामेण तापसी पृष्टा सा सिद्धा सिद्धसम्मता।शशंस शबरी वृद्धा रामाय प्रत्युपस्थिता।।3.74.10।।
explanation: When Rama asked Sabari who was an old, accomplished ascetic adored by siddhas, she stood in front and replied :

content: अद्य प्राप्ता तपस्सिद्धिस्तव संदर्शनान्मया।अद्य मे सफलं तप्तं गुरवश्च सुपूजिताः।।3.74.11।।
explanation: On seeing you now my penance has attained fulfilment, my services to my preceptors have borne fruit.

content: अद्य मे सफलं जन्म स्वर्गश्चैव भविष्यति।त्वयि देववरे राम पूजिते पुरुषर्षभ।।3.74.12।।
explanation: O best of men, O highest of the gods my birth has become fruitful today with your worship, (you have made) even attainment of heaven quite certain.

content: चक्षुषा तव सौम्येन पूतास्मि रघुनन्दन।गमिष्याम्यक्षयान्लोकांस्त्वत्प्रसादादरिन्दम।।3.74.13।।
explanation: O delight of the Raghus, your handsome look has sanctified me, O subduer of enemies, by your grace I will reach the inmperishable worlds.

content: चित्रकूटं त्वयि प्राप्ते विमानैरतुलप्रभैः।इतस्ते दिवमारूढा यानहं पर्यचारिषम्।।3.74.14।।
explanation: The men I served have ascended heaven on aerial chariots of incomparable radiance the moment you touched Chitrakuta.

content: तैश्चाहमुक्ता धर्मज्ञैर्महाभागैर्महर्षिभिः।आगमिष्यति ते रामस्सुपुण्यमिममाश्रमम्।।3.74.15।।स ते प्रतिग्रहीतव्यस्सौमित्रिसहितोतिथिः।तं च दृष्ट्वा वरान्लोकानक्षयांस्त्वं गमिष्यसि।।3.74.16।।
explanation: Those great honourable sages who knew the ways of dharma said: 'Rama would visit this sacred hermitage along with Lakshmana. He would be your guest. Receive him with due honour. And you would attain the great, inexhaustible worlds when you see him.'

content: मया तु विविधं वन्यं सञ्चितं पुरुषर्षभ।तवार्थे पुरुषव्याघ्र पम्पायास्तीरसम्भवम्।।3.74.17।।
explanation: O best among men I have collected and kept for your sake different kinds of forestfood grown on the bank of Pampa.

content: एवमुक्तस्स धर्मात्मा शबर्या शबरीमिदम्।राघवः प्राह विज्ञाने तां नित्यमबहिष्कृताम्।।3.74.18।।
explanation: Entreated by her in that manner, the righteous Rama spoke to Sabari who was established in true knowledge:

content: दनोस्सकाशात्तत्त्वेन प्रभावं ते महात्मनः।श्रुतं प्रत्यक्षमिच्छामि सन्द्रष्टुं यदि मन्यसे।।3.74.19।।
explanation: I have heard from great Danu about your power. If you agree, I would like to see this power in person.

content: एतत्तु वचनं श्रुत्ता रामवक्त्राद्विनिस्सृतम्।शबरी दर्शयामास तावुभौ तद्वनं महत्।।3.74.20।।
explanation: At these words from the mouth of Rama, Sabari took them both round the great garden.

content: पश्य मेघघनप्रख्यं मृगपक्षिसमाकुलम्।मतङ्गवनमित्येव विश्रुतं रघुनन्दन।।।3.74.21।।
explanation: O delight of the Raghus see this garden looking like the dense cloud. Full of animals and birds, it is popularly known as Matanga garden.

content: इह ते भावितात्मानो गुरवो मे महावने।जुहवाञ्चक्रिरे तीर्थं मन्त्रवन्मन्त्रपूजितम्।।3.74.22।।
explanation: My precepters, who had perceived the Supreme Spirit made sacrificial offerings in this great garden, invoked gods through the power of mantras. They brought water and offered oblations to the sacrificial fire.

content: इयं प्रत्यक्थ्सली वेदिर्यत्र ते मे सुसत्कृताः।पुष्पोपहारं कुर्वन्ति श्रमादुद्वेपिभिः करैः।।3.74.23।।
explanation: This is the altar named Pratyaksthali where the saints aged and exhausted( by performing chandrayana) whom I worshipped made offerings of flowers with trembling hands.

content: तेषां तपःप्रभावेण पश्याद्यापि रघूद्वह।द्योतयन्ति दिशस्सर्वाश्श्रिया वेद्योऽतुलप्रभाः।।3.74.24।।
explanation: O Rama see, even now they illuminate the sacrificial altars with the power of their penance. They shed light in all directions with a matchless brilliance.

content: अशक्नुवद्भिस्तैर्गन्तुमुपवासश्रमालसैः।चिन्तितेऽभ्यागतान्पश्य सहितान्सप्तसागरान्।।3.74.25।।
explanation: Look at the seven seas, which have reached here at their mere thought as they could not reach them due to fatigue from fasting.

content: कृताभिषेकैस्तैर्न्यस्ता वल्कलाः पादपेष्विह।अद्यापि नावशुष्यन्ति प्रदेशे रघुनन्दन।।3.74.26।।
explanation: O delight of the Raghus  look at the bark robes spread on the trees to dry after their bathing which are still wet.

content: देवकार्याणि कुर्वद्भिर्यानीमानि कृतानि वै।पुष्पैःकुवलयैस्सार्धं म्लानत्वं नोपयान्तिवै।।3.74.27।।
explanation: The flowers including lotuses offered by the sages while worshipping gods have not yet wilted.

content: कृत्स्नं वनमिदं दृष्टं श्रोतव्यं च श्रुतं त्वया।तदिच्छाम्यभ्यनुज्ञाता त्यक्तुमेतत्कलेबरम्।।3.74.28।।
explanation: You have seen the entire garden and have listened what is to be heard. With your permission I would like to give up this body.

content: तेषामिच्छाम्यहं गन्तुं समीपं भावितात्मनाम्।मुनीनामाश्रमो येषामहं च परिचारिणी।।3.74.29।।
explanation: I wish to reach those realisers of the Supreme Spirit whom I served and to whom this hermitage belonged.

content: धर्मिष्ठं तु वचश्श्रुत्वा राघवस्सहलक्ष्मणः।प्रहर्षमतुलं लेभे आश्चर्यमिति तत्त्वतः।।3.74.30।।
explanation: Rama and Lakshmana on hearing the pious words of Savari joyfully exclaimed, This is really wonderful.

content: तामुवाच ततो रामश्श्रमणीं संशितव्रताम्।अर्चितोऽहं त्वया भक्त्या गच्छकामं यथासुखम्।।3.74.31।।
explanation: Looking at Sabari who was steadfast in her vow, Rama said, O ascetic, you have worshipped me with devotion. You may go wherever you like (to the world you desire)

content: इत्युक्ता जटिला वृद्धा चीरकृष्णाजिनाम्बरा।तस्मिन्मुहूर्ते शबरी देहं जीर्णं जिहासती।।3.74.32।।अनुज्ञाता तु रामेण हुत्वात्मानं हुताशने।ज्वलत्पावकसङ्काशा स्वर्गमेव जगाम सा।।3.74.33।।
explanation: With matted locks, tattered bark clothes and deer skin, Sabari consigned her old and emaciated body to the fire at that moment, with the permission of Rama and ascended to heaven, her body glowing like fire.

content: दिव्याभरणसंयुक्ता दिव्यमाल्यानुलेपना।दिव्याम्बरधरा तत्र बभूव प्रियदर्शना।।3.74.34।।विराजयन्ती तं देशं विद्युत्सौदामिनी यथा।
explanation: Adorned with wonderful ornaments and beautiful garlands, anointed with fragrant unguents, robed in most beautiful clothes, she appeared like a streak of lightning, her body shining bright and her face contented.

content: यत्र ते सुकृतात्मानो विहरन्ति महर्षयः।।3.74.35।।तत्पुण्यं शबरी स्थानं जगामात्मसमाधिना।
explanation: By virtue of her selfmeditation, Sabari went to that sacred world where the holy sages lived because of their good deeds.इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे चतुस्सप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventyfourth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama and Lakshmana reach Pampa-- admire the beautiful nature on the banks of Pampa.]दिवं तु तस्यां यातायां शबर्यां स्वेन तेजसा।लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा चिन्तयामास राघवः।।3.75.1।।
explanation: When Sabari departed for heaven with her brilliance, Rama  contemplated (about the power of sages)with Lakshmana.

content: स चिन्तयित्वा धर्मात्मा प्रभावं तं महात्मनाम्।हितकारिणमेकाग्रं लक्ष्मणं राघवोऽब्रवीत्।।3.75.2।।
explanation: Thinking about the power of the great sages, righteous Rama said to Lakshmana,  his wellwisher with singleminded devotion:

content: दृष्टोऽयमाश्रमस्सौम्य बह्वाश्चर्यो महात्मनाम्।विश्वस्तमृगशार्दूलो नानाविहगसेवितः।।3.75.3।।
explanation: O handsome one, we have seen this highly wonderful hermitage, where deer and tigers dwell together with mutual confidence, where birds of all kinds inhabit.

content: सप्तानां च समुद्राणामेषु तीर्थेषु लक्ष्मण।उपस्पृष्टं च विधिवत्पितरश्चापि तर्पिताः।।3.75.4।।
explanation: O Lakshmana, having bathed in the waters of the seven seas (by taking ritualistic bath in these waters) the manes are offered oblations in accordance with tradition.

content: प्रणष्टमशुभं तत्तत्कल्याणं समुपस्थितम्।तेन तत्त्वेन हृष्टं मे मनो लक्ष्मण सम्प्रति।।3.75.5।।हृदये हि नरव्याघ्र शुभमाविर्भविष्यति।
explanation: We have got rid of inauspicious time and good days have come. Therefore, I feel truly happy. Good fortune will appear (now), O Lakshmana, O tiger among men

content: तदागच्छ गमिष्यामि पम्पां तां प्रियदर्शनाम्।।3.75.6।।ऋष्यमूको गिरिर्यत्र नातिदूरे प्रकाशते।यस्मिन्वसति धर्मात्मा सुग्रीवोंऽशुमतस्सुतः।।3.75.7।।नित्यं वालिभयात्त्रस्तश्चतुर्भिस्सह वानरैः।
explanation: Come, let us go to Pampa, which is pleasing to look at. Sugriva, the rigteous self, the son of the Sun has been staying for fear of Vali at the shining Rishyamuka, not far from here.

content: अभित्वरे च तं द्रष्टुं सुग्रीवं वानरर्षभम्।।3.75.8।।तदधीनं हि मे सौम्य सीतायाः परिमार्गणम्।
explanation: I am hastening to see that noble Sugriva the mighty monkey, as the search for Sita depends on him, O handsome one

content: एवं ब्रुवाणं तं धीरं रामं सौमित्रिरब्रवीत्।।3.75.9।।गच्छावस्त्वरितं तत्र ममापि त्वरते मनः।
explanation: To the words of Rama who was of stable mind, Lakshmana replied : My mind too is hastening me. Let us get there quickly.

content: आश्रमात्तु तत स्तस्मान्निष्क्रम्य स विशाम्पतिः।।3.75.10।।आजगाम ततः पम्पां लक्ष्मणेन सह प्रभुः।
explanation: Then Rama the lord of men along with Lakshmana departed from the hermitage and went to Pampa.

content: स ददर्श ततः पुण्यामुदारजनसेविताम्।।3.75.11।।नानाद्रुमलताकीर्णां पम्पां पानीयवाहिनीम्।पद्मैस्सौगन्धिकैस्ताम्रां शुक्लां कुमुदमण्डलैः।।3.75.12।।नीलां कुवलयोद्घाटैर्बहुवर्णां कुथामिव।
explanation: He saw the sacred lake Pampa whose sweet flow of water was used by great seers. It abounded in trees and creepers. Its surface was red with lotuses at one place, white with clusters of lilies at another and with blue lotuses at other places. As such, it looked like a carpet with variegated colours.

content: स तामासाद्य वै रामो दूरादुदकवाहिनीम्।।3.75.13।।मतङ्गसरसं नाम ह्रदं समवगाहत।
explanation: Rama reached the Matanga lake which he could see from  a distance and bathed in it.

content: अरविन्दोत्पलवतीं पद्मसौगन्धिकायुताम्।।3.75.14।।पुष्पिताम्रवणोपेतां बर्हिणोद्घुष्टनादिताम्।तिलकैर्बीजपूरैश्च धवैश्शुक्लद्रुमैस्तथा।।3.75.15।।पुष्पितैः करवीरैश्च पुन्नागैश्च सुपुष्पितैः।मालतीकुन्दगुल्मैश्च भाण्डीरैर्निचुलैस्तथा।।3.75.16।।अशोकैस्सप्तपर्णैश्च केतकैरतिमुक्तकैः।अन्यैश्च विविधैर्वृक्षैः प्रमदामिव भूषिताम्।।3.75.17।।समीक्षमाणौ पुषपाढ्यं सर्वतो विपुलद्रुमम्।कोयष्टिकैश्चार्जुनकैश्शतपत्रैश्च कीरकैः।।3.75.18।।एतैश्चान्यैश्च विहगैर्नादितं तु वनं महत्।ततो जग्मतुरव्यग्रौ राघवौ सुसमाहितौ।।3.75.19।।तद्वनं चैव सरसः पश्यन्तै शकुनैर्युतम्।
explanation: Lake Pampa was filled with red lotuses and their fragrance.The bank was lined with blossoming mango trees and trees of several kinds like tilaka trees with fruits full of seeds like citron, dhava trees, white trees in bloom, karavira trees loaded with flowers, punnaga trees, clusters of jasmine and kunda shrubs, fig trees, so also reeds, ashoka trees, atimuktaka creepors and several other trees looking like women adorned all over. Rama and Lakshmana passed by, glancing at them. There were other trees full of flowers, huge trees, koyashtika trees with reed. Different kinds of birds such as peacocks, parrots, dwelling in the forest were screaming aloud. Looking at all these in that forest Rama and Lakshmana passed by undisturbed with a composed mind.

content: स ददर्श ततः पम्पां शीतवारिनिधिं शुभाम्।।3.75.20।।तिलकाशोकपुन्नागवकुलोद्दालकाशिनीम्।
explanation: Rama saw lake Pampa with cool waters and the groves on the bank filled with tilaka, ashoka, punnaga, bakula and uddala trees.

content: स रामो विविधान्वृक्षान्सरांसि विविधानि च।।3.75.21।।पश्यन्कामाभिसन्तप्तो जगाम परमं ह्रदम्।
explanation: On seeing different kinds of trees and tanks, the lovestriken Rama visited that great lake.

content: पुष्पितोपवनोपेतां सालचम्पकशोभिताम्।।3.75.22।।षट्पदौघसमाविष्टां श्रीमतीमतुलप्रभाम्।स्फटिकोपमतोयाढ्यां श्लक्ष्णवालुकसन्तताम्।।3.75.23।।स तां दृष्ट्वा पुनः पम्पां पद्मसौगन्घिकैर्युताम्।इत्युवाच तदा वाक्यं लक्ष्मणं सत्यविक्रमः।।3.75.24।।
explanation: There were lovely pleasuregardens in full bloom  filled with sal and champk trees. Honeybees on flowers looked lovely and bright. The waters were crystalclear and fragrant with lotuses.The soft sands on the banks of Pampa gleamed. Rama saw them again and again and described them to Lakshmana.

content: अस्यास्तीरे तु पूर्वोक्तः पर्वतो धातुमण्डितः।ऋष्यमूक इति ख्यातः पुण्यः पुष्पितपादपः।।3.75.25।।
explanation: The famous mount, sacred Rishyamuka is situated on the bank of Pampa full of blossoming trees.

content: हरेः ऋक्षरजोनाम्नः पुत्रस्तस्य महात्मनः।अध्यास्ते तं महावीर्यस्सुग्रीव इति विश्रुतः।।3.75.26।।
explanation: The mighty son of Riksharaja, the great soul, the Sun whose son was the wellknown Sugriva, resides on this mountain.

content: सुग्रीवमभिगच्छ त्वं वानरेन्द्रं नरर्षभ।इत्युवाच पुनर्वाक्यं लक्ष्मणं सत्यविक्रमम्।।3.75.27।।
explanation: Rama said to Lakshmana, the best of men, who had truth as his strength, Go to Sugriva, lord of the monkeys.

content: राज्यभ्रष्टेन दीनेन तस्यामासक्तचेतसा।कथं मया विना शक्यं सीतां लक्ष्मण जीवितुम्।।3.75.28।।
explanation: O Lakshmana, deprived of the kingdom I have become a destitute. With my heart attached to Sita how can I live without her ?

content: इत्येवमुक्त्वा मदनाभिपीडितः स लक्ष्मणं वाक्यमनन्यचेतसम्।विवेश पम्पां नलिनीं मनोरमां रघूत्तमश्शोकविषादयन्त्रितः।।3.75.29।।
explanation: Having said these words to Lakshmana who was listening to him with undivided attention, Rama, the best of the Raghus, oppressed by love and afflicted by tears of grief entered Pampa, the delightful lotuslake.

content: ततो महद्वर्त्म सुदूरसङ्क्रमं क्रमेण गत्वा प्रविलोकयन्वनम्।ददर्श पम्पां शुभदर्शकाननामनेकनानाविधपक्षिजालकाम्।।3.75.30।।
explanation: Thereafter, going slowly to a distance, Rama and Lakshmana saw Pampa surrounded by beautiful forests full of many varieties of birds.इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे पञ्चसप्ततिमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventyfifth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
